original: prāṇabhṛta upadadhāti /
analyzed: prāṇabhṛtaḥ upadadhāti
translated: He lays down the Prânabhrits.

original: prāṇā vai prāṇabhṛtaḥ prāṇānevaitadupadadhāti tāḥ🔽prathamāyāṃ citā upadadhāti pūrvārdha eṣo 'gneryatprathamā citiḥ
analyzed: prāṇāḥ vai prāṇabhṛtaḥ prāṇān eva etat upadadhāti tāḥ  prathamāyām citau upadadhāti pūrva ardhe eṣaḥ gneḥ yat prathamā citiḥ
translated: The Prânabhrits are the vital airs: it is the vital airs he thus lays down.

original: purastāttatprāṇāndadhāti tasmādime purastātprāṇāḥ / / /🔽tā daśadaśopadadhāti /
analyzed: purastāt tat prāṇān dadhāti tasmāt ime purastāt prāṇāḥ  tāḥ daśa daśa upadadhāti
translated: He lays them down in the first layer; for the first layer of that Agni is the fore-part: he thus places the vital airs in front; whence these vital airs are in front.

original: daśa vai prāṇā yadu vā api bahu kṛtvo daśadaśa daśaiva🔽tṛtpañca kṛtvo daśadaśopadadhāti pañca vā etānpaśūnupadadhāti daśadaśa vā
analyzed: daśa vai prāṇāḥ yat u vai api bahu kṛtvas daśa daśa daśa eva  tṛd pañca kṛtvas daśa daśa upadadhāti pañca vai etān paśūn upadadhāti daśa daśa vā
translated: He lays down ten (Prânabhrits) each time;--there are ten vital airs: even if he were to do it many times, it would be ten (only) each time.

original: ekaikasminpaśau prāṇāstadeṣu sarveṣu prāṇāndadhātyanantarhitāḥ paśubhya🔽upadadhātyanantarhitāṃstatpaśubhyaḥ prāṇāndadhāti sarvata upadadhāti sarvata
analyzed: ekaikasmin paśau prāṇāḥ tat eṣu sarveṣu prāṇān dadhāti an antarhitāḥ paśubhyaḥ  upadadhāti an antarhitān tat paśubhyaḥ prāṇān dadhāti sarvatas upadadhāti sarvatas
translated: Five times ten he lays down;--five of these animals (or victims) he lays down, and each of these animals has ten vital airs: he thus lays the vital airs into all of them.🔽He lays them down without (any special arrangement),--he thus lays the vital airs into the animals without (any special arrangement).

original: evaiṣvetatprāṇāndadhāti / / /
analyzed: eva eṣu etat prāṇān dadhāti
translated: He lays them down on every side: he thus lays the vital airs into them on every side.

original: yadveva prāṇabhṛta upadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva prāṇabhṛtaḥ upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Prânabhrits.

original: prajāpatervisrastātprāṇā udakrāmandevatā bhūtvā
analyzed: prajāpateḥ visrastāt prāṇāḥ udakrāman devatāḥ bhūtvā
translated: The vital airs went out from Pragâpati when relaxed (disjointed). Having become deities,

original: tānabravīdupa meta prati ma etaddhatta yena me yūyamudakramiṣṭeti sa vai
analyzed: tān abravīt upa mā ita prati me etat dhatta yena me yūyam udakramiṣṭa iti sa vai
translated: they said to him, 'Come hither to us, and restore to us that whereby we have gone out from thee!' He said, 'Well, then, restore ye to me the vital airs!'--'So be it!' they said.

original: tadannaṃ sṛjasva yatte vayam paśyanta upavasāmeti te vā ubhaye sṛjāmahā iti tatheti
analyzed: tat annam sṛjasva yat te vayam paśyantaḥ upavasāma iti te vai ubhaye sṛjāmahai iti tathā iti
translated: 'Create that food, so that we may see you and fast,' they said. 'Let us both create it,' they said. 'So be it,'

original: te prāṇāśca prajāpatiścaitadannamasṛjantaitāḥ prāṇabhṛtaḥ / / /
analyzed: te prāṇāḥ ca prajāpatiḥ ca etat annam asṛjanta etāḥ prāṇabhṛtaḥ
translated: they said. Then the vital airs and Prajapati created this food, these vital airs.

original: sa purastādupadadhāti /🔽ayam puro bhuva ityagnirvai purastadyattamāha pura iti
analyzed: sa purastāt upadadhāti  ayam puras bhuvaḥ iti agniḥ vai puras tat yat tam āha puras iti
translated: He lays it down in front,🔽'This is Purîbhû,' (with the words), 'This is Purîbhû,' (he says), for Purîbhû is Agni. As to why he calls him Purîbhû,

original: prāñcaṃ hyagnimuddharanti prāñcamupacarantyatha yadbhuva ityāhāgnirvai bhuvo
analyzed: prāñcam hi agnim uddharanti prāñcam upacaranti atha yat bhuvaḥ iti āha agniḥ vai bhuvaḥ
translated: it is because they carry Agni forward and serve him while he is facing east. And as to why he says 'bhû,' it is because Agni is bhû.

original: 'gnerhīdaṃ sarvam bhavati prāṇo hāgnirbhūtvā purastāttasthau tadeva
analyzed: gneḥ hi idam sarvam bhavati prāṇaḥ ha agniḥ bhūtvā purastāt tasthau tat eva
translated: For by Agni all this (universe) is. The vital air became Agni and stood in front. That is

original: tadrūpamupadadhāti / / /
analyzed: tad rūpam upadadhāti
translated: that form he now lays down.

original: tasya prāṇo bhauvāyana iti /
analyzed: tasya prāṇaḥ bhauvāyanaḥ iti
translated: 'Its vital air is Bhouvana,'

original: prāṇaṃ tasmādrūpādagnerniramimīta vasantaḥ prāṇāyana🔽iti vasantamṛtum prāṇānniramimīta gāyatrī vāsantīti gāyatrīṃ cando
analyzed: prāṇam tasmāt rūpāt agneḥ niramimīta vasantaḥ prāṇāyana  iti vasantam ṛtum prāṇān niramimīta gāyatrī vāsantī iti gāyatrīm cando
translated: he says; from that form of Agni he fashioned the vital air. 'The spring is the vital air's offspring,'🔽he says; from the spring season he fashioned the vital air. 'The Gâyatrî is the spring's,'🔽he says; from the Gâyatrî metre he fashioned the spring. 'From the Gâyatrî the Gâyatra (hymn-tune),'

original: vasantādṛtorniramimīta gāyatryai gāyatramiti gāyatryai candaso gāyatraṃ sāma🔽niramimīta gāyatrādupāṃśuriti gāyatrātsāmna upāṃśuṃ grahaṃ
analyzed: vasantāt ṛtoḥ niramimīta gāyatryai gāyatram iti gāyatryai candasaḥ gāyatram sāma 🔽niramimīta gāyatrāt upāṃśuḥ iti gāyatrāt sāmnaḥ upāṃśum graham
translated: he says; from the Gâyatra hymn-tune he fashioned the Gâyatra Sâman. 'From the Gâyatra the Upâmsu (graha),'🔽he says; from the Gâyatra Sâman he fashioned the Upâmsu cup.

original: niramimītopāṃśostrivṛdityupāṃśorgrahāttrivṛtaṃ stomaṃ niramimīta trivṛto
analyzed: niramimīta upāṃśoḥ trivṛt iti upāṃśoḥ grahāt trivṛtam stomam niramimīta trivṛtaḥ
translated: from the Upamshuyaja he meted out the Trivrit Stoma. From the Trivrit Stoma

original: rathantaramiti trivṛta stomādrathantaram pṛṣṭhaṃ niramimīta / / /
analyzed: rathantaram iti trivṛtaḥ stomāt rathantaram pṛṣṭham niramimīta
translated: he meted out the Rathantara Saman.

original: vasiṣṭha ṛṣiriti /
analyzed: vasiṣṭhaḥ ṛṣiḥ iti
translated: The Rishi was Vasishtha.

original: prāṇo vai vasiṣṭha ṛṣiryadvai nu śreṣṭhastena vasiṣṭho 'tho
analyzed: prāṇaḥ vai vasiṣṭhaḥ ṛṣiḥ yat vai nu śreṣṭhaḥ tena
translated: The Rishi Vasishtha is the breath; in that he is the best, therefore he is Vasishtha; moreover,

original: yadvastṛtamo vasati teno eva vasiṣṭhaḥ prajāpatigṛhītayā tvayeti prajāpatisṛṣṭayā
analyzed: yat vastṛtamaḥ vasati tena u eva vasiṣṭhaḥ prajāpati gṛhītayā tvayā iti prajāpati sṛṣṭayā
translated: in that he dwells most abundantly, therefore he is Vasishtha. 'By thee taken by Prajapati', he says; by thee created by Prajapati,

original: tvayetyetatprāṇaṃ gṛhṇāmi prajābhya iti prāṇam purastātprāpādayata nānopadadhāti
analyzed: tvayā iti etat prāṇam gṛhṇāmi prajābhyaḥ iti prāṇam purastāt prāpādayata nānā upadadhāti
translated: he says. 'I take the breath for the people', he says; he places the breath in front. He puts it down separately;

original: ye nānākāmāḥ prāṇe tāṃstaddadhāti sakṛtsādayatyekaṃ tatprāṇaṃ karotyatha yannānā
analyzed: ye nānā kāmāḥ prāṇe tān tat dadhāti sakṛt sādayati ekam tat prāṇam karoti atha yat nānā
translated: whatever various desires there are in the breath, those he places therein. He settles it once; he makes it one breath. But if he were to settle it separately,

original: sādayetprāṇaṃ ha vicindyātsaiṣā trivṛdiṣṭakā yajuḥ sādanaṃ
analyzed: sādayet prāṇam ha vicindyāt sā eṣā trivṛt iṣṭakā yajuḥ sādanam
translated: he would divide the breath. That is the Trivrit brick, the Yajus the settling,

original: sūdadohāstattrivṛttrivṛdagniryāvānagniryāvatyasya mātrā tāvattatkṛtvopadadhāti / / /
analyzed: sūdadohāḥ tat trivṛt trivṛt agniḥ yāvān agniḥ yāvatī asya mātrā tāvat tat kṛtvā upadadhāti
translated: the Sudadohas; that is the Trivrit. As great as Agni is, as great as is his measure, so great he makes it when he puts it down.

original: atha dakṣiṇataḥ /
analyzed: atha dakṣiṇatas
translated: Then on the right (south) side.🔽'This on the right, the all-worker', this is Vayu, the all-worker, who is this

original: ayaṃ dakṣiṇā viśvakarmetyayaṃ vai vāyurviśvakarmā yo 'yam
analyzed: ayam dakṣiṇā viśvakarmā iti ayam vai vāyuḥ viśvakarmā yaḥ yam
translated: wind.

original: pavata eṣa hīdaṃ sarvaṃ karoti tadyattamāha dakṣiṇeti tasmādeṣa dakṣiṇaiva
analyzed: pavate eṣa hi idam sarvam karoti tat yat tam āha dakṣiṇā iti tasmāt eṣa dakṣiṇā eva
translated: He moves it, for he makes all this. In that he says 'to the right', therefore it is to the right.

original: bhūyiṣṭhaṃ vāti mano ha vāyurbhūtvā dakṣiṇatastasthau tadeva tadrūpamupadadhāti / / /
analyzed: bhūyiṣṭham vāti manaḥ ha vāyuḥ bhūtvā dakṣiṇatas tasthau tat eva tat rūpam upadadhāti
translated: He is purified, for he makes all this. In that he says 'on the right', therefore he blows most on the right side. The mind became the wind and stood on the right side. He puts down that form.

original: tasya mano vaiśvakarmaṇamiti /🔽manastasmādrūpādvāyorniramimīta grīṣmo mānasa
analyzed: tasya manaḥ vaiśvakarmaṇam iti  manaḥ tasmāt rūpāt vāyoḥ niramimīta grīṣmaḥ mānasa
translated: Of it, the mind is Vaiśvakarmana.🔽The mind fashioned the wind from that form. The summer is the mind's

original: iti grīṣmamṛtum manaso niramimīta triṣṭubgraiṣmīti triṣṭubhaṃ cando🔽grīṣmādṛtorniramimīta triṣṭubhaḥ svāramiti triṣṭubhaścandasaḥ svāraṃ sāma
analyzed: iti grīṣmam ṛtum manasaḥ niramimīta triṣṭubh graiṣmī iti triṣṭubham cando  grīṣmāt ṛtoḥ niramimīta triṣṭubhaḥ svāram iti triṣṭubhaḥ candasaḥ svāram sāma
translated: . He fashioned the summer season from the mind. The Triṣṭubh is the summer's🔽. He fashioned the Triṣṭubh metre from the summer season. The Svara is the Triṣṭubh's

original: niramimīta svārādantaryāma iti svārātsāmno 'ntaryāmaṃ grahaṃ🔽niramimītāntaryāmātpañcadaśa ityantaryāmādgrahātpañcadaśaṃ stomaṃ niramimīta
analyzed: niramimīta svārāt antaryāmaḥ iti svārāt sāmnaḥ ntaryāmam graham  niramimīta antaryāmāt pañcadaśaḥ iti antaryāmāt grahāt pañcadaśam stomam niramimīta
translated: . He fashioned the Svara Sāman from the Triṣṭubh metre. The Antaryāma is the Svara's🔽. He fashioned the Antaryāma cup from the Svara Sāman. The Pañcadaśa is the Antaryāma's🔽. He fashioned the Pañcadaśa Stoma from the Antaryāma cup. The Bṛhat is the Pañcadaśa's

original: pañcadaśādbṛhaditi pañcadaśātstomādbṛhatpṛṣṭhaṃ niramimīta / / /
analyzed: pañcadaśāt bṛhat iti pañcadaśāt stomāt bṛhat pṛṣṭham niramimīta
translated: . He fashioned the Bṛhat Pṛṣṭha from the Pañcadaśa Stoma.

original: bharadvāja ṛṣiriti /
analyzed: bharadvājaḥ ṛṣiḥ iti
translated: The sage is Bharadvāja.

original: mano vai bharadvāja ṛṣirannaṃ vājo yo vai mano bibharti so
analyzed: manaḥ vai bharadvājaḥ ṛṣiḥ annam vājaḥ yaḥ vai manaḥ bibharti saḥ
translated: The sage Bharadvāja is the mind, and the strength is food. He who bears the mind bears

original: 'nnaṃ vājam bharati tasmānmano bharadvāja ṛṣiḥ prajāpatigṛhītayā tvayeti
analyzed: nnam vājam bharati tasmāt manaḥ bharadvājaḥ ṛṣiḥ prajāpati gṛhītayā tvayā iti
translated: He bears food and strength, therefore the Rishi Bharadvaja is called Bharadvāja. With you taken by Prajāpati,

original: prajāpatisṛṣṭayā tvayetyetanmano gṛhṇāmi prajābhya iti mano dakṣiṇataḥ🔽prāpādayata nānopadadhāti ye nānākāmā manasi tāṃstaddadhāti sakṛtsādayatyekaṃ
analyzed: prajāpati sṛṣṭayā tvayā iti etat manaḥ gṛhṇāmi prajābhyaḥ iti manaḥ dakṣiṇatas  prāpādayata nānā upadadhāti ye nānā kāmāḥ manasi tān tat dadhāti sakṛt sādayati ekam
translated: 'He bears food, he bears strength,' therefore the Rishi Bharadvaja;--'by thee taken by Pragâpati,'--that is, 'by thee created by Pragâpati;'--'I take the mind for the people,'--he placed the mind on the right (south) side;--

original: tanmanaḥ karotyatha yannānā sādayenmano ha vicindyātsaiṣā trivṛdiṣṭakā tasyokto🔽bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: tat manaḥ karoti atha yat nānā sādayet manaḥ ha vicindyāt sā eṣā trivṛt iṣṭakā tasya uktā  bandhuḥ
translated: he put it down separately: he thereby put into the mind those wishes which are separate (or, various);--he settles it once: he thereby makes that mind one. And were he to settle it separately, he would cleave the mind. This is a threefold brick: the significance of this (will be explained) hereafter .

original: atha paścāt /🔽ayam paścādviśvavyacā ityasau vā ādityo viśvavyacā yadā hyevaiṣa🔽udetyathedaṃ sarvaṃ vyaco bhavati tadyattamāha paścāditi tasmādetam🔽pratyañcameva yantam paśyanti cakṣurhādityo bhūtvā paścāttasthau tadeva
analyzed: atha paścāt  ayam paścāt viśvavyacāḥ iti asau vai ādityaḥ viśvavyacāḥ yadā hi eva eṣa  udeti atha idam sarvam vyacaḥ bhavati tat yat tam āha paścāt iti tasmāt etam  pratyañcam eva yantam paśyanti cakṣuḥ ha ādityaḥ bhūtvā paścāt tasthau tat eva
translated: Now on the back (west) side.

original: tadrūpamupadadhāti / / /
analyzed: tad rūpam upadadhāti
translated: 'This is the back, the all-encompassing,'--the all-encompassing one, doubtless, is yonder sun; for when he rises then everything here becomes all-encompassing. And as to his calling him 'the back,' therefore we see him only when he moves towards the west. The eye, having become the sun, remained behind; he now lays that form into it.

original: tasya cakṣurvaiśvavyacasamiti /
analyzed: tasya cakṣuḥ vaiśvavyacasam iti
translated: 'Its eye, the all-encompassing,'--

original: cakṣustasmādrūpādādityānniramimīta
analyzed: cakṣuḥ tasmāt rūpāt ādityāt niramimīta
translated: the eye he fashioned out of that form;--

original: varṣāścākṣuṣya iti varṣā ṛtuṃ cakṣuṣo niramimīta jagatī vārṣīti jagatīṃ cando
analyzed: varṣāḥ cākṣuṣyaḥ iti varṣāḥ ṛtum cakṣuṣaḥ niramimīta jagatī vārṣī iti jagatīm cando
translated: 'the rainy season, the eye,'--the rainy season he fashioned out of the eye;--'the Gagatî, the rainy,'--the Gagatî metre he fashioned out of the rainy season.

original: varṣābhya ṛtorniramimīta jagatyā ṛkṣamamiti jagatyai candasa ṛkṣamaṃ sāma
analyzed: varṣābhyaḥ ṛtoḥ niramimīta jagatyai ṛkṣamam iti jagatyai candase ṛkṣamam sāma
translated: From the rainy season, from the season, he measured out the Jagati metre, the Rksamana Sâman.🔽He measured out the Rksamana Sâman.

original: niramimīta 'rkṣamācukra ityṛkṣamātsāmnaḥ śukraṃ grahaṃ niramimīta🔽śukrātsaptadaśa iti śukrādgrahātsaptadaśaṃ stomaṃ niramimīta
analyzed: niramimīta rkṣam ācukraḥ iti ṛkṣamāt sāmnaḥ śukram graham niramimīta  śukrāt saptadaśaḥ iti śukrāt grahāt saptadaśam stomam niramimīta
translated: From the Rksamana Sâman he measured out the Shukra cup.🔽From the Shukra cup he measured out the Saptadaça Stoma.

original: saptadaśādvairūpamiti saptadaśātstomādvairūpam pṛṣṭhaṃ niramimīta / / /
analyzed: saptadaśāt vairūpam iti saptadaśāt stomāt vairūpam pṛṣṭham niramimīta
translated: From the Saptadaça Stoma he measured out the Vairûpa Prishtha.

original: jamadagnirṛṣiriti /
analyzed: jamadagniḥ ṛṣiḥ iti
translated: The Rishi Jamadagni, he says.

original: cakṣurvai jamadagnirṛṣiryadenena jagatpaśyatyatho manute🔽tasmāccakṣurjamadagnirṛṣiḥ prajāpatigṛhītayā tvayeti prajāpatisṛṣṭayā🔽tvayetyetaccakṣurgṛhṇāmi prajābhya iti cakṣuḥ paścātprāpādayata nānopadadhāti ye🔽nānākāmāścakṣuṣi tāṃstaddadhāti sakṛtsādayatyekaṃ taccakṣuḥ karotyatha yannānā
analyzed: cakṣuḥ vai jamadagniḥ ṛṣiḥ yat enena jagat paśyati atha u manute  tasmāt cakṣuḥ jamadagniḥ ṛṣiḥ prajāpati gṛhītayā tvayā iti prajāpati sṛṣṭayā  tvayā iti etat cakṣuḥ gṛhṇāmi prajābhyaḥ iti cakṣuḥ paścāt prāpādayata nānā upadadhāti ye  nānā kāmāḥ cakṣuṣi tān tat dadhāti sakṛt sādayati ekam tat cakṣuḥ karoti atha yat nānā
translated: The eye is the Rishi Jamadagni, in that by it one sees the world and thinks,

original: sādayeccakṣurha vicindyātsaiṣā trivṛdiṣṭakā tasyokto bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: sādayet cakṣuḥ ha vicindyāt sā eṣā trivṛt iṣṭakā tasya uktaḥ bandhuḥ
translated: therefore the eye is the Rishi Jamadagni. With thee taken by Prajâpati, he says; with thee created by Prajâpati, he says. With thee I take the eye for the people, he says; he placed the eye behind. He puts down separately; whatever desires there are in the eye, those he bestows. He settles it once: he makes the eye one. But were he to settle it separately, he would divide the eye. That is the threefold brick; the meaning of that has been explained.

original: athottarataḥ /
analyzed: atha uttaratas
translated: Now on the north side.

original: idamuttarātsvariti diśo vā uttarāttadyattā āhottarādityuttarā
analyzed: idam uttarāt svar iti diśaḥ vai uttarāt tat yat tāḥ āha uttarāt iti uttarā
translated: This is the northern quarter. The northern quarter is above this. As to why it is above, the northern quarter is above this (earth),

original: hyasmātsarvasmāddiśo 'tha yatsvarityāha svargo hi loko diśaḥ śrotraṃ ha diśo
analyzed: hi asmāt sarvasmāt diśaḥ yat svar iti āha svargaḥ hi lokaḥ diśaḥ śrotram ha diśaḥ
translated: and the northern quarter is above all this (earth). Then as to why he says 'svara' (sound), the world of heaven is the quarters, for the quarters are the ear.

original: bhūtvottaratastasthau tadeva tadrūpamupadadhāti / / /
analyzed: bhūtvā uttaratas tasthau tat eva tat rūpam upadadhāti
translated: The ear became the northern quarter and settled down. He lays down that form.

original: tasya śrotraṃ sauvamiti /
analyzed: tasya śrotram sauvam iti
translated: Its ear is sauva.

original: śrotraṃ tasmādrūpāddigbhyo niramimīta śaracrautrīti🔽śaradamṛtuṃ śrotrānniramimītānuṣṭupśāradītyanuṣṭubhaṃ candaḥ śarada
analyzed: śrotram tasmāt rūpāt digbhyaḥ niramimīta śara crautrī iti  śaradam ṛtum śrotrāt niramimīta anuṣṭubh śāradī iti anuṣṭubham candaḥ śaradaḥ
translated: He fashioned the ear from that form, from the quarters. The autumn is the ear.🔽He fashioned the autumn season from the ear. The Anustubh is the autumn.🔽He fashioned the Anustubh metre from the autumn season. The Aindri is the Anustubh.

original: ṛtorniramimītānuṣṭubha aiḍamityanuṣṭubhaścandasa aiḍaṃ sāma🔽niramimītaiḍānmanthītyaiḍātsāmno manthinaṃ grahaṃ niramimīta manthina🔽ekaviṃśa iti manthino grahādekaviṃśaṃ stomaṃ
analyzed: ṛtoḥ niramimīta anuṣṭubhe aiḍam iti anuṣṭubhaḥ candasaḥ aiḍam sāma  niramimīta aiḍāt manthī iti aiḍāt sāmnaḥ manthinam graham niramimīta manthina  ekaviṃśaḥ iti manthinaḥ grahāt ekaviṃśam stomam
translated: He fashioned the Aindri Saman from the Anustubh metre. The Manthin is the Aindri.🔽He fashioned the Manthin cup from the Aindri Saman. The Ekavinça is the Manthin.🔽He fashioned the Ekavinça Stoma from the Manthin cup. The Vairaja is the Ekavinça.

original: niramimītaikaviṃśādvairājamityekaviṃśātstomādvairājam pṛṣṭhaṃ niramimīta / / /
analyzed: niramimīta ekaviṃśāt vairājam iti ekaviṃśāt stomāt vairājam pṛṣṭham niramimīta
translated: He fashioned the Vairaja Prstha from the Ekavinça Stoma.

original: viśvāmitra ṛṣiriti /
analyzed: viśvāmitraḥ ṛṣiḥ iti
translated: The Rishi is Visvamitra.

original: śrotraṃ vai viśvāmitra ṛṣiryadenena sarvataḥ śṛṇotyatho yadasmai
analyzed: śrotram vai viśvāmitraḥ ṛṣiḥ yat enena sarvatas śṛṇoti atha u yat asmai
translated: The Rishi Visvamitra is the ear, because by it one hears on all sides, and also because it is the ear.

original: sarvato mitram bhavati tasmācrotraṃ viśvāmitra ṛṣiḥ prajāpatigṛhītayā tvayeti🔽prajāpatisṛṣṭayā tvayetyetacrotraṃ gṛhṇāmi prajābhya iti śrotramuttarataḥ🔽prāpādayata nānopadadhāti ye nānākāmāḥ śrotre tāṃstaddadhāti sakṛtsādayatyekaṃ
analyzed: sarvatas mitram bhavati tasmāt acrotram viśvāmitraḥ ṛṣiḥ prajāpati gṛhītayā tvayā iti  prajāpati sṛṣṭayā tvayā iti etat crotram gṛhṇāmi prajābhyaḥ iti śrotram uttaratas  prāpādayata nānā upadadhāti ye nānā kāmāḥ śrotre tān tat dadhāti sakṛt sādayati ekam
translated: 'From all sides be thou a friend', (with these words he touches) the right ear; therefore the sage Viçvamitra is a friend to all. 'By thee taken by Pragâpati', (with these words he touches) the left ear; that is, 'by thee created by Pragâpati.' 'The ear I take for my offspring,' (with these words he touches) the ear on the left (north) side; he thus places the ear on the left side. He lays down (the bricks) separately; the wishes which are various in the ear, those he thus lays into it. He settles them once only; the ear is one only.

original: tacrotraṃ karotyatha yannānā sādayecrotraṃ ha vicindyātsaiṣā trivṛdiṣṭakā tasyokto🔽bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: tat crotram karoti atha yat nānā sādayet crotram ha vicindyāt sā eṣā trivṛt iṣṭakā tasya uktā  bandhuḥ
translated: He is a friend on every side: therefore the sage Viçvamitra is on every side. 'By thee taken by Pragâpati', he says;--by thee created by Pragâpati, he means to say. 'I take the ear for the people,' he says, and thus lays the ear into the northern (part of the body). He lays it down once: he thus makes the ear one (and the same in all men). If he were to lay it down separately, he would divide the ear. This is a threefold brick: the significance of this (will be explained) hereafter .

original: atha madhye /🔽iyamupari matiriti candramā vā upari tadyattamāhoparotyupari hi🔽candramā atha yanmatirityāha vāgvai matirvācā hīdaṃ sarvam manute vāggha🔽candramā bhūtvopariṣṭāttasthau tadeva tadrūpamupadadhāti / / /
analyzed: atha madhye  iyam upari matiḥ iti candramāḥ vai upari tat yat tam āha uparā ūti upari hi  candramāḥ atha yat matiḥ iti āha vāc vai matiḥ vācā hi idam sarvam manute vāc ha  candramāḥ bhūtvā upariṣṭāt tasthau tat eva tat rūpam upadadhāti
translated: Now in the middle.

original: tasyai vāṅnātyeti /
analyzed: tasyai vāc na atyeti
translated: 'This is above, the mind,'--the moon doubtless is above; and as to why he speaks of it as 'above,' the moon is indeed above (us). And as to why he calls it 'mind,' the mind doubtless is speech, for by speech everything here is thought out; and speech became the moon and remained above: it is that form he now lays down.

original: vācaṃ tasmādrūpāccandramaso niramimīta hemanto vācya iti
analyzed: vācam tasmāt rūpāt candramasaḥ niramimīta hemantaḥ vācyaḥ iti
translated: Speech does not go beyond it: from that form, the moon, he fashioned speech. 'The winter is of speech,' he says;

original: hemantamṛtuṃ vāco niramimīta paṅktirhaimantīti paṅktiṃ cando
analyzed: hemantam ṛtum vācaḥ niramimīta paṅktiḥ haimantī iti paṅktim cando
translated: he fashioned the winter season from speech. 'The Paṅkti (metre) is of the winter,' he says;--the Paṅkti metre

original: hemantādṛtorniramimīta paṅktyai nidhanavaditi paṅktyai candaso nidhanavatsāma🔽niramimīta nidhanavata āgrayaṇa iti nidhanavataḥ sāmna āgrayaṇaṃ grahaṃ🔽niramimītāgrayaṇāttriṇavatrayastriṃśāvityāgrayaṇādgrahāttriṇavatrayastriṃśau stomau🔽niramimīta triṇavatrayastriṃśābhyāṃ śākvararaivate iti triṇavatrayastriṃśābhyāṃ
analyzed: hemantāt ṛtoḥ niramimīta paṅktyai nidhanavat iti paṅktyai candasaḥ nidhanavat sāma  niramimīta nidhanavataḥ āgrayaṇe iti nidhanavataḥ sāmnaḥ āgrayaṇam graham  niramimīta āgrayaṇāt triṇava trayastriṃśau iti āgrayaṇāt grahāt triṇava trayastriṃśau stomau  niramimīta triṇava trayastriṃśābhyām śākvara raivate iti triṇava trayastriṃśābhyām
translated: He measured out for the Paṅkti metre the Sāman with a concluding part.🔽He measured out for the Sāman with a concluding part the Āgrayana cup.🔽He measured out for the Āgrayana cup the Triṇava and Trayastriṃśa Stomas.

original: stomābhyāṃ śākvararaivate pṛṣṭhe niramimīta / / /
analyzed: stomābhyām śākvara raivate pṛṣṭhe niramimīta
translated: He measured out for the Triṇava and Trayastriṃśa Stomas the Śākvara and Raivata Pṛṣṭhas.

original: viśvakarma ṛṣiriti /
analyzed: viśvakarmā ṛṣiḥ iti
translated: Viśvakarman Ṛṣi.

original: vāgvai viśvakarma 'rṣirvācā hīdaṃ sarvaṃ kṛtaṃ🔽tasmādvāgviśvakarma 'rṣiḥ prajāpatigṛhītayā tvayeti prajāpatisṛṣṭayā
analyzed: vāc vai viśvakarma ṛṣiḥ vācā hi idam sarvam kṛtam  tasmāt vāc viśvakarma ṛṣiḥ prajāpati gṛhītayā tvayā iti prajāpati sṛṣṭayā
translated: Viśvakarman Ṛṣi is speech, for by speech everything here is made;

original: tvayetyetadvācaṃ gṛhṇāmi prajābhya iti vācamupariṣṭātprāpādayata nānopadadhāti ye
analyzed: tvayā iti etat vācam gṛhṇāmi prajābhyaḥ iti vācam upariṣṭāt prāpādayata nānā upadadhāti ye
translated: therefore Viśvakarman Ṛṣi is speech. With thee taken by Prajāpati, he said; with thee created by Prajāpati, he said; with thee I take speech for offspring, he said; he placed speech above. He lays down separately;

original: nānākāmā vāci tāṃstaddadhāti sakṛtsādayatyekāṃ tadvācaṃ karotyatha yannānā
analyzed: nānā kāmāḥ vāci tān tat dadhāti sakṛt sādayati ekām tat vācam karoti atha yat nānā
translated: whatever desires there are in speech, those he places therein. He settles once; he makes speech one. Then in that he lays down separately,

original: sādayedvācaṃ ha vicindyātsaiṣā trivṛdiṣṭakā tasyokto bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: sādayet vācam ha vicindyāt sā eṣā trivṛt iṣṭakā tasya uktaḥ bandhuḥ
translated: he would cut off speech; this is the threefold brick; the meaning of this has been explained.

original: etadvai tadannam /
analyzed: etat vai tat annam
translated: This, indeed, is that food

original: yattatprāṇāśca prajāpatiścāsṛjantaitāvānvai sarvo yajño yajña u
analyzed: yat tat prāṇāḥ ca prajāpatiḥ ca asṛjanta etāvān vai sarvaḥ yajñaḥ yajñaḥ u
translated: which the vital airs and Pragâpati created; for so great is the whole sacrifice, the sacrifice

original: devānāmannam / / /🔽tā daśadśopadadhāti /🔽daśākṣarā virāḍvirāḍu kṛtsnamannaṃ🔽sarvamevāsminnetatkṛtsnamannaṃ dadhāti sarvata upadadhāti sarvata
analyzed: devānām annam  tāḥ daśa dśa upadadhāti  daśa akṣarā virāj virāju kṛtsnam annam  sarvam eva asmin etat kṛtsnam annam dadhāti sarvatas upadadhāti sarvatas
translated: being the food of the gods.

original: evāsminnetatkṛtsnamannaṃ dadhāti tā haitā virāja etānprāṇānbibhrati
analyzed: eva asmin etat kṛtsnam annam dadhāti tāḥ ha etāḥ virājaḥ etān prāṇān bibhrati
translated: He lays down ten (bricks) each time;--the Virâg consists of ten syllables, and the Virâg is all food: he thus puts all food into him (Agni). He lays them down all round: he thus puts all food into him on every side. And, besides, those Virâg (bricks) support those vital airs;

original: yatprāṇānbibhrati tasmātprāṇabhṛtaḥ / / /🔽tadāhuḥ / kim prāṇāḥ kim prāṇabhṛta iti prāṇā eva prāṇā aṅgāni prāṇabhṛntyaṅgāni hi
analyzed: yat prāṇān bibhrati tasmāt prāṇabhṛtaḥ  tat āhuḥ kim prāṇāḥ kim prāṇabhṛtaḥ iti prāṇāḥ eva prāṇāḥ aṅgāni prāṇabhṛnti aṅgāni hi
translated: and because they support the vital airs, therefore they are Prânabhrits (vital-air-bearers).

original: prāṇānbibhrati prāṇāstveva prāṇā annam prāṇabhṛdannaṃ hi prāṇānbibharti / / /🔽tadāhuḥ / kathamasyaitāḥ sarvāḥ prājāpatyā bhavantīti yadeva sarvāsvāha
analyzed: prāṇān bibhrati prāṇāḥ tu eva prāṇāḥ annam prāṇabhṛt annam hi prāṇān bibharti  tat āhuḥ katham asya etāḥ sarvāḥ prājāpatyāḥ bhavanti iti yat eva sarvāsu āha
translated: As to this they say, 'What are the vital airs, and what the vital-air-bearers?' The vital airs are the vital airs, and the limbs are the vital-air-bearers, for the limbs support the vital airs. But the vital airs are indeed the vital airs, and food is the vital-air-bearer, for food supports the vital airs.

original: prajāpatigṛhītayā tvayetyevamu hāsyaitāḥ sarvāḥ prājāpatyā bhavanti / / /
analyzed: prajāpati gṛhītayā tvayā iti evam u ha asya etāḥ sarvāḥ prājāpatyāḥ bhavanti
translated: As to this they say, 'How does he make all these (bricks) to belong to Pragâpati?' Well, when he says, 'By thee taken by Pragâpati,' then all these (bricks) of his become belonging to Pragâpati.

original: tadāhuḥ / yadgrahāya gṛhītāya stuvate 'tha śaṃsatyatha🔽kasmātpurastādgrahāṇāmṛcaśca sāmāni copadadhātīti saṃsthā vai karmaṇo🔽'nvīkṣitavya 'rcā vai pratipadā graho gṛhyata ṛci sāma gīyate
analyzed: tat āhuḥ yat grahāya gṛhītāya stuvate śaṃsati atha  kasmāt purastāt grahāṇām ṛcaḥ ca sāmāni ca upadadhāti iti saṃsthā vai karmaṇaḥ  nvīkṣitavya ṛcā vai pratipadā grahaḥ gṛhyate ṛci sāma gīyate
translated: As to this they say, 'If he praises after the cup has been drawn, and then recites the Sâman ,🔽why then does he put the Rik and Sâman hymns in front of the cups?' The completion of the rite, doubtless, is to be looked for in the Sâman; for the cup is drawn with the Rik verse, and the Sâman is chanted in the Rik.

original: tadasyaitadyatpurastādgrahāṇāmṛcaśca sāmāni copadadhātyatha🔽yadupariṣṭādgrahāṇāṃ stutaśastre bhavatastadvasyaitadyadupariṣṭādgrahāṇāṃ
analyzed: tat asya etat yat purastāt grahāṇām ṛcaḥ ca sāmāni ca upadadhāti atha  yat upariṣṭāt grahāṇām stuta śastre bhavataḥ tat vai asya etat yat upariṣṭāt grahāṇām
translated: And as to why he puts the Rik and Sâman hymns in front of the cups, it is because this (cup) is drawn first of all the cups.🔽And as to why the Sâman and the hymn follow after the cups, it is because this (cup) is drawn last of all the cups.

original: stomāṃśca pṛṣṭhāni copadadhāti / / /🔽tadāhuḥ / yadetattrayaṃ saha kriyate graha stotraṃ śastramathātra grahaṃ caiva🔽stotraṃ copadadhāti kathamasyātrāpi śasramupahitaṃ yadvāva stotraṃ tacastraṃ yāsu
analyzed: stomān ca pṛṣṭhāni ca upadadhāti  tat āhuḥ yat etat trayam saha kriyate graha stotram śastram atha atra graham ca eva  stotram ca upadadhāti katham asya atra api śasram upahitam yat vāva stotram tat astram yāsu
translated: And as to why he puts the Stomas and the Prishthas in front of the cups, it is because this (cup) is drawn first of all the cups.

original: hyeva stuvate tā u evānuśaṃsatyevamu hāsyātrāpi śastramupahitam bhavati / / /
analyzed: hi eva stuvate tāḥ u eva anuśaṃsati evam u ha asya atra api śastram upahitam bhavati
translated: As to this they say, 'If these three are performed together, the cup, the hymn, and the Sastra , and if he puts the cup and the hymn in front (of the Sastra), how then is the Sastra also put in front by him?' Well, the hymn, doubtless, is the Sastra; for it is on those (verses) which they chant that he subsequently recites (the Sastra). Thus, then, the Sastra also is put in front by him.

original: tadāhuḥ / yadyathā pituḥ putramevaṃ trīṇi prathamānyāhātha kasmādṛkṣāmayoḥ
analyzed: tat āhuḥ yat yathā pituḥ putram evam trīṇi prathamāni āha atha kasmāt ṛk sāmayoḥ
translated: As to this they say, 'If he speaks of these three in the same way as of father and son, why then does he first mention the three (cups) , and afterwards the Rik and Sâman?'

original: saṃkrāmatīti sāma vā ṛcaḥ patistadyattatrāpi yathā pituḥ putramevam brūyādyathā
analyzed: saṃkrāmati iti sāma vai ṛcaḥ patiḥ tat yat tatra api yathā pituḥ putram evam brūyāt yathā
translated: 'It passes over,'--the Saman is the lord of the Rik; and in that (case) also he should speak as of a son to his father, or

original: patiṃ santam putram brūyāttādṛktattasmādṛkṣāmayoḥ saṃkrāmati kasmādu triḥ
analyzed: patim santam putram brūyāt tādṛś tat tasmāt ṛś sāmayoḥ saṃkrāmati kasmāt u tris
translated: as of a husband to his son; in the same way it passes over from the Rik to the Saman. And why he repeats it thrice,

original: saṃtanotīti pitaram putram pautraṃ tāṃstatsaṃtanoti tasmādu tebhya eka eva dadāti / / /
analyzed: saṃtanoti iti pitaram putram pautram tān tat saṃtanoti tasmāt u tebhyaḥ ekaḥ eva dadāti
translated: (is this): he repeats the father, the son, the grandson; he thus repeats them; and therefore he gives to them (the sacrificial fee) as to one only.

original: tadyāḥ purastādupadadhāti /
analyzed: tat yāḥ purastāt upadadhāti
translated: Now those which he lays down in front,

original: tāḥ prāṇabhṛto 'tha yāḥ paścāttāścakṣurbhṛtastā
analyzed: tāḥ prāṇa bhṛtaḥ yāḥ paścāt tāḥ cakṣuḥ bhṛtaḥ tā
translated: they are the 'life-holders;' and those which are behind, they are the 'eye-holders;'

original: apānabhṛto 'tha yā dakṣiṇatastā manobhṛtastā u vyānabhṛto 'tha yā uttaratastāḥ
analyzed: apāna bhṛtaḥ tha yāḥ dakṣiṇatas tāḥ manaḥ bhṛtaḥ tāḥ u vyāna bhṛtaḥ tha yāḥ uttaratas tāḥ
translated: they are the 'out-breath-holders.' And those which are on the right (south) side, they are the 'mind-holders;' they are the 'through-breath-holders.' And those which are on the left (north) side,

original: śrotrabhṛtastā udānabhṛto 'tha yā madhye tā vāgbhṛtastā u samānabhṛtaḥ / / /
analyzed: śrotra bhṛtaḥ tāḥ udāna bhṛtaḥ tha yāḥ madhye tāḥ vāc bhṛtaḥ tāḥ u samāna bhṛtaḥ
translated: they are the 'ear-holders;' they are the 'up-breath-holders.' And those which are in the middle, they are the 'speech-holders;' they are the 'equalizing-breath-holders.'

original: tadu ha carakādhvaryavaḥ /🔽anyā evāpānabhṛto vyānabhṛta udānabhṛtaḥ🔽samānabhṛtaścakṣurbhṛto manobhṛtaḥ śrotrabhṛto vāgbhṛta ityupadadhati na tathā
analyzed: tat u ha carakādhvaryavaḥ  anyāḥ eva apāna bhṛtaḥ vyāna bhṛtaḥ udāna bhṛtaḥ  samāna bhṛtaḥ cakṣuḥ bhṛtaḥ manaḥ bhṛtaḥ śrotra bhṛtaḥ vāc bhṛtaḥ iti upadadhati na tathā
translated: Now, the Charaka-Adhvaryus

original: kuryādatyahaiva rocayantyatro evaitāni sarvāṇi rūpāṇyupadhīyante / / /
analyzed: kuryāt atyaha eva rocayanti atra u eva etāni sarvāṇi rūpāṇi upadhīyante
translated: lay down the 'out-breath-holders,' the 'through-breath-holders,' the 'up-breath-holders,' the 'equalizing-breath-holders,' the 'eye-holders,' the 'mind-holders,' the 'ear-holders,' and the 'speech-holders,' as different (from the others); but let him not do so; for they are indeed over-scrupulous in this matter: all these forms are laid down here.

original: sa vai purastādupadhāya paścādupadadhāti /
analyzed: sa vai purastāt upadhāya paścāt upadadhāti
translated: He puts down (the bricks) in front, and then behind.

original: prāṇo hāpāno bhūtvāṅgulyagrebhya iti🔽saṃcaratyapāna u ha prāṇo bhūtvāṅgulyagrebhya iti saṃcarati tadyatpurastādupadhāya
analyzed: prāṇaḥ ha apānaḥ bhūtvā aṅguli agrebhyaḥ iti  saṃcarati apānaḥ u ha prāṇaḥ bhūtvā aṅguli agrebhyaḥ iti saṃcarati tat yat purastāt upadhāya
translated: The downward breathing, becoming the upward breathing, moves from the tips of the fingers.🔽And the upward breathing, becoming the downward breathing, moves from the tips of the fingers. In that he puts down (the bricks) in front,

original: paścādupadadhātyenāvevaitatprāṇau saṃtanoti saṃdadhāti tasmādetau prāṇau saṃtatau
analyzed: paścāt upadadhāti enau eva etat prāṇau saṃtanoti saṃdadhāti tasmāt etau prāṇau saṃtatau
translated: and then behind, he thus connects, joins together, these two breaths. Therefore these two breaths are connected,

original: saṃhitau / / /
analyzed: saṃhitau
translated: joined together.

original: atha dakṣiṇata upadhāyottarata upadadhāti /
analyzed: atha dakṣiṇatas upadhāya uttaratas upadadhāti
translated: Then, having put down (the bricks) on the right, he puts down (those) on the left.

original: vyāno hodāno bhūtvāṅgulyagrebhya iti🔽saṃcaratyudāna u ha vyāno bhūtvāṅgulyagrebhya iti saṃcarati tadyaddakṣiṇata
analyzed: vyānaḥ ha udānaḥ bhūtvā aṅguli agrebhyaḥ iti  saṃcarati udānaḥ u ha vyānaḥ bhūtvā aṅguli agrebhyaḥ iti saṃcarati tat yat dakṣiṇatas
translated: The cross-breathing, becoming the upward breathing, moves from the tips of the fingers.🔽And the upward breathing, becoming the cross-breathing, moves from the tips of the fingers. In that he puts down (the bricks) on the right,

original: upadhāyottarata upadadhātyetāvevaitatprāṇau saṃtanoti saṃdadhāti tasmādetau prāṇau
analyzed: upadhāya uttaratas upadadhāti etau eva etat prāṇau saṃtanoti saṃdadhāti tasmāt etau prāṇau
translated: and then on the left, he thus connects, joins together, these two breaths. Therefore these two breaths are

original: saṃtatau saṃhitau / / /
analyzed: saṃtatau saṃhitau
translated: connected, joined together.

original: atha yā madhya upadadhāti /
analyzed: atha yāḥ madhye upadadhāti
translated: Then the (bricks) which he puts down in the middle,

original: sa prāṇastā retaḥsicorvelayopadadhāti pṛṣṭayo vai
analyzed: sa prāṇaḥ tāḥ retaḥ sicoḥ velayā upadadhāti pṛṣṭayaḥ vai
translated: that is the out-breathing. He puts them down on the range of the two Retahsic (bricks). The Retahsic (bricks) are the ribs,

original: retaḥsicau madhyamu pṛṣṭayo madhyata evāsminnetatprāṇaṃ dadhāti sarvata
analyzed: retaḥsicau madhyam pṛṣṭayaḥ madhyatas eva asmin etat prāṇam dadhāti sarvatas
translated: the ribs are the middle: in the middle he thus puts the out-breathing into him. On all sides he puts them down: on all sides he thus puts the out-breathing into him.

original: upadadhāti sarvata evāsminnetatprāṇaṃ dadhātyatho evaṃ haiṣa gudaḥ prāṇaḥ🔽samantaṃ nābhim paryakno nūcīśca tiraścīścopadadhāti tasmādime 'nvañcaśca
analyzed: upadadhāti sarvatas eva asmin etat prāṇam dadhāti atha u evam ha eṣa gudaḥ prāṇaḥ  samantam nābhim paryaknaḥ nūcīḥ ca tiraścīḥ ca upadadhāti tasmāt ime nvañcaḥ ca
translated: He lays them down all round: he thus places breath in him on every side. Moreover, that is the anus, and the breath is the navel.🔽He lays down the Nûkas and the Tîrîs all round the navel: hence the vital airs in the body are both longitudinal and transverse.

original: tiryañcaścātmanprāṇāḥ saṃspṛṣṭā upadadhāti prāṇānevaitatsaṃtanoti saṃdadhāti
analyzed: tiryañcaḥ ca ātman prāṇāḥ saṃspṛṣṭāḥ upadadhāti prāṇān eva etat saṃtanoti saṃdadhāti
translated: He lays them down so as to touch: he thus connects and joins the vital airs.

original: tasmādime prāṇāḥ saṃtatāḥ saṃhitāḥ / / /
analyzed: tasmāt ime prāṇāḥ saṃtatāḥ saṃhitāḥ
translated: Hence these vital airs are connected and joined together.

original: tā haike puruṣamupārpyopadadhati /🔽eṣa vai prāṇastametā bibhrati yatprāṇam🔽bibhrati tasmātprāṇabhṛta iti na tathā kuryādeṣo 'haiva prāṇo ya eṣa hiraṇmayaḥ🔽puruṣastasya tvayamātmā yāvadidamabhyayamagnirvihitastadyaddhāsyaitā aṅga🔽nābhiprāpnuyuḥ prāṇo hāsya tadaṅgaṃ nābhiprāpnuyādyadu vai prāṇo 'ṅgaṃ
analyzed: tāḥ ha eke puruṣam upārpya upadadhati  eṣa vai prāṇaḥ tam etāḥ bibhrati yat prāṇam  bibhrati tasmāt prāṇabhṛtaḥ iti na tathā kuryāt eṣaḥ ha eva prāṇaḥ yaḥ eṣa hiraṇmayaḥ  puruṣaḥ tasya tu ayam ātmā yāvat idam abhi ayam agniḥ vihitaḥ tat yat ha asya etāḥ aṅga  na abhiprāpnuyuḥ prāṇaḥ ha asya tat aṅgam na abhiprāpnuyāt yat u vai prāṇaḥ ṅgam
translated: Now some lay them down after having placed (them) on a man.

original: nābhiprāpnoti śuṣyati vā vai tanmlāyati vā tasmādenāḥ
analyzed: na abhiprāpnoti śuṣyati vā vai tat mlāyati vā tasmāt enāḥ
translated: 'This (man) is the breath: they (the Prânabhrits) support him, and because they support the breath, therefore they are Prânabhrits.' Let him not do so; for that golden man is the breath, and this (earth) is his body, as far as this Agni (the altar) has been built up. Now were those (bricks) not to reach his (Agni's) limbs, the breath would not reach that limb of his (Agni); and whatever limb the breath does not reach, that either dries up or rots away: let him therefore lay them down after having placed them on the enclosing-stones.

original: pariśritsvevopārpyopadadhyādatha yā madhya upadadhāti tābhirasyaiṣa ātmā
analyzed: pariśritsu eva upārpya upadadhyāt atha yāḥ madhye upadadhāti tābhiḥ asya eṣaḥ ātmā
translated: And as to those which he lays down in the middle, they are his (Agni's) body.

original: pūrṇastā u evaitasmādanantarhitāḥ / / /
analyzed: pūrṇaḥ tāḥ u eva etasmāt an antarhitāḥ
translated: They are complete, and not excluded from this (fire-altar).

original: tadāhuḥ / yadayam puro bhuvo 'yaṃ dakṣiṇā viśvakarmāyam paścādviśvavyacā🔽idamuttarātsvariyamupari matiriti samprati diśo 'bhyanūcyante 'tha kasmādenā🔽akṣṇayādeśeṣūpadadhātīti prāṇā vai prāṇabhṛtastā yatsamprati diśa🔽upadadhyātprāgapaṃ haivāyam prāṇaḥ saṃcaredatha yadenā evamabhyanūktāḥ
analyzed: tat āhuḥ yat ayam puras bhuvaḥ yam dakṣiṇā viśvakarmā ayam paścāt viśvavyacāḥ  idam uttarāt svar iyam upari matiḥ iti samprati diśaḥ bhyanūcyante kasmāt enā  akṣṇayā deśeṣu upadadhāti iti prāṇāḥ vai prāṇabhṛtaḥ tāḥ yat samprati diśaḥ  upadadhyāt prāk apam ha eva ayam prāṇaḥ saṃcaret atha yat enāḥ evam abhyanūktāḥ
translated: As to that, they say, 'This (brick) in front is the Bhuva (earth), this on the right is the Vishvakarma (all-worker), this behind is the Vishvavyana (all-pervading),

original: satīrakṣṇayādeśeṣūpadadhāti tasmādayam prāgapam prāṇaḥ sannakṣṇayā
analyzed: satīḥ akṣṇayā deśeṣu upadadhāti tasmāt ayam prāc apam prāṇaḥ san akṣṇayā
translated: this on the left is the Svariya (self-sovereign), and this above is the Mati (mind):' thus the regions are named in order; but why does he lay them down in the directions in a contrary order?--the Prânabhrit (bricks) are the vital airs; were he to lay them down in the directions in order, then this vital air of his would move forward; but inasmuch as, after being named in that (direct) order, he lays them down in the directions in a contrary order, therefore this vital air of his, being in front, moves in a contrary (retrograde) direction,

original: sarvāṇyaṅgāni sarvamātmānamanusaṃcarati / / /
analyzed: sarvāṇi aṅgāni sarvam ātmānam anusaṃcarati
translated: and pervades all the limbs and the whole body.

original: sa eṣa paśuryadagniḥ /🔽so 'traiva sarvaḥ kṛtsnaḥ saṃskṛtastasya yāḥ🔽purastādupadadhāti tau bāhū atha yāḥ paścātte sakthyāvatha yā madhya upadadhāti
analyzed: saḥ eṣa paśuḥ yat agniḥ  saḥ trā eva sarvaḥ kṛtsnaḥ saṃskṛtaḥ tasya yāḥ  purastāt upadadhāti tau bāhū atha yāḥ paścāt te sakthyau atha yāḥ madhye upadadhāti
translated: Now that Agni is an animal;

original: sa ātmā tā retaḥsicorvelayopadadhāti pṛṣṭayo vai retaḥsicau madhyamu pṛṣṭayo
analyzed: saḥ ātmā tāḥ retaḥsicoḥ velayā upadadhāti pṛṣṭayaḥ vai retaḥsicau madhyam pṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: and he is here made up whole and complete. The two (bricks) which he lays down in front are his two fore-feet, and those two (bricks) which he lays down behind are his two thighs; and what (bricks) he lays down in the middle that is his body. He lays them down on the range of the Retahsik (bricks), for the Retahsik are the ribs, and the middle is the ribs.

original: madhyato hyayamātmā sarvata upadadhāti sarvato hyayamātmā / / /
analyzed: madhyatas hi ayam ātmā sarvatas upadadhāti sarvatas hi ayam ātmā
translated: for this Self is in the middle; everywhere he puts it down, for this Self is everywhere.

original: tadāhuḥ / yatpūrveṣu gaṇeṣvekaikaṃ stomamekaikam pṛṣṭhamupadadhātyatha
analyzed: tat āhuḥ yat pūrveṣu gaṇeṣu ekaikam stomam ekaikam pṛṣṭham upadadhāti atha
translated: As to that, they say, 'In the former groups he puts down each Stoma and each Prstha once;

original: kasmādatra dvau stomau dve pṛṣṭhe upadadhātītyātmā vā asyaiṣa ātmānaṃ
analyzed: kasmāt atra dvau stomau dve pṛṣṭhe upadadhāti iti ātmā vai asya eṣaḥ ātmānam
translated: why then does he here put down two Stomas and two Prsthas?' This, they say, is his Self;

original: tadaṅgānāṃ jyeṣṭhaṃ variṣṭhaṃ vīryavattamaṃ karoti tasmādayamātmāṅgānāṃ
analyzed: tat aṅgānām jyeṣṭham variṣṭham vīryavattamam karoti tasmāt ayam ātmā aṅgānām
translated: he makes it the most excellent, the best, the most powerful of the limbs; therefore this Self

original: jyeṣṭho variṣṭho vīryavattamaḥ / / /
analyzed: jyeṣṭhaḥ variṣṭhaḥ vīryavattamaḥ
translated: is the most excellent, the best, the most powerful of the limbs.

original: tadāhuḥ / kathamasyaiṣo 'gniḥ sarvaḥ kṛtsna iṣṭakāyāmiṣṭakāyāṃ saṃskṛto bhavatīti
analyzed: tat āhuḥ katham asya eṣaḥ gniḥ sarvaḥ kṛtsnaḥ iṣṭakāyām iṣṭakāyām saṃskṛtaḥ bhavati iti
translated: As to that, they say, 'How is this Agni of his completely made up in every brick?'

original: majjā yajurasthīṣṭakā māṃsaṃ sādanaṃ tvakṣūdadohā loma purīṣasya yajurannam
analyzed: majjā yajuḥ asthi iṣṭakāḥ māṃsam sādanam tvakṣu udadohāḥ loma purīṣasya yajuḥ annam
translated: The Yajuṣ is the marrow, the brick is the bone, the placing (of the brick) is the flesh, the Udavasānīya is the skin, the Yajuṣ of the earth is the hair, the earth is the food,

original: purīṣamevamu hāsyaiṣo 'gniḥ sarvaḥ kṛtsna iṣṭakāyāmiṣṭakāyāṃ saṃskṛto bhavati / / /
analyzed: purīṣam evam u ha asya eṣaḥ gniḥ sarvaḥ kṛtsnaḥ iṣṭakāyām iṣṭakāyām saṃskṛtaḥ bhavati
translated: the food is the belly; thus indeed this Agni of his is completely made up in every brick.

original: sa eṣa sārvāyuṣo 'gniḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eṣa sārvāyuṣaḥ gniḥ
translated: This is the life-long Agni.

original: sa yo haitamevaṃ sārvāyuṣamagniṃ veda sarvaṃ haivāyureti / / /
analyzed: sa yaḥ ha etam evam sārvāyuṣam agnim veda sarvam ha eva āyuḥ eti
translated: He who thus knows the life-long Agni goes to the full life.

original: athātaḥ samañcanaprasāraṇasyaiva /
analyzed: atha atas samañcana prasāraṇasya eva
translated: Now, then, of the contraction and expansion.

original: saṃcitaṃ haike
analyzed: saṃcitam ha eke
translated: Some, indeed, contract it,

original: samañcanaprasāraṇenetyabhimṛśanti paśureṣa yadagniryadā vai paśuraṅgāni saṃ
analyzed: samañcana prasāraṇena iti abhimṛśanti paśuḥ eṣa yat agniḥ yadā vai paśuḥ aṅgāni saṃ
translated: By contraction and expansion, they touch. This fire is an animal. When an animal contracts its limbs

original: cāñcati pra ca sārayatyatha sa tairvīryaṃ karoti / / /
analyzed: ca añcati pra ca sārayati atha sa taiḥ vīryam karoti
translated: and extends them, then it performs heroic deeds with them.

original: saṃvatsaro 'si parivatsaro 'si /
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ si parivatsaraḥ si
translated: You are the year, the year all around,

original: idāvatsaro 'sīdvatsaro 'si vatsaro 'si uṣasaste
analyzed: idāvatsaraḥ si idvatsaraḥ si vatsaraḥ si uṣasaḥ te
translated: the year now, the year that was, the year that is, the year that will be. May your dawns

original: kalpantāmahorātrāste kalpantāmardhamāsāste kalpantām māsāste kalpantāmṛtavaste
analyzed: kalpantām ahar rātrāḥ te kalpantām ardha māsāḥ te kalpantām māsāḥ te kalpantām ṛtavaḥ te
translated: prosper, may your days and nights prosper, may your half-months prosper, may your months prosper, may your seasons prosper,

original: kalpantāṃ saṃvatsaraste kalpatām pretyā etyai saṃ cāñca pra ca sāraya suparṇācidasi
analyzed: kalpantām saṃvatsaraḥ te kalpatām pretyai etyai sam ca añca pra ca sāraya suparṇācit asi
translated: may your year prosper. For going and coming, contract and extend. You are the bird.

original: tayā devatayāṅgirasvaddhruvaḥ sīdeti / / /
analyzed: tayā devatayā aṅgirasvat dhruvaḥ sīda iti
translated: By that deity, sit firm in the manner of Angiras.

original: api ha smāha śāṭyāyaniḥ /
analyzed: api ha sma āha śāṭyāyaniḥ
translated: Satyayani said:

original: sphoṭatorhaikaḥ pakṣayorupaśuśrāvaitenābhimṛṣṭasya
analyzed: sphoṭatoḥ ha ekaḥ pakṣayoḥ upaśuśrāva etena abhimṛṣṭasya
translated: One who heard the sound of the wings of a bird being touched by this

original: tasmādenametenābhyeva mṛśediti / / /
analyzed: tasmāt enam etena abhi eva mṛśet iti
translated: should touch it with this.

original: atha ha smāha svarhinnāgnajitaḥ /
analyzed: atha ha sma āha svarhit nāgnajitaḥ
translated: Then SvarhinnAgnajit said:

original: nagnajidvā gāndhāraḥ prāṇo vai
analyzed: nagnajit vā gāndhāraḥ prāṇaḥ vai
translated: Agnidhra of Gandhara said:

original: samañcanaprasāraṇaṃ yasminvā aṅge prāṇo bhavati tatsaṃ cāñcati pra ca sārayati
analyzed: samañcana prasāraṇam yasmin vai aṅge prāṇaḥ bhavati tat sam ca añcati pra ca sārayati
translated: Contraction and expansion are the breath. In whatever limb the breath is, that contracts and extends.

original: saṃcitamevainam bahiṣṭādabhyanyāttadasminprāṇaṃ samañcanaprasāraṇaṃ dadhāti
analyzed: saṃcitam eva enam bahiṣṭāt abhyanyāt tat asmin prāṇam samañcana prasāraṇam dadhāti
translated: He should put it on the outside of the accumulated (bricks); he thus puts into it the drawing together and the spreading out of the vital air.

original: tathā saṃ cāñcati pra ca sārayatīti tadahaiva samañcanaprasāraṇaṃ yatsa taduvāca
analyzed: tathā sam ca añcati pra ca sārayati iti tat aha eva samañcana prasāraṇam yat sa tat uvāca
translated: In like manner it draws together and spreads out; and that is the drawing together and the spreading out which he has mentioned.

original: rājanyabandhuriva tveva taduvāca yannu śataṃ kṛtvo 'tho sahasram
analyzed: rājanyabandhuḥ iva tu eva tat uvāca yat nu śatam sahasram
translated: 'It is as if he were a Râganya's son,' he said, 'who should say, A hundred times, a thousand times have I done this and that!

original: bahiṣṭādabhyanyurna vai tasmiṃste prāṇaṃ dadhyuryo vā ātmanprāṇaḥ sa eva
analyzed: bahiṣṭāt abhyanyuḥ na vai tasmin te prāṇam dadhyuḥ yaḥ vai ātman prāṇaḥ saḥ eva
translated: If they were to put it on the outside, they would not find the vital air in it; for that vital air which is in the self is the same as

original: prāṇastadyatprāṇabhṛta upadadhāti tadasminprāṇaṃ samañcanaprasāraṇaṃ dadhāti
analyzed: prāṇaḥ tat yat prāṇabhṛtaḥ upadadhāti tat asmin prāṇam samañcana prasāraṇam dadhāti
translated: the vital air. In that he puts down the Prânabhrits, he thereby puts into it the drawing together and the spreading out of the vital air.

original: tathā saṃ cāñcati pra ca sārayatyatha lokampṛṇe upadadhātyasyāṃ sraktyāṃ tayorupari
analyzed: tathā sam ca añcati pra ca sārayati atha lokampṛṇe upadadhāti asyām sraktyām tayoḥ upari
translated: In like manner it draws together and spreads out. He then puts down the Lokamprinâ (bricks) in that corner; above them

original: bandhuḥ purīṣaṃ nivapati tasyopari bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: bandhuḥ purīṣam nivapati tasya upari bandhuḥ
translated: he puts the enclosing-stones; above them the earth-fillings.

original: dvitīyāṃ citimupadadhāti /🔽etadvai devāḥ prathamāṃ citiṃ citvā samārohannayaṃ vai
analyzed: dvitīyām citim upadadhāti  etat vai devāḥ prathamām citim citvā samārohan ayam vai
translated: The second layer he lays on;🔽for the gods, having laid the first layer, ascended it. This first layer is this (terrestrial) world: having completed this world, they ascended it.

original: lokaḥ prathamā citirimameva tallokaṃ saṃskṛtya samārohan / / /
analyzed: lokaḥ prathamā citiḥ imam eva tat lokam saṃskṛtya samārohan
translated: The first layer is this very world; having finished this world, they ascended to the second layer.

original: te 'bruvan / cetayadhvamiti citimicateti vāva tadabruvannita ūrdhvamicateti te
analyzed: te bruvan cetayadhvam iti citim icata iti vāva tat abruvan itas ūrdhvam icata iti te
translated: They said, 'Meditate!'--that is, 'Seek ye a layer!'--'Seek ye one above!' they said.

original: cetayamānā etāṃ dvitīyāṃ citimapaśyanyadūrdhvam pṛthivyā
analyzed: cetayamānāḥ etām dvitīyām citim apaśyan yat ūrdhvam pṛthivyā
translated: They said, 'Meditate!'--'Meditate ye a layer!' they said, 'meditate ye an upward layer!'--Meditating, they saw this second layer, what is above the earth

original: arvācīnamantarikṣātteṣāmeṣa loko 'dhruva ivāpratiṣṭhita iva manasyāsīt / / /🔽te 'śvināvabruvan /🔽yuvaṃ vai brahmāṇau bhiṣajau stho yuvaṃ na imāṃ dvitīyāṃ🔽citimupadhattamiti kiṃ nau tato bhaviṣyatīti yuvameva no 'syā agnicityāyā adhvaryū
analyzed: arvācīnam antarikṣāt teṣām eṣa lokaḥ dhruvaḥ iva a pratiṣṭhitaḥ iva manasi āsīt  te śvinau abruvan  yuvam vai brahmāṇau bhiṣajau sthaḥ yuvam naḥ imām dvitīyām  citim upadhattam iti kim nau tatas bhaviṣyati iti yuvam eva naḥ syāḥ agni cityāyāḥ adhvaryū
translated: and below the air. Of these (three worlds) this world seemed to them as it were uncertain, as it were not firmly established.

original: bhaviṣyatha iti tatheti tebhya etāmaśvinau dvitīyāṃ citimupādhattāṃ
analyzed: bhaviṣyathaḥ iti tathā iti tebhyaḥ etām aśvinau dvitīyām citim upādhattām
translated: They spake unto the Asvins, 'Ye two are the Brahmans, the physicians: lay ye down this second layer for us!'--'What will accrue unto us therefrom?' (said the Asvins.)--'Ye two shall be the Adhvaryus of ours at this building of the fire-altar!'--'So be it!' They laid down for them this second layer, the Asvins.

original: tasmādāhuraśvināveva devānāmadhvaryū iti / / /🔽sa upadadhāti /🔽dhruvakṣitirdhruvayonirdhruvāsīti yadvai sthiraṃ yatpratiṣṭhitaṃ🔽taddhruvamatha vā eṣāmeṣa loko 'dhruva ivāpratiṣṭhita iva
analyzed: tasmāt āhuḥ aśvinau eva devānām adhvaryū iti  saḥ upadadhāti  dhruva kṣitiḥ dhruva yoniḥ dhruvā asi iti yat vai sthiram yat pratiṣṭhitam  tat dhruvam atha vai eṣām eṣa lokaḥ dhruvaḥ iva a pratiṣṭhitaḥ iva
translated: Hence they say, 'The Asvins are the Adhvaryus of the gods.'

original: manasyāsīttamevaitatsthiraṃ dhruvaṃ kṛtvā pratyadhattāṃ dhruvaṃ yonimāsīda
analyzed: manasi āsīt tam eva etat sthiram dhruvam kṛtvā pratyadhattām dhruvam yonim āsīda
translated: He lays it down with , 'Firm-seated, firm-housed, thou art firm,'--for what is firm, what is firmly established, that is 'dhruva' (firm); but this world of theirs seemed as it were uncertain, as it were not firmly established, in the mind: having made it firm and certain, they set it up. 'Firm-housed,' (he says), because it is the house of the firm one (Agni). 'Firm-seated,' (he says), because it is the seat of the firm one.

original: sādhuyeti sthiraṃ yonimāsīda sādhuyetyetadukhyasya ketum prathamaṃ juṣāṇetyayaṃ
analyzed: sādhuyā iti sthiram yonim āsīda sādhuyā iti etat ukhyasya ketum prathamam juṣāṇā iti ayam
translated: 'For the good', (with these words) it has sat down in a firm womb; 'for the good', (with these words) it has accepted the first sign of the fire.

original: vā agnirukhyastasyaiṣa prathamaḥ keturyatprathamā citistaṃ
analyzed: vai agniḥ ukhyaḥ tasya eṣa prathamaḥ ketuḥ yat prathamā citiḥ tam
translated: This Agni is the fire; this is its first sign, to wit, the first layer; 'it has accepted', (with these words) he says this.

original: juṣāṇetyetadaśvinādhvaryū sādayatāmiha tvetyaśvinau hyadhvaryū upādhattām / / /
analyzed: juṣāṇā iti etat aśvinā adhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā iti aśvinau hi adhvaryū upādhattām
translated: 'May the two Asvins, the Adhvaryus, settle thee here'; for the two Asvins, the Adhvaryus, did settle it.

original: kulāyinī ghṛtavatī puraṃdhiriti /🔽kulāyamiva vai dvitīyā citiḥ syone sīda sadane🔽pṛthivyā iti pṛthivī vai prathamā citistasyai śive syone sīda sadana ityetadabhi tvā🔽rudrā vasavo gṛṇantvityetāstvāṃ devatā abhigṛṇantvityetadimā brahma pīpihi

original: raṇāyeti devānāṃ sumnāya mahate raṇāyetyetatpitevaidhi sūnava ā suśeveti yathā pitā🔽putrāya syonaḥ suśeva evaṃ suśevaidhītyetatsvāveśā tanvā saṃviśāsvetyātmā vai tanūḥ🔽svāveśenātmanā saṃviśasvetyetadaśvinādhvaryū sādayatāmiha tvetyaśvinau🔽hyadhvaryū upādhattām / / /
analyzed: raṇāya iti devānām sumnāya mahate raṇāya iti etat pitā iva edhi sūnave ā su śeva iti yathā pitā  putrāya syonaḥ su śevaḥ evam su śevā edhi iti etat su āveśā tanvā saṃviśāsva iti ātmā vai tanūḥ  su āveśena ātmanā saṃviśasva iti etat aśvinā adhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā iti aśvinau  hi adhvaryū upādhattām
translated: 'For the great contest of the gods', he says; 'for the great contest' means 'for the great joy'; 'Be thou kindly, as a father to his son', he says; 'as kindly as a father to his son, so kindly be thou', he says; 'with thy own dwelling enter thou into thy own body', he says; his body is his self; 'with thy own dwelling, with thy own self, enter thou', he says; 'may the two Asvins, the Adhvaryus, settle thee here'; for the two Asvins, the Adhvaryus, did settle it.

original: pṛthivyāḥ purīṣamasīti /
analyzed: pṛthivyāḥ purīṣam asi iti
translated: 'For the battle',--that is, 'for the great joy of the gods, for the battle.'--'Be thou kindly, as a father to his son,'--as a father is kind to his son, so be thou kind!--'with thy most gracious favour,'--the body doubtless is the self;--'with thy most gracious favour, enter thou into thy own body,'--that is, 'with thy most gracious favour enter thou into thy self.'--'May the two Asvins, the Adhvaryus, settle thee here!' for the two Asvins did settle her as Adhvaryus.

original: pṛthivī vai prathamā citistasyā etatpurīṣamiva🔽yaddvitīyāpso nāmeti raso nāmetyetattāṃ tvā viśve abhigṛṇantu devā iti tāṃ tvā sarve🔽'bhigṛṇantu devā ityetatstomapṛṣṭhā ghṛtavatīha sīdeti yāntstomānasyāṃ taṃsyamāno🔽bhavati taireṣā stomapṛṣṭhā prajāvadasme draviṇāyajasveti prajāvadasme
analyzed: pṛthivī vai prathamā citiḥ tasyāḥ etat purīṣam iva  yat dvitīyā apsaḥ nāma iti rasaḥ nāma iti etat tām tvā viśve abhigṛṇantu devāḥ iti tām tvā sarve  bhigṛṇantu devāḥ iti etat stoma pṛṣṭhā ghṛtavatī iha sīda iti yān stomān asyām taṃsyamānaḥ  bhavati taiḥ eṣā stoma pṛṣṭhā prajāvat asme draviṇā āyajasva iti prajāvat asme
translated: 'Thou art the dust of the earth,'--the first layer doubtless is this earth, and this (dust) is as its dust;

original: draviṇamāyajasvetyetadaśvinādhvaryū sādayatāmiha tvetyaśvinau hyadhvaryū🔽upādhattām / / /
analyzed: draviṇam āyajasva iti etat aśvinā adhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā iti aśvinau hi adhvaryū  upādhattām
translated: 'having the name of water,'--that is, 'having the name of sap;'--'may the All-gods settle thee here,'--that is, 'may all the gods settle thee here;'--'having the Stoma for thy back, rich in ghee, sit ye down here!'--the Stoma which he is about to fasten on to this (earth) are those Stomas; with them she has the Stoma for her back;--'gain thou wealth in offspring for us!'--that is, 'gain thou wealth in offspring for us!'--'May the two Asvins, the Adhvaryus, settle thee here!' for the two Asvins did settle her as Adhvaryus.

original: tā etā diśaḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ etāḥ diśaḥ
translated: These are the regions.

original: tā retaḥsicorvelayopadadhātīme vai retaḥsicāvanayostaddiśo dadhāti🔽tasmādanayordiśaḥ sarvata upadadhāti sarvatastaddiśo dadhāti tasmātsarvato diśaḥ
analyzed: tāḥ retaḥsicoḥ velayā upadadhāti ime vai retaḥsicau anayoḥ tat diśaḥ dadhāti  tasmāt anayoḥ diśaḥ sarvatas upadadhāti sarvatas tat diśaḥ dadhāti tasmāt sarvatas diśaḥ
translated: He places them on the two Retahsik (portions of the altar);--the Retahsik are these two (heaven and earth): he thus places the regions in these two (worlds).🔽He places them on every side: he thus places the regions on every side; whence there are regions on every side.

original: sarvataḥ samīcīḥ sarvatastatsamīcīrdiśo dadhāti tasmātsarvataḥ samīcyo diśastā
analyzed: sarvatas samīcīḥ sarvatas tat samīcīḥ diśaḥ dadhāti tasmāt sarvatas samīcyaḥ diśaḥ tā
translated: He places them all around, facing every quarter: he thus places the regions all around, facing every quarter; whence the regions are all around, facing every quarter.

original: nānopadadhāti nānā sādayati nānā sūdadohasā 'dhivadati nānā hi diśaḥ / / /
analyzed: nānā upadadhāti nānā sādayati nānā sūdadohasā dhivadati nānā hi diśaḥ
translated: He places them separately, settles them separately, and pronounces the Sûdadohas over them separately; for the regions are separate.

original: atha pañcamīṃ diśyāmupadadhāti /
analyzed: atha pañcamīm diśyām upadadhāti
translated: He then lays down the fifth regional (brick).

original: ūrdhvā ha sā dikṣā yā sordhvā digasau sa ādityo🔽'mumevaitadādityamupadadhāti tāmantareṇa dakṣiṇāṃ diśyāmupadadhātyamuṃ
analyzed: ūrdhvā ha sā dikṣā yā sā ūrdhvā diś asau saḥ ādityaḥ  mum eva etat ādityam upadadhāti tām antareṇa dakṣiṇām diśyām upadadhāti amum
translated: That region is the upper one which is above; and that is yonder sun.

original: tadādityamantareṇa dakṣiṇāṃ diśaṃ dadhāti tasmādeṣo 'ntareṇa dakṣiṇāṃ diśameti / / /🔽adityāstvā pṛṣṭhe sādayāmīti /
analyzed: tat ādityam antareṇa dakṣiṇām diśam dadhāti tasmāt eṣaḥ ntareṇa dakṣiṇām diśam eti  adityāḥ tvā pṛṣṭhe sādayāmi iti
translated: He thus lays yonder sun into it (the altar);--he places it between (the two bricks representing) the southern region: he thus places yonder sun between the southern region. Hence he (the sun) moves between the southern region.

original: iyaṃ vā aditirasyāmevainametatpratiṣṭhāyām
analyzed: iyam vai aditiḥ asyām eva enam etat pratiṣṭhāyām
translated: 'On the back of Aditi I settle thee,'--Aditi doubtless is this (earth): on this (earth), as a foundation, he thus establishes him.

original: pratiṣṭhāpayatyantarikṣasya dhartrīṃ viṣṭambhanīṃ diśāmadhipatnīm
analyzed: pratiṣṭhāpayati antarikṣasya dhartrīm viṣṭambhanīm diśām adhipatnīm
translated: 'The supporter of the air, the prop of the regions, the mistress of the quarters,'--the air doubtless is this (earth), and the regions are the quarters: he thus establishes him on this (earth) as the prop of the regions, the quarters.

original: bhuvanānāmityantarikṣasya hyeṣa dhartā viṣṭambhano🔽diśāmadhipatirbhuvanānāmūrmirdrapso apāmasīti raso vā ūrmirviśvakarmā ta ṛṣiriti
analyzed: bhuvanānām iti antarikṣasya hi eṣa dhartā viṣṭambhanaḥ  diśām adhipatiḥ bhuvanānām ūrmiḥ drapsaḥ apām asi iti rasaḥ vai ūrmiḥ viśvakarmā te ṛṣiḥ iti
translated: 'Of the worlds', for he is the supporter and upholder of the atmosphere;🔽'the overlord of the quarters', of the worlds; 'the wave, the drop, of the waters', the wave is the sap; 'thou art', etc.

original: prajāpatirvai viśvakarmā prajāpatisṛṣṭāsītyetadaśvinādhvaryū sādayatāmiha
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ vai viśvakarmā prajāpati sṛṣṭā asi iti etat aśvinā adhvaryū sādayatām iha
translated: The sage Visvakarman', Visvakarman is Prajapati; 'thou art created by Prajapati', that is, 'thou art created by Prajapati'; 'may the Asvins, the Adhvaryus, settle thee here',

original: tvetyaśvinau hyadhvaryū upādhattām / / /
analyzed: tvā iti aśvinau hi adhvaryū upādhattām
translated: 'in thee', for the Asvins, as Adhvaryus, did settle thee.

original: yadvevaitā āśvinīrupadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva etāḥ āśvinīḥ upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down these two pertaining to the Asvins.

original: prajāpatiṃ visrastaṃ devatā ādāya vyudakrāmaṃstasya
analyzed: prajāpatim visrastam devatāḥ ādāya vyudakrāman tasya
translated: The gods, having taken Prajapati, when relaxed, departed in different directions.

original: yadūrdhvam pratiṣṭhāyā avācīnam madhyāttadasyāśvināvādāyotkramyātiṣṭhatām / / /
analyzed: yat ūrdhvam pratiṣṭhāyāḥ avācīnam madhyāt tat asya aśvinau ādāya utkramya atiṣṭhatām
translated: Of him, what was above the foundation and below the middle, that the Asvins took and stood apart, having stepped out of it.

original: tāvabravīt /
analyzed: tau abravīt
translated: They said to him,

original: upa metam prati ma etaddhattaṃ yena me yuvamuda /🔽kramiṣṭamiti kiṃ
analyzed: upa mā itam prati me etat dhattam yena me yuvam uda  kramiṣṭam iti kim
translated: 'Come to us, restore to us that whereby ye have stepped out from us.'

original: nau tato bhaviṣyatīti yuvaddevatyameva ma etadātmano bhaviṣyatīti tatheti
analyzed: nau tatas bhaviṣyati iti yuvat devatyam eva me etat ātmanaḥ bhaviṣyati iti tathā iti
translated: 'What will be our reward therefrom?' 'That will be to you as sacred to you as to us.' 'So be it.'

original: tadasminnetadaśvinau pratyadhattām / / /
analyzed: tat asmin etat aśvinau pratyadhattām
translated: So the Asvins restored that to him.

original: tadyā etāḥ pañcāśvinyaḥ /
analyzed: tat yāḥ etāḥ pañca aśvinyaḥ
translated: And those five pertaining to the Asvins which he now lays down,

original: etadasya tadātmanastadyadetā atropadadhāti yadevāsyaitā
analyzed: etat asya tat ātmanaḥ tat yat etāḥ atra upadadhāti yat eva asya etāḥ
translated: are what was his body; and because he now lays them down here, therefore they are his body.

original: ātmanastadasminnetatpratidadhāti tasmādetā atropadadhāti / / /🔽dhruvakṣitirdhruvayonirdhruvāsīti /
analyzed: ātmanaḥ tat asmin etat pratidadhāti tasmāt etāḥ atra upadadhāti  dhruva kṣitiḥ dhruva yoniḥ dhruvā asi iti
translated: He puts it into this (brick), and that into himself; therefore he puts them down here.🔽'Firm-seated, firm-lying, firm thou art,'

original: yadvai sthiraṃ yatpratiṣṭhitaṃ taddhruvamatha
analyzed: yat vai sthiram yat pratiṣṭhitam tat dhruvam atha
translated: for what is firm, what is fixed, that is firm.

original: vā asyaitadasthiramivādhruvamivātmana āsīttadevaitatsthiraṃ dhruvaṃ kṛtvā
analyzed: vai asya etat asthiram iva adhruvam iva ātmanaḥ āsīt tat eva etat sthiram dhruvam kṛtvā
translated: Now this (earth) was as it were not firm, not fixed, in his (Agni's) self; he made it firm and fixed,

original: pratyadhattām / / /
analyzed: pratyadhattām
translated: and put it back.

original: kulāyinī ghṛtavatī puraṃdhiriti /
analyzed: kulāyinī ghṛtavatī puraṃdhiḥ iti
translated: 'The nest-builder, the ghee-rich, the wise,'

original: kulāyamiva vā asyaitadātmanaḥ🔽svairdakṣairdakṣapiteha sīdetyadakṣayatāmevāsyaitadātmanaḥ pṛthivyāḥ🔽purīṣamasīti purīṣasaṃhitamiva vā asyaitadātmano retaḥsicorvelayā pṛṣṭayo vai
analyzed: kulāyam iva vai asya etat ātmanaḥ  svaiḥ dakṣaiḥ dakṣa pitā iha sīda iti a dakṣayatām eva asya etat ātmanaḥ pṛthivyāḥ  purīṣam asi iti purīṣa saṃhitam iva vai asya etat ātmanaḥ retaḥ sicoḥ velayā pṛṣṭayaḥ vai
translated: for this (earth) is as it were a nest of his self.🔽'Sit here, O thou that art born of the womb of Daksha,'--he thereby made this (earth) of his self to be not barren;🔽'thou art the dust,'--for this (earth) is as it were the dust of his self;--'between the two receptacles of seed,'--the receptacles of seed are the two sides;🔽(the earth) is as it were piled up between the two sides of his self;--'on every side,'--he puts it down on every side, for on every side

original: retaḥsicau pṛṣṭisācayamiva vā asyaitadātmanaḥ sarvata upadadhāti sarvato🔽hyasyaitadaśvināvātmanaḥ pratyadhattām / / /
analyzed: retaḥsicau pṛṣṭisācayam iva vai asya etat ātmanaḥ sarvatas upadadhāti sarvatas  hi asya etat aśvinau ātmanaḥ pratyadhattām
translated: the Asvins put it back into his (Agni's) self.

original: atha 'rtavye upadadhāti /
analyzed: atha ṛtavye upadadhāti
translated: He then lays down the Ṛtavyâ (season-bricks).

original: ṛtava ete yadṛtavye ṛtūnevaitadupadadhāti śukraśca śuciśca
analyzed: ṛtavaḥ ete yat ṛtavye ṛtūn eva etat upadadhāti śukraḥ ca śuciḥ ca
translated: The Ṛtavyâs are the seasons; it is the seasons he thus lays down,--'The bright and the pure,'--the bright and the pure, doubtless, are the spring and the summer;

original: graiṣmāvṛtū iti nāmanī enayorete nāmabhyāmevaine etadupadadhāti dve iṣṭake
analyzed: graiṣmau ṛtū iti nāmanī enayoḥ ete nāmabhyām eva ene etat upadadhāti dve iṣṭake
translated: 'The two summer seasons', these are the names of these two; verily with their names he puts them down. Two are the bricks,

original: bhavato dvau hi māsāvṛtuḥ sakṛtsādayatyekaṃ tadṛtuṃ karoti / / /
analyzed: bhavataḥ dvau hi māsau ṛtuḥ sakṛt sādayati ekam tat ṛtum karoti
translated: 'The two summer seasons,'--these are the names of these two; it is with their names that he thus lays them down. There are two bricks,--two months make a season; once he settles them,--he makes (them) one season.

original: tadyadete atropadadhāti /
analyzed: tat yat ete atra upadadhāti
translated: And as to why he now lays down these two;

original: saṃvatsara eṣo 'gnirima u lokāḥ saṃvatsarastasya
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ eṣaḥ gniḥ ime u lokāḥ saṃvatsaraḥ tasya
translated: this Agni is the year, and the year is these worlds;

original: yadūrdhvam pṛthivyā arvācīnamantarikṣāttadasyaiṣā dvitīyāṃ citistadvasya grīṣma🔽ṛtustadyadete atropadadhāti / / /
analyzed: yat ūrdhvam pṛthivyāḥ arvācīnam antarikṣāt tat asya eṣā dvitīyām citiḥ tat u asya grīṣma  ṛtuḥ tat yat ete atra upadadhāti
translated: what is above the earth and below the atmosphere is this second layer of him; that is his summer season. And as to why he now lays down these two;

original: yadvevaite atropadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva ete atra upadadhāti
translated: and, again, as to why he now lays down these two;

original: prajāpatireṣo 'gniḥ saṃvatsara u prajāpatistasya🔽yadūrdhvam pratiṣṭhāyā avācīnam madhyāttadasyaiṣā dvitīyā citistadvasya grīṣma
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ eṣaḥ gniḥ saṃvatsaraḥ u prajāpatiḥ tasya  yat ūrdhvam pratiṣṭhāyāḥ avācīnam madhyāt tat asya eṣā dvitīyā citiḥ tat u asya grīṣma
translated: this Agni is Pragâpati, and Pragâpati is the year;🔽what is above the foundation and below the middle is this second layer of him; that is his summer season. And as to why he now lays down these two;

original: ṛtustadyadete atropadadhāti yadevāsyaite ātmanastadasminnetatpratidadhāti
analyzed: ṛtuḥ tat yat ete atra upadadhāti yat eva asya ete ātmanaḥ tat asmin etat pratidadhāti
translated: he thus supplies him (Pragâpati-Agni) with what these two are to him in the body.

original: tasmādete atropadadhāti / / /
analyzed: tasmāt ete atra upadadhāti
translated: This is why he now lays down these two.

original: atha vaiśvadevīrupadadhāti /
analyzed: atha vaiśvadevīḥ upadadhāti
translated: He then lays down the Vaisvadevîs.

original: eṣā vai sā dvītīyā citiryāmebhyastadaśvinā upādhattāṃ
analyzed: eṣā vai sā dvītīyā citiḥ yāmebhyaḥ tat aśvinau upādhattām
translated: This, then, is that second layer which the two Asvins then restored to them;

original: tāmupadhāyedaṃ sarvamabhavatāṃ yadidaṃ kiṃ ca / / /
analyzed: tām upadhāya idam sarvam abhavatām yat idam kim ca
translated: Having laid down that (brick), all this has come to be, whatever there is.

original: te devā abruvan /🔽aśvinau vā idaṃ sarvamabhūtāmupa tajjānīta yathā🔽vyamihāpyasāmeti te 'bruvaṃścetayadhvamiti citimicateti vāva tadabruvaṃstadicata
analyzed: te devāḥ abruvan  aśvinau vai idam sarvam abhūtām upa tat jānīta yathā  vyamiha apyasāma iti te bruvan cetayadhvam iti citim icata iti vāva tat abruvan tat icata
translated: The gods said:

original: yathā vayamihāpyasāmeti te cetayamānā etā iṣṭakā apaśyanvaiśvadevīḥ / / /
analyzed: yathā vayam iha api asāma iti te cetayamānāḥ etāḥ iṣṭakāḥ apaśyan vaiśvadevīḥ
translated: The Asvins have become all this. Consider how we may be here also. They said: Meditate! Meditate on the altar! That is what they said. Meditate on how we may be here also. Meditating, they saw these bricks dedicated to the All-gods.

original: te 'bruvan / aśvinau vā idaṃ🔽sarvamabhūtāmaśvibhyāmevāśvinościtimanūpadadhāmahā iti te
analyzed: te bruvan aśvinau vai idam  sarvam abhūtām aśvibhyām eva aśvinoḥ citim anūpadadhāmahai iti te
translated: They said: The Asvins have become all this.

original: 'śvibhyāmevāśvinościtimanūpādadhata tasmādetāmāśvinī citirityācakṣate
analyzed: śvibhyām eva aśvinoḥ citim anūpādadhata tasmāt etām āśvinī citiḥ iti ācakṣate
translated: By the Asvins we shall lay down the altar of the Asvins. They laid down by the Asvins the altar of the Asvins. Therefore they call it the Asvin altar.

original: tasmādyathaiva pūrvāsāmudarka evametāsāmiśvibhyāṃ hyevāśvinościtimanūpādadhata / / /
analyzed: tasmāt yathā eva pūrvāsām udarkaḥ evam etāsām iśvibhyām hi eva aśvinoḥ citim anūpādadhata
translated: Therefore, just as the former ones have a top, so do these, for by the Asvins they laid down the altar of the Asvins.

original: yadveva vaiśvadevīrupadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva vaiśvadevīḥ upadadhāti
translated: And again, why he lays down the Vaiśvadevī (bricks).

original: ye vai te viśve devā etāṃ dvitīyāṃ citimapaśyanye ta
analyzed: ye vai te viśve devāḥ etām dvitīyām citim apaśyan ye te

analyzed: etena rasena upāyan te ete tān eva etat upadadhāti tāḥ etāḥ sarvāḥ prajāḥ tā
translated: who came with that essence, they are these (bricks); he lays them down for those (gods). These are all beings;

original: retaḥsicorvelayopadadhātīme vai retaḥsicāvanayostatprajā dadhāti tasmādanayoḥ🔽prajāḥ sarvata upadadhāti sarvatastatprajā dadhāti tasmātsarvataḥ prajā diśyā
analyzed: retaḥsicoḥ velayā upadadhāti ime vai retaḥsicau anayoḥ tat prajāḥ dadhāti tasmāt anayoḥ  prajāḥ sarvatas upadadhāti sarvatas tat prajāḥ dadhāti tasmāt sarvatas prajā diśyā
translated: He places (them) on the range of the Retahsik (bricks);--the Retahsik, doubtless, are these two (heaven and earth): he thus bestows offspring on these two, whence there is offspring from these two.🔽He places (them) on every side: he thus bestows offspring on every side, whence there is offspring on every side.

original: anūpadadhāti dikṣu tatprajā dadhāti tasmātsarvāsu dikṣu prajāḥ / / /
analyzed: anūpadadhāti dikṣu tat prajāḥ dadhāti tasmāt sarvāsu dikṣu prajāḥ
translated: He places (them) on the regions: he thus bestows offspring on the regions, whence there is offspring in all the regions.

original: yadveva vaiśvadevīrupadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva vaiśvadevīḥ upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Vaisvadevîs.

analyzed: prajāpateḥ visrastāt sarvāḥ prajāḥ
translated: From Pragâpati, when relaxed, all the creatures went forth from the middle,

analyzed: udakrāman etasyāḥ adhi yoneḥ tāḥ enam etasmin ātmanaḥ pratihite prāpadyanta  sa yaḥ sa prajāpatiḥ vyasraṃsata

analyzed: ayam eva sa yaḥ yam agniḥ cīyate yāḥ asmāt tāḥ prajā  madhyataḥ udakrāman etāḥ tāḥ vaiśvadevyaḥ iṣṭakāḥ tat yat etāḥ upadadhāti yāḥ eva asmāt tāḥ  prajāḥ madhyataḥ udakrāman tāḥ asmin etat prapādayati retaḥsicoḥ velayā pṛṣṭayaḥ vai
translated: And that Pragâpati who was relaxed is this very Agni who is now being built up; and those creatures which went forth from him,🔽from the middle, are these Vaisvadevî (all-godly) bricks; and when he now lays down these (bricks), he thereby restores to him those creatures which went forth from him, from the middle,

original: retaḥsicau madhyamu pṛṣṭayo madhyata evāsminnetāḥ prajāḥ prapādayati sarvata
analyzed: retaḥsicau pṛṣṭayaḥ madhyatas eva asmin etāḥ prajāḥ prapādayati sarvatas
translated: from him (Agni). On the range of the Retahsik (he places them);--the Retahsik, doubtless, are the ribs, and the ribs are the middle: he thus restores those creatures to him in the middle. On every side (he places them);--

original: upadadhāti sarvata evāsminnetāḥ prajāḥ prapādayati / / /
analyzed: upadadhāti sarvatas eva asmin etāḥ prajāḥ prapādayati
translated: He lays them down all round: from all sides he causes these creatures to be propagated in him.

original: yadveva vaiśvadevīrupadadhāti /🔽etadvai prajāpatiretasminnātmanaḥ pratihite
analyzed: yat u eva vaiśvadevīḥ upadadhāti  etat vai prajāpatiḥ etasmin ātmanaḥ pratihite
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Vaisvadevîs.🔽When that (Agni) had been restored in his body,

original: 'kāmayata prajāḥ sṛjeya prajāyeyeti sa ṛtubhiradbhiḥ prāṇaiḥ saṃvatsareṇāśvibhyāṃ🔽sayugbhūtvaitāḥ prajāḥ prājanayattathaivaitadyajamāna etābhirdevatābhiḥ
analyzed: kāmayata prajāḥ sṛjeya prajāyeya iti saḥ ṛtubhiḥ adbhiḥ prāṇaiḥ saṃvatsareṇa aśvibhyām  sayuj bhūtvā etāḥ prajāḥ prājanayat tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ etābhiḥ devatābhiḥ
translated: Pragâpati desired, 'May I create, may I be propagated!' He, having become united with the seasons, the waters, the vital airs, the year, and the two Asvins,

translated: created these creatures; and in like manner does the Sacrificer, having become united with those deities, create these creatures. For this reason the formula, 'With the yoke-fellow, with the yoke-fellow,' is repeated in all (the Vaisvadevî bricks).

original: sajūrṛtubhiriti /🔽tadṛtūnprājanayadṛtubhirvai sayugbhūtvā🔽prājanayatsajūrvidhābhirityāpo vai vidhā adbhirhīdaṃ sarvaṃ vihitamadbhirvai🔽sayugbhūtvā prājanayatsajūrdevairiti taddevānprājanayadyaddevā ityācakṣate
analyzed: sajūs ṛtubhiḥ iti  tat ṛtūn prājanayat ṛtubhiḥ vai sayuj bhūtvā  prājanayat sajūs vidhābhiḥ iti āpaḥ vai vidhāḥ adbhiḥ hi idam sarvam vihitam adbhiḥ vai  sayuj bhūtvā prājanayat sajūs devaiḥ iti tat devān prājanayat yat devāḥ iti ācakṣate
translated: 'With the seasons, with the yoke-fellow,' (with these words he lays down the first brick);🔽he thereby created the seasons; having become united with the seasons he created (them). 'With the forms, with the yoke-fellow,' (with these words he lays down the second brick); the forms are the waters, for by the waters everything here is formed: having become united with the waters he created (them). 'With the gods, with the yoke-fellow,' (with these words he lays down the third brick); he thereby created the gods; for whatever they call 'the gods,'

original: sajūrdevairvayonādhairiti prāṇā vai devā vayonādhāḥ prāṇairhīdaṃ sarvaṃ vayunaṃ
analyzed: sajūs devaiḥ vayonādhaiḥ iti prāṇāḥ vai devāḥ vayonādhāḥ prāṇaiḥ hi idam sarvam vayunam
translated: 'With the gods, the supporters of life, with the yoke-fellow,' (with these words he lays down the fourth brick); the supporters of life are the vital airs, for by the vital airs everything here has life (or vigour): having become united with the vital airs he created (them).

original: naddhamatho candāṃsi vai devā vayonādhāścandobhirhīdaṃ sarvaṃ vayunaṃ🔽naddham prāṇairvai sayugbhūtvā prājanayadagnaye tvā vaiśvānarāyeti saṃvatsaro vā
analyzed: naddham atha u candāṃsi vai devāḥ vayonādhāḥ candobhiḥ hi idam sarvam vayunam  naddham prāṇaiḥ vai sayuj bhūtvā prājanayat agnaye tvā vaiśvānarāya iti saṃvatsaraḥ vā
translated: The gods, the supporters of life, with the metres; for by the metres this whole world is supported.🔽Having become united with the vital airs, he produced. 'To Agni Vaisvānara thee!' Agni Vaisvānara is the year;

original: agnirvaiśvānaraḥ saṃvatsareṇa vai sayugbhūtvā prājanayadaśvinādhvaryū sādayatāmiha
analyzed: agniḥ vaiśvānaraḥ saṃvatsareṇa vai sayuj bhūtvā prājanayat aśvinā adhvaryū sādayatām iha
translated: having become united with the year, he produced. 'May the two Asvins, the Adhvaryus, settle thee here!'

original: tvetyaśvibhyāṃ vai sayugbhūtvā prājanayat / / /
analyzed: tvā iti aśvibhyām vai sayuj bhūtvā prājanayat
translated: having become united with the two Asvins, he produced.

original: sajūrvasubhiriti dakṣiṇataḥ /
analyzed: sajūs vasubhiḥ iti dakṣiṇatas
translated: 'United with the Vasus' (he settles) on the right (side);

original: tadvasūnprājanayatsajū rudrairiti🔽paścāttadrudrānprājanayatsajūrādityairityuttaratastadādityānprājanayatsajūrviśvairdeva
analyzed: tat vasūn prājanayat sajūs rudraiḥ iti  paścāt tat rudrān prājanayat sajūs ādityaiḥ iti uttaratas tat ādityān prājanayat sajūs viśvaiḥ deva
translated: therewith he produced the Vasus. 'United with the Rudras' (he settles) on the back (side);🔽therewith he produced the Rudras. 'United with the Âdityas' (he settles) on the left (side);🔽therewith he produced the Âdityas. 'United with all gods' (he settles) above;

original: irityupariṣṭāttadviśvāndevānprājanayattā vai samānaprabhṛtayaḥ samānodarkā nānā🔽madhyatastā yatsamānaprabhṛtayaḥ samānībhirhi devatābhiḥ purastāccopariṣṭācca
analyzed: iḥ iti upariṣṭāt tat viśvān devān prājanayat tāḥ vai samāna prabhṛtayaḥ samāna udarkāḥ nānā  madhyatas tāḥ yat samāna prabhṛtayaḥ samānībhiḥ hi devatābhiḥ purastāt ca upariṣṭāt ca
translated: therewith he produced all the gods. They have the same beginning and the same end, but are different🔽in the middle.
