analyzed: sayuj bhūtvā prājanayat atha yat nānā madhyatas nyā anyāḥ hi prajāḥ madhyatas
translated: for he produced different (kinds of) creatures in the middle.

original: prājanayat / / /
analyzed: prājanayat
translated: He generated...🔽🔽

original: atha prāṇabhṛta upadadhāti /🔽etadvai devā abruvaṃścetayadhvamiti citimicateti vāva🔽tadabruvaṃste cetayamānā vāyumeva
analyzed: atha prāṇabhṛtaḥ upadadhāti  etat vai devāḥ abruvan cetayadhvam iti citim icata iti vāva  tat abruvan te cetayamānāḥ vāyum eva
translated: He then lays down the Prânabhrits. For the gods then said, 'Meditate ye (ketay)!' whereby doubtless they meant to say, 'Seek ye a layer (kitim)!' Whilst meditating, they saw that very Vâyu (the wind), that blower, as the layer (kiti) of the sacrifice.

original: citimapaśyaṃstāmasminnadadhustathaivāsminnayametaddadhāti / / /
analyzed: citim apaśyan tām asmin adadhuḥ tathā eva asmin ayam etat dadhāti
translated: He then lays down the Prânabhrits. For the gods then said, 'Meditate ye (ketay)!' whereby doubtless they meant to say, 'Seek ye a layer (kitim)!' Whilst meditating, they saw that very Vâyu as a layer, and laid him down therein: in like manner does this (Sacrificer) now lay him down therein.

original: prāṇabhṛta upadadhāti /
analyzed: prāṇabhṛtaḥ upadadhāti
translated: He lays down the Prânabhrits.

original: prāṇo vai vāyurvāyumevāsminnetaddadhāti🔽retaḥsicorvelayeme vai retaḥsicāvanayostadvāyuṃ dadhāti tasmādanayorvāyuḥ sarvata
analyzed: prāṇaḥ vai vāyuḥ vāyum eva asmin etat dadhāti  retaḥsicoḥ velayā ime vai retaḥsicau anayoḥ tat vāyum dadhāti tasmāt anayoḥ vāyuḥ
translated: Vâyu doubtless is the breath: it is Vâyu he thus lays into him (Agni-Pragâpati).🔽The Retahsik (he lays down) on the range of the Retahsik; for these two (bricks) are these two (worlds), and he thus lays Vâyu into these two; whence there is Vâyu between these two (worlds).

analyzed: upadadhāti sarvatas tat vāyum dadhāti tasmāt sarvatas vāyuḥ sarvatas samīcīḥ  sarvatas tat samyañcam vāyum dadhāti tasmāt sarvatas samyaṅ bhūtvā sarvābhyaḥ digbhyaḥ
translated: He lays them down all round: he thus lays Vâyu all round, whence there is Vâyu everywhere.🔽He lays them down all round, in every direction: he thus lays Vâyu in every direction, in every place; whence Vâyu blows from every side, from every place.

original: vāti diśyā anūpadadhāti dikṣu tadvāyuṃ dadhāti tasmātsarvāsu dikṣu vāyuḥ / / /
analyzed: vāti diśyāḥ anūpadadhāti dikṣu tat vāyum dadhāti tasmāt sarvāsu dikṣu vāyuḥ
translated: He lays them down in contact with the Dîkshâs (initiation-days): he thus lays Vâyu into the regions, whence there is Vâyu in all the regions.

original: yadveva prāṇabhṛta upadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva prāṇabhṛtaḥ upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Prânabhrits.

analyzed: āsu eva etat prajāsu prāṇān dadhāti tāḥ an antarhitā
translated: He thus lays breath into these creatures, and they are not separated from it.

original: vaiśvadevībhya upadadhātyanantarhitāṃstatprajābhyaḥ prāṇāndadhāti prāṇam me🔽pāhyapānam me pāhi vyānam me pāhi cakṣurma urvyā bibhāhi śrotram me
analyzed: vaiśvadevībhyaḥ upadadhāti an antarhitān tat prajābhyaḥ prāṇān dadhāti prāṇam me  pāhi apānam me pāhi vyānam me pāhi cakṣuḥ me urvyā bibhāhi śrotram me
translated: He lays down the Vaiçvadevîs without interval; he thereby bestows the vital airs upon the people. 'Guard my expiration, guard my inspiration, guard my cross-breathing, shine widely with my eye,

analyzed: ślokaya iti etān eva āsu etad klptān prāṇān dadhāti
translated: make my ear resound!' he thereby bestows upon them those vital airs which are well-ordered.

original: athāpasyā upadadhāti /🔽etadvai devā abruvaṃścetayadhvamiti citimicateti vāva
analyzed: atha apasyāḥ upadadhāti  etat vai devāḥ abruvan cetayadhvam iti citim icata iti vāva
translated: He then lays down the Apasyâs.

original: tadabruvaṃste cetayamānā vṛṣṭimeva
analyzed: tat abruvan te cetayamānāḥ vṛṣṭim eva
translated: The gods then spake, 'Meditate ye!'--meditate (kit) a layer!--so they spake.--Whilst meditating they saw that very rain-cloud,

original: citimapaśyaṃstāmasminnadadhustathaivāsminnayametaddadhāti / / /
analyzed: citim apaśyan tām asmin adadhuḥ tathā eva asmin ayam etat dadhāti
translated: and put it into him (Agni); and in like manner does this (Sacrificer) now put it into him.

original: apasyā upadadhāti /🔽āpo vai vṛṣṭirvṛṣṭimevāsminnetaddadhāti retaḥsicorvelayeme vai🔽retaḥsicāvanayostadvṛṣṭiṃ dadhāti tasmādanayorvarṣati sarvata upadadhāti🔽sarvatastadvṛṣṭiṃ dadhāti tasmātsarvato varṣati sarvataḥ samīcīḥ sarvatastamīcīṃ
analyzed: apasyāḥ upadadhāti  āpaḥ vai vṛṣṭiḥ vṛṣṭim eva asmin etat dadhāti retaḥ sicoḥ velayā ime vai  retaḥsicau anayoḥ tat vṛṣṭim dadhāti tasmāt anayoḥ varṣati sarvatas upadadhāti  sarvatas tat vṛṣṭim dadhāti tasmāt sarvatas varṣati sarvatas samīcīḥ sarvatas tamīcīm
translated: He lays down the Apasyâs.

original: vṛṣṭiṃ dadhāti tasmātsarvataḥ samyaṅbhūtvā sarvābhyo digbhyo varṣati vāyavyā
analyzed: vṛṣṭim dadhāti tasmāt sarvatas samyak bhūtvā sarvābhyaḥ digbhyaḥ varṣati vāyavyā
translated: The rain-cloud, doubtless, is the rain: it is rain he thus bestows on him. Between the Retahsik (he places them): these two are the welkin; he thus bestows rain on these two, whence it rains from these two. On all sides (he places them): he thus bestows rain on all sides, whence it rains on all sides. On all sides (he places them) in a straight line: he thus bestows rain in a straight line on all sides, whence, having become straight on all sides, it rains from all the quarters. He places them on the Vâyavya (layer): the Vâyavya is the wind; it is the wind he thus bestows on the rain-cloud; whence the wind is in the rain-cloud.

original: anūpadadhāti vāyau tadvṛṣṭiṃ dadhāti tasmādyāṃ diśaṃ vāyureti tāṃ diśaṃ
analyzed: anūpadadhāti vāyau tat vṛṣṭim dadhāti tasmāt yām diśam vāyuḥ eti tām diśam
translated: He places it in the water; he thus puts rain into the wind; therefore in whatever direction the wind blows, in that direction🔽

original: vṛṣṭiranveti / / /
analyzed: vṛṣṭiḥ anveti
translated: He puts it down in the north; he thereby puts rain into the wind; therefore the rain follows the direction in which the wind blows.

original: yadvevāpasyā upadadhāti /🔽eṣvevaitatprāṇeṣvapo dadhāti tā antarhitāḥ prāṇabhṛdbhya
analyzed: yat u eva apasyāḥ upadadhāti  eṣu eva etat prāṇeṣu apaḥ dadhāti tāḥ antarhitāḥ prāṇabhṛdbhyaḥ
translated: Where he puts down the two Apasyas,🔽there he puts water into the vital airs; he puts them down inside the Prāṇabhṛt bricks; he thereby puts water inside the vital airs.

original: upadadhātyanantarhitāstatprāṇebhyo 'po dadhātyatho annaṃ vā āpo 'nantarhitaṃ🔽tatprāṇebhyo 'nnaṃ dadhātyapaḥ pinvauṣadhīrjinva dvipādava catuṣpātpāhi divo
analyzed: upadadhāti an antarhitāḥ tat prāṇebhyaḥ u dadhāti atha u annam vai āpaḥ na antarhitam  tat prāṇebhyaḥ nnam dadhāti apaḥ pinva oṣadhīḥ jinva dvipād ava catuṣpād pāhi divaḥ
translated: Moreover, water is food; he thereby puts food inside the vital airs.

original: vṛṣṭimerayetyetā evaiṣvetatkLptā apo dadhāti / / /
analyzed: vṛṣṭim eraya iti etāḥ eva eṣu etat klptāḥ apaḥ dadhāti
translated: 'Make the waters swell, animate the plants, protect the bipeds and quadrupeds, attract the rain from the sky', he says; he thereby puts into them the waters which are fit for them.

original: atha candasyā upadadhāti /🔽etadvai devā abruvaṃścetayadhvamiti citimicateti vāva🔽tadabruvaṃste cetayamānāḥ paśūneva
analyzed: atha candasyāḥ upadadhāti  etat vai devāḥ abruvan cetayadhvam iti citim icata iti vāva  tat abruvan te cetayamānāḥ paśūn eva
translated: He then puts down the Chandas bricks.

original: citimapaśyaṃstāmasminnadadhustathaivāsminnayametaddadhāti / / /
analyzed: citim apaśyan tām asmin adadhuḥ tathā eva asmin ayam etat dadhāti
translated: The gods then said, 'Meditate ye!'--'Meditate we will!'--so they said. Meditating, they saw the cattle as a layer; they put it into this (earth), and in like manner does this (Sacrificer) now put it therein.

original: candasyā upadadhāti /
analyzed: candasyāḥ upadadhāti
translated: He puts down the Chandas bricks.

original: paśavo vai candāṃsi paśūnevāsminnetaddadhāti sarvata
analyzed: paśavaḥ vai candāṃsi paśūn eva asmin etat dadhāti sarvatas
translated: The Chandas are cattle; it is cattle he thus puts into it. On all sides;

original: upadadhāti sarvatastatpaśūndadhāti tasmātsarvataḥ paśavo 'pasyā anūpadadhātyapsu
analyzed: upadadhāti sarvatas tat paśūn dadhāti tasmāt sarvatas paśavaḥ upasyāḥ anūpadadhāti apsu
translated: He places (them) on all sides: he thus places cattle on all sides; therefore cattle are on all sides. He places the enclosing-sticks outside: he thus places cattle in the waters;

original: tatpaśūnpratiṣṭhāpayati tasmādyadā varṣatyatha paśavaḥ pratitiṣṭhanti / / /
analyzed: tat paśūn pratiṣṭhāpayati tasmāt yadā varṣati atha paśavaḥ pratitiṣṭhanti
translated: he thus establishes cattle in the waters; therefore when it rains then cattle are established.

original: yadveva candasyā upadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva candasyāḥ upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the metres.

original: prajāpatervisrastātpaśava udakrāmaṃścandāṃsi bhūtvā
analyzed: prajāpateḥ visrastāt paśavaḥ udakrāman candāṃsi bhūtvā
translated: From Pragâpati, when relaxed, cattle went forth, becoming the metres.

original: tāngāyatrī cando bhūtvā vayasāpnottadyadgāyatryāpnodetaddhi canda āśiṣṭhaṃ sā
analyzed: tān gāyatrī candaḥ bhūtvā vayasā āpnot tat yat gāyatrī āpnot etat hi candaḥ āśiṣṭham sā
translated: He overtook them by means of the Gâyatrî metre, for the Gâyatrî is the most powerful of metres.

original: tadbhūtvā prajāpatiretānpaśūnvayasāpnot / / /🔽mūrdhā vaya iti /🔽prajāpatirvai mūrdhā sa vayo 'bhavatprajāpatiścanda iti
analyzed: tat bhūtvā prajāpatiḥ etān paśūn vayasā āpnot  mūrdhā vayaḥ iti  prajāpatiḥ vai mūrdhā sa vayaḥ bhavat prajāpatiḥ candaḥ iti

analyzed: bhaviṣyati iti yuvam eva naḥ śreṣṭhau bhaviṣyathaḥ iti tathā iti tebhyaḥ etām indra agnī
translated: 'Do you two lay down this third layer for us,' they said. 'What will be our reward for that?' 'You two shall be the best of us,' they said. 'So be it.' For them Indra and Agni

original: tṛtīyāṃ citimupādhattāṃ tasmādāhurindrāgnī eva devānāṃ śreṣṭhāviti / / /
analyzed: tṛtīyām citim upādhattām tasmāt āhuḥ indra agnī eva devānām śreṣṭhau iti
translated: laid down this third layer. Therefore they say that Indra and Agni are the best of the gods.

original: sa vā indrāgnibhyāmupadadhāti /🔽viśvakarmaṇā sādayatīndrāgnī ca vai viśvakarmā
analyzed: sa vai indra agnibhyām upadadhāti  viśvakarmaṇā sādayati indra agnī ca vai viśvakarmā
translated: He lays down with 'Indra and Agni,'

original: caitāṃ tṛtīyāṃ citimapaśyaṃstasmādindrāgnibhyāmupadadhāti viśvakarmaṇā sādayati / / /
analyzed: ca etām tṛtīyām citim apaśyan tasmāt indra agnibhyām upadadhāti viśvakarmaṇā sādayati
translated: and settles with 'Visvakarman.' Indra and Agni and Visvakarman saw this third layer. Therefore he lays down with 'Indra and Agni,' and settles with 'Visvakarman.'

original: yadvevendrāgnibhyāmupadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva indra agnibhyām upadadhāti
translated: And again, why he lays down with 'Indra and Agni,'

original: viśvakarmaṇā sādayati prajāpatiṃ visrastaṃ devatā
analyzed: viśvakarmaṇā sādayati prajāpatim visrastam devatā
translated: and settles with 'Visvakarman.' When Pragâpati was relaxed, the gods took him,

original: ādāya vyudakrāmaṃstasyendrāgnī ca viśvakarmā ca madhyamādāyotkamyātiṣṭhan / / /🔽tānabravīt /🔽upa meta prati ma etaddhatta yena me yūyamudakramiṣṭeti kiṃ nastato
analyzed: ādāya vyudakrāman tasya indra agnī ca viśvakarmā ca madhyam ādāya utkamya atiṣṭhan  tān abravīt  upa mā ita prati me etat dhatta yena me yūyam udakramiṣṭa iti kim naḥ tatas
translated: and departed from him. Indra, Agni, and Visvakarman took his middle part, and stood off.

original: bhaviṣyatīti yuṣmaddevatyameva ma etadātmano bhaviṣyatīti tatheti
analyzed: bhaviṣyati iti yuṣmad devatyam eva me etat ātmanaḥ bhaviṣyati iti tathā iti
translated: They said to them, 'Come to me, restore to me that whereby ye have departed from me.' 'What will be our reward for that?' 'That shall be of your deity in my body.' 'So be it.'

original: tadasminnetadindrāgnī ca viśvakarmā ca pratyadadhuḥ / / /
analyzed: tat asmin etat indra agnī ca viśvakarmā ca pratyadadhuḥ
translated: In it they, Indra-Agni and Visvakarman, placed this (earth).

original: tadyaiṣā madhyamā svayamātṛṇā /🔽etadasya tadātmanastadyadetāmatropadadhāti
analyzed: tat yā eṣā madhyamā svayamātṛṇā  etat asya tat ātmanaḥ tat yat etām atra upadadhāti
translated: Now this middle naturally-perforated (brick)🔽is that self of his. In that he puts it down here,

original: yadevāsyaiṣātmanastadasminnetatpratidadhāti tasmādetāmatropadadhāti / / /🔽indrāgnī avyathamānām /
analyzed: yat eva asya eṣā ātmanaḥ tat asmin etat pratidadhāti tasmāt etām atra upadadhāti  indra agnī a vyathamānām
translated: in that self of his he thus puts that (earth) back. For this reason he puts it down here.

original: iṣṭakāṃ dṛṃhataṃ yuvamiti yathaiva yajustathā bandhuḥ🔽pṛṣṭhena dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣaṃ ca vibādhasa iti pṛṣṭhena hyeṣā dyāvāpṛthivī
analyzed: iṣṭakām dṛṃhatam yuvam iti yathā eva yajuḥ tathā bandhuḥ  pṛṣṭhena dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣam ca vibādhase iti pṛṣṭhena hi eṣā dyāvāpṛthivī
translated: 'O Indra and Agni, make ye firm the undecaying brick', (with these words) he puts down the naturally-perforated (brick);🔽for the sake of firmness. 'With the back ye overspread the two worlds and the atmosphere', (with these words) he puts down the naturally-perforated (brick);

original: antarikṣaṃ ca vibādhate / / /
analyzed: antarikṣam ca vibādhate
translated: for by the back of this (earth) he overspreads the two worlds and the atmosphere.

original: viśvakarmā tvā sādayatviti /🔽viśvakarmā hyetāṃ tṛtīyāṃ citimapaśyadantarikṣasya🔽pṛṣṭhe vyacasvatīm prathasva tīmityantarikṣasya hyetatpṛṣṭhaṃ
analyzed: viśvakarmā tvā sādayatu iti  viśvakarmā hi etām tṛtīyām citim apaśyat antarikṣasya  pṛṣṭhe vyacasvatīm prathasva tīm iti antarikṣasya hi etat pṛṣṭham
translated: 'May Visvakarman settle thee', (with these words) he puts down the naturally-perforated (brick);🔽for Visvakarman saw this third layer. 'On the back of the atmosphere, wide and broad', (with these words) he puts down the naturally-perforated (brick);

original: vyacasvatprathasvadantarikṣaṃ yacāntarikṣaṃ dṛṃhāntarikṣam mā hiṃsīrityātmānaṃ
analyzed: vyacasvat prathasvat antarikṣam yaca antarikṣam dṛṃha antarikṣam mā hiṃsīḥ iti ātmānam
translated: for this (earth) is the wide and broad back of the atmosphere. 'Support the atmosphere, make firm the atmosphere, harm not the atmosphere', (with these words) he puts down the naturally-perforated (brick);

original: yacātmānaṃ dṛṃhātmānam mā hiṃsīrityetat / / /
analyzed: yaca ātmānam dṛṃha ātmānam mā hiṃsīḥ iti etat
translated: 'support thyself, make firm thyself, harm not thyself', is what he thereby says.

original: viśvasmai prāṇāyāpānāya /
analyzed: viśvasmai prāṇāya apānāya
translated: 'For all expiration, for all inspiration', (with these words) he puts down the naturally-perforated (brick);

original: vyānāyodānāyeti prāṇo vai svayamātṛṇā sarvasmā u vā🔽etasmai prāṇaḥ pratiṣṭhāyai caritrāyetīme vai lokāḥ svayamātṛṇā ima u lokāḥ🔽pratiṣṭhā caritraṃ vāyuṣṭvābhipātviti vāyuṣṭvābhigopāyatvityetanmahyā svastyeti
analyzed: vyānāya udānāya iti prāṇaḥ vai svayamātṛṇā sarvasmai u vā  etasmai prāṇaḥ pratiṣṭhāyai caritrāya iti ime vai lokāḥ svayamātṛṇāḥ ime u lokāḥ  pratiṣṭhā caritram vāyuḥ tvā abhipātu iti vāyuḥ tvā abhigopāyatu iti etat mahyā svastyā iti
translated: 'For the out-breathing, for the through-breathing,'--the naturally-perforated one, doubtless, is the breath: for all this (Agni) he (the Sacrificer) takes it;--'for support, for moving about,'--the naturally-perforated ones, doubtless, are these worlds: these worlds are the support and moving about of that (Agni);--'may the wind guard thee!'--that is, 'may the wind protect thee!'--'for great bliss,'--that is, 'for great well-being;'--'for the attainment of the heavenly world,'--that is, 'for the attainment of the heavenly world;'--'for life unto me!'--that is, 'for my life!'

original: mahatyā svastyetyetaccardiṣā śaṃtameneti yaccardiḥ śaṃtamaṃ tenetyetatsādayitvā
analyzed: mahatyā svastyā iti etat cardiṣā śaṃtamena iti yat cardiḥ śaṃtamam tena iti etat sādayitvā
translated: for the out-breathing, for the through-breathing,'--the naturally-perforated one, doubtless, is the breath: for all this (Agni) the breath is the naturally-perforated one;--'for support, for moving about,'--the naturally-perforated ones, doubtless, are these worlds: for these worlds he establishes it;--'may the wind protect thee!'--that is, 'may the wind guard thee!'--'with great welfare,'--that is, 'with great bliss;'--'with the most propitious favour,'--that is, 'with whatever most propitious favour there is, therewith.' Having deposited it,

original: sūdadohasādhivadati tasyokto bandhuratha sāma gāyati tasyopari bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: sūdadohasā adhivadati tasya uktaḥ bandhuḥ atha sāma gāyati tasya upari bandhuḥ
translated: he recites the Sûdadohas over it: the significance of this has been explained. He then sings the Sâman: the significance of this has been explained .

original: atha diśyā upadadhāti /🔽diśo vai diśyā diśa evaitadupadadhāti tadyābhirado
analyzed: atha diśyāḥ upadadhāti  diśaḥ vai diśyāḥ diśaḥ eva etat upadadhāti tat yābhiḥ adaḥ
translated: He then lays down the regional (bricks).

original: vāyurdigbhiranantarhitābhirupaittā etāstā evaitadupadadhāti tā u evāmūḥ🔽purastāddarbhastambaṃ ca logeṣṭakāścopadadhātyasau vā āditya etā amuṃ tadādityaṃ
analyzed: vāyuḥ digbhiḥ an antarhitābhiḥ upait tāḥ etāḥ tāḥ eva etat upadadhāti tāḥ u eva amūḥ  purastāt darbha stambam ca loga iṣṭakāḥ ca upadadhāti asau vai ādityaḥ etāḥ amum tat ādityam
translated: The regional ones, doubtless, are the regions: it is the regions he thus lays down. Those regions which Vâyu (the wind) entered, not leaving a gap, are these same (regions): it is them he thus lays down. They are the same as those (laid down in the first layer),

original: dikṣvadhyūhati dikṣu cinoti tā yattatraiva syurbahirdhā tatsyurbahirdho vā
analyzed: dikṣu adhyūhati dikṣu cinoti tāḥ yat tatra eva syuḥ bahirdhā tat syuḥ bahirdhas vā
translated: but in front he lays down both the bundle of Darbha grass and the Lokamprinâ (bricks). The Lokamprinâs, doubtless, are this (terrestrial) world, and the bundle of Darbha grass is yonder sun: he thus places yonder sun in the regions, he builds him up in the regions. And were they to be there (in the first layer) only, they would be outside (the altar): outside, doubtless, is what is in the regions.

original: etadyoneragnikarma yatpurā puṣkaraparṇāttā yadihāhṛtyopadadhāti tadenā yonau
analyzed: etat yoneḥ agnikarma yat purā puṣkaraparṇāt tāḥ yat iha āhṛtya upadadhāti tat enāḥ yonau
translated: In that he lays down these (bricks) which were formerly (laid down) from the lotus leaf, he thereby establishes them in their birthplace, in the lotus leaf; and so they are not outside (the altar).

original: puṣkaraparṇe pratiṣṭhāpayati tatho haitā abahirdhā bhavanti tā anantarhitāḥ
analyzed: puṣkaraparṇe pratiṣṭhāpayati tathā u ha etāḥ a bahirdhāḥ bhavanti tāḥ an antarhitāḥ
translated: He lays them down not separated from the naturally-perforated (brick); for the naturally-perforated one is the air: he thus places the regions in the air.

original: svayamātṛṇāyā upadadhātyantarikṣaṃ vai madhyamā🔽svayamātṛṇānantarhitāstadantarikṣāddiśo dadhātyuttarā uttarāstadantarikṣāddiśo
analyzed: svayamātṛṇāyāḥ upadadhāti antarikṣam vai madhyamā  svayamātṛṇān antarhitāḥ tat antarikṣāt diśaḥ dadhāti uttarāḥ uttarāḥ tat antarikṣāt diśaḥ
translated: He lays them down above (the naturally-perforated one); he thus places the regions above the air.

original: dadhāti retaḥsicorvelayeme vai retaḥsicāvanayostaddiśo dadhāti tasmādanayordiśaḥ🔽sarvata upadadhāti sarvatastaddiśo dadhāti tasmātsarvato diśaḥ samīcīḥ
analyzed: dadhāti retaḥsicoḥ velayā ime vai retaḥsicau anayoḥ tat diśaḥ dadhāti tasmāt anayoḥ diśaḥ  sarvatas upadadhāti sarvatas tat diśaḥ dadhāti tasmāt sarvatas diśaḥ samīcīḥ
translated: He lays them down on the range of the Retahsik (bricks); for the Retahsik are these two (worlds): he thus places the regions in these two (worlds), and hence there are regions in these two (worlds).🔽He lays them down on every side: he thus places the regions on every side, and hence the regions are on every side.

original: sarvatastatsamīcīrdiśo dadhāti tasmātsarvataḥ samīcyo diśaḥ / / /
analyzed: sarvatas tat samīcīḥ diśaḥ dadhāti tasmāt sarvatas samīcyaḥ diśaḥ
translated: He thus places the regions on every side, and hence the regions are on every side.

original: yadveva diśyā upadadhāti /🔽candāṃsi vai diśo gāyatrī vai prācī diktraṣṭubdakṣiṇā
analyzed: yat u eva diśyāḥ upadadhāti  candāṃsi vai diśaḥ gāyatrī vai prācī diś traṣṭubh dakṣiṇā
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the regional (bricks).🔽The regions are the metres: the eastern region is the Gâyatrî, the southern the Trishtubh,

original: jagatī pratīcyanuṣṭubudīcī paṅktirūrdhvā paśavo vai candāṃsyantarikṣam
analyzed: jagatī pratīcī anuṣṭubh udīcī paṅktiḥ ūrdhvā paśavaḥ vai candāṃsi antarikṣam
translated: the western the Jagatî, the northern the Anushtubh, and the upper one the Pankti. The metres are the beasts, and the air is the middle.

original: madhyamā citirantarikṣe tatpaśūndadhāti tasmādantarikṣāyatanāḥ paśavaḥ / / /
analyzed: madhyamā citiḥ antarikṣe tat paśūn dadhāti tasmāt antarikṣa āyatanāḥ paśavaḥ
translated: The middle layer is in the atmosphere: he thus puts cattle into the atmosphere; whence cattle have their abode in the atmosphere.

original: yadveva diśyā upadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva diśyāḥ upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the regional (bricks).

original: candāṃsi vai diśaḥ paśavo vai candāṃsyannam paśavo🔽madhyam madhyamā citirmadhyatastadannaṃ dadhāti tā anantarhitāḥ svayamātṛṇāyā🔽upadadhāti prāṇo vai svayamātṛṇānantarhitaṃ tatprāṇādannaṃ dadhātyuttarā uttaraṃ
analyzed: candāṃsi vai diśaḥ paśavaḥ vai candāṃsi annam paśavaḥ  madhyam madhyamā citiḥ madhyatas tat annam dadhāti tāḥ an antarhitāḥ svayamātṛṇāyāḥ  upadadhāti prāṇaḥ vai svayam ātṛṇa an antarhitam tat prāṇāt annam dadhāti uttarā uttaram
translated: The regions are the metres, and the metres are cattle, and cattle are food;

original: tatprāṇādannaṃ dadhāti retaḥsicorvelayā pṛṣṭayo vai retaḥsicau madhyamu pṛṣṭayo🔽madhyata evāsminnetadannaṃ dadhāti sarvata upadadhāti sarvata evāsminnatadannaṃ
analyzed: tat prāṇāt annam dadhāti retaḥsicoḥ velayā pṛṣṭayaḥ vai retaḥsicau madhyam u pṛṣṭayaḥ  madhyatas eva asmin etat annam dadhāti sarvatas upadadhāti sarvatas eva asmin atadannam
translated: the middle layer is the middle: he thus puts food into the middle (of the altar). He lays them down so as not to be separated from the naturally-perforated (brick); for the naturally-perforated one is the breath: he thus places food so as not to be separated from the breath. He lays them down one after the other, one above another: he thus places food one above another, so as not to be separated from the breath.🔽With the 'Retahsik' (bricks) he lays down the ribs; for the Retahsik are the ribs: he thus puts food into the middle (of the body).

original: dadhāti / / /
analyzed: dadhāti
translated: He lays them down all round: he thus puts food into it (the altar) on all sides.

original: rāñyasi prācī dik /
analyzed: rāñī asi prācī diś
translated: 'Thou art the queen, the eastern region!'🔽'Thou art the ruling, the southern region!'🔽'Thou art the all-ruling, the western region!'

original: virāḍasi dakṣiṇā dikṣamrāḍasi pratīcī dikṣvarāḍasyudīcī
analyzed: virāj asi dakṣiṇā dikṣu samrāj asi pratīcī dikṣu arāj asi udīcī
translated: 'Thou art the over-ruling, the northern region!'

original: digadhipatnyasi bṛhatī digiti nāmānyāsāmetāni nāmagrāhamevainā etadupadadhāti tā
analyzed: diś adhi patnī asi bṛhatī diś iti nāmāni āsām etāni nāmagrāham eva enāḥ etat upadadhāti tā
translated: 'Thou art the lady, the wide region!'--these are their names: it is by their names that he thus lays them down.

original: nānopadadhāti nānā sādayati nānā sūdadohasādhivadati nānā hi diśaḥ / / /
analyzed: nānā upadadhāti nānā sādayati nānā sūdadohasā adhivadati nānā hi diśaḥ
translated: He lays down various (bricks), he settles various (bricks), he recites the Sûdadohas over various (bricks), for the quarters are various.

original: atha viśvajyotiṣamupadadhāti /
analyzed: atha viśvajyotiṣam upadadhāti
translated: He then lays down the Visva-jyoti (all-light brick).

original: vāyurvai madhyamā
analyzed: vāyuḥ vai madhyamā
translated: The middle one is Vâyu (the wind),

original: viśvajyotirvāyurhyevāntarikṣaloke viśvaṃ jyotirvāyumevaitadupadadhāti🔽tāmanantarhitāṃ diśyābhya upadadhāti dikṣu tadvāyuṃ dadhāti tasmātsarvāsu dikṣu
analyzed: viśvajyotiḥ vāyuḥ hi eva antarikṣa loke viśvam jyotiḥ vāyum eva etat upadadhāti  tām anantarhitām diśi ābhyaḥ upadadhāti dikṣu tat vāyum dadhāti tasmāt sarvāsu dikṣu
translated: for the Visva-jyoti is Vâyu (the wind), since Vâyu is the all-light in the air-world: it is Vâyu he thus lays down.

original: vāyuḥ / / /
analyzed: vāyuḥ
translated: He lays it down not separated from the two Dîkshâs (bricks): he thus places Vâyu in the quarters, whence Vâyu is (to be found) in all the quarters.

original: yadveva viśvajyotiṣamupadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva viśvajyotiṣam upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Visva-jyoti.

original: prajā vai viśvajyotiḥ prajā hyeva viśvaṃ jyotiḥ🔽prajananamevaitadupadadhāti tāmanantarhitāṃ diśyābhyā upadadhāti dikṣu tatprajā
analyzed: prajā vai viśvajyotiḥ prajā hi eva viśvam jyotiḥ  prajananam eva etat upadadhāti tām anantarhitām diśi ābhyāḥ upadadhāti dikṣu tat prajā
translated: The Visva-jyoti is creatures, for creatures are the all-light;

original: dadhāti tasmātsarvāsu dikṣu prajāḥ / / /🔽viśvakarmā tvā sādayatviti /
analyzed: dadhāti tasmāt sarvāsu dikṣu prajāḥ  viśvakarmā tvā sādayatu iti
translated: he thus lays down generation: he lays it down not separated from the two Dîkshâs (bricks): he thus places creatures in the quarters, whence there are creatures in all the quarters.

original: viśvakarmā hyetāṃ tṛtīyāṃ citimapaśyadantarikṣasya
analyzed: viśvakarmā hi etām tṛtīyām citim apaśyat antarikṣasya
translated: 'May Visvakarman settle thee,' for Visvakarman saw this third layer,

original: pṛṣṭhe jyotiṣmatīmityantarikṣasya hyayam pṛṣṭhe jyotiṣmānvāyuḥ / / /
analyzed: pṛṣṭhe jyotiṣmatīm iti antarikṣasya hi ayam pṛṣṭhe jyotiṣmān vāyuḥ
translated: 'on the back of the air, the light one,' for on the back of the air is the light Vâyu.

original: viśvasmai prāṇāyāpānāya /
analyzed: viśvasmai prāṇāya apānāya
translated: 'For all expiration, for all inspiration,'

original: vyānāyeti prāṇo vai viśvajyotiḥ sarvasmā u vā etasmai
analyzed: vyānāya iti prāṇaḥ vai viśvajyotiḥ sarvasmai u vai etasmai
translated: 'For the out-breathing', (with these words he puts down the brick) for the out-breathing is the all-light, and for all this (brick)

original: prāṇo🔽viśvaṃ jyotiryaceti sarvaṃ jyotiryacetyetadvāyuṣṭe 'dhipatiriti vāyumavāsyā adhipatiṃ
analyzed: prāṇo  viśvam jyotiḥ yacā iti sarvam jyotiḥ yacā iti etat vāyuḥ te dhipatiḥ iti vāyum ava asyāḥ adhipatim
translated: the out-breathing is the all-light.

original: karoti sādayitvā sūdadohasādhivadati tasyokto bandhuḥ / / /🔽atha 'rtavyā upadadhāti /🔽ṛtava ete yadṛtavyā ṛtūnevaitadupadadhāti nabhaśca🔽nabhasyaśca vārṣikāvṛtū iti nāmanī enayorete nāmabhyāmevaine etadupadadhāti dve🔽iṣṭake bhavato dvau hi māsāvṛtuḥ sakṛtsādayatyekaṃ tadṛtuṃ
analyzed: karoti sādayitvā sūdadohasā adhivadati tasya uktaḥ bandhuḥ  atha rtavyāḥ upadadhāti  ṛtavaḥ ete yat ṛtavyāḥ ṛtūn eva etat upadadhāti nabhaḥ ca  nabhasyaḥ ca vārṣikau ṛtū iti nāmanī enayoḥ ete nāmabhyām eva ene etat upadadhāti dve  iṣṭake bhavataḥ dvau hi māsau ṛtuḥ sakṛt sādayati ekam tat ṛtum
translated: 'Thou art the all-light', he says; that is, 'thou art the all-light.' 'Vâyu is thy lord', he says; he makes Vâyu the overlord of this (brick). Having settled it, he recites the Sûdadohas verse on it: the significance of this has been explained.

original: karotyavakāsūpadadhātyavakābhiḥ pracādayatyāpo vā avakā apastadetasminnṛtau🔽dadhāti tasmādetasminnṛtau bhūyiṣṭhaṃ varṣati / / /🔽athottare / iṣaścorjaśca śāradāvṛtū iti nāmanī enayorete nāmabhyāmevaine
analyzed: karoti avakāsu upadadhāti avakābhiḥ pracādayati āpaḥ vai avakāḥ apaḥ tat etasmin ṛtau  dadhāti tasmāt etasmin ṛtau bhūyiṣṭham varṣati  atha uttare iṣaḥ ca ūrjaḥ ca śāradau ṛtū iti nāmanī enayoḥ ete nāmabhyām eva ene
translated: He then puts down the seasonal (bricks). The seasonal (bricks) are the seasons: it is the seasons he thus lays down. 'Nabha and Nabhasya, the two rainy seasons', (with these words he puts down two bricks); these are the names of those two (seasons): it is with their names he thus lays them down. There are two bricks, for a season consists of two months. He settles them at once: he thus makes them one season. He puts them down on the lotus-leaf, and covers them with lotus-leaf; for the lotus-leaf is water: he thus puts water into that season, whence it rains most abundantly in that season.

original: etadupadadhāti dve iṣṭake bhavato dvau hi māsāvṛtuḥ sakṛtsādayatyekaṃ tadṛtuṃ
analyzed: etat upadadhāti dve iṣṭake bhavataḥ dvau hi māsau ṛtuḥ sakṛt sādayati ekam tat ṛtum
translated: He then (lays down) two on the north side: 'Iṣa and Urja, the two autumnal seasons,' (with these words he puts down two bricks); these are the names of those two (seasons): it is with their names he thus lays them down. There are two bricks, for a season consists of two months. He settles them at once: he thus makes them one season.

original: karotyavakāsūpadadhātyāpo vā avakā apastadetasya 'rtoḥ purastāddadhāti🔽tasmādetasya 'rtoḥ purastādvarṣati nopariṣṭātpracādayati tasmānna
analyzed: karoti avakāsu upadadhāti āpaḥ vai avakāḥ apaḥ tat etasya ṛtoḥ purastāt dadhāti  tasmāt etasya rtoḥ purastāt varṣati na upariṣṭāt pracādayati tasmāt na
translated: He puts them down in the Avakâs; the Avakâs are water: he thus puts water in front of that season.

original: tathevopariṣṭādvarṣati / / /🔽tadyadetā / atropadadhāti saṃvatsara eṣo 'gnirima u lokāḥ
analyzed: tathā iva upariṣṭāt varṣati  tat yat etāḥ atra upadadhāti saṃvatsaraḥ eṣaḥ gniḥ ime u lokāḥ
translated: Therefore it rains in front of that season, not behind it. He does not cover it above: therefore it does not rain above it in the same way.

original: saṃvatsarastasyāntarikṣameva madhyamā citirantarikṣamasya varṣāśaradāvṛt🔽tadyadetā atropadadhāti yadevāsyaitā ātmanastadasminnetatpratidadhāti tasmādetā
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ tasya antarikṣam eva madhyamā citiḥ antarikṣam asya varṣā śarad āvṛt  tat yat etāḥ atra upadadhāti yat eva asya etāḥ ātmanaḥ tat asmin etat pratidadhāti tasmāt etāḥ
translated: And, again, as to why he puts them down here. This Agni is the year, and these worlds are the year: its middle layer is the middlemost layer (of the altar), and its rainy and autumn seasons are the two layers on both sides of it.

original: atropadadhāti / / /
analyzed: atra upadadhāti
translated: And as to why he puts them down here, it is because these (two seasons) belong to this (Agni's body): he thus restores to him what these (seasons) are of his (body). For this reason he puts them down here.

original: yadvevaitā atropadadhāti /🔽prajāpatireṣo 'gniḥ saṃvatsara u prajāpatistasya🔽madhyameva madhyamā citirmadhyamasya varṣāśaradāvṛtū tadyadetā atropadadhāti
analyzed: yat u eva etāḥ atra upadadhāti  prajāpatiḥ eṣaḥ gniḥ saṃvatsaraḥ u prajāpatiḥ tasya  madhyamā iva madhyamā citiḥ madhyamasya varṣā śaradau ṛtū tat yat etāḥ atra upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he puts them down here.

original: yadevāsyaitā ātmanastadasminnetatpratidadhāti tasmādetā atropadadhāti / / /
analyzed: yat eva asya etāḥ ātmanaḥ tat asmin etat pratidadhāti tasmāt etāḥ atra upadadhāti
translated: This Agni is Pragâpati, and Pragâpati is the year: its middle layer is the middlemost layer (of the altar), and the rainy and autumn seasons are the two layers on both sides of it. And as to why he puts them down here, it is because these (two seasons) belong to this (Agni's body): he thus restores to him what these (seasons) are of his (body). For this reason he puts them down here.

original: tā vā etāḥ / catasra ṛtavyā madhyamāyāṃ citā upadadhāti dvedve itarāsu citiṣu
analyzed: tāḥ vai etāḥ catasraḥ ṛtavyāḥ madhyamāyām citāḥ upadadhāti dve dve itarāsu citiṣu
translated: He puts down four ऋतव्या bricks on the middle layer, and two and two on the other layers.

original: catuṣpādā vai paśavo 'ntarikṣam madhyamā citirantarikṣe tatpaśūndadhāti
analyzed: catuṣpādāḥ vai paśavaḥ ntarikṣam madhyamā citiḥ antarikṣe tat paśūn dadhāti
translated: The cattle are four-footed, the middle layer is the atmosphere: in the atmosphere he places the cattle.

original: tasmādantarikṣāyatanāḥ paśavaḥ / / /🔽yadveva catasraḥ catuṣpādā vai paśavo 'nnam paśavo madhyam madhyamā
analyzed: tasmāt antarikṣa āyatanāḥ paśavaḥ  yat u eva catasraḥ catuṣpādāḥ vai paśavaḥ nnam paśavaḥ madhyam madhyamā
translated: Therefore cattle have their abode in the atmosphere.

original: citirmadhyatastadannaṃ dadhāti / / /🔽yadveva catasraḥ /🔽caturakṣaraṃ vā antarikṣaṃ dvyakṣarā
analyzed: citiḥ madhyatas tat annam dadhāti  yat u eva catasraḥ  catur akṣaram vai antarikṣam dvi akṣarā
translated: And, again, as to why (he puts down) four (layers); the cattle are four-footed, and cattle are food: the middle (layer) is the middle (part of the sacrifice), and in the middle he places food.

original: itarāścitayastadyāvadantarikṣaṃ tāvattatkṛtvopadadhāti / / /🔽yadveva catasraḥ /
analyzed: itarāḥ citayaḥ tat yāvat antarikṣam tāvat tat kṛtvā upadadhāti  yat u eva catasraḥ
translated: And, again, as to why (he puts down) four; the atmosphere is of four syllables, and the other layers are of two syllables each: as great as the atmosphere is, so great he makes it, and thus lays it down.

original: paśureṣa yadagnirmadhyaṃ tatprati paśuṃ variṣṭhaṃ karoti
analyzed: paśuḥ eṣa yat agniḥ madhyam tat prati paśum variṣṭham karoti
translated: And, again, as to why (he puts down) four; this Agni is a cattle: he makes it the largest in the middle;

original: tasmānmadhyam prati paśurvariṣṭhaḥ / / /🔽tā vā etāḥ / catasra ṛtavyāstāsāṃ viśvajyotiḥ pañcamī pañca diśyāstaddaśa daśākṣarā
analyzed: tasmāt madhyam prati paśuḥ variṣṭhaḥ  tāḥ vai etāḥ catasraḥ ṛtavyāḥ tāsām viśvajyotiḥ pañcamī pañca diśyāḥ tat daśa daśa akṣarā
translated: therefore cattle are the largest in the middle.

original: virāḍannaṃ virāṇmadhyam madhyamā citirmadhyatastadannaṃ dadhāti tā
analyzed: virāj annam virāj madhyam madhyamā citiḥ madhyatas tat annam dadhāti tā
translated: Now these are four seasonal (bricks); the All-light (brick) is the fifth, and the five regional (bricks): that makes ten. The Virâg consists of ten syllables, and the Virâg is food: in the middle (he places) the food, in the middle layer.

original: anantarhitāḥ svayamātṛṇāyā upadadhāti prāṇo vai svayamātṛṇānantarhitaṃ
analyzed: an antarhitāḥ svayamātṛṇāyāḥ upadadhāti prāṇaḥ vai svayamātṛṇā an antarhitam
translated: He places them so as not to be separated from the naturally-perforated one; for the naturally-perforated one is the breath: he thus places the food so as not to be separated from the breath.

original: tatprāṇādannaṃ dadhātyuttarā uttaraṃ tatprāṇādannaṃ dadhāti / / /🔽atha prāṇabhṛta upadadhāti /🔽prāṇā vai prāṇabhṛtaḥ prāṇānevaitadupadadhāti tā daśa🔽bhavanti daśa vai prāṇāḥ pūrvārdha upadadhāti purastāddhīme prāṇā āyurme pāhi🔽jyotirme yaceti prāṇo vai jyotiḥ prāṇam me yacetyevaitadāha tā anantarhitā ṛtavyābhya
analyzed: tat prāṇāt annam dadhāti uttarā uttaram tat prāṇāt annam dadhāti  atha prāṇabhṛtaḥ upadadhāti  prāṇāḥ vai prāṇabhṛtaḥ prāṇān eva etat upadadhāti tāḥ daśa  bhavanti daśa vai prāṇāḥ pūrva ardhe upadadhāti purastāt hi ime prāṇāḥ āyuḥ me pāhi  jyotiḥ me yaca iti prāṇaḥ vai jyotiḥ prāṇam me yaca iti eva etat āha tāḥ an antarhitāḥ ṛtavyābhyaḥ
translated: He places it higher and higher; he places food higher and higher than the breath.

original: upadadhāti prāṇo vai vāyurṛtuṣu tadvāyum pratiṣṭhāpayati / / /
analyzed: upadadhāti prāṇaḥ vai vāyuḥ ṛtuṣu tat vāyum pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: Then he lays down the Prāṇabhṛt (bricks). The Prāṇabhṛt (bricks) are the breaths; he thus lays the breaths into him (Agni). They are ten; there are ten vital airs. He places them in the fore-part; for these vital airs are in front. 'Guard my life, bestow light on me,'--light is the breath: 'bestow breath on me,' he thereby says. He places them so as not to be separated from the Ṛtavyâs; for the breath is the wind: he thus establishes the wind in the seasons.

original: atha candasyā upadadhāti /🔽paśavo vai candāṃsyantarikṣam madhyamā citirantarikṣe
analyzed: atha candasyāḥ upadadhāti  paśavaḥ vai candāṃsi antarikṣam madhyamā citiḥ antarikṣe
translated: He then lays down the Chandâs (Vedic metres).

original: tatpaśuṃ dadhāti tasmādantarikṣāyatanāḥ paśavaḥ / / /
analyzed: tat paśum dadhāti tasmāt antarikṣa āyatanāḥ paśavaḥ
translated: The metres are cattle; the middlemost layer is the air: he thus places cattle in the air; whence cattle have their abode in the air.

original: yadveva candasyā upadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva candasyāḥ upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the metres.

original: paśavo vai candāṃsyannm paśavo madhyam
analyzed: paśavaḥ vai candāṃsi annm paśavaḥ madhyam
translated: The metres are cattle, and cattle are food;

original: madhyamā citirmadhyatastadannaṃ dadhāti / / /🔽tā dvādaśadvādaśopadadhāti /
analyzed: madhyamā citiḥ madhyatas tat annam dadhāti  tāḥ dvādaśa dvādaśa upadadhāti
translated: and the middlemost layer is the middle: he thus places food in the middle of it.

original: dvādaśākṣarā vai jagatī paśavo jagatyantarikṣam
analyzed: dvādaśa akṣarā vai jagatī paśavaḥ jagatī antarikṣam
translated: Twelve (bricks) he places in each (layer); for the Gagatî consists of twelve syllables, and cattle are of Gâgata (moving) nature, and the air is the middle: he thus places cattle in the air.

original: madhyamā citirantarikṣe tatpaśūndadhāti tasmādantarikṣāyatanāḥ paśavaḥ / / /
analyzed: madhyamā citiḥ antarikṣe tat paśūn dadhāti tasmāt antarikṣa āyatanāḥ paśavaḥ
translated: The middle layer is in the atmosphere: he thus places cattle in the atmosphere; whence cattle have their abode in the atmosphere.

original: yadveva dvādaśadvādaśa /
analyzed: yat u eva dvādaśa dvādaśa
translated: And, again, as to why (he lays down) twelve (bricks) each time.

original: dvādaśākṣarā vai jagatī paśavo vai jagatyannam paśavo
analyzed: dvādaśa akṣarā vai jagatī paśavaḥ vai jagatī annam paśavaḥ
translated: The Gagatî consists of twelve syllables, and the Gagatî is cattle, and cattle are food;

original: madhyam madhyamā citirmadhyatastadanna dadhāti tā anantarhitāḥ prāṇabhṛdbhya🔽upadadhātyanantarhitaṃ tatprāṇebhyo 'nnaṃ dadhātyuttarā uttaraṃ tatprāṇebhyo
analyzed: madhyam madhyamā citiḥ madhyatas tat anna dadhāti tāḥ an antarhitāḥ prāṇabhṛdbhyaḥ  upadadhāti an antarhitam tat prāṇebhyaḥ nnam dadhāti uttarā uttaram tat prāṇebhyaḥ
translated: the middle layer is the middle (of the sacrifice): he thus places food in the middle (of the sacrifice). He lays them down so as not to be separated from the Prânabhrits: he thus places food not separated from the vital airs.🔽The last (he lays down) in each case so as not to be separated from the Prânabhrits: he thus places food not separated from the vital airs.

original: 'nnaṃ dadhāti / / /
analyzed: annam dadhāti
translated: The last (he lays down) in each case so as to be higher than the preceding one: he thus places food higher and higher for the vital airs.

original: mā canda iti /🔽ayaṃ vai loko māyaṃ hi loko mita iva pramā canda ityantarikṣaloko🔽vai pramāntarikṣaloko hyasmāllokātpramita iva pratimā canda ityasau vai lokaḥ🔽pratimaiṣa hyantarikṣaloke pratimita ivāsrīvayaścanda ityannamasrīvayastadyadeṣu
analyzed: mā candaḥ iti  ayam vai lokaḥ mā ayam hi lokaḥ mitaḥ iva pramā candaḥ iti antarikṣa lokaḥ  vai pramā antarikṣa lokaḥ hi asmāt lokāt pramitaḥ iva pratimā candaḥ iti asau vai lokaḥ  pratimā eṣa hi antarikṣa loke pratimitaḥ iva asrīvayaḥ candaḥ iti annam asrīvayaḥ tat yat eṣu
translated: 'The measure, O metre,' (is one of them);

original: lokeṣvannaṃ tadasrīvayo 'tho yadebhyo lokebhyo 'nnaṃ sravati tadasrīvayo 'thāto
analyzed: lokeṣu annam tat asrīvayaḥ tha u yat ebhyaḥ lokebhyaḥ nnam sravati tat asrīvayaḥ tha atas
translated: the 'measure' is this (terrestrial) world, for this world is, as it were, measured;--'the extent, O metre,' (is another); the 'extent' is the air-world, for the air-world is, as it were, extended from this world;--'the counter-measure, O metre,' (is another); the 'counter-measure' is yonder world, for yonder world is, as it were, measured in the air-world;--'the counter-extent, O metre,' (is another); the 'counter-extent' is food, for food is, as it were, extended in these worlds; and also because food flows from these worlds, therefore it is the 'counter-extent.'

original: niruktānyeva candāṃsyupadadhāti / / /
analyzed: niruktāni eva candāṃsi upadadhāti
translated: Now, then, as to the defined metres which he lays down.

original: paṅktiścandaḥ /
analyzed: paṅktiḥ candaḥ
translated: The Paṅkti metre,

original: uṣṇikcando bṛhatī cando 'nuṣṭupcando virāṭ cando gāyatrī
analyzed: uṣṇih candaḥ bṛhatī candaḥ nuṣṭubh candaḥ virāj candaḥ gāyatrī
translated: The metre Uṣṇik, the metre Bṛhatī, the metre Anuṣṭup, the metre Virāj, the metre Gāyatrī,

original: candastriṣṭupcando jagatī canda ityetāni niruktāni virāḍaṣṭamāni🔽candāṃsyupadadhāti pṛthivī cando 'ntarikṣaṃ canda iti yānyetaddevatyāni candāṃsi
analyzed: candaḥ triṣṭubh candaḥ jagatī candaḥ iti etāni niruktāni virāj aṣṭamāni  candāṃsi upadadhāti pṛthivī candaḥ ntarikṣam candaḥ iti yāni etad devatyāni candāṃsi
translated: the metre Triṣṭup, the metre Jagatī, these are the defined metres, Virāj being the eighth.🔽He lays down these defined metres, the metre Earth, the metre Firmament,🔽he thereby lays down those metres which have those deities.

original: tānyevaitadupadadhātyagnirdevatā vāto devatetyetā vai devatāścandāṃsi
analyzed: tāni eva etat upadadhāti agniḥ devatā vātaḥ devatā iti etāḥ vai devatāḥ candāṃsi
translated: Agni is the deity, Vāta is the deity, these deities are the metres;

original: tānyevaitadupadadhāti / / /
analyzed: tāni eva etat upadadhāti
translated: he thereby lays down those (metres).

original: sa vai niruktāni cāniruktāni copadadhāti /🔽sa yatsarvāṇi
analyzed: sa vai niruktāni ca aniruktāni ca upadadhāti  sa yat sarvāṇi
translated: He lays down both defined and undefined (metres).

original: niruktānyupādhāsyadantavaddhānnamabhaviṣyadakṣeṣyata hātha
analyzed: niruktāni upādhāsyat antavat ha annam abhaviṣyat akṣeṣyata ha atha
translated: If he were to lay down all defined (metres), food would be limited; it would be exhausted.

original: yatsarvāṇyaniruktāni paro 'kṣaṃ hānnamabhaviṣyanna hainadadrakṣyaṃścana
analyzed: yat sarvāṇi aniruktāni parokṣam ha annam abhaviṣyan na ha enat adrakṣyan cana
translated: If he were to lay down all undefined (metres), food would be imperceptible; one could not see it at all.

original: niruktāni cāniruktāni copadadhāti tasmānniruktamannamadyamānaṃ na kṣīyate / / /🔽tāni vā etāni /
analyzed: niruktāni ca aniruktāni ca upadadhāti tasmāt niruktam annam adyamānam na kṣīyate  tāni vai etāni
translated: He lays down both defined and undefined (metres); therefore food, when eaten, is not exhausted.

original: trīṇi dvādaśānyupadadhāti tatṣaṭtriṃśatṣaṭtriṃśadakṣarā bṛhatyeṣā
analyzed: trīṇi dvādaśāni upadadhāti tat ṣaṭtriṃśat ṣaṭtriṃśat akṣarā bṛhatī eṣā
translated: These (bricks) are three sets of twelve; that makes thirty-six; the Brihatî consists of thirty-six syllables.

original: vai sā bṛhatī yāṃ taddevā antarikṣam bṛhatīṃ tṛtīyāṃ citimapaśyaṃstasyā etasyai devā
analyzed: vai sā bṛhatī yām tat devāḥ antarikṣam bṛhatīm tṛtīyām citim apaśyan tasyai etasyai devāḥ
translated: That is the great one, the great one is the atmosphere, the gods saw the third layer as the great one, of that one, of that (layer), the gods

original: uttamāḥ / / /
analyzed: uttamāḥ
translated: are the highest.

original: yadvevaitā iṣṭakā upadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva etāḥ iṣṭakāḥ upadadhāti
translated: And again, why he lays down these bricks.

original: prajāpatervisrastātsarvāṇi bhūtāni sarvā diśo 'nu
analyzed: prajāpateḥ visrastāt sarvāṇi bhūtāni sarvāḥ diśaḥ nu
translated: From the relaxed Prajapati all beings and all quarters

original: vyudakrāman / / /
analyzed: vyudakrāman
translated: departed.

original: sa yaḥ sa prajāpatirvyasraṃsata /🔽ayameva sa yo 'yamagniścīyate 'tha yānyasmāttāni🔽bhūtāni vyudakrāmannetāstā iṣṭakāstadyadetā upadadhāti yānyevāsmāttāni bhūtāni
analyzed: sa yaḥ sa prajāpatiḥ vyasraṃsata  ayam eva sa yaḥ yam agniḥ cīyate yāni asmāt tāni  bhūtāni vyudakrāman etāḥ tāḥ iṣṭakāḥ tat yat etāḥ upadadhāti yāni eva asmāt tāni bhūtāni
translated: And that Prajapati who was relaxed,

original: vyudakrāmaṃstānyasminnetatpratidadhāti / / /
analyzed: vyudakrāman tāni asmin etat pratidadhāti
translated: this very one is he who is being piled up here. Then those beings which departed from him, they are these bricks. In that he lays down these (bricks), he thereby puts into him those beings which departed from him.

original: tadyā daśa prathamā upadadhāti /🔽sa candramāstā daśa bhavanti daśākṣarā🔽virāḍannaṃ virāḍannamu candramā atha yā uttarāḥ ṣaṭtriṃśadardhamāsāśca te
analyzed: tat yāḥ daśa prathamāḥ upadadhāti  sa candramāḥ tāḥ daśa bhavanti daśa akṣarā  virāj annam virāj annam u candramāḥ atha yāḥ uttarāḥ ṣaṭtriṃśat ardha māsāḥ ca te
translated: Now, the ten which he first lays down,

original: māsāśca caturviṃśatirardhamāsā dvādaśa māsāścandramā vai saṃvatsaraḥ sarvāṇi
analyzed: māsāḥ ca caturviṃśatiḥ ardha māsāḥ dvādaśa māsāḥ candramāḥ vai saṃvatsaraḥ sarvāṇi
translated: that is the moon. They are ten, the Viraj has ten syllables, the Viraj is food, the moon is food. Then the other thirty-six, they are the half-months and the months. Twenty-four half-months, twelve months. The moon is the year, all beings

original: bhūtāni / / /
analyzed: bhūtāni
translated: are in the middle of him.

original: taṃ yatra devāḥ samaskurvan /
analyzed: tam yatra devāḥ samaskurvan
translated: When the gods put him together,

original: tadasminnetāni sarvāṇi bhūtāni madhyato
analyzed: tat asmin etāni sarvāṇi bhūtāni madhyatas
translated: in him they put all these beings in the middle.

original: 'dadhustathaivāsminnayametaddadhāti tā anantarhitā ṛtavyābhya upadadhātyṛtuṣu
analyzed: dadhuḥ tathā eva asmin ayam etat dadhāti tāḥ an antarhitāḥ ṛtavyābhyaḥ upadadhāti ṛtuṣu
translated: 'They have laid them down in him, and so does he lay them down in him.' He lays them down so as not to be separated from the seasonal (bricks). In the seasons

original: tatsarvāṇi bhūtāni pratiṣṭhāpayati / / /🔽atha vālakhilyā upadadhāti /
analyzed: tat sarvāṇi bhūtāni pratiṣṭhāpayati  atha vālakhilyāḥ upadadhāti
translated: he establishes all beings.

original: prāṇā vai vālakhilyāḥ prāṇānevaitadupadadhāti tā
analyzed: prāṇāḥ vai vālakhilyāḥ prāṇān eva etat upadadhāti tā
translated: He then lays down the Vâlakhilyâs. The Vâlakhilyâs are the vital airs: it is the vital airs he thus lays down.

original: yadvālakhilyā nāma yadvā urvarayorasambhinnam bhavati khila iti vai tadācakṣate
analyzed: yat vālakhilyāḥ nāma yat vai urvarayoḥ a sambhinnam bhavati khilaḥ iti vai tat ācakṣate
translated: As to why they are called Vâlakhilyâs. What is not cut off from the two (halves of the) seed is called a khil (stubble);

original: vālamātrādu heme prāṇā asambhinnāste yadvālasātrādasambhinnāstasmādvālakhilyāḥ / / /
analyzed: vāla mātrāt u ha ime prāṇāḥ a sambhinnāḥ te yat vāla sātrāt a sambhinnāḥ tasmāt vālakhilyāḥ
translated: and from that stubble the vital airs are not cut off: as much as a hair's breadth they are not cut off; and because they are not cut off as much as a hair's breadth, therefore they are Vâlakhilyâs.

original: sa vai sapta purastādupadadhāti /🔽sapta paścāttadyāḥ sapta purastādupadadhāti ya🔽eveme sapta purastātprāṇāstānasminnetaddadhāti / / /
analyzed: sa vai sapta purastāt upadadhāti  sapta paścāttadyāḥ sapta purastāt upadadhāti yaḥ  eva ime sapta purastāt prāṇāḥ tān asmin etat dadhāti
translated: He lays down seven in front,🔽and seven behind. Those seven which he lays down in front are the seven vital airs which are in front here: it is them he thus lays into him.🔽And those seven which he lays down behind are the seven vital airs which are behind here: it is them he thus lays into him.

original: atha yāḥ sapta paścāt /
analyzed: atha yāḥ sapta paścāt
translated: And those seven which he lays down behind are the seven vital airs which are behind here: it is them he thus lays into him.

original: eṣāmevaitatprāṇānāmetānprāṇānpratīnkaroti
analyzed: eṣām eva etat prāṇānām etān prāṇān pratīn karoti
translated: He thus makes these vital airs of his the out-breathing.

original: tasmādyadebhirannamatti tadetairatyeti / / /🔽yadveva sapta purastādupadadhāti /
analyzed: tasmāt yat ebhiḥ annam atti tat etaiḥ atyeti  yat u eva sapta purastāt upadadhāti
translated: And hence whatever food he eats, he passes it by means of these (vital airs).

original: sapta vā ime purastātprāṇāścatvāri dorbāhavāṇi
analyzed: sapta vai ime purastāt prāṇāḥ catvāri dos bāhavāṇi
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down seven in front. There are seven vital airs in front here, and four arms and two hands,

original: śiro grīvā yadūrdhvaṃ nābhestatsaptamamaṅge 'ṅge hi prāṇa ete vai sapta
analyzed: śiraḥ grīvā yat ūrdhvam nābheḥ tat saptamam aṅge ṅge hi prāṇaḥ ete vai sapta
translated: The head and neck, and what is above the navel, is the seventh limb, for the life is in the limbs. These are the seven

original: purastātprāṇāstānasminnetaddadhāti / / /
analyzed: purastāt prāṇāḥ tān asmin etat dadhāti
translated: prāṇas in front; he puts them into this (brick).

original: atha yāḥ sapta paścāt /
analyzed: atha yāḥ sapta paścāt
translated: Now those seven (bricks) behind;

original: sapta vā ime paścātprāṇāścatvāryūrvaṣṭhīvāni dvai pratiṣṭhe
analyzed: sapta vai ime paścāt prāṇāḥ catvāri ūru aṣṭhīvāni dvai pratiṣṭhe
translated: there are seven of these prāṇas behind, four in the thighs, two in the knees,

original: yadavāṅnābhestatsaptamamaṅge 'ṅge hi prāṇa ete vai sapta
analyzed: yat avāk nābheḥ tat saptamam aṅge ṅge hi prāṇaḥ ete vai sapta
translated: and what is below the navel is the seventh limb, for the life is in the limbs. These are the seven

original: paścātprāṇāstānasminnetaddadhāti / / /
analyzed: paścāt prāṇāḥ tān asmin etat dadhāti
translated: prāṇas behind; he puts them into this (brick).

original: mūrdhāsi rāṭ /🔽dhruvāsi dharuṇā dhartryasi dharaṇī yantrī rāḍyantryasi yamanī
analyzed: mūrdhā asi rāj  dhruvā asi dharuṇā dhartrī asi dharaṇī yantrī rāj yantrī asi yamanī
translated: Thou art the head, the king.🔽Thou art firm, the supporter, the supporteress, the supporter, the controller, the controlleress, the controller.

original: dhruvāsi dharitrītyetānevāsminnetaddhruvānprāṇānyacati / / /
analyzed: dhruvā asi dharitrī iti etān eva asmin etat dhruvān prāṇān yacati
translated: Thou art firm, the supporteress. In this (brick) he thus places those firm prāṇas.

original: yadveva vālakhilyā upadadhāti /🔽etadvai devā🔽vālakhilyābhirevemāṃlokāntsamayuritaścordhvānamutaścārvācastathaivaitadyajamāno
analyzed: yat u eva vālakhilyāḥ upadadhāti  etat vai devā  vālakhilyābhiḥ eva imān lokān samayuḥ itas ca ūrdhvānam utas ca arvācaḥ tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Vâlakhilyâs.

original: vālakhilyābhirevemāṃlokāntsaṃyātītaścordhvānamutaścārvācaḥ / / /🔽mūrdhāsi rāḍitīmaṃ lokamarohan /
analyzed: vālakhilyābhiḥ eva imān lokān saṃyāti itas ca ūrdhvān amutas ca arvācaḥ  mūrdhā asi rāj iti imam lokam arohan
translated: The gods, indeed, by means of the Vâlakhilyâs, then, went up to these worlds from here upwards, and from thence downwards, and from here across; and in like manner does the Sacrificer, by means of the Vâlakhilyâs, now go up to these worlds from here upwards, and from thence downwards, and from here across.

original: dhruvāsi dharuṇetyantarikṣalokaṃ dhartryasi
analyzed: dhruvā asi dharuṇā iti antarikṣa lokam dhartrī asi
translated: 'Thou art the head, the king,'--with (this formula he lays down the brick) on this (terrestrial) world;--'thou art firm, the supporter,'--on the air-world;--'thou art the supporteress,'--

original: dharaṇītyamuṃ dharaṇītyamuṃ lokamāyuṣe tvā varcase tvā kṛṣyai tvā kṣemāya
analyzed: dharaṇī iti amum dharaṇī iti amum lokam āyuṣe tvā varcase tvā kṛṣyai tvā kṣemāya
translated: This one is the earth, this one is the earth. For life I take thee, for radiance I take thee, for ploughing I take thee, for prosperity I take thee.

original: tveti catvāraścatuṣpādāḥ paśavo 'nnam paśavasta etaiścaturbhiścatuṣpādaiḥ
analyzed: tvā iti catvāraḥ catuṣpādāḥ paśavaḥ nnam paśavaḥ te etaiḥ caturbhiḥ catuṣpādaiḥ
translated: There are four sets of four-footed animals, and animals are food. By means of these four sets of four-footed animals,

original: paśubhiretenānnenāmuṣmiṃloke pratyatiṣṭhaṃstathaivaitadyajamāna
analyzed: paśubhiḥ etena annena amuṣmin loke pratyatiṣṭhan tathā eva etat yajamāna
translated: by means of this food, they established themselves in yonder world. In the same way the sacrificer

original: etaiścaturbhiścatuṣpādaiḥ paśubhiretenānnenāmuṣmiṃloke pratitiṣṭhati / / /
analyzed: etaiḥ caturbhiḥ catuṣpādaiḥ paśubhiḥ etena annena amuṣmin loke pratitiṣṭhati
translated: by means of these four sets of four-footed animals, by means of this food, establishes himself in yonder world.

original: sa sa parāṅiva rohaḥ /🔽iyamu vai pratiṣṭhā te devā imām
analyzed: sa sa parāṅ iva rohaḥ  iyam u vai pratiṣṭhā te devāḥ imām
translated: It is as if he were ascending upwards.

original: pratiṣṭhāmabhipratyāyaṃstathaivaitadyajamāna imām prati ṣāmabhipratyaiti / / /🔽yantri rāḍityamuṃ lokamarohan /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhām abhipratyāyan tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ imām prati sām abhipratyaiti  yantri rāj iti amum lokam arohan
translated: This (earth) is the foundation. The gods then returned to this foundation. In the same way the sacrificer now returns to this foundation.🔽He ascends this world with You are the support,

original: yantryasi yamanītyantarikṣalokaṃ dhruvāsi🔽dharitrītīmaṃ lokamiṣe tvorje tvā rayyai tvā poṣāya tveti catvāraścatuṣpādāḥ
analyzed: yantrī asi yamanī iti antarikṣa lokam dhruvā asi  dharitri iti imam lokam iṣe tvā ūrje tvā rayyai tvā poṣāya tvā iti catvāraḥ catuṣpādāḥ
translated: the air world with You are the supporter,

original: paśavo 'nnam paśavasta etaiścaturbhiścatuṣpādaiḥ paśubhiretenānnenāsmiṃloke
analyzed: paśavaḥ nnam paśavaḥ te etaiḥ caturbhiḥ catuṣpādaiḥ paśubhiḥ etena annena asmin loke
translated: and this world with You are firm, you are the supporter. For food I take thee, for strength I take thee, for wealth I take thee, for increase I take thee. There are four sets of four-footed animals, and animals are food. By means of these four sets of four-footed animals, by means of this food,🔽 they established themselves in this world.

original: pratyatiṣṭhaṃstathaivaitadyajamāna etaiścaturbhiścatuṣpādaiḥ
analyzed: pratyatiṣṭhan tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ etaiḥ caturbhiḥ catuṣpādaiḥ
translated: and the sacrificer with these four having four feet.

original: paśubhiretenānnenāsmiṃloke pratitiṣṭhati / / /
analyzed: paśubhiḥ etena annena asmin loke pratitiṣṭhati
translated: In the same way the sacrificer stands firm in this world with these four animals with four feet, with this food.

original: athātaḥ saṃskṛtireva /🔽yā amūrekādaśeṣṭakā upadadhāti yo 'sau prathamo🔽'nuvākastadantarikṣaṃ sa ātmā tadyattā ekādaśa bhavantyekādaśākṣarā vai
analyzed: atha atas saṃskṛtiḥ eva  yāḥ amūḥ ekādaśa iṣṭakāḥ upadadhāti yaḥ sau prathamaḥ  nuvākaḥ tat antarikṣam saḥ ātmā tat yat tāḥ ekādaśa bhavanti ekādaśa akṣarāḥ vai
translated: Now then the consecration.

original: triṣṭuptraiṣṭubhamantarikṣamatha yā uttarāḥ ṣaṣṭiḥ sa vāyuḥ sa prajāpatiḥ so 'gniḥ
analyzed: triṣṭubh traiṣṭubham antarikṣam atha yāḥ uttarāḥ ṣaṣṭiḥ sa vāyuḥ sa prajāpatiḥ saḥ gniḥ
translated: Those eleven bricks which he lays down, that is the air, that is the self. In that they are eleven, for the Tristubh has eleven syllables, and the air is of the Tristubh nature. Then those sixty which follow are the wind, that is Prajapati, that is Agni,

original: sa yajamānaḥ / / /
analyzed: sa yajamānaḥ
translated: that is the sacrificer.

original: tadyāḥ purastādupadadhāti /🔽śiro 'sya tāstā daśa bhavanti daśa vai prāṇāḥ prāṇā u vai
analyzed: tat yāḥ purastāt upadadhāti  śiraḥ sya tāḥ tāḥ daśa bhavanti daśa vai prāṇāḥ prāṇāḥ u vai
translated: Now those which he lays down in front,

original: śiraḥ pūrvārdha upadadhāti purastāddhīdaṃ śiraḥ / / /
analyzed: śiraḥ pūrva ardhe upadadhāti purastāt hi idam śiraḥ
translated: they are its head. They are ten, for there are ten vital airs, and the head is the vital airs. In the front part he lays them down, for the head is in front of this (universe).

original: atha yā dakṣiṇataḥ /
analyzed: atha yā dakṣiṇatas
translated: Now those on the right side,

original: yadūrdhvam madhyādavācīnaṃ śīrṣṇastadasya tā atha yāḥ
analyzed: yat ūrdhvam madhyāt avācīnam śīrṣṇaḥ tat asya tāḥ atha yāḥ
translated: that is above the middle and below the head. They are its (the altar's). Then those on the back,

original: paścādyadūrdhvam pratiṣṭhāyā avācīnam madhyāttadasya tāḥ pratiṣṭhaivottarataḥ / / /
analyzed: paścāt yat ūrdhvam pratiṣṭhāyāḥ avācīnam madhyāt tat asya tāḥ pratiṣṭhā eva uttaratas
translated: that is above the foundation and below the middle. They are its (the altar's). The foundation is on the north.

original: tadyāḥ sapta purastādvālakhilyā upadadhāti /
analyzed: tat yāḥ sapta purastāt vālakhilyāḥ upadadhāti
translated: Now those seven Valakhilya bricks which he lays down in front,

original: ya eveme sapta
analyzed: ye eva ime sapta
translated: they are these seven

original: purastātprāṇāstānasminnetaddadhāti tā anantarhitā etābhyo daśabhya
analyzed: purastāt prāṇāḥ tān asmin etat dadhāti tāḥ an antarhitāḥ etābhyaḥ daśabhyaḥ
translated: In front (he places) the vital airs; he thus places them in this (brick). They are not separated from those ten (vital airs) which he places in front;

original: upadadhātyanantarhitāṃstacīrṣṇaḥ prāṇāndadhāti / / /
analyzed: upadadhāti an antarhitān tad cīrṣṇaḥ prāṇān dadhāti
translated: he thus places the vital airs in the head not separated (from the body).

original: atha yāḥ sapta paścāt /🔽ya eveme sapta paścātprāṇāstānasminnetaddadhāti tā
analyzed: atha yāḥ sapta paścāt  ye eva ime sapta paścāt prāṇāḥ tān asmin etat dadhāti tā
translated: And those seven (bricks) which he places behind,--🔽those seven vital airs which are here behind, he thus places in this (brick). They are not separated from those twelve (vital airs) which he places in front;

original: anantarhitā etābhyo dvādaśabhya upadadhātyanantarhitāṃstadātmanaḥ prāṇāndadhāti🔽sa eṣa vāyuḥ prajāpatirasmiṃstraiṣṭubhe 'ntarikṣe samantam paryaknastadyattṛtīyāṃ🔽citimupadadhāti vāyuṃ caiva tadantarikṣaṃ ca saṃkkṛtyopadhatte 'tha lokampṛṇe
analyzed: an antarhitāḥ etābhyaḥ dvādaśabhyaḥ upadadhāti an antarhitān tat ātmanaḥ prāṇān dadhāti  saḥ eṣa vāyuḥ prajāpatiḥ asmin traiṣṭubhe ntarikṣe samantam paryaknaḥ tat yat tṛtīyām  citim upadadhāti vāyum ca eva tat antarikṣam ca saṃkkṛtya upadhatte lokampṛṇe
translated: he thus places the vital airs in the body not separated (from each other).🔽This Vâyu Pragâpati is enclosed on all sides in this Trishtubh (brick), the air; and when he places the third layer, he does so, having enclosed both the air and Vâyu,

original: upadadhātyasyāṃ sraktyāṃ tayorupari bandhuḥ purīṣaṃ nivapati tasyopari bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: upadadhāti asyām sraktyām tayoḥ upari bandhuḥ purīṣam nivapati tasya upari bandhuḥ
translated: and having enclosed them he places them. He then places the two Lokamprinâ (bricks) in this corner; the significance of these two (bricks) is the same as before . He pours sand thereon; the significance of this (will be explained) further on.

original: caturthīṃ citimupadadhāti /🔽etadvai devāstṛtīyāṃ citiṃ citvā samārohannantarikṣaṃ
analyzed: caturthīm citim upadadhāti  etat vai devāḥ tṛtīyām citim citvā samārohan antarikṣam
translated: He places the fourth layer.🔽Now when the gods had laid down the third layer, they ascended (the altar);

original: vai tṛtīyā citirantarikṣameva tatsaṃskṛtya samārohan / / /
analyzed: vai tṛtīyā citiḥ antarikṣam eva tat saṃskṛtya samārohan
translated: for the third layer is the air, and having completed the air they ascended it.

original: te 'bruvan / cetayadhvamiti citimicateti vāva tadabruvannita ūrdhvamicateti te🔽cetayamānā etāṃ caturthīṃ citimapaśyanyadūrdhvamantarikṣādarvācīnaṃ
analyzed: te bruvan cetayadhvam iti citim icata iti vāva tat abruvan itas ūrdhvam icata iti te  cetayamānāḥ etām caturthīm citim apaśyan yat ūrdhvam antarikṣāt arvācīnam
translated: They said, 'Meditate!'--that is to say, 'Seek ye a layer!'--'Seek ye one above this!'

original: divasteṣāmeṣā loko 'dhruva ivāpratiṣṭhita ivamanasyāsīt / / /🔽te brahmābruvan /🔽tvāmihopadadhāmahā iti kim me tato bhaviṣyatīti tvameva naḥ🔽śreṣṭham bhaviṣyasīti tatheti te 'tra brahmopādadhata tasmādāhurbrahmaiva🔽devānāṃ śreṣṭhamiti tadetayā vai caturthyā cityeme dyāvāpṛthivī viṣṭabdhe brahma🔽vai caturthī citistasmādāhurbrahmaṇā dyāvāpṛthivī viṣṭabdhe iti stomānupadadhāti
analyzed: divaḥ teṣām eṣā lokaḥ dhruvaḥ iva a pratiṣṭhitaḥ iva manasyā āsīt  te brahma abruvan  tvām iha upadadhāmahai iti kim me tatas bhaviṣyati iti tvam eva naḥ  śreṣṭham bhaviṣyasi iti tathā iti te tra brahma upādadhata tasmāt āhuḥ brahma eva  devānām śreṣṭham iti tat etayā vai caturthyā cityā ime dyāvāpṛthivī viṣṭabdhe brahma  vai caturthī citiḥ tasmāt āhuḥ brahmaṇā dyāvāpṛthivī viṣṭabdhe iti stomān upadadhāti
translated: Meditating, they saw this fourth layer, that which is above the air and below the sky. To them this world seemed as it were uncertain, as it were unsettled, as it were not existing.

original: prāṇā vai stomāḥ prāṇā u vai brahma brahmaivaitadupadadhāti / / /
analyzed: prāṇāḥ vai stomāḥ prāṇāḥ u vai brahma brahma eva etat upadadhāti
translated: They said to Brahman, 'Here we will lay thee down.'--'What will be my reward then?'--'Thou shalt be the best of us.'--'So be it!'--So they laid down Brahman here. Therefore they say, 'Brahman is the best of the gods.' By this fourth layer these two, heaven and earth, are indeed firmly established; for the fourth layer is Brahman: therefore they say, 'By Brahman heaven and earth are firmly established.' He lays down the Stomas (hymn-forms); for the Stomas are the vital airs, and Brahman is the vital airs: it is Brahman he thus lays down.

original: yadveva stomānupadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva stomān upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Stomas.

original: etadvai devāḥ prajāpatimabruvaṃstvāmihopadadhāmahā
analyzed: etat vai devāḥ prajāpatim abruvan tvām iha upadadhāmahai
translated: The gods then said to Pragâpati, 'Here we will lay thee down.'--'What will be my reward then?'

original: iti tatheti sa vai nābravītkim me tato bhaviṣyatīti yadu ha kiṃ ca🔽prajāpatirdeveṣvīṣe kimasmākaṃ tato bhaviṣyatītyevocustasmādu haitadyatpitā🔽putreṣvicate kimasmākaṃ tato bhaviṣyatītyevāhuratha yatputrāḥ pitari🔽tathetyevāhaivaṃ hi tadagre prajāpatiśca devāśca samavadanta stomānupadadhāti
analyzed: iti tathā iti sa vai na abravīt kim me tatas bhaviṣyati iti yat u ha kim ca  prajāpatiḥ deveṣu īṣe kim asmākam tatas bhaviṣyati iti eva ūcuḥ tasmāt u ha etat yat pitā  putreṣu icate kim asmākam tatas bhaviṣyati iti eva āhuḥ atha yat putrāḥ pitari  tathā iti eva āha evam hi tat agre prajāpatiḥ ca devāḥ ca samavadanta stomān upadadhāti
translated: He said, 'So be it,' but he did not say, 'What will be mine from it?' Whatever Prajapati desired among the gods, they said, 'What will be ours from it?' Therefore, even now, when a father🔽desires something among his sons, they say, 'What will be ours from it?' And when the sons (desire something) from the father, they say, 'So be it.' For thus indeed did Prajapati and the gods converse in the beginning. He lays down the Stomas.

original: prāṇā vai stomāḥ prāṇā u vai prajāpatiḥ prajāpatimevaitadupadadhāti / / /🔽yadveva stomānupadadhāti /
analyzed: prāṇāḥ vai stomāḥ prāṇāḥ u vai prajāpatiḥ prajāpatim eva etat upadadhāti  yat u eva stomān upadadhāti
translated: He said, 'So be it,' but he did not say, 'What will be my share in it?' Whatever Prajapati desired among the gods, they said, 'What will be our share in it?' Therefore, even now, when a father desires something among his sons, they say, 'What will be our share in it?' But when the sons desire something from the father, they say, 'So be it.' For thus indeed did Prajapati and the gods agree in the beginning. He lays down the Stomas. The Stomas are the breaths, and Prajapati is the breaths; verily he lays down Prajapati himself.

original: ye vai te prāṇā ṛṣaya etāṃ caturthīṃ citimapaśyanye ta
analyzed: ye vai te prāṇāḥ ṛṣayaḥ etām caturthīm citim apaśyan ye te
translated: And again, why he lays down the Stomas. Those Rsis, the breaths, who beheld this fourth layer,

original: etena rasenopāyaṃsta ete tānevaitadupadadhāti stomānupadadhāti prāṇā vai stomāḥ
analyzed: etena rasena upāyan te ete tān eva etat upadadhāti stomān upadadhāti prāṇāḥ vai stomāḥ
translated: and who came by it with this essence, they are these (bricks); verily he lays them down. He lays down the Stomas. The Stomas are the breaths,

original: prāṇā u vā ṛṣaya ṛṣīnevaitadupadadhāti / / /🔽yadveva stomānupadadhāti /
analyzed: prāṇāḥ u vai ṛṣayaḥ ṛṣīn eva etat upadadhāti  yat u eva stomān upadadhāti
translated: and the Rsis are the breaths; verily he lays down the Rsis themselves.

original: prajāpatiṃ visrastaṃ devatā ādāya vyudakrāmaṃstasya
analyzed: prajāpatim visrastam devatāḥ ādāya vyudakrāman tasya
translated: And again, why he lays down the Stomas. The gods, having taken Prajapati when relaxed, departed in different directions.

original: yudūrdhvam madhyādavācīnaṃ śīrṣṇastadasya vāyurādāyotkramyātiṣṭhaddevatāśca
analyzed: yut ūrdhvam madhyāt avācīnam śīrṣṇaḥ tat asya vāyuḥ ādāya utkramya atiṣṭhat devatāḥ ca
translated: What is above the middle and below the head, that Vāyu took up and stood above as the deities.

original: bhūtvā saṃvatsararūdāṇi ca / / /🔽tamabravīt /🔽upa mehi prati ma etaddhehi yena me tvamudakramīriti kim me tato
analyzed: bhūtvā saṃvatsara rūdāṇi ca  tam abravīt  upa me hi prati me etat hehi yena me tvam udakramīḥ iti kim me
translated: What is above the middle and below the head, that Vâyu took up and stood above, having become the deities and the Sâman-hymns of the year.

original: bhaviṣyatīti tvaddevatyameva ma etadātmano bhaviṣyatīti tatheti
analyzed: bhaviṣyati iti tvad devatyam eva me etat ātmanaḥ bhaviṣyati iti tathā iti
translated: He said to it, 'Come to me! Return to me that whereby thou hast gone away from me!'--'What will be my reward for that?'--'That shall be to me as sacred to thee!'--'So be it!'

original: tadasminnetadvāyuḥ pratyapadhāt / / /🔽tadyā etā aṣṭādaśa prathamāḥ /
analyzed: tat asmin etat vāyuḥ pratyapadhāt  tat yāḥ etāḥ aṣṭādaśa prathamāḥ
translated: So Vâyu restored that to him.

original: etadasya tadātmanastadyadetā atropadadhāti
analyzed: etat asya tat ātmanaḥ tat yat etāḥ atra upadadhāti
translated: Now those first eighteen (bricks) are the same as this (brick); and when he now lays them down here,

analyzed: yat eva asya etāḥ ātmanaḥ tat asmin etat pratidadhāti tasmāt etāḥ atra upadadhāti
translated: it is the same as his (Vâyu's) self he thus restores to him; and for this reason he lays them down here.

original: stomānupadadhāti prāṇā vai stomāḥ prāṇāu vai vāyurvāyumevaitadupadadhāti / / /

translated: He lays down the Stomas (hymn-forms); for the Stomas are the vital airs, and Vâyu (the wind) is the vital airs: it is Vâyu he thus lays down.

original: sa purastādupadadhāti /🔽āśustrivṛditi ya eva trivṛtstomastaṃ tadupadadhāti
analyzed: sa purastāt upadadhāti  āśuḥ trivṛt iti yaḥ eva trivṛt stomaḥ tam tat upadadhāti
translated: He lays it down in front,🔽with , 'The swift one, the threefold,'--the threefold hymn-form he thus lays down;

original: tadyattamāhāśurityeṣa hi stomānāmāśiṣṭho 'tho vāyurvā āśustrivṛtsa eṣu triṣu
analyzed: tat yat tam āha āśuḥ iti eṣa hi stomānām āśiṣṭhaḥ vāyuḥ vai āśuḥ trivṛt saḥ eṣu triṣu
translated: and as to why he calls it 'the swift one,' it is because it is the swiftest of the hymn-forms; and 'the swift one, the threefold,' means Vâyu (the wind), for he (Vâyu) is threefold in these (worlds).

original: lokeṣu vartate tadyattamāhāśurityeṣa hi sarveṣām bhūtānāmāśiṣṭho vāyurha bhūtvā
analyzed: lokeṣu vartate tat yat tam āha āśuḥ iti eṣa hi sarveṣām bhūtānām āśiṣṭhaḥ vāyuḥ ha bhūtvā
translated: in that he calls it 'Ashu', for this (wind) is the most powerful of all beings. Having become Vayu,

original: purastāttasthau tadeva tadrūpamupadadhāti / / /

translated: it stood in the east. He lays down that very form.

original: bhāntaḥ pañcadaśa iti /
analyzed: bhāntaḥ pañcadaśaḥ iti
translated: 'The shining one, the fifteen',

original: ya eva pañcadaśa stomastaṃ tadupadadhāti tadyattamāha

translated: he lays down the fifteenfold Stoma. In that he calls it

analyzed: bhāntaḥ iti vajraḥ vai bhāntaḥ vajraḥ candramāḥ vai bhāntaḥ pañcadaśaḥ
translated: 'the shining one', the thunderbolt is the shining one, the fifteenfold. Then the moon is the shining one, the fifteenfold.

original: sa ca pañcadaśāhānyāpūryate pañcadaśāpakṣīyate tadyattamāha bhānta iti bhāti hi
analyzed: sa ca pañcadaśa ahāni āpūryate pañcadaśa apakṣīyate tat yat tam āha bhāntaḥ iti bhāti hi
translated: It is filled up in fifteen days and diminishes in fifteen days. In that he calls it 'the shining one', for the moon

analyzed: candramāḥ candramāḥ ha bhūtvā dakṣiṇatas tasthau tat eva tad rūpam upadadhāti
translated: shines. Having become the moon, it stood on the right side. He lays down that very form.

original: vyomā saptadaśa iti /
analyzed: vyomā saptadaśaḥ iti
translated: 'The all-encompassing, the seventeen',

analyzed: yaḥ eva saptadaśaḥ stomaḥ tam tat upadadhāti tat yat tam āha
translated: he lays down the seventeenfold Stoma. In that he calls it

analyzed: vyoma iti prajāpatiḥ vai vyomā prajāpatiḥ saptadaśaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ vāva vyomā
translated: 'the all-encompassing', the all-encompassing is Prajapati, the seventeenfold. Then the all-encompassing is the year,

analyzed: saptadaśaḥ tasya dvādaśa māsāḥ pañca ṛtavaḥ tat yat tam āha vyoma iti vyomā hi
translated: the seventeenfold. It has twelve months and five seasons. In that he calls it 'the all-encompassing', for the all-encompassing

analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ saṃvatsaraḥ ha bhūtvā uttaratas tasthau tat eva tat rūpam upadadhāti
translated: The year, having become the year, stood on the north. He lays down that (brick) of that form.

original: dharuṇa ekaviṃśa iti /🔽ya evaikaviṃśa stomastaṃ tadupadadhāti tadyattamāha dharuṇa
analyzed: dharuṇaḥ ekaviṃśaḥ iti  yaḥ eva ekaviṃśaḥ stomaḥ tam tat upadadhāti tat yat tam āha dharuṇa

analyzed: iti pratiṣṭhā vai dharuṇaḥ pratiṣṭhā ekaviṃśaḥ asau vai ādityaḥ dharuṇa

analyzed: ādityaḥ ha bhūtvā paścāt tasthau tat eva tat rūpam upadadhāti atha

translated: he lays down the forms of the year.🔽The impetuous one, the Aṣṭāçastriṁça.

original: pratūrtiraṣṭādaśastasya dvādaśa māsāḥ pañca 'rtavaḥ saṃvatsara eva
analyzed: pratūrtiḥ aṣṭādaśaḥ tasya dvādaśa māsāḥ pañca ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ eva
translated: He lays down that Stoma of which the Aṣṭāçastriṁça is the Stoma. Then the impetuous one, the Aṣṭāçastriṁça, is the year. It has twelve months, five seasons, the year itself is the impetuous one, the Aṣṭāçastriṁça.

original: pratūrtiraṣṭādaśastadyattamāha pratūrtiriti saṃvatsaro hi sarvāṇi bhūtāni pratirati
analyzed: pratūrtiḥ aṣṭādaśaḥ tat yat tam āha pratūrtiḥ iti saṃvatsaraḥ hi sarvāṇi bhūtāni pratirati
translated: The impetuous one is the eighteenth. In that he calls it the impetuous one, the year impetuously delights in all beings.

original: tadeva tadrūpamupadadhāti / / /
analyzed: tat eva tat rūpam upadadhāti
translated: He puts that form into it.

original: tapo navadaśa iti /🔽ya eva navadaśa stomastaṃ tadupadadhātyatho saṃvatsaro tapo🔽navadaśastasya dvādaśa māsāḥ ṣaḍṛtavaḥ saṃvatsara eva tapo navadaśastadyattamāha
analyzed: tapaḥ navadaśaḥ iti  yaḥ eva navadaśaḥ stomaḥ tam tat upadadhāti atha u  navadaśaḥ tasya dvādaśa māsāḥ ṣaṭ ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ eva tapaḥ navadaśaḥ tat yat tam āha
translated: Heat is the nineteenth.🔽He puts into it that Stoma which is the nineteenth. Moreover, the year is heat, the nineteenth. It has twelve months, six seasons, and the year itself is heat, the nineteenth. In that he calls it heat, the year heats all beings.

original: tapa iti saṃvatsaro hi sarvāṇi bhūtāni tapati tadeva tadrūpamupadadhāti / / /
analyzed: tapaḥ iti saṃvatsaraḥ hi sarvāṇi bhūtāni tapati tat eva tat rūpam upadadhāti

analyzed: abhīvartaḥ saviṃśaḥ iti  yaḥ eva saviṃśaḥ stomaḥ tam tat upadadhāti atha u saṃvatsaraḥ vā  abhīvartaḥ saviṃśaḥ tasya dvādaśa māsāḥ sapta ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ eva abhīvartaḥ
translated: The overcomer is the twentieth.

original: saviṃśastadyattamāhābhīvarta iti saṃvatsaro hi sarvāṇi bhūtānyabhivartate tadeva
analyzed: saviṃśaḥ tat yat tam āha abhīvartaḥ iti saṃvatsaraḥ hi sarvāṇi bhūtāni abhivartate tat eva
translated: He puts into it that Stoma which is the twentieth. Moreover, the year is the overcomer, the twentieth. It has twelve months, seven seasons, and the year itself is the overcomer, the twentieth. In that he calls it the overcomer, the year overcomes all beings.

original: tadrūpamupadadhāti / / /
analyzed: tad rūpam upadadhāti
translated: He puts that form into it.

analyzed: varcaḥ dvāviṃśaḥ iti

analyzed: yaḥ eva dvāviṃśaḥ stomaḥ tam tat upadadhāti atha u saṃvatsaraḥ vāva
translated: He puts into it that Stoma which is the twenty-first. Moreover, the year is indeed

translated: The splendour is the twenty-second. It has twelve months, seven seasons, two day and night, and the year itself is the splendour,

analyzed: varcasvitamaḥ tat eva tat rūpam upadadhāti  sambharaṇaḥ trayoviṃśaḥ iti yaḥ eva trayoviṃśaḥ stomaḥ tam tat upadadhāti atha u saṃvatsaraḥ
translated: the twenty-second. As to why he calls it 'splendour', the year is indeed the most resplendent of all beings. He puts down that form of it.

original: vāva sambharaṇastrayoviṃsastasya trayodaśa māsā sapta 'rtavo dve ahorātre saṃvatsara🔽eva sambharaṇastrayoviṃśastadyattamāha sambharaṇa iti saṃvatsaro hi sarvāṇi bhūtāni

translated: The gathering is the twenty-third. He puts down the twenty-third Stoma which is that. Moreover, the gathering is the twenty-third. It has thirteen months, seven seasons, two day and night, and the year itself is the gathering,

translated: the twenty-third. As to why he calls it 'gathering', the year indeed gathers all beings. He puts down that form of it.

analyzed: yoniḥ caturviṃśaḥ iti  yaḥ eva caturviṃśaḥ stomaḥ tam tat upadadhāti atha u saṃvatsaraḥ vāva  yoniḥ caturviṃśaḥ tasya caturviṃśatiḥ ardha māsāḥ tat yat tam āha yoniḥ iti saṃvatsaraḥ hi

translated: He lays down that hymn-form which is the Pañcaviṃśa Sāman. The womb is the Pañcaviṃśa.

translated: beings. He lays down that form of it.

analyzed: kratuḥ ekatriṃśaḥ iti
translated: Will is the Ekātrimśa.

analyzed: yaḥ eva ekatriṃśaḥ stomaḥ tam tat upadadhāti atha u saṃvatsaraḥ vāva
translated: He lays down that hymn-form which is the Ekātrimśa Sāman. The will is the Ekātrimśa.🔽It has thirty-one parts.

original: kraturekatriṃśastasya caturviṃśatirardhamāsāḥ ṣadṛtavaḥ saṃvatsara eva
analyzed: kratuḥ ekatriṃśaḥ tasya caturviṃśatiḥ ardha māsāḥ ṣaṣ ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ eva
translated: The thirty-one is Kratu; his twenty-four half-months, six seasons, and the year itself

original: kraturekatriṃśastadyattamāha kraturiti saṃvatsaro hi sarvāṇi bhūtāni karoti tadeva
analyzed: kratuḥ ekatriṃśaḥ tat yat tam āha kratuḥ iti saṃvatsaraḥ hi sarvāṇi bhūtāni karoti tat eva
translated: is Kratu. As to why he calls it Kratu, the year indeed makes all beings; that

analyzed: tad rūpam upadadhāti
translated: he puts down as the form of that (year).

analyzed: pratiṣṭhā iti pratiṣṭhā hi trayastriṃśaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ vāva pratiṣṭhā trayastriṃśaḥ tasya

original: caturviṃśatirardhamāsāḥ ṣadṛtavo dve ahorātre saṃvatsara eva pratiṣṭhā
analyzed: caturviṃśatiḥ ardha māsāḥ ṣaṣ ṛtavaḥ dve ahar rātre saṃvatsaraḥ eva pratiṣṭhā
