analyzed: trayastriṃśaḥ tat yat tam āha pratiṣṭhā iti saṃvatsaraḥ hi sarveṣām bhūtānām pratiṣṭhā
translated: the thirty-three. As to why he calls it Pratiṣṭhā, the year indeed is the support of all beings;

original: tadeva tadrūpamupadadhāti / / /
analyzed: tat eva tat rūpam upadadhāti
translated: that he puts down as the form of that (year).

original: bradhnasya viṣṭapaṃ catustriṃśa iti /🔽ya eta catustriṃśa stomastaṃ tadupadadhātyatho
analyzed: bradhnasya viṣṭapam catustriṃśaḥ iti  yaḥ eta catustriṃśaḥ stomaḥ tam tat upadadhāti atha u
translated: The thirty-four is the vault of the sun.

original: saṃvatsaro vāva bradhnasya viṣṭapaṃ catustriṃśastasya caturviṃśatirardhamāsāḥ sapta
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ vāva bradhnasya viṣṭapam catustriṃśaḥ tasya caturviṃśatiḥ ardha māsāḥ sapta
translated: The thirty-four Stomas are that (brick). Moreover, the year itself is the vault of the sun, the thirty-four. Its twenty-four half-months, seven

original: 'rtavo dve ahorātre saṃvatsara eva bradhnasya viṣṭapaṃ catustriṃśastadyattamāha
analyzed: rtavaḥ dve ahar rātre saṃvatsaraḥ eva bradhnasya viṣṭapam catustriṃśaḥ tat yat tam āha
translated: The two seasons, day and night, are the year, the expanse of the sun is thirty-four. As to why he says this,

original: bradhnasya viṣṭapamiti svārājyaṃ vai bradhnasya viṣṭapaṃ svārājya
analyzed: bradhnasya viṣṭapam iti svārājyam vai bradhnasya viṣṭapam svārājya
translated: 'The two seasons, day and night, the year itself is the expanse of the sun, the thirty-four.' As to why he calls it 'the expanse of the sun', the expanse of the sun is indeed the self-rule,

original: catustriṃśastadeva tadrūpamupadadhāti / / /
analyzed: catustriṃśaḥ tat eva tat rūpam upadadhāti
translated: the self-rule is the thirty-four; he thereby lays down that form.

original: nākaḥ ṣaṭtriṃśa iti /🔽ya eva ṣaṭtriṃśa stomastaṃ tadupadadhātyatho saṃvatsaro vāva
analyzed: nākaḥ ṣaṭtriṃśaḥ iti  yaḥ eva ṣaṭtriṃśaḥ stomaḥ tam tat upadadhāti atha u saṃvatsaraḥ vāva
translated: 'The sky, the thirty-six.'

original: nākaḥ ṣaṭtriṃśastasya caturviṃśatirardhamāsā dvādaśa māsāstadyattamāha nāka iti na🔽hi tatra gatāya kasmai canākam bhavatyatho saṃvatsaro vāva nākaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ
analyzed: nākaḥ ṣaṭtriṃśaḥ tasya caturviṃśatiḥ ardha māsāḥ dvādaśa māsāḥ tat yat tam āha nākaḥ iti na  hi tatra gatāya kasmai ca nākam bhavati atha u saṃvatsaraḥ vāva nākaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ
translated: He thereby lays down the thirty-six Stomas. Moreover, the sky, the thirty-six, is the year. Of it there are twenty-four half-months, twelve months. As to why he calls it 'the sky',

original: svargo lokastadeva tadrūpamupadadhāti / / /
analyzed: svargaḥ lokaḥ tat eva tat rūpam upadadhāti
translated: for to him who has gone there there is no sky for any one. Moreover, the sky is indeed the year, the year is the heavenly world; he thereby lays down that form.

original: vivarto 'ṣṭācatvāriṃśa iti /🔽ya evāṣṭācatvariṃśa stomastaṃ tadupadadhātyatho
analyzed: vivartaḥ ṣṭācatvāriṃśaḥ iti  yaḥ eva aṣṭācatvariṃśaḥ stomaḥ tam tat upadadhāti atha u
translated: 'The whirl, the forty-eight.'

original: saṃvatsaro vāva vivarto 'ṣṭācatvāriṃśastasya ṣaḍviṃśatirardhamāsāstrayodaśa māsāḥ
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ vāva ṣṭācatvāriṃśaḥ tasya ṣaḍviṃśatiḥ ardha māsāḥ trayodaśa māsāḥ
translated: He thereby lays down the forty-eight Stomas. Moreover, the whirl, the forty-eight, is the year. Of it there are twenty-six half-months, thirteen months,

original: sapta 'rtavo dve ahorātre tadyattamāha vivarta iti saṃvatsarāddhi sarvāṇi bhūtāni
analyzed: sapta ṛtavaḥ dve ahar rātre tat yat tam āha vivartaḥ iti saṃvatsarāt hi sarvāṇi bhūtāni
translated: The seven seasons, the two, day and night, that he calls the turning, for from the year all beings are born.

original: vivartante tadeva tadrūpamupadadhāti / / /🔽dhartraṃ catuṣṭoma iti /🔽ya eva catuṣṭoma stomastaṃ tadupadadhāti tadyattamāha🔽dhartramiti pratiṣṭhā vai dhartram pratiṣṭhā catuṣṭomo 'tho vāyurvāva dhartraṃ🔽catuṣṭomaḥ sa ābhiścatasṛbhirdigbhi stute tadyattamāha dhartramiti pratiṣṭhā vai
analyzed: vivartante tat eva tat rūpam upadadhāti  dhartram catuṣṭomaḥ iti  yaḥ eva catuṣṭomaḥ stomaḥ tam tat upadadhāti tat yat tam āha  dhartram iti pratiṣṭhā vai dhartram pratiṣṭhā vāyuḥ vāva dhartram  catuṣṭomaḥ saḥ ābhiḥ catasṛbhiḥ digbhiḥ stute tat yat tam āha dhartram iti pratiṣṭhā vai
translated: The seven seasons, the two day and night,--inasmuch as he calls it 'the revolving (season)', from the year all beings revolve; he thus lays down that form of his (Agni).

original: dhartraṃ vāyuru sarveṣām bhūtānām pratiṣṭhā tadeva tadrūpamupadadhāti sa vai
analyzed: dhartram vāyuḥ u sarveṣām bhūtānām pratiṣṭhā tat eva tat rūpam upadadhāti sa vai
translated: 'The supporter, the four-versed,'--the four-versed one is the same as the four-versed hymn-form ; he thus lays down that four-versed one. And as to why he calls it 'the supporter,' the supporter means a foundation, and the four-versed one is a foundation. But the supporter also is Vâyu (the wind),--the four-versed one is Vâyu: he is praised by these four quarters (of the world). And as to why he calls him 'the supporter,' the supporter means a foundation, and Vâyu is the foundation of all beings: he thus lays down that form of his (Agni).

original: vāyumeva prathamamupadadhāti vāyumuttamaṃ vāyunaiva tadetāni sarvāṇi🔽bhūtānyubhayataḥ parigṛhṇāti / / /🔽tā vā etāḥ / aṣṭādaśeṣṭakā upadadhāti tau dvau trivṛtau prāṇo vai trivṛdvāyuru prāṇo
analyzed: vāyum eva prathamam upadadhāti vāyum uttamam vāyunā eva tat etāni sarvāṇi  bhūtāni ubhayatas parigṛhṇāti  tāḥ vai etāḥ aṣṭādaśa iṣṭakāḥ upadadhāti tau dvau trivṛtau prāṇaḥ vai trivṛt vāyuḥ u prāṇaḥ
translated: He lays down Vâyu (the wind) first, and Vâyu last: by means of Vâyu he thus encloses all these beings on both sides.

original: vāyureṣā citiḥ / / /
analyzed: vāyuḥ eṣā citiḥ
translated: Now these are eighteen bricks he lays down; and those two (sets of) three are the breath, for the three is the breath, and Vâyu (the wind) is the breath: this layer is Vâyu.

original: yadvevāṣṭādaśa /
analyzed: yat u eva aṣṭādaśa
translated: And, again, as to why there are eighteen.

original: aṣṭādaśo vai saṃvatsaro dvādaśa māsāḥ pañca 'rtavaḥ saṃvatsara
analyzed: aṣṭādaśaḥ vai saṃvatsaraḥ dvādaśa māsāḥ pañca ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsara
translated: The year consists of eighteen parts, twelve months and six seasons;

original: eva prajāpatiraṣṭādaśaḥ prjāpatiragniryāvānagniryāvatyasya mātrā
analyzed: eva prajāpatiḥ aṣṭādaśaḥ prjāpatiḥ agniḥ yāvān agniḥ yāvatī asya mātrā
translated: Prajapati is the year, consisting of eighteen parts; Prajapati is Agni. As great as Agni is, as great as is his measure,

original: tāvattatkṛtvopadadhāti / / /
analyzed: tāvat tat kṛtvā upadadhāti
translated: having made it so great, he lays it down.

original: atha spṛta upadadhāti /
analyzed: atha spṛtaḥ upadadhāti
translated: He then lays down the Srita (bricks).

original: etadvai prajāpatiretasminnātmanaḥ pratihite sarvāṇi bhūtāni
analyzed: etat vai prajāpatiḥ etasmin ātmanaḥ pratihite sarvāṇi bhūtāni
translated: When that (Agni) was put together in his own body, all beings

original: garbhyabhavattānyasya garbha eva santi pāpmā mṛtyuragṛhṇāt / / /
analyzed: garbhī abhavat tāni asya garbhe eva santi pāpmā mṛtyuḥ agṛhṇāt
translated: became enclosed in him. While they were enclosed in him, evil, death, seized them.

original: sa devānabravīt /
analyzed: sa devān abravīt
translated: He said to the gods,

original: yuṣmābhiḥ sahemāni sarvāṇi bhūtāni pāpmano mṛtyo spṛṇavānīti
analyzed: yuṣmābhiḥ saha imāni sarvāṇi bhūtāni pāpmanaḥ mṛtyo spṛṇavāni iti
translated: 'With you I will deliver all these beings from evil, from death.'

original: kiṃ nastato bhaviṣyatīti vṛṇīdhvamityabravīttam bhāgo no 'stvityeke
analyzed: kim naḥ tatas bhaviṣyati iti vṛṇīdhvam iti abravīt tam bhāgaḥ naḥ stu iti eke
translated: 'What will be our reward?' 'Choose,' he said. Some said, 'Let us have a share!'

original: 'bruvannādhipatyaṃ no 'stvityeke sa bhāgamekebhyaḥ kṛtvādhipatyamekebhyaḥ sarvāṇ🔽i bhūtāni pāpmano mṛtyoraspṛṇodyadaspṛṇottasmātspṛtastathaivaitadyajamāno
analyzed: bruvan ādhipatyam naḥ stu iti eke sa bhāgam ekebhyaḥ kṛtvā ādhipatyam ekebhyaḥ sarvān  i bhūtāni pāpmanaḥ mṛtyoḥ aspṛṇot yat aspṛṇot tasmāt spṛtaḥ tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ
translated: Others said, 'Let us have lordship!' Having made a share for some, lordship for others,🔽he delivered all beings from evil, from death. In that he delivered (them), (the bricks) are called Srita (delivered). In the same way the sacrificer,

original: bhāgamekebhyaḥ kṛtvādhipatyamekebhyaḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni pāpmano mṛtyo spṛṇoti
analyzed: bhāgam ekebhyaḥ kṛtvā ādhipatyam ekebhyaḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni pāpmanaḥ mṛtyo spṛṇoti
translated: having made a share for some, lordship for others, delivers all beings from evil, from death.

original: tasmādu sarvāsveva spṛtaṃspṛtamityanuvartate / / /
analyzed: tasmāt u sarvāsu eva spṛtam spṛtam iti anuvartate
translated: Therefore, in all (cases), 'touched, touched' is repeated.

original: agnirbhāgo 'si /
analyzed: agniḥ bhāgaḥ si
translated: You are the portion of Agni.

original: dīkṣāyā ādhipatyamiti vāgvai dīkṣāgnaye bhāgaṃ kṛtvā vāca
analyzed: dīkṣāyāḥ ādhipatyam iti vāc vai dīkṣā agnaye bhāgam kṛtvā vāca
translated: The overlordship is of the consecration. Speech is indeed the consecration. Having given a portion to Agni, he made speech

original: ādhipatyamakarodbrahma spṛtaṃ trivṛtstoma iti brahma prajānāṃ trivṛtā stomena
analyzed: ādhipatyam akarot brahma spṛtam trivṛt stomaḥ iti brahma prajānām trivṛtā stomena
translated: the overlord. He touched the Brahman with the Trivrit stoma. With the Trivrit stoma, he touched the Brahman of the people

original: pāpmanā mṛtyoraspṛṇot / / /
analyzed: pāpmanā mṛtyoḥ aspṛṇot
translated: with sin and death.

original: indrasya bhāgo 'si /
analyzed: indrasya bhāgaḥ si
translated: You are the portion of Indra.

original: viṣṇorādhipatyamitīndrāya bhāgaṃ kṛtvā viṣṇava🔽ādhipatyamakarotkṣatraṃ spṛtam pañcadaśa stoma iti kṣatram prajānām
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ ādhipatyam iti indrāya bhāgam kṛtvā viṣṇave  ādhipatyam akarot kṣatram spṛtam pañcadaśaḥ stomaḥ iti kṣatram prajānām
translated: The overlordship is of Vishnu. Having given a portion to Indra, he made Vishnu🔽the overlord. He touched the Kshatriya with the Pañchadasha stoma. With the Pañchadasha stoma, he touched the Kshatriya of the people

original: pañcadaśena stomena pāpmano mṛtyoraspṛṇot / / /
analyzed: pañcadaśena stomena pāpmanaḥ mṛtyoḥ aspṛṇot
translated: with sin and death.

original: nṛcakṣasām bhāgo 'si /
analyzed: nṛ cakṣasām bhāgaḥ si
translated: You are the portion of the men-seers.

original: dhāturādhipatyamiti devā vai nṛcakṣaso devebhyo bhāgaṃ🔽kṛtvā dhātra ādhipatyamakarojjanitraṃ spṛtaṃ saptadaśa stoma iti viḍvai janitraṃ
analyzed: dhātuḥ ādhipatyam iti devāḥ vai nṛ cakṣasaḥ devebhyaḥ bhāgam  kṛtvā dhātre ādhipatyam akarot janitram spṛtam saptadaśaḥ stomaḥ iti viś vai janitram
translated: The overlordship is of the creator. The gods are indeed the men-seers. Having given a portion to the gods, he made the creator🔽the overlord. He touched the womb with the Saptada sha stoma. The womb is indeed the people. With the Saptada sha stoma, he touched the people of the people

original: viśam prajānāṃ saptadaśena stomena pāpmano mṛtyoraspṛṇot / / /
analyzed: viśam prajānām saptadaśena stomena pāpmanaḥ mṛtyoḥ aspṛṇot
translated: with sin and death.

original: mitrasya bhāgo 'si /
analyzed: mitrasya bhāgaḥ si
translated: You are the portion of Mitra.

original: varuṇasyādhipatyamiti prāṇo vai mitro 'pāno varuṇaḥ prāṇāya🔽bhāgaṃ kṛtvāpānāyādhipatyamakaroddivo vṛṣṭirvāta spṛta ekaviṃśa stoma iti vṛṣṭiṃ
analyzed: varuṇasya ādhipatyam iti prāṇaḥ vai mitraḥ upānaḥ varuṇaḥ prāṇāya  bhāgam kṛtvā apānāya ādhipatyam akarot divaḥ vṛṣṭiḥ vātaḥ spṛtaḥ ekaviṃśaḥ stomaḥ iti vṛṣṭim
translated: 'The overlordship of Varuna', he said; for Mitra is the out-breathing, and Varuna is the in-breathing; having made over to the out-breathing a share, he made overlordship to the in-breathing. 'The rain from the sky, the wind is restrained, the Ekavimsa the Stoma', he said; the rain is the waters,

original: ca vātaṃ ca prajānāmekaviṃśena stomena pāpmano mṛtyoraspṛṇot / / /
analyzed: ca vātam ca prajānām ekaviṃśena stomena pāpmanaḥ mṛtyoḥ aspṛṇot
translated: The overlordship of Varuna, the out-breath is Varuna, having made the out-breath a share, he made the in-breath overlord. The rain from the sky, the wind are supported, the Ekavimsa Stoma. With the Ekavimsa Stoma he freed the rain and the wind of the people from evil, from death.

original: vasūnām bhāgo 'si /🔽rudrāṇāmādhipatyamiti prāṇo vai mitro 'pāno varuṇaḥ prāṇāya🔽bhāgaṃ kṛtvāpānāyādhipatyamakaroddivo vṛṣṭirvāta spṛta ekaviṃśa stoma iti vṛṣṭiṃ
analyzed: vasūnām bhāgaḥ si  rudrāṇām ādhipatyam iti prāṇaḥ vai mitraḥ upānaḥ varuṇaḥ prāṇāya  bhāgam kṛtvā apānāya ādhipatyam akarot divaḥ vṛṣṭiḥ vātaḥ spṛtaḥ ekaviṃśaḥ stomaḥ iti vṛṣṭim
translated: You are the share of the Vasus.

original: ca vātaṃ ca prajānāmekaviṃśena stomena pāpmano mṛtyoraspṛṇot / / /
analyzed: ca vātam ca prajānām ekaviṃśena stomena pāpmanaḥ mṛtyoḥ aspṛṇot
translated: The overlordship of the Rudras, the out-breath is Varuna, having made the out-breath a share, he made the in-breath overlord. The rain from the sky, the wind are supported, the Ekavimsa Stoma. With the Ekavimsa Stoma he freed the rain and the wind of the people from evil, from death.

original: ādityānām bhāgo 'si /🔽marutāmādhipatyamityādityebhyo bhāgaṃ kṛtvā marudbhya🔽ādhipatyamakarodgarbhā spṛtāḥ pañcaviṃśa stoma iti garbhānprajānām pañcaviṃśena
analyzed: ādityānām bhāgaḥ si  marutām ādhipatyam iti ādityebhyaḥ bhāgam kṛtvā marudbhyaḥ  ādhipatyam akarot garbhāḥ spṛtāḥ pañcaviṃśaḥ stomaḥ iti garbhān prajānām pañcaviṃśena
translated: You are the share of the Adityas.

original: stomena pāpmano mṛtyoraspṛṇot / / /
analyzed: stomena pāpmanaḥ mṛtyoḥ aspṛṇot
translated: The overlordship of the Maruts, having made a share for the Adityas, he made overlordship for the Maruts. The embryos are supported, the Pancavimsa Stoma. With the Pancavimsa Stoma he freed the embryos of the people from evil, from death.

original: adityai bhāgo 'si /
analyzed: adityai bhāgaḥ si
translated: You are the share of Aditi.

original: pūṣṇaṃ ādhipatyamitīyaṃ vā aditirasyai bhāgaṃ kṛtvā pūṣṇa
analyzed: pūṣṇam ādhipatyam iti iyam vai aditiḥ asyai bhāgam kṛtvā pūṣṇa
translated: The overlordship of Pushan, this is Aditi, having made a share for her, he made overlordship for Pushan.

original: ādhipatyamakarodoja spṛtaṃ triṇava stoma ityojaḥ prajānāṃ triṇavena stomena
analyzed: ādhipatyam akarot ojaḥ spṛtam triṇavaḥ stomaḥ iti ojaḥ prajānām triṇavena stomena
translated: He made lordship over strength, the twenty-sevenfold Stoma being the strength of creatures.

original: papmano mṛtyoraspṛṇot / / /
analyzed: papmanaḥ mṛtyoḥ aspṛṇot
translated: He freed them from evil, from death.

original: devasya saviturbhāgo 'si /
analyzed: devasya savituḥ bhāgaḥ si
translated: You are the share of the god Savitr.

original: bṛhaspaterādhipatyamiti devāya savitre bhāgaṃ kṛtvā
analyzed: bṛhaspateḥ ādhipatyam iti devāya savitre bhāgam kṛtvā
translated: You are the lordship of Brihaspati. Having made the share for the god Savitr,

original: bṛhaspataya ādhipatyamakarotsamīcīrdiśa spṛtāścatuṣṭoma stoma iti sarvā diśaḥ
analyzed: bṛhaspataye ādhipatyam akarot samīcīḥ diśaḥ spṛtāḥ catuṣṭomaḥ stomaḥ iti sarvāḥ diśaḥ
translated: he made lordship for Brihaspati. The straight directions, the fourfold Stoma being all the directions.

original: prajānāṃ catuṣṭomena stomena pāpmano mṛtyoraspṛṇot / / /
analyzed: prajānām catuṣṭomena stomena pāpmanaḥ mṛtyoḥ aspṛṇot
translated: He freed all creatures by the fourfold Stoma from evil, from death.

original: yavānām bhāgo 'si /🔽ayavānāmādhipatyamiti pūrvapakṣā vai yavā aparapakṣā
analyzed: yavānām bhāgaḥ si  a yavānām ādhipatyam iti pūrvapakṣāḥ vai yavāḥ aparapakṣā
translated: You are the share of the barley.🔽You are the lordship of the Ayavas. The barley is the bright fortnights, the Ayavas are the dark fortnights,

original: ayavāste hīdaṃ sarvaṃ yuvate cāyuvate ca pūrvapakṣebhyo bhāgaṃ
analyzed: ayavāḥ te hi idam sarvam yuvate ca ā yuvate ca pūrvapakṣebhyaḥ bhāgam
translated: for they carry this all away and do not carry it away. Having made the share for the bright fortnights,

original: kṛtvāparapakṣebhya ādhipatyamakarotprajā spṛtāścatuścatvāriṃśa stoma iti sarvāḥ
analyzed: kṛtvā aparapakṣebhyaḥ ādhipatyam akarot prajāḥ spṛtāḥ catuścatvāriṃśaḥ stomaḥ iti sarvāḥ
translated: he made lordship for the dark fortnights. All creatures, the forty-fourfold Stoma being all creatures.

original: prajāścatuścatvāriṃśena stomena pāpmano mṛtyoraspṛṇot / / /
analyzed: prajāḥ catuścatvāriṃśena stomena pāpmanaḥ mṛtyoḥ aspṛṇot
translated: He freed them by the forty-fourfold Stoma from evil, from death.

original: ṛbhūṇām bhāgo 'si /
analyzed: ṛbhūṇām bhāgaḥ si
translated: You are the share of the Rbhus.

original: viṣveṣāṃ devānāmādhipatyamityṛbhubhyo bhāgaṃ kṛtvā
analyzed: viṣveṣām devānām ādhipatyam iti ṛbhubhyaḥ bhāgam kṛtvā
translated: You are the lordship of all the gods. Having made the share for the Rbhus,

original: viśvebhyo devebhya ādhipatyamakarodbhūtaṃ spṛtaṃ trayastriṃśa stoma iti sarvāṇi🔽bhūtāni trayastriṃśena stomena pāpmano mṛtyoraspṛṇottathaivaitadyajamānaḥ sarvāṇi
analyzed: viśvebhyaḥ devebhyaḥ ādhipatyam akarot bhūtam spṛtam trayastriṃśaḥ stomaḥ iti sarvāṇi  bhūtāni trayastriṃśena stomena pāpmanaḥ mṛtyoḥ aspṛṇot tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ sarvāṇi
translated: He made lordship over all the gods. The Bhûta is the Trayastrimsa Stoma. By the Trayastrimsa Stoma🔽he freed all the Bhûtas from evil, from death. In the same way the Sacrificer, by the Trayastrimsa Stoma, frees all the Bhûtas

original: bhūtāni trayastriṃśena stomena pāpmano mṛtyo spṛṇoti / / /🔽tā vā etā daśeṣṭakā upadadhāti /
analyzed: bhūtāni trayastriṃśena stomena pāpmanaḥ mṛtyoḥ spṛṇoti  tāḥ vai etāḥ daśa iṣṭakāḥ upadadhāti
translated: from evil, from death.

original: daśākṣarā virāḍvirāḍagnirdaśa diśo diśo 'gnirdaśa
analyzed: daśa akṣarā virāj virāj agniḥ daśa diśaḥ diśaḥ gniḥ daśa
translated: He lays down ten bricks. The Virâg consists of ten syllables, and Agni is Virâg; there are ten regions, and Agni is the regions;

original: prāṇāḥ prāṇā agniryāvānagniryāvatyasya mātrā tāvataiva tadetāni sarvāṇi bhūtāni
analyzed: prāṇāḥ prāṇāḥ agniḥ yāvān agniḥ yāvatī asya mātrā tāvatā eva tat etāni sarvāṇi bhūtāni
translated: there are ten vital airs, and Agni is the vital airs. As great as Agni is, as great as is his measure, by so much he frees all these Bhûtas

original: pāpmano mṛtyo spṛṇoti / / /🔽atha 'rtavye upadadhāti /
analyzed: pāpmanaḥ mṛtyo spṛṇoti  atha ṛtavye upadadhāti
translated: from evil, from death.

original: ṛtava ete yadṛtavye ṛtūnevaitadupadadhāti sahaśca🔽sahasyaśca haimantikāvṛtū iti nāmanī enayorete nāmabhyāmevaine etadupadadhāti
analyzed: ṛtavaḥ ete yat ṛtavye ṛtūn eva etat upadadhāti sahaḥ ca  sahasyaḥ ca haimantikau ṛtū iti nāmanī enayoḥ ete nāmabhyām eva ene etat upadadhāti
translated: He then lays down the Ṛtavyâ (seasonable) bricks. The Ṛtavyâs are the seasons; it is the seasons he thus lays down. 'Saha and

original: dve iṣṭake bhavato dvau hi māsāvṛtuḥ sakṛtsādayatyekaṃ tadṛtuṃ karoti / / /
analyzed: dve iṣṭake bhavataḥ dvau hi māsau ṛtuḥ sakṛt sādayati ekam tat ṛtum karoti
translated: Sahasya, the winter-seasons,'--these are the names of these two; it is by their names he thus lays them down. There are two bricks, for a season consists of two months. He settles them at once: he thus makes one season of them.

original: tadyadete atropadadhāti /
analyzed: tat yat ete atra upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays them down here.

original: saṃvatsara eṣo 'gnirima u lokāḥ saṃvatsarastasya
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ eṣaḥ gniḥ ime u lokāḥ saṃvatsaraḥ tasya
translated: This Agni is the year, and these worlds are the year.

original: yadūrdhvamantarikṣādarvācīnaṃ divastadasyaiṣā caturthī citistadvasya hemanta
analyzed: yat ūrdhvam antarikṣāt arvācīnam divaḥ tat asya eṣā caturthī citiḥ tat vai asya hemanta
translated: That which is above the atmosphere and below the sky is his fourth layer, that is the winter

original: ṛtustadyadete atropadadhāti yadevāsyaite ātmanastadasminnetatpratidadhāti
analyzed: ṛtuḥ tat yat ete atra upadadhāti yat eva asya ete ātmanaḥ tat asmin etat pratidadhāti
translated: season of him. In that he puts these two here, he thereby restores to him what these two are of his self.

original: tasmādete atropadadhāti / / /
analyzed: tasmāt ete atra upadadhāti
translated: Therefore he puts these two here.

original: yadvevaite atropadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva ete atra upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he puts these two here.

original: prajāpatireṣo 'gniḥ saṃvatsara u prajāpatistasya
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ eṣaḥ gniḥ saṃvatsaraḥ u prajāpatiḥ tasya
translated: This Agni is Prajapati, and Prajapati is the year.

original: yadūrdhvam madhyādavācīnaṃ śīrṣṇastadasyaiṣā caturthī citistadvasya hemanta
analyzed: yat ūrdhvam madhyāt avācīnam śīrṣṇaḥ tat asya eṣā caturthī citiḥ tat vai asya hemanta
translated: That which is above the middle and below the head is his fourth layer, that is the winter

original: ṛtustadyadete atropadadhāti yadevāsyaite ātmanastadasminnetatpratidadhāti
analyzed: ṛtuḥ tat yat ete atra upadadhāti yat eva asya ete ātmanaḥ tat asmin etat pratidadhāti
translated: season of him. In that he puts these two here, he thereby restores to him what these two are of his self.

original: tasmādete atropadadhāti / / /
analyzed: tasmāt ete atra upadadhāti
translated: Therefore he puts these two here.

original: atha sṛṣṭīrupadadhāti /
analyzed: atha sṛṣṭīḥ upadadhāti
translated: Then he puts down the Srsti bricks.

original: etadvai prajāpatiḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni pāpmano
analyzed: etat vai prajāpatiḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni pāpmanaḥ
translated: For Prajapati, having freed all beings from evil,

original: mṛtyormuktvākāmayata prajāḥ sṛjeya prajāyeyeti / / /
analyzed: mṛtyoḥ muktvā akāmayata prajāḥ sṛjeya prajāyeya iti
translated: from death, desired, 'Let me create offspring, let me be propagated.'

original: sa prāṇānabravīt /
analyzed: sa prāṇān abravīt
translated: He said to the breaths,

original: yuṣmābhiḥ sahemāḥ prajāḥ prajanayānīti te vai kena stoṣyāmaha
analyzed: yuṣmābhiḥ saha imāḥ prajāḥ prajanayāni iti te vai kena stoṣyāmaha
translated: 'With you I will procreate these creatures.' They said, 'By what shall we be worshipped?'

original: iti mayā caiva yuṣmābhiśceti tatheti te prāṇaiścaiva prajāpatinā cāstuvata yadu ha kiṃ
analyzed: iti mayā ca eva yuṣmābhiḥ ca iti tathā iti te prāṇaiḥ ca eva prajāpatinā ca astuvata yat u ha kim
translated: Thus by me and by you. Thus they praised with their own life-breaths and with Prajapati. Whatever

original: ca devāḥ kurvate stomenaiva tatkurvate yajño vai stomo yajñenaiva tatkurvate
analyzed: ca devāḥ kurvate stomena eva tat kurvate yajñaḥ vai stomaḥ yajñena eva tat kurvate
translated: Thus by me and by you. They said, So be it. They praised with the vital airs and with Prajapati. Whatever the gods do, they do it with the Stoma. The Stoma is the sacrifice. They do it with the sacrifice itself.

original: tasmādu sarvāsvevāstuvatāstuvatetyanuvartate / / /
analyzed: tasmāt u sarvāsu eva astuvata astuvata iti anuvartate
translated: Therefore it is continued in all, They praised with the praise.

original: ekayāstuvateti /
analyzed: ekayā astuvata iti
translated: They praised with one,

original: vāgvā ekā vācaiva tadastuvata prajā adhīyanteti prajā atrādhīyanta
analyzed: vāc vai ekā vācā eva tat astuvata prajāḥ adhīyanta iti prajāḥ atra adhīyanta
translated: One is indeed speech. With speech alone they praised. The creatures were born, the creatures were born here.

original: prajāpatiradhipatirāsīditi prajāpatiratrādhipatirāsīt / / /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ adhipatiḥ āsīt iti prajāpatiḥ atra adhipatiḥ āsīt
translated: Prajapati was the overlord, Prajapati was indeed the overlord here.

original: tisṛbhirastuvateti /
analyzed: tisṛbhiḥ astuvata iti
translated: They praised with three,

original: trayo vai prāṇāḥ prāṇa udāno vyānastaireva tadastuvata
analyzed: trayaḥ vai prāṇāḥ prāṇaḥ udānaḥ vyānaḥ taiḥ eva tat astuvata
translated: There are indeed three vital breaths: the exhaled breath, the inhaled breath, and the circulating breath. With them alone they praised.

original: brahmāsṛjyateti brahmātrāsṛjyata brahmaṇaspatiradhipatirāsīditi
analyzed: brahma asṛjyata iti brahma atra asṛjyata brahmaṇaspatiḥ adhipatiḥ āsīt iti
translated: Brahman was created, Brahman was indeed created here. Brahmanaspati was the overlord,

original: brahmaṇaspatiratrādhipatirāsīt / / /
analyzed: brahmaṇaspatiḥ atra adhipatiḥ āsīt
translated: Brahmanaspati was indeed the overlord here.

original: pañcabhirastuvateti /
analyzed: pañcabhiḥ astuvata iti
translated: They praised with five,

original: ya eveme manaḥpañcamāḥ prāṇāstaireva tadastuvata
analyzed: ye eva ime manaḥ pañcamāḥ prāṇāḥ taiḥ eva tat astuvata
translated: Those indeed are the five vital breaths with the mind as the fifth. With them alone they praised.

original: bhūtānyasṛjyanteti bhūtānyatrāsṛjyanta bhūtānām patiradhipatirāsīditi bhūtānām
analyzed: bhūtāni asṛjyanta iti bhūtāni atra asṛjyanta bhūtānām patiḥ adhipatiḥ āsīt iti bhūtānām
translated: The beings were created, the beings were indeed created here. The lord of beings was the overlord, the lord of beings🔽was indeed the overlord here.

original: patiratrādhipatirāsīt / / /
analyzed: patiḥ atra adhipatiḥ āsīt
translated: The lord was the overlord here.

original: saptabhirastuvateti /🔽ya eveme sapta śīrṣanprāṇāstaireva tadastuvata sapta ṛṣayo
analyzed: saptabhiḥ astuvata iti  ye eva ime sapta śīrṣan prāṇāḥ taiḥ eva tat astuvata sapta ṛṣayaḥ
translated: They praised with seven.🔽They praised with those very seven vital airs in the head. The seven sages

original: 'sṛjyanteti sapta 'rṣayo 'trāsṛjyanta dhātādhipatirāsīditi dhātātrādhipatirāsīt / / /
analyzed: sṛjyanta iti sapta rṣayaḥ tra asṛjyanta dhātā adhipatiḥ āsīt iti dhātā atra adhipatiḥ āsīt
translated: were created here. The creator was the overlord here.

original: navabhirastuvateti /
analyzed: navabhiḥ astuvata iti
translated: They praised with nine.

original: nava vai prāṇāḥ sapta śīrṣannavāñcau dvau taireva tadastuvata
analyzed: nava vai prāṇāḥ sapta śīrṣan avāñcau dvau taiḥ eva tat astuvata
translated: There are indeed nine vital airs, seven in the head and two downward ones. They praised with those very ones.

original: pitaro 'sṛjyanteti pitaro 'trāsṛjyantāditiradhipatnyāsīdityaditiratrādhipatnyāsīt / / /
analyzed: pitaraḥ sṛjyanta iti pitaraḥ tra asṛjyanta aditiḥ adhipatnī āsīt iti aditiḥ atra adhipatnī āsīt
translated: The fathers were created here. Aditi was the overlady here.

original: ekādaśabhirastuvateti /🔽daśa prāṇā ātmaikādaśastenaiva tadastuvata ṛtavo
analyzed: ekādaśabhiḥ astuvata iti  daśa prāṇāḥ ātmā ekādaśaḥ tena eva tat astuvata ṛtavaḥ
translated: They praised with eleven.🔽The ten vital airs and the self are the eleventh. They praised with that very one. The seasons

original: 'sṛjyantetyṛtavo 'trāsṛjyantārtavā adhipataya āsannityārtavā atrādhipataya āsan / / /
analyzed: sṛjyanta iti ṛtavaḥ tra asṛjyanta ārtavāḥ adhipatayaḥ āsan iti ārtavāḥ atra adhipatayaḥ āsan
translated: were created here. The seasonal periods were the overlords here.

original: trayodaśabhirastuvateti /
analyzed: trayodaśabhiḥ astuvata iti
translated: They praised with thirteen.

original: daśa prāṇā dve pratiṣṭhe ātmā trayodaśastenaiva tadastuvata
analyzed: daśa prāṇāḥ dve pratiṣṭhe ātmā trayodaśaḥ tena eva tat astuvata
translated: The ten vital airs, two foundations, and the self are the thirteenth. They praised with that very one.

original: māsā asṛjyanteti māsā atrāsṛjyanta saṃvatsaro 'dhipatirāsīditi saṃvatsaro🔽'trādhipatirāsīt / / /
analyzed: māsāḥ asṛjyanta iti māsāḥ atra asṛjyanta saṃvatsaraḥ dhipatiḥ āsīt iti 🔽tri adhipatiḥ āsīt
translated: The months were created here. The year was the overlord here.

original: pañcadaśabhirastuvateti /
analyzed: pañcadaśabhiḥ astuvata iti
translated: 'With fifteen they sang praises,' (with that) they created the Kshatriya.

original: daśa hastyā aṅgulayaścatvāri dorbāhavāṇi yadūrdhvaṃ🔽nābhestatpañcadaśaṃ tenaiva tadastuvata kṣatramasṛjyateti kṣatramasṛjyateti
analyzed: daśa hastyāḥ aṅgulayaḥ catvāri dorbāhavāṇi yat ūrdhvam  nābheḥ tat pañcadaśam tena eva tat astuvata kṣatram asṛjyata iti kṣatram asṛjyata iti
translated: The ten fingers and toes, the four upper arms, and what is above

original: kṣatramatrāsṛjyatendro 'dhipatirāsīditīndro 'trādhipatirāsīt / / /
analyzed: kṣatram atra asṛjyata indraḥ dhipatiḥ āsīt iti indraḥ u tra adhipatiḥ āsīt
translated: the navel, that is the fifteenth. With that they sang praises. 'The Kshatriya was created,' they say. Indra was the lord, they say.

original: saptadaśabhirastuvateti /
analyzed: saptadaśabhiḥ astuvata iti
translated: 'With seventeen they sang praises,' (with that) they created the village animals.

original: daśa pādyā aṅgulayaścatvāryūrvaṣṭhīvāni dve pratiṣṭhe🔽yadavāṅnābhestatsaptadaśaṃ tenaiva tadastuvata grāmyāḥ paśavo 'sṛjyanteti grāmyāḥ
analyzed: daśa pādyāḥ aṅgulayaḥ catvāri ūru aṣṭhīvāni dve pratiṣṭhe  yat avāk nābheḥ tat saptadaśam tena eva tat astuvata grāmyāḥ paśavaḥ sṛjyanta iti grāmyāḥ
translated: The ten toes and fingers, the four thighs and knees, the two feet,

original: paśavo 'trāsṛjyanta bṛhaspatiradhipatirāsīditi bṛhaspatiratrādhipatirāsīt / / /
analyzed: paśavaḥ tra asṛjyanta bṛhaspatiḥ adhipatiḥ āsīt iti bṛhaspatiḥ atra adhipatiḥ āsīt
translated: and what is below the navel, that is the seventeenth. With that they sang praises. 'The village animals were created,' they say. Brihaspati was the lord, they say.

original: navadaśabhirastuvateti /
analyzed: navadaśabhiḥ astuvata iti
translated: 'With nineteen they sang praises,' (with that) they created the Sudra and Arya.

original: daśa hastyā aṅgulayo nava prāṇāstaireva tadastuvata
analyzed: daśa hastyāḥ aṅgulayaḥ nava prāṇāḥ taiḥ eva tat astuvata
translated: The ten fingers and toes, the nine vital airs, with those they sang praises.🔽'The Sudra and Arya were created,' they say. Day and night were the overlords, they say.

original: śūdrāryāvasṛjyetāmiti śūdrāryāvatrāsṛjyetāmahorātre adhipatnī āstāmityahorātre🔽atrādhipatnī āstām / / /
analyzed: śūdra āryau asṛjyetām iti śūdra āryau atra asṛjyetām ahar rātre adhipatnī āstām iti ahar rātre  atra adhipatnī āstām
translated: Day and night were the overlords here.

original: ekaviṃśatyāstuvateti /
analyzed: ekaviṃśatyā astuvata iti
translated: 'With twenty-one they sang praises,' (with that) they created the gods.🔽The ten fingers and toes, the nine vital airs, the mind is the twenty-first.

original: daśa hastyā aṅgulayo daśa pādyā ātmaikaviṃśastenaiva🔽tadastuvataikaśaphāḥ paśavo 'sṛjyantetyekaśaphāḥ paśavo 'trāsṛjyanta varuṇo
analyzed: daśa hastyāḥ aṅgulayaḥ daśa pādyāḥ ātmā ekaviṃśaḥ tena eva  tat astuvata ekaśaphāḥ paśavaḥ sṛjyanta iti ekaśaphāḥ paśavaḥ tra asṛjyanta varuṇaḥ
translated: Ten fingers, ten toes, the self is the twenty-first. By that🔽They praised with that, the one-hoofed animals were created, the one-hoofed animals were created here,

original: 'dhipatirāsīditi varuṇo 'trādhipatirāsīt / / /
analyzed: dhipatiḥ āsīt iti varuṇaḥ tri adhipatiḥ āsīt
translated: Varuṇa was the lord, Varuṇa was the lord here.

original: trayoviṃśatyāstuvateti /
analyzed: trayoviṃśatyā astuvata iti
translated: With twenty-three, they say.

original: daśa hastyā aṅgulayo daśa pādyā dve pratiṣṭhe ātmā
analyzed: daśa hastyāḥ aṅgulayaḥ daśa pādyāḥ dve pratiṣṭhe ātmā
translated: Ten fingers, ten toes, two feet, the self

original: trayoviṃśastenaiva tadastuvata kṣudrāḥ paśavo 'sṛjyanteti kṣudrāḥ paśavo
analyzed: trayoviṃśaḥ tena eva tat astuvata kṣudrāḥ paśavaḥ sṛjyanta iti kṣudrāḥ paśavaḥ
translated: is the twenty-third. By that they praised, the small animals were created, the small animals

original: 'trāsṛjyanta pūṣādhipatirāsīditi pūṣādhipatirāsīt / / /
analyzed: trā asṛjyanta pūṣā adhipatiḥ āsīt iti pūṣā adhipatiḥ āsīt
translated: were created here, Pūṣan was the lord, Pūṣan was the lord here.

original: pañcaviṃśatyāstuvateti /
analyzed: pañcaviṃśatyā astuvata iti
translated: With twenty-five, they say.

original: daśa hastyā aṅgulayo daśa pādyāścatvāryaṅgānyātmā
analyzed: daśa hastyāḥ aṅgulayaḥ daśa pādyāḥ catvāri aṅgāni ātmā
translated: Ten fingers, ten toes, four limbs, the self

original: paścaviṃśastenaiva tadastuvatāraṇyāḥ paśavo 'sṛjyantetyāraṇyāḥ paśavo 'trāsṛjyanta
analyzed: paścaviṃśaḥ tena eva tat astuvata āraṇyāḥ paśavaḥ sṛjyanta iti āraṇyāḥ paśavaḥ tra asṛjyanta
translated: is the twenty-fifth. By that they praised, the wild animals were created, the wild animals

original: vāyuradhipatirāsīditi vāyuratrādhipatirāsīt / / /
analyzed: vāyuḥ adhipatiḥ āsīt iti vāyuḥ atra adhipatiḥ āsīt
translated: were created here, Vāyu was the lord, Vāyu was the lord here.

original: saptaviṃśatyāstuvateti /
analyzed: saptaviṃśatyā astuvata iti
translated: With twenty-seven, they say.

original: daśa hastyā aṅgulayo daśa pādyāścatvāryaṅgāni dve pratiṣṭhe
analyzed: daśa hastyāḥ aṅgulayaḥ daśa pādyāḥ catvāri aṅgāni dve pratiṣṭhe
translated: Ten fingers, ten toes, four limbs, two feet, the self🔽is the twenty-seventh. By that they praised, the birds were created, the birds

analyzed: ātmā saptaviṃśaḥ tena eva tat astuvata dyāvāpṛthivī vyaitām iti dyāvāpṛthivī atra vyaitām  vasavaḥ rudrāḥ ādityāḥ anuvyāyan iti vasavaḥ rudrāḥ ādityāḥ atra anuvyāyan te eva adhipatayaḥ
translated: The Self is the twenty-seventh. By that they praised. Heaven and earth were separated, heaven and earth were separated here.

analyzed: āsan iti te u eva atra adhipatayaḥ āsan
translated: The Vasus, Rudras, and Adityas followed in the separation, the Vasus, Rudras, and Adityas followed in the separation here. They were the overlords.🔽They were the overlords here.

original: navaviṃśatyāstuvateti /
analyzed: navaviṃśatyā astuvata iti
translated: They praised with nineteen.

original: daśa hastyā aṅgulayo daśa pādyā nava prāṇāstaireva
analyzed: daśa hastyāḥ aṅgulayaḥ daśa pādyāḥ nava prāṇāḥ taiḥ eva
translated: There are ten fingers, ten toes, and nine vital breaths. By those

analyzed: tat astuvata vanaspatayaḥ sṛjyanta iti vanaspatayaḥ tra asṛjyanta somaḥ dhipatiḥ āsīt iti
translated: they praised. The trees were created, the trees were created here. Soma was the overlord,

original: somo 'trādhipatirāsīt / / /
analyzed: somaḥ tri adhipatiḥ āsīt
translated: Soma was the overlord here.

original: ekatriṃśatāstuvateti /
analyzed: ekatriṃśatā astuvata iti
translated: They praised with thirty-one.

original: daśa hastyā aṅgulayo daśa pādyā daśa prāṇā
analyzed: daśa hastyāḥ aṅgulayaḥ daśa pādyāḥ daśa prāṇā
translated: There are ten fingers, ten toes, ten vital breaths,

original: ātmaikatriṃśastenaiva tadastuvata prajā asṛjyanteti prajā atrāsṛjyanta
analyzed: ātmā ekatriṃśaḥ tena eva tat astuvata prajāḥ asṛjyanta iti prajāḥ atra asṛjyanta
translated: the Self is the thirty-first. By that they praised. Creatures were created, creatures were created here.

original: yavāścāyavāścādhipataya āsanniti pūrvapakṣāparapakṣā evātrādhipataya āsan / / /
analyzed: yavāḥ ca ayavāḥ ca adhipatayaḥ āsan iti pūrvapakṣa aparapakṣāḥ eva atra adhipatayaḥ āsan
translated: The Yavas and Ayavas were the overlords, the Yavas and Ayavas were the overlords here.

original: trayastriṃśatāstuvateti /
analyzed: trayastriṃśatā astuvata iti
translated: They praised with thirty-three.

original: daśa hastyā aṅgulayo daśa pādyā daśa prāṇā dve pratiṣṭhe
analyzed: daśa hastyāḥ aṅgulayaḥ daśa pādyāḥ daśa prāṇāḥ dve pratiṣṭhe
translated: There are ten fingers, ten toes, ten vital breaths, two foundations,

original: ātmā trayastriṃśastenaiva tadastuvata bhūtānyaśāmyanniti sarvāṇi
analyzed: ātmā trayastriṃśaḥ tena eva tat astuvata bhūtāni aśāmyan iti sarvāṇi
translated: The thirty-three are the self; by it they praised; the beings became calm, all beings became calm here.

original: bhūtānyatrāśāmyanprajāpatiḥ parameṣṭhyadhipatirāsīditi prajāpatiḥ🔽parameṣṭhyatrādhipatirāsīt / / /
analyzed: bhūtāni atra aśāmyan prajāpatiḥ parameṣṭhī adhipatiḥ āsīt iti prajāpatiḥ  parameṣṭhī atra adhipatiḥ āsīt
translated: Prajapati was the overlord, the supreme lord, Prajapati was the overlord here, the supreme lord.

original: tā vā etāḥ / saptadaśeṣṭakā upadadhāti saptadaśo vai saṃvatsaraḥ prajāpatiḥ sa
analyzed: tāḥ vai etāḥ saptadaśa iṣṭakāḥ upadadhāti saptadaśaḥ vai saṃvatsaraḥ prajāpatiḥ sa
translated: These are those (bricks). He lays down seventeen bricks; the year consists of seventeen half-months, Prajapati is the year,

original: prajanayitā tadetena vai saptadaśena saṃvatsareṇa prajāpatinā prajanayitraitāḥ prajāḥ
analyzed: prajanayitā tat etena vai saptadaśena saṃvatsareṇa prajāpatinā prajanayitrā etāḥ prajāḥ
translated: he is the begetter; with that seventeenfold year, with Prajapati, the begetter, he thus begets these creatures.

original: prājanayadyatprājanayadasṛjata tadyadasṛjata tasmātsṛṣṭayastāḥ
analyzed: prājanayat yat prājanayat asṛjata tat yat asṛjata tasmāt sṛṣṭayaḥ tāḥ
translated: In that he begets them, he creates them; in that he creates them, therefore they are Sṛṣṭis (creations).

original: sṛṣṭvātmanprāpādayata tathaivaitadyajamāna etena saptadaśena saṃvatsareṇa
analyzed: sṛṣṭvā ātman prāpādayata tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ etena saptadaśena saṃvatsareṇa
translated: Having created them, he placed them in himself; in the same way the sacrificer, with that seventeenfold year,

original: prajāpatinā prajanayitraitāḥ prajāḥ prajanayati tāḥ sṛṣṭvātmanprapādayate
analyzed: prajāpatinā prajanayitrā etāḥ prajāḥ prajanayati tāḥ sṛṣṭvā ātman prapādayate
translated: with Prajapati, the begetter, begets these creatures; having created them, he places them in himself.

original: retaḥsicorvelayā pṛṣṭayo vai retaḥsicau madhyamu pṛṣṭayo madhyata evāsminnetāḥ
analyzed: retaḥsicoḥ velayā pṛṣṭayaḥ vai retaḥsicau madhyam u pṛṣṭayaḥ madhyataḥ eva asmin etāḥ
translated: In the region of the Retahsik (he places them); the Retahsik are the sides, the sides are the middle; from the middle he thus places these creatures in him.

original: prajāḥ prapādayati sarvata upadadhāti sarvata evāsminnetāḥ prajāḥ prapādayati / / /
analyzed: prajāḥ prapādayati sarvatas upadadhāti sarvatas eva asmin etāḥ prajāḥ prapādayati
translated: He places (them) on all sides; on all sides he thus places these creatures in him.🔽.

original: athāto 'nvāvṛtam /
analyzed: atha atas nvāvṛtam
translated: Now, then, the successive arrangement.

original: trivṛdvatīm purastādupadadhātyekaviṃśavatīm
analyzed: trivṛdvatīm purastāt upadadhāti ekaviṃśavatīm
translated: He places the one consisting of three parts in front, the one consisting of twenty-one parts

original: paścātpañcadaśavatīṃ dakṣiṇataḥ saptadaśavatīmuttarataḥ / / /
analyzed: paścāt pañcadaśavatīm dakṣiṇatas saptadaśavatīm uttaratas
translated: in the rear, the one consisting of fifteen parts on the right, the one consisting of seventeen parts on the left.

original: etadvai prajāpatim /
analyzed: etat vai prajāpatim
translated: This, indeed, is Pragâpati.

original: trivṛdvatyāmupahitāyām pañcadaśavatyām
analyzed: trivṛdvatyām upahitāyām pañcadaśavatyām
translated: When the one consisting of three parts was laid down, and the one consisting of fifteen parts,

original: mṛtyurasīdadimāmata upadhāsyate tamatra grahīṣyāmīti tam prāpaśyattam
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ asīdat imām atas upadhāsyate tam atra grahīṣyāmi iti tam prāpaśyat tam
translated: Death sat down, thinking, 'I will seize him when he lays down this (brick): I will get hold of him.' He saw him,

original: prakhyāya parikramyaikaviṃśavatīmupādhattaikaviṃśavatīm
analyzed: prakhyāya parikramya ekaviṃśavatīm upādhatta ekaviṃśavatīm
translated: and, having gone round by the right, he laid down the one consisting of twenty-one parts. The one consisting of twenty-one parts.

original: mṛtyurāgacatpañcadaśavatīmupādhatta pañcadaśavatīm
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ āgacat pañcadaśavatīm upādhatta pañcadaśavatīm
translated: Death came to him. He laid down the one consisting of fifteen parts. The one consisting of fifteen parts.

original: mṛtyurāgacatsaptadaśavatīmupādhatta so 'traiva mṛtyuṃ🔽nyakarodatrāmohayattathaivaitadyajamāno 'traiva sarvānpāpmano nikarotyatra
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ āgacat saptadaśavatīm upādhatta saḥ u tra eva mṛtyum  nyakarot atra amohayat tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ u tra eva sarvān pāpmanaḥ nikaroti atra
translated: Death came to him. He laid down the one consisting of seventeen parts. He drove away Death right there,

original: mohayati / / /
analyzed: mohayati
translated: and confounded him right there. And in the same way does the Sacrificer now drive away all evils right there, and confound them right there.

original: athottarāḥ /
analyzed: atha uttarāḥ
translated: Now, the northern ones.

original: trivṛdvatyāmeva trivṛdvatīmanūpadadhātyekaviṃśavatyāmekaviṃśavatīm
analyzed: trivṛdvatyām eva trivṛdvatīm anūpadadhāti ekaviṃśavatyām ekaviṃśavatīm
translated: In the one consisting of three parts he places the one consisting of three parts, in the one consisting of twenty-one parts the one consisting of twenty-one parts,

original: pañcadaśavatyāṃ saptadaśavatīṃ saptadaśavatyām pañcadaśavatīṃ tā yadevaṃ
analyzed: pañcadaśavatyām saptadaśavatīm saptadaśavatyām pañcadaśavatīm tāḥ yat evam
translated: in the one consisting of fifteen parts the one consisting of seventeen parts, and in the one consisting of seventeen parts the one consisting of fifteen parts. The reason why (he places them) thus,

original: vyatihāramupadadhāti tasmādakṣṇayāstomīyā atho yadete stomā ato 'nyathānupūrvaṃ
analyzed: vyatihāram upadadhāti tasmāt akṣṇayāstomīyāḥ atha u yat ete stomāḥ atas nyathānupūrvam
translated: He puts down the Vyatiharas; therefore the Stotriyas are oblique. And because these Stomas are in a different order from this,

original: tasmādvevākṣṇayāstomīyā atho evaṃ devā upādadhatetarathāsurāstato devā
analyzed: tasmāt u eva akṣṇayāstomīyāḥ atha u evam devāḥ upādadhata itarathā asurāḥ tatas devā
translated: therefore also the Stotriyas are oblique. And in this way the gods put them down, in a different way the Asuras. Then the gods

original: abhavanparāsurā bhavatyātmanā parāsya dviṣanbhrātṛvyo bhavati ya evaṃ veda / / /
analyzed: abhavan parā asurāḥ bhavati ātmanā parā asya dviṣan bhrātṛvyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: prospered, the Asuras were defeated. He who knows thus prospers himself and defeats his enemy.

original: sa eṣa paśuryadagniḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eṣa paśuḥ yat agniḥ
translated: This Agni is an animal.

original: so 'traiva sarvaḥ kṛtsnaḥ saṃskṛtastasya trivṛdvatyāveva śiraste
analyzed: saḥ trā eva sarvaḥ kṛtsnaḥ saṃskṛtaḥ tasya trivṛdvatyau eva śiraḥ te
translated: Here he is made whole and complete. Of him the two Trivrit ones are the head.

original: yattrivṛdvatyau bhavatastrivṛddhi śiro dve bhavato dvikapālaṃ hi śiraḥ pūrvārdha
analyzed: yat trivṛdvatyau bhavataḥ trivṛt hi śiraḥ dve bhavataḥ dvi kapālam hi śiraḥ pūrva ardha
translated: In that they are Trivrit ones, the head is Trivrit. They are two, for the head has two parts. In the front part

original: upadadhāti purastāddhīdaṃ śiraḥ / / /
analyzed: upadadhāti purastāt hi idam śiraḥ
translated: he puts them down, for the head is in front of this (universe).

original: pratiṣṭhaikaviṃśavatyau /🔽te yadekaviṃśavatyau bhavataḥ pratiṣṭhā hyekaviṃśo dve
analyzed: pratiṣṭhā ekaviṃśavatyau  te yat ekaviṃśavatyau bhavataḥ pratiṣṭhā hi ekaviṃśaḥ dve
translated: The two Ekavinśa ones are the feet.🔽In that they are Ekavinśa ones, for the Ekavinśa is a foundation. They are two, for a foundation is a pair. In the back

original: bhavato dvandvaṃ hi pratiṣṭhā paścādupadadhāti paścāddhīyam pratiṣṭhā / / /🔽bāhū pañcadaśavatyau /
analyzed: bhavataḥ dvandvam hi pratiṣṭhā paścāt upadadhāti paścāt hi iyam pratiṣṭhā  bāhū pañcadaśavatyau
translated: he puts them down, for the foundation is behind this (universe).🔽The two Pañcadaśa ones are the arms.

original: te yatpañcadaśavatyau bhavataḥ pañcadaśau hi bāhū dve
analyzed: te yat pañcadaśavatyau bhavataḥ pañcadaśau hi bāhū dve
translated: In that they are Pañcadaśa ones, for the arms are Pañcadaśa. They are two,

original: bhavato dvau hīmau bāhū pārśvata upadadhāti pārśvato hīmau bāhū / / /🔽annaṃ saptadaśavatyau /
analyzed: bhavataḥ dvau hi imau bāhū pārśvatas upadadhāti pārśvatas hi imau bāhū  annam saptadaśavatyau
translated: He puts them down on the sides of the two arms, for these arms are on the sides.🔽The two (bricks) containing the Saptadaça are food.

original: te yatsaptadaśavatyau bhavataḥ saptadaśaṃ hyannaṃ dve
analyzed: te yat saptadaśavatyau bhavataḥ saptadaśam hi annam dve
translated: As to why they contain the Saptadaça, food is indeed seventeenfold.

original: bhavato dvyakṣaraṃ hyannaṃ te anantarhite
analyzed: bhavataḥ dvi akṣaram hi annam te an antarhite
translated: They are two, for food consists of two syllables. He puts them down not separated (from the other bricks),

original: pañcadaśavatībhyāmupadadhātyanantarhitaṃ tadbāhubhyāmannaṃ dadhāti bāhye🔽pañcadaśavatyau bhavato 'ntare saptadaśavatyau bāhubhyāṃ tadubhayato 'nnam
analyzed: pañcadaśavatībhyām upadadhāti an antarhitam tat bāhubhyām annam dadhāti bāhye  pañcadaśavatyau bhavataḥ ntare saptadaśavatyau bāhubhyām tat ubhayatas nnam
translated: with two (formulas) containing the Pañkadasa. He thus places food between the arms. They are outside,

original: parigṛhṇāti / / /
analyzed: parigṛhṇāti
translated: the two (formulas) containing the Pañkadasa; the two (formulas) containing the Saptadaça are inside. He thus encloses the food on both sides with the arms.

original: atha yā madhya upadadhāti /
analyzed: atha yāḥ madhye upadadhāti
translated: Then as to those which he puts down in the middle.

original: sa ātmā tā retaḥsicorvelayopadadhāti pṛṣṭayo vai
analyzed: saḥ ātmā tāḥ retaḥ sicoḥ velayā upadadhāti pṛṣṭayaḥ vai
translated: That is the body. He puts them down on the range of the Retahsik (bricks). The Retahsik are the ribs,

original: retaḥsicau madhyamu pṛṣṭayo madhyato hyayamātmā sarvata upadadhāti sarvato
analyzed: retaḥsicau pṛṣṭayaḥ madhyatas hi ayam ātmā sarvatas upadadhāti sarvatas
translated: and the ribs are the middle; for in the middle is this body. He puts them down on all sides;

original: hyayamātmātha yadato 'nyadatiriktaṃ tadyadvai devānāmatiriktaṃ candāṃsi tāni
analyzed: hi ayam ātmā atha yat atas nyat atiriktam tat yat vai devānām atiriktam candāṃsi tāni
translated: for this body is on all sides. Then what is left over besides that, that is the metres which are left over besides the gods,🔽and those metres are cattle. Then those cattle are the auspicious signs,

original: tadyāni tāni candāṃsi paśavaste tadye te paśavaḥ puṇyāstā lakṣmyastadyāstāḥ puṇyā
analyzed: tat yāni tāni candāṃsi paśavaḥ te tat ye te paśavaḥ puṇyāḥ tāḥ lakṣmyaḥ tat yāḥ tāḥ puṇyā
translated: and those auspicious signs are the worlds.

original: lakṣmyo 'sau sa ādityaḥ sa āsāmeṣa dakṣiṇataḥ / / /
analyzed: lakṣmyā u sau saḥ ādityaḥ saḥ āsām eṣa dakṣiṇatas
translated: That is the sun, that is the southern one of these (rays).

original: tā haike 'nantarhitāstrivṛdvatībhyāmupadadhati /
analyzed: tāḥ ha eke na antarhitāḥ trivṛdvatībhyām upadadhati
translated: Some put them down without interruption by the two containing the Trivrt (Stoma).

original: jihvāhanū iti vadanto yāścaturdaśa🔽te hanū yāḥ ṣaṭ sā jihveti na tathā kuryādati te recayanti yathā pūrvayorhanvorapare🔽hanū anūpadadhyādyathā pūrvasyāṃ jihvāyāmaparāṃ
analyzed: jihvā hanū iti vadantaḥ yāḥ caturdaśa  te hanū yāḥ ṣaḍ sā jihvā iti na tathā kuryāt ati te recayanti yathā pūrvayoḥ hanvoḥ apare  hanū anūpadadhyāt yathā pūrvasyām jihvāyām aparām
translated: Saying, 'They are the tongue and the jaws,'--those which are fourteen,🔽they are the jaws; and those which are six, they are the tongue.' Let him not do so: they would make a redundancy, as if he were to put down the other jaws under the former ones,

original: jihvāmanūpadadhyāttādṛktadyatrāhaiva śirastadeva hanū tajjihvā / / /
analyzed: jihvām anūpadadhyāt tādṛś tat yatra aha eva śiraḥ tat eva hanū tat jihvā
translated: and the other tongue under the former one. It is just so when he puts down the head, then the jaws, then the tongue.

original: asminnu haike 'vāntaradeśa upadadhati /🔽asau vā āditya etā amuṃ tadādityametasyāṃ
analyzed: asmin u ha eke vā antara deśe upadadhati  asau vai ādityaḥ etāḥ amum tat ādityam etasyām
translated: In this (layer) some put down an intermediate space,

original: diśi dadhma iti na tathā kuryādanyāni vāva tāni karmāṇi yairetamatra dadhāti / / /
analyzed: diśi dadhmaḥ iti na tathā kuryāt anyāni vāva tāni karmāṇi yaiḥ etam atra dadhāti
translated: saying, 'That is yonder sun: we will put him, the sun, in that southern quarter.' Let him not do so: other are those works by which he puts him there.

original: dakṣiṇata u haika upadadhati /🔽tadetāḥ puṇyā lakṣmīrdakṣiṇato dadhmaha iti
analyzed: dakṣiṇatas u ha eke upadadhati  tat etāḥ puṇyāḥ lakṣmīḥ dakṣiṇatas dadhmahe iti
translated: Some put (the bricks) down on the south side,🔽saying, 'We will put that auspicious luck on the south side.'

original: tasmādyasya dakṣiṇato lakṣma bhavati tam puṇyalakṣmīka ityācakṣata uttarata
analyzed: tasmāt yasya dakṣiṇatas lakṣma bhavati tam puṇya lakṣmīkaḥ iti ācakṣate uttaratas
translated: Hence, when any one has a mark on the south side, people say of him that he is lucky. On the north side,

original: striyā uttarataāyatanā hi strī tattatkṛtameva purastāttvevainā upadadhyādyatrāhaiva🔽śirastadeva hanū tajjihvāthaitāḥ puṇyā lakṣmīrmukhato dhatte tasmādyasya mukhe
analyzed: striyāḥ uttaratas āyatanā hi strī tat tat kṛtam eva purastāt tu eva enāḥ upadadhyāt yatra aha eva  śiraḥ tat eva hanū tat jihvā atha etāḥ puṇyā lakṣmīḥ mukhataḥ dhatte tasmāt yasya mukhe
translated: The woman is on the north side of the house, for the woman is on the north side of the man; therefore he should put it down in front, where the head is, that is the jaws, that is the tongue; then he places on the mouth those auspicious marks of prosperity; therefore they say of him whose face

original: lakṣma bhavati tam puṇyalakṣmīka ityācakṣate / / /
analyzed: lakṣma bhavati tam puṇya lakṣmīkaḥ iti ācakṣate
translated: has a mark, 'He is prosperous.'

original: saiṣā brahmacitiḥ /🔽yadbrahmopādadhata tasmādbrahmacitiḥ sā
analyzed: sā eṣā brahmacitiḥ  yat brahma upādadhata tasmāt brahmacitiḥ sā
translated: That is the Brahman-layer.

original: prajāpaticitiryatprajāpatimupādadhata tasmātprajāpaticitiḥ sa
analyzed: prajāpati citiḥ yat prajāpatim upādadhata tasmāt prajāpati citiḥ sa
translated: In that they put down the Brahman, therefore it is the Brahman-layer. That is the Prajapati-layer.

original: 'rṣicitiryadṛṣīnupādadhata tasmādṛṣicitiḥ sā vāyucitiryadvāyumupādadhata
analyzed: ṛṣi citiḥ yat ṛṣīn upādadhata tasmāt ṛṣi citiḥ sā vāyu citiḥ yat vāyum upādadhata
translated: In that they put down the Rishis, therefore it is the Rishi-layer. That is the Vayu-layer. In that they put down the Vayu,

original: tasmādvāyucitiḥ sā stomacitiryatstomānupādadhata tasmātstomacitiḥ sā
analyzed: tasmāt vāyu citiḥ sā stoma citiḥ yat stomān upādadhata tasmāt stoma citiḥ sā
translated: therefore it is the Vayu-layer. That is the Stoma-layer. In that they put down the Stomas, therefore it is the Stoma-layer.

original: prāṇacitiryatprāṇānupādadhata tasmātprāṇacitirato yatamadeva katamacca vidyāttena🔽haivāsyaiṣārṣeyavatī bandhumatī citirbhavatyatha lokampṛṇe upadadhātyasyāṃ
analyzed: prāṇa citiḥ yat prāṇān upādadhata tasmāt prāṇa citiḥ atas yatamat eva katamat ca vidyāt tena  ha eva asya eṣā ārṣeyavatī bandhumatī citiḥ bhavati atha lokampṛṇe upadadhāti asyām
translated: That is the life-breath-layer. In that they put down the life-breaths, therefore it is the life-breath-layer. Therefore, whatever and whatever one may know,

original: sraktyāṃ tayorupari bandhuḥ purīṣaṃ nivapati tasyopari bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: sraktyām tayoḥ upari bandhuḥ purīṣam nivapati tasya upari bandhuḥ
translated: by that indeed his layer becomes connected with the Rishis and related. Then he puts down the two Lokampṛṇās in this line. The significance of them is above. He pours out the filling-up (earth). The significance of that is above.

original: pañcamīṃ citimupadadhāti /
analyzed: pañcamīm citim upadadhāti
translated: He lays down the fifth layer.

original: etadvai devāścaturthīṃ citiṃ citvā
analyzed: etat vai devāḥ caturthīm citim citvā
translated: For the gods, having built the fourth layer,

original: samārohanyadūrdhvamantarikṣādarvācīnaṃ divastadeva tatsaṃskṛtya samārohan / / /
analyzed: samārohan yat ūrdhvam antarikṣāt arvācīnam divaḥ tat eva tat saṃskṛtya samārohan
translated: ascended it. They ascended it, having completed what is above the atmosphere and below the sky.

original: te 'bruvan / cetayadhvamiti citimicateti vāva tadabruvannita ūrdhvamicateti te
analyzed: te bruvan cetayadhvam iti citim icata iti vāva tat abruvan itas ūrdhvam icata iti te
translated: They said, 'Meditate!'--a layer, doubtless, they meant to say;--'meditate ye!'--in other words, 'seek ye a layer above this!'

original: cetayamānā divameva virājam pañcamīṃ citimapaśyaṃstebhya eṣa loko 'candayat / / /
analyzed: cetayamānāḥ divam eva virājam pañcamīm citim apaśyan tebhyaḥ eṣa candayat
translated: Meditating, they saw that resplendent fifth layer, even this sky; and this world was created for them.

original: te 'kāmayanta /🔽asapatnamimaṃ lokamanupabādhaṃ kurvīmahīti te 'bruvannupa
analyzed: te kāmayanta  asapatnam imam lokam anupabādham kurvīmahi iti te bruvan upa
translated: They desired,

original: tajjānīta yathemaṃ lokamasapatnamanupabādhaṃ karavāmahā iti te🔽'bruvaṃścetayadhvamiti citimicateti vāva tadabruvaṃstadicata yathemaṃ
analyzed: tat jānīta yathā imam lokam asapatnam anupabādham karavāmahai iti te  bruvan cetayadhvam iti citim icata iti vāva tat abruvan tat icata yathā imam
translated: 'Let us make this world free from foes, unassailable!' They said, 'Meditate!'--a layer, doubtless, they meant to say;--'meditate ye!'--in other words, 'seek ye a layer above this!'

original: lokamasapatnamanupabādhaṃ karavāmahā iti / / /
analyzed: lokam asapatnam anupabādham karavāmahai iti
translated: They said, 'Meditate!'--a layer, doubtless, they meant to say;--'meditate ye!'--in other words, 'seek ye a layer above this!'--'so as to make this world free from foes, unassailable!'

original: te cetayamānāḥ /🔽etā iṣṭakā apaśyannasapatnāstā upādadhata tābhiretaṃ
analyzed: te cetayamānāḥ  etāḥ iṣṭakāḥ apaśyan asapatnāḥ tāḥ upādadhata tābhiḥ etam
translated: Meditating,

original: lokamasapatnamanupabādhamakurvata tadyadetābhirimaṃ
analyzed: lokam asapatnam an upabādham akurvata tat yat etābhiḥ imam
translated: they saw those bricks, the 'asapatnâs' (unrivalled), and laid them down; and by means of them they made this world free from foes, unassailable. And because by means of them they made this world🔽free from foes, unassailable, therefore they are called 'asapatnâs.'

original: lokamasapatnamanupabādhamakurvata tasmādetā asapatnāstathevaitadyajamāno
analyzed: lokam asapatnam an upabādham akurvata tasmāt etāḥ asapatnāḥ tathā iva etat yajamānaḥ
translated: they made this world free from rivals and injury; in the same way the sacrificer

original: yadetā upadadhātamevaitallokamasapatnamanupabādhaṃ kurute sarvata upadadhāti🔽sarvata evaitadetaṃ lokamasapatnamanupabādhaṃ kurute parārdha upadadhāti
analyzed: yat etāḥ upadadhātam eva etat lokam asapatnam an upabādham kurute sarvatas upadadhāti  sarvatas eva etat etam lokam asapatnam anupabādham kurute parārdhe upadadhāti
translated: when he puts down these (bricks) makes this world free from rivals and injury. He puts them down on every side;🔽on every side he makes this world free from rivals and injury. He puts them down in the last place;

original: sarvamevaitadetaṃ lokamasapatnamanupavādhaṃ kurute / / /
analyzed: sarvam eva etat etam lokam asapatnam anupavādham kurute
translated: in the last place he makes this world free from rivals and injury.

original: atha virāja upadadhāti /
analyzed: atha virājaḥ upadadhāti
translated: Then he puts down the Virâg bricks.

original: eṣā vai sā virāḍyāṃ taddevā virājam pañcamīṃ
analyzed: eṣā vai sā virāḍyām tat devāḥ virājam pañcamīm
translated: This is that Virâg which the gods saw as the fifth layer;

original: citimapaśyaṃstā daśadaśopadadhāti daśākṣarā virāḍvirāḍeṣā civiḥ sarvata
analyzed: citim apaśyan tāḥ daśa daśa upadadhāti daśa akṣarā virāj virāj eṣā civiḥ
translated: he puts down ten (bricks) each time; the Virâg consists of ten syllables, this layer is the Virâg;

original: upadadhāti yo vā ekasyāṃ diśi virājati na vai sa virājati yo vāva sarvāsu dikṣu virājati
analyzed: upadadhāti yaḥ vai ekasyām diśi virājati na vai sa virājati yaḥ vāva sarvāsu dikṣu virājati
translated: he puts them down on every side; he who shines in one region does not indeed shine, but he who shines in all regions

original: sa eva virājati / / /
analyzed: saḥ eva virājati
translated: shines indeed.

original: yadvevaitā asapatnā upadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva etāḥ asapatnāḥ upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he puts down these Asapatnâs (rival-less bricks).

original: etadvai prajāpatimetasminnātmanaḥ pratihite
analyzed: etat vai prajāpatim etasmin ātmanaḥ pratihite
translated: Now when that part of his body had been restored,🔽evil came upon Pragâpati on every side; he saw these bricks, the Asapatnâs, he put them down, and by them

original: sarvataḥ pāpmopāyatata sa etā iṣṭakā apaśyadasapatnāstā upādhatta tābhistam
analyzed: sarvatas pāpmā upāyatata saḥ etāḥ iṣṭakāḥ apaśyat asapatnāḥ tāḥ upādhatta tābhiḥ tam
translated: he repelled evil on every side.

original: pāpmānamapāhata pāpmā vai sapatnastadyadetābhiḥ pāpmānaṃ sapatnamapāhata
analyzed: pāpmānam apāhata pāpmā vai sapatnaḥ tat yat etābhiḥ pāpmānam sapatnam apāhata
translated: He drove away evil, evil is a foe; in that he drove away evil, the foe, with these (verses),

original: tasmādetā asapatnāḥ / / /
analyzed: tasmāt etāḥ asapatnāḥ
translated: therefore they are the 'asapatnâs' (not-having-a-foe).

original: tadvā etatkriyate /
analyzed: tat vai etat kriyate
translated: Now this is done.

original: yaddevā akurvannidaṃ nvimaṃ sa pāpmā nopayatate
analyzed: yat devāḥ akurvan idam nu imam sa pāpmā na upayatate
translated: In that the gods did this, (thinking), 'Surely, this evil will not overtake us,'

original: yattvetatkaroti yaddevā akurvaṃstatkaravāṇītyatho ya eva pāpmā yaḥ
analyzed: yat tu etat karoti yat devāḥ akurvan tat karavāṇi iti atha u yaḥ eva pāpmā yaḥ
translated: and in that he does this, (thinking), 'In that the gods did this, I will do this,' and also in that he drives away with these (verses) that evil, that foe, which is,

original: sapatnastametābhirapahate tadyadetābhiḥ pāpmānaṃ sapatnamapahate tasmādetā🔽asapatnāḥ sarvata upadadhāti sarvata evaitatpāpmānaṃ sapatnamapahate parārdha
analyzed: sapatnaḥ tam etābhiḥ apahate tat yat etābhiḥ pāpmānam sapatnam apahate tasmāt etāḥ  asapatnāḥ sarvatas upadadhāti sarvatas eva etat pāpmānam sapatnam apahate parārdha
translated: in that he drives away with these (verses) evil, the foe, therefore they are the 'asapatnâs' (not-having-a-foe).🔽He places them on every side: on every side he thus drives away evil, the foe.

original: upadadhāti sarvasmādevaitadātmanaḥ pāpmānaṃ sapatnamapahate / / /
analyzed: upadadhāti sarvasmāt eva etat ātmanaḥ pāpmānam sapatnam apahate
translated: He places them in the middle: from the whole body he thus drives away evil, the foe.

original: sa purastādupadadhāti /
analyzed: sa purastāt upadadhāti
translated: He places one in front,

original: agne jātānpraṇudā naḥ sapatnāniti yathaiva yajustathā
analyzed: agne jātān praṇuda naḥ sapatnān iti yathā eva yajuḥ tathā
translated: (with the verse), 'O Agni, drive away from us our foes, when born!' as the text, so the meaning.

original: bandhuratha paścātsahasā jātānpraṇudā naḥ sapatnāniti yathaiva yajustathā bandhuḥ / / /🔽sā yā purastādagniḥ sā /🔽yā paścādagniḥ sāgninaiva
analyzed: bandhuḥ atha paścāt sahasā jātān praṇuda naḥ sapatnān iti yathā eva yajuḥ tathā bandhuḥ  sā yā purastādagniḥ sā  yā paścādagniḥ sā agninā eva
translated: Then one behind, (with the verse), 'Drive away with force our foes, when born!' as the text, so the meaning.🔽Now that which is in front is Agni,🔽and that which is behind is Agni.

original: tatpurastātpāpmānamapāhatāgninā
analyzed: tat purastāt pāpmānam apāhata agninā
translated: With Agni he thus drives away evil from the front, with Agni

original: paścāttathaivaitadyajamāno 'gninaiva purastātpāpmānamapahate 'gninā paścāt / / /
analyzed: paścāt tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ gninā eva purastāt pāpmānam apahate gninā paścāt
translated: In the same way the Sacrificer now, by Agni in front, repels evil; by Agni behind, by Agni on the right, by Agni on the left, by Agni above, by Agni below.

original: atha dakṣiṇataḥ /
analyzed: atha dakṣiṇatas
translated: Now on the right (south).

original: ṣoḍaśī stoma ojo draviṇamityekādaśākṣarā vai
analyzed: ṣoḍaśī stomaḥ ojaḥ draviṇam iti ekādaśa akṣarāḥ vai
translated: The Ṣoḍaśin (Saman) is the Stoma, strength the wealth (of the sacrificer). The Trishtubh consists of eleven syllables.

original: triṣṭuptraiṣṭubhamantarikṣaṃ catasro diśa eṣa eva vajraḥ
analyzed: triṣṭubh traiṣṭubham antarikṣam catasraḥ diśaḥ eṣaḥ eva vajraḥ
translated: The Trishtubh is the air. There are four quarters. This very (Saman) is the fifteenfold thunderbolt.

original: pañcadaśastasyāsāvevādityaḥ ṣoḍaśī vajrasya bhartā sa etena pañcadaśena
analyzed: pañcadaśaḥ tasya asau eva ādityaḥ ṣoḍaśī vajrasya bhartā saḥ etena pañcadaśena
translated: The sun is its Ṣoḍaśin, the bearer of the thunderbolt. With this fifteenfold thunderbolt,

original: vajreṇaitayā triṣṭubhā dakṣiṇataḥ pāpmānamapāhata tathaivaitadyajamāna etena
analyzed: vajreṇa etayā triṣṭubhā dakṣiṇatas pāpmānam apāhata tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ etena
translated: with this Trishtubh, he repelled evil on the right. In the same way the Sacrificer now,

original: pañcadaśena vajreṇaitayā triṣṭubhā dakṣiṇataḥ pāpmānamapahate / / /
analyzed: pañcadaśena vajreṇa etayā triṣṭubhā dakṣiṇatas pāpmānam apahate
translated: with this fifteenfold thunderbolt, with this Trishtubh, repels evil on the right.

original: athottarataḥ /
analyzed: atha uttaratas
translated: Now on the left (north).

original: catuścatvāriṃśa stomo varco draviṇamiti catuścatvāriṃśadakṣarā vai🔽triṣṭuptraiṣṭubho vajraḥ sa etena catuścatvāriṃśena vajreṇaitayā triṣṭubhottarataḥ
analyzed: catuścatvāriṃśaḥ stomaḥ varcaḥ draviṇam iti catuścatvāriṃśat akṣarāḥ vai  triṣṭubh traiṣṭubhaḥ vajraḥ saḥ etena catuścatvāriṃśena vajreṇa etayā triṣṭubhā uttaratas
translated: The Catuścatvāriṃśa (Saman) is the Stoma, splendour the wealth (of the sacrificer). The Trishtubh consists of forty-four syllables.🔽The Trishtubh is the thunderbolt. With this forty-fourfold thunderbolt, with this Trishtubh, he repelled evil on the left. In the same way the Sacrificer now,

original: pāpmānamapāhata tathaivaitadyajamāna etena catuścatvāriṃśena vajreṇaitayā🔽triṣṭubhottarataḥ pāpmānamapahate / / /
analyzed: pāpmānam apāhata tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ etena catuścatvāriṃśena vajreṇa etayā 🔽triṣṭubhā uttaratas pāpmānam apahate
translated: with this forty-fourfold thunderbolt, with this Trishtubh, repels evil on the left.

original: atha madhye /
analyzed: atha madhye
translated: Now in the middle.

original: agneḥ purīṣamasīti brahma vai caturthī citiragniru vai brahma tasyā
analyzed: agneḥ purīṣam asi iti brahma vai caturthī citiḥ agniḥ u vai brahma tasyāḥ
translated: 'Thou art the filling of Agni', he says; the fourth layer is the Brahman, and Agni is the Brahman;

original: etatpurīṣamiva yatpañcamyapso nāmeti tasyokto bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: etat purīṣam iva yat pañcamī apsaḥ nāma iti tasya uktaḥ bandhuḥ
translated: this is as it were the filling of that (Brahman), which is the fifth (layer); it is called 'water', the meaning of that has been explained.

original: tām prācīṃ tiraścīmupadadhāti /🔽etaddhaitayā prajāpatiḥ pāpmano
analyzed: tām prācīm tiraścīm upadadhāti  etat ha etayā prajāpatiḥ pāpmanaḥ
translated: He lays it down crosswise from east to west;

original: mūlamavṛścattathaivainayāyametatpāpmano mūlaṃ vṛścati dakṣiṇato🔽dakṣiṇataudyāmo hi vajro 'ntareṇa dakṣiṇāṃ diśyāmudyāmāya ha tamavakāśaṃ
analyzed: mūlam avṛścat tathā eva enayā ayam etat pāpmanaḥ mūlam vṛścati dakṣiṇatas  dakṣiṇatas udyāmaḥ hi vajraḥ ntareṇa dakṣiṇām diśyām udyāmāya ha tam avakāśam
translated: for by means of it Pragâpati then cut out the root of evil; and in like manner does this (Sacrificer) thereby now cut out the root of evil. On the right (south) side (he lays it down);

original: karoti / / /
analyzed: karoti
translated: for the thunderbolt is hurled from the right (south) to the left (north); he thus makes room for it to be hurled from the right to the left.

original: sā yā purastātprāṇaḥ sā /🔽yā paścādapānaḥ sā prāṇenaiva🔽tatpurastātpāpmānamapāhatāpānena paścāttathaivaitadyajamānaḥ prāṇenaiva
analyzed: sā yā purastāt prāṇaḥ sā  yā paścāt apānaḥ sā prāṇena eva  tat purastāt pāpmānam apāhata apānena paścāt tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ prāṇena eva
translated: That (layer) which is in front is the out-breathing;

original: purastātpāpmānamapahate 'pānena paścāt / / /
analyzed: purastāt pāpmānam apahate pānena paścāt
translated: and that which is behind is the in-breathing. By means of the out-breathing he then drove away evil from the front, and by means of the in-breathing from behind; and in like manner does the Sacrificer thereby now, by means of the out-breathing, drive away evil from the front, and by means of the in-breathing from behind.

original: atha ye abhitaḥ /
analyzed: atha ye abhitas
translated: Now those (layers) on both sides.

original: tau bāhū sa yo 'syābhitaḥ pāpmāsīdbāhubhyāṃ tamapāhata
analyzed: tau bāhū sa yaḥ sya abhitas pāpmā āsīt bāhubhyām tam apāhata
translated: They are the two arms; whatever evil there was on both sides of him, that he drove away by his arms;

original: tathaivaitadyajamāno yo 'syābhitaḥ pāpmā bhavati bāhubhyāmeva tamapahate / / /
analyzed: tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ yaḥ sya abhitas pāpmā bhavati bāhubhyām eva tam apahate
translated: and in like manner does the Sacrificer thereby now drive away whatever evil there is on both sides of him by his arms.

original: annam purīṣavatī /
analyzed: annam purīṣavatī
translated: The filling (is) food.

original: sa yo 'syopariṣṭhātpāpmāsīdannena tamapāhāta
analyzed: sa yaḥ sya upariṣṭhāt pāpmā āsīt annena tam apāhāta
translated: Whatever evil there was above him, he removed with food.

original: tathaivaitadyajamāno yo 'syopariṣṭātpāpmā bhavatyannenaiva tamapahate / / /
analyzed: tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ yaḥ sya upariṣṭāt pāpmā bhavati annena eva tam apahate
translated: In the same way the sacrificer now removes with food whatever evil there is above him.

original: sa yaddha vā evaṃvitprāṇiti /🔽yo 'sya purastātpāpmā bhavati taṃ tenāpahate 'tha
analyzed: sa yat ha vai evaṃvid prāṇiti  yaḥ sya purastāt pāpmā bhavati tam tena apahate
translated: Now, when he who knows this breathes out,🔽whatever evil there is in front of him, he removes it thereby;

original: yadapāniti tena taṃ yaḥ paścādatha yadbāhubhyāṃ karma kurute tena taṃ yo 'bhito🔽'tha yadannamatti tena taṃ ya upariṣṭātsarvadā ha vā evaṃvitpāpmānamapahate 'pi
analyzed: yat apāniti tena tam yaḥ paścāt atha yat bāhubhyām karma kurute tena tam yaḥ bhitas  yat annam atti tena tam yaḥ upariṣṭāt sarvadā ha vai evaṃvid pāpmānam apahate pi
translated: and when he breathes in, that which is behind; and when he performs work with his arms, that which is on both sides;🔽and when he eats food, that which is above. He who knows this removes evil at all times,

original: svapaṃstasmādevaṃ viduṣaḥ pāpaṃ na kīrtayennedasya pāpmāsānīti / / /
analyzed: svapan tasmāt evam viduṣaḥ pāpam na kīrtayet na id asya pāpmā āsāni iti
translated: even while sleeping. Therefore one should not proclaim the evil of him who knows this, lest he should become his evil.

original: atha candasyā upadadhāti /🔽etadvai prajāpatiḥ pāpmano
analyzed: atha candasyāḥ upadadhāti  etat vai prajāpatiḥ pāpmanaḥ
translated: Then he lays down the metres.

original: mṛtyormuktvānnamaicattasmādu haitadupatāpī vasīyānbhūtvānnamicati
analyzed: mṛtyoḥ muktvā annam aicat tasmāt u ha etat upatāpī vasīyān bhūtvā annam icati
translated: For Prajapati, having become freed from evil, from death, desired food. Therefore even now one who is ill, having become stronger, desires food.

original: tasminnāśaṃsante 'nnamicati jīviṣyatīti tasmai devā etadannam
analyzed: tasmin āśaṃsante nnam icati jīviṣyati iti tasmai devāḥ etat annam
translated: In him they hope, 'He desires food, he will live.' The gods gave him that food,

original: prāyacannetāścandasyāḥ paśavo vai candāṃsyannam paśavastānyasmā acadayaṃstāni
analyzed: prāyacan etāḥ candasyāḥ paśavaḥ vai candāṃsi annam paśavaḥ tāni asmai acadayan tāni
translated: these metres. The metres are cattle, and cattle are food. They gave them to him. They are

original: yadasmā acadayaṃstasmāccandāṃsi / / /
analyzed: yat asmai acadayan tasmāt candāṃsi
translated: In that they cut it for him, therefore the metres.

original: tā daśadaśopadadhāti /
analyzed: tāḥ daśa daśa upadadhāti
translated: He lays down ten each.

original: daśākṣarā virāḍvirāḍu kṛtsnamannaṃ🔽sarvamevāsminnetatkṛtsnamannaṃ dadhāti sarvata upadadhāti sarvata
analyzed: daśa akṣarā virāj virāju kṛtsnam annam  sarvam eva asmin etat kṛtsnam annam dadhāti sarvatas upadadhāti sarvatas
translated: The Viraj has ten syllables, the Viraj is all food.🔽He places all food entirely in this (Agni). He places (them) on all sides;

original: evāsminnetatkṛtsnamannaṃ dadhāti / / /🔽evaścanda iti /
analyzed: eva asmin etat kṛtsnam annam dadhāti  evaścandaḥ iti
translated: he places all food entirely in this (Agni) on all sides.

original: ayaṃ vai loka evaścando varivaścanda ityantarikṣaṃ vai varivaścandaḥ
analyzed: ayam vai lokaḥ evaścandaḥ varivaḥ candaḥ iti antarikṣam vai varivaḥ candaḥ
translated: The metre 'Eva' (means) this world; the metre 'Varivâ' (means) the atmosphere;

original: śambhūścanda iti dyaurvai śambhūścandaḥ paribhūścanda iti diśo vai paribhūścanda
analyzed: śambhūḥ candaḥ iti dyauḥ vai śambhūḥ candaḥ paribhūḥ candaḥ iti diśaḥ vai paribhūḥ canda
translated: the metre 'Shambhu' (means) the sky; the metre 'Paribhû' (means) the quarters;

original: ācaccanda ityannaṃ vā ācaccando manaścanda iti p rajāpatirvai manaścando
analyzed: ācat candaḥ iti annam vai ācat candaḥ manaḥ candaḥ iti p rajāpatiḥ vai manaḥ cando
translated: the metre 'âcha' (means) food; the metre 'mana' (means) Prajapati;

original: vyacaścanda ityasau vā ādityo vyacaścandaḥ / / /🔽sindhuścanda iti /🔽prāṇo vai sindhuścandaḥ samudraścanda iti mano vai
analyzed: vyacaḥ candaḥ iti asau vai ādityaḥ vyacaḥ candaḥ  sindhuḥ candaḥ iti  prāṇaḥ vai sindhuḥ candaḥ samudraḥ candaḥ iti manaḥ vai
translated: the metre 'vyacha' (means) yonder sun.🔽The metre 'Sindhu' (means) the breath; the metre 'Samudra' (means) the mind;

original: samudraścandaḥ sariraṃ canda iti vāgvai sariraṃ candaḥ kakupcanda iti prāṇo vai
analyzed: samudraḥ candaḥ sariram candaḥ iti vāc vai sariram candaḥ kakubh candaḥ iti prāṇaḥ vai
translated: the metre 'Sarirâ' (means) speech; the metre 'Kakup' (means) the breath;

original: kakupcandastrikakupcanda ityudāno vai trikakupcandaḥ kāvyaṃ canda iti trayī vai🔽vidyā kāvyaṃ cando 'ṅkupaṃ canda ityāpo vā aṅkupaṃ cando 'kṣarapaṅktiścanda🔽ityasau vai loko 'kṣarapaṅktiścandaḥ padapaṅktiścanda ityayaṃ vai lokaḥ
analyzed: kakubh candaḥ trikakubh candaḥ iti udānaḥ vai trikakubh candaḥ kāvyam candaḥ iti trayī vai  vidyā kāvyam cando ṅkupam candaḥ iti āpaḥ vai aṅkupam cando kṣarapaṅktiḥ canda  iti asau vai lokaḥ kṣarapaṅktiḥ candaḥ padapaṅktiḥ candaḥ iti ayam vai lokaḥ
translated: The Kakup metre, the Trikakup metre, the Kavya metre, the Ankup metre, the Aksharapankti metre, the Pada pankti metre. The Trikakup metre is indeed the out-breath. The Kavya metre is the three Vedas.🔽The Ankup metre is indeed the waters. The Aksharapankti metre is indeed this world. The Pada pankti metre is indeed this world.

original: padapaṅktiścando viṣṭārapaṅktiścanda iti diśo vai viṣṭārapaṅktiścandaḥ kṣuro🔽bhrajaścanda ityasau vā ādityaḥ kṣuro bhrajaścanda ācaccandaḥ pracaccanda
