translated: The gods, having built the Virâg altar, ascended it.

original: 'bruvaṃścetayadhvamiti citimicateti vāva tadabruvaṃste cetayamānā nākameva🔽svargaṃ lokamapaśyaṃstamupādadhata sa yaḥ sa nākaḥ svargo loka etāstā
analyzed: bruvan cetayadhvam iti citim icata iti vāva tat abruvan te cetayamānāḥ nākam eva  svargam lokam apaśyan tam upādadhata sa yaḥ sa nākaḥ svargaḥ lokaḥ etāḥ tā
translated: 'Think ye!' he said. 'Think ye on the layer!' is what he said. They, thinking, saw the world of heaven, the Naka, and put it down. That which is the Naka, the world of heaven, are these layers.

original: stomabhāgāstadyadetā upadadhāti nākamevaitatsvargaṃ lokamupadhatte / / /🔽tadyāstisraḥ prathamāḥ /
analyzed: stomabhāgāḥ tat yat etāḥ upadadhāti nākam eva etat svargam lokam upadhatte  tat yāḥ tisraḥ prathamāḥ
translated: 'Speak ye, think ye!'--'We will think, we will build up the altar!'--this is what they said. While thinking, they saw the Nâka, the heavenly world, and put it down. Now that Nâka, the heavenly world, is these (four) sets of Stomas: when he lays down these (bricks), he thereby lays down the Nâka, the heavenly world.

original: ayaṃ sa loko yā dvitīyā antarikṣaṃ tadyāstṛtīyā dyauḥ sā🔽yāścaturthyaḥ prācī sā digyāḥ pañcamyo dakṣiṇā sā yāḥ ṣaṣṭhyaḥ pratīcī sā yāḥ
analyzed: ayam sa lokaḥ yāḥ dvitīyāḥ antarikṣam tat yāḥ tṛtīyāḥ dyauḥ sā  yāḥ caturthyaḥ prācī sā diś yāḥ pañcamyaḥ dakṣiṇā sā yāḥ ṣaṣṭhyaḥ pratīcī sā yāḥ
translated: Now those three (bricks) which are the first are this (terrestrial) world; those which are the second are the air; those which are the third are the sky;

original: saptamya udīcī sā / / /🔽tā vā etāḥ / ekaviṃśatiriṣṭakā ime ca lokā diśaśceme ca vai lokā diśaśca pratiṣṭheme
analyzed: saptamyaḥ udīcī sā  tāḥ vai etāḥ ekaviṃśatiḥ iṣṭakāḥ ime ca lokāḥ diśaḥ ca ime ca vai lokāḥ diśaḥ ca pratiṣṭhā ime
translated: those which are the fourth are the eastern region; those which are the fifth are the southern region; those which are the sixth are the western region; those which are the seventh are the northern region.

original: ca lokā diśaścaikaviṃśastasmādāhuḥ pratiṣṭhaikaviṃśa iti / / /
analyzed: ca lokāḥ diśaḥ ca ekaviṃśaḥ tasmāt āhuḥ pratiṣṭhā ekaviṃśaḥ iti
translated: Now these are twenty-one bricks, and these worlds and the regions are twenty-one; and these worlds and the regions are a foundation: hence they say that the twenty-one is a foundation.

original: atha yā aṣṭāviṣṭakā atiyanti /
analyzed: atha yāḥ aṣṭau iṣṭakāḥ atiyanti
translated: Now as to those eight bricks which are left over.

original: sāṣṭākṣarā gāyatrī brahma gāyatrī
analyzed: sā aṣṭa akṣarā gāyatrī brahma gāyatrī
translated: The Gâyatrî consists of eight syllables, and the Gâyatrî is Brahman;

original: tadyattadbrahmaitattadyadetanmaṇḍalaṃ tapati tadetasminnekaviṃśe pratiṣṭhāyām
analyzed: tat yat tat brahma etat tat yat etat maṇḍalam tapati tat etasmin ekaviṃśe pratiṣṭhāyām
translated: and that which is Brahman is this (sun) which shines yonder, and that (sun) rests on this twenty-one-fold foundation.

original: pratiṣṭhitaṃ tapati tasmānnāvapadyate / / /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhitam tapati tasmāt na avapadyate
translated: It is established and shines, therefore it does not fail.

original: taddhaike / veṣaśrīḥ kṣatrāya kṣatraṃ jinveti triṃśattamīmupadadhati🔽triṃśadakṣarā virāḍvirāḍeṣā citiriti na tathā kuryādati te
analyzed: tat ha eke veṣa śrīḥ kṣatrāya kṣatram jinva iti triṃśattamīm upadadhati  triṃśat akṣarā virāj virāj eṣā citiḥ iti na tathā kuryāt ati te
translated: Now, some put down the thirtieth brick with the verse, May the splendor of the sacrificial post invigorate the Kshatriya for the Kshatriya.

original: recayantyekaviṃśasampadamatho gāyatrīsampadamatho indraloko haiṣa yaiṣānyūnā🔽virāḍindrāya ha ta indraloke dviṣantam bhrātṛvyam pratyudyāminaṃ🔽kurvantīndramindralokānnudante yajamāno vai sve yajña indro yajamānāya ha te
analyzed: recayanti ekaviṃśa sampadam atha u gāyatrī sampadam atha u indra lokaḥ ha eṣa yā eṣā anyūnā  virāj indrāya ha te indra loke dviṣantam bhrātṛvyam pratyudyāminam  kurvanti indram indra lokān nudante yajamānaḥ vai sve yajñe indraḥ yajamānāya ha te
translated: They say, The Viraj has thirty syllables, and this brick is the Viraj. One should not do so, for they would exceed the perfection of the Ekavinça and the perfection of the Gayatri.🔽Now, this (brick) is the kingdom of Indra, which is deficient in the Viraj. For Indra, in the kingdom of Indra, they make an enemy, a rival, to be overcome.

original: yajamānaloke dviṣantam bhrātṛvyam pratyudyāminaṃ kurvanti yajamānaṃ
analyzed: yajamāna loke dviṣantam bhrātṛvyam pratyudyāminam kurvanti yajamānam
translated: They drive away Indra from the kingdom of Indra. Now, the sacrificer is Indra in his own sacrifice. For the sacrificer, in the world of the sacrificer, they make an enemy, a rival, to be overcome.

original: yajamānalokānnudante yaṃ vā etamagnimāharantyeṣa eva yajamāna āyatanenaiṣa u
analyzed: yajamāna lokān nudante yam vai etam agnim āharanti eṣaḥ eva yajamānaḥ āyatanena eṣaḥ u
translated: They drive away the sacrificer from the world of the sacrificer. Now, when they bring this Agni (to the altar), he is the sacrificer himself. By his own abode

original: evātra triṃśattamī / / /
analyzed: eva atra triṃśattamī
translated: he is here the thirtieth.

original: tā aṣāḍhāyai velayopadadhāti /
analyzed: tāḥ aṣāḍhāyai velayā upadadhāti
translated: He puts them down on the border of the Ashâdhâ.

original: vāgvā aṣāḍhā rasa eṣa vāci tadrasaṃ dadhāti
analyzed: vāc vai aṣāḍhāḥ rasaḥ eṣa vāci tat rasam dadhāti
translated: The Ashâdhâ is speech, and this (brick) is sap. He thus puts sap into speech.

original: tasmātsarveṣāmaṅgānāṃ vācaivānnasya rasaṃ vijānāti / / /
analyzed: tasmāt sarveṣām aṅgānām vācā eva annasya rasam vijānāti
translated: Therefore by means of speech one knows the sap of food of all the limbs.🔽.

original: yadvevāṣāḍhāyai /🔽iyaṃ vā aṣāḍhāsāvāditya stomabhāgā amuṃ tadādityamasyām
analyzed: yat u eva aṣāḍhāyai  iyam vai aṣāḍhā asau ādityaḥ stomabhāgā amum tat ādityam asyām
translated: And, again, as to why (he puts down) the Ashadha (bricks).

original: pratiṣṭhāyām pratiṣṭhāpayati / / /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhāyām pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: The Ashadha is this (earth), and the Stomabhâgâs are yonder sun: he thus establishes yonder sun on this (earth) as a foundation.

original: yadvevāṣāḍhāyai /🔽iyaṃ vā aṣāḍhā hṛdayaṃ stomabhāgā asyāṃ taddhṛdayam mano🔽dadhāti tasmādasyāṃ hṛdayena manasā cetayate sarvata upadadhāti
analyzed: yat u eva aṣāḍhāyai  iyam vai aṣāḍhāḥ hṛdayam stomabhāgāḥ asyām tat hṛdayam manaḥ  dadhāti tasmāt asyām hṛdayena manasā cetayate sarvatas upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why (he puts down) the Ashadha (bricks).

original: sarvatastaddhṛdayam mano dadhāti tasmādasyāṃ sarvato hṛdayena manasā cetayate
analyzed: sarvatas tat hṛdayam manaḥ dadhāti tasmāt asyām sarvatas hṛdayena manasā cetayate
translated: The Ashadha is this (earth), and the Stomabhâgâs are the heart: he thus puts the heart, the mind, into this (earth). He puts them down all round: he thus puts the heart, the mind, into this (earth) on every side; whence people think with their heart, with their mind, on every side of this (earth).

original: 'tho puṇyā haitā lakṣmyastā etatsarvato dhatte tasmādyasya sarvato lakṣma bhavati
analyzed: puṇyāḥ ha etāḥ lakṣmyaḥ tāḥ etat sarvatas dhatte tasmāt yasya sarvatas lakṣma bhavati
translated: And, moreover, these are auspicious marks: he thus places them on every side; whence he who has marks on every side,

original: tam puṇyalakṣmīka ityācakṣate / / /
analyzed: tam puṇya lakṣmīkaḥ iti ācakṣate
translated: is called 'of auspicious marks.'

original: athaināḥ purīṣeṇa pracādayati /🔽annaṃ vai purīṣaṃ rasa eṣa tametattiraḥ karoti
analyzed: atha enāḥ purīṣeṇa pracādayati  annam vai purīṣam rasaḥ eṣa tam etat tiras karoti
translated: He then covers them with the (first) layer of earth.🔽The layer of earth is food, and this (brick) is sap: he thus places the sap above the food;

original: tasmāttira ivānnasya rasaḥ / / /
analyzed: tasmāt tiras iva annasya rasaḥ
translated: whence the sap is as it were above the food.

original: yadveva purīṣeṇa /
analyzed: yat u eva purīṣeṇa
translated: And, again, as to why (he covers them with the layer of earth).

original: annaṃ vai purīṣaṃ rasa eṣo 'nnaṃ ca tadrasaṃ ca saṃtanoti
analyzed: annam vai purīṣam rasaḥ eṣaḥ nnam ca tat rasam ca saṃtanoti
translated: The layer of earth is food, and this (brick) is sap: he thus unites the food with the sap,

original: saṃdadhāti / / /
analyzed: saṃdadhāti
translated: he joins them together.

original: yadveva purīṣeṇa /
analyzed: yat u eva purīṣeṇa
translated: And, again, as to why (he covers them with the layer of earth).

original: hṛdayaṃ vai stomabhāgāḥ purītatpurīṣaṃ hṛdayaṃ tatpurītatā
analyzed: hṛdayam vai stomabhāgāḥ purītat purīṣam hṛdayam tat purītatā
translated: The Stomabhâgâs are the heart, the earth is the heart's core: he thus covers the heart with the heart's core.

original: pracādayati / / /
analyzed: pracādayati
translated: He covers it with the earth-fillings.

original: yadveva purīṣeṇa /
analyzed: yat u eva purīṣeṇa
translated: And, again, why (he does so) with the earth-fillings.

original: saṃvatsara eṣo 'gnistametaccitipurīṣairvyāvartayati🔽tadyāścatasraḥ prathamāścitayaste catvāra ṛtavo 'tha stomabhāgā upadhāya purīṣaṃ
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ eṣaḥ gniḥ tam etat citi purīṣaiḥ vyāvartayati  tat yāḥ catasraḥ prathamāḥ citayaḥ te catvāraḥ ṛtavaḥ stomabhāgāḥ upadhāya purīṣam
translated: This Agni is the year: he thus builds him up by means of those layers and earth-fillings.

original: nivapati sā pañcamī citiḥ sa pañcama ṛtuḥ / / /🔽tadāhuḥ / yallokampṛṇāntā anyāścitayo bhavanti nātra lokampṛṇāmupadadhāti kātra
analyzed: nivapati sā pañcamī citiḥ sa pañcamaḥ ṛtuḥ  tat āhuḥ yat lokampṛṇā antāḥ anyāḥ citayaḥ bhavanti na atra lokampṛṇām upadadhāti kā atra
translated: The first four layers are the four seasons; and having laid down the Stomabhâgâs, he pours down the earth-filling,--that is the fifth layer, and the fifth season.

original: lokampṛṇetyasau vā ādityo lokampṛṇaiṣa u eṣā citiḥ saiṣā svayaṃ lokampṛṇā citiratha
analyzed: lokampṛṇā iti asau vai ādityaḥ lokampṛṇā eṣaḥ u eṣā citiḥ sā eṣā svayam lokampṛṇā citiḥ atha
translated: As to this they say, 'Since the other layers are completed by the Lokamprinâ (space-filling bricks), and here he does not lay down a Lokamprinâ, what, then, is the space-filling (layer) here?' The space-filling one, doubtless, is yonder sun, and that layer is he (the sun): that is a self-existent space-filling layer.

original: yadata ūrdhvamā purīṣātsā ṣaṣṭhī citiḥ sa ṣaṣṭha ṛtuḥ / / /
analyzed: yat atas ūrdhvam ā purīṣāt sā ṣaṣṭhī citiḥ sa ṣaṣṭhaḥ ṛtuḥ
translated: And what there is above the earth-filling is the sixth layer, and the sixth season.

original: atha purīṣaṃ nivapati /
analyzed: atha purīṣam nivapati
translated: He then pours down the earth-filling.

original: tatra vikarṇīṃ copadadhāti hiraṇyaśakalaiḥ
analyzed: tatra vikarṇīm ca upadadhāti hiraṇya śakalaiḥ
translated: There he lays down the Vikarnî, and scatters chips of gold (on the layer);

original: prokṣatyagnimabhyādadhāti sā saptamī citiḥ sa saptama ṛtuḥ / / /
analyzed: prokṣati agnim abhyādadhāti sā saptamī citiḥ sa saptamaḥ ṛtuḥ
translated: he sprinkles (the Vikarnî) with water, and puts on the fire: that is the seventh layer, and the seventh season.

original: tā u vai ṣaḍeva /
analyzed: tāḥ u vai ṣaḍ eva
translated: They are, indeed, only six.

original: yaddhi vikarṇī ca svayamātṛṇā ca ṣaṣṭhyā eva tacciteḥ / / /
analyzed: yat hi vikarṇī ca svayamātṛṇā ca ṣaṣṭhyāḥ eva tat citeḥ
translated: For what the Vikarnî and the naturally-perforated (brick) are, that is the sixth layer.

original: tā u vai pañcaiva /
analyzed: tāḥ u vai pañca eva
translated: They are indeed five.

original: yajuṣānyāsu purīṣaṃ nivapati tūṣṇīmatra tenaiṣā na citiratho
analyzed: yajuṣā anyāsu purīṣam nivapati tūṣṇīm atra tena eṣā na citiḥ atho
translated: In the other (layers) he puts down the filling-in with a Yagus formula, here silently; thus this is not a layer.

original: lokampṛṇāntā anyāścitayo bhavanti nātra lokanpṛṇāmupadhāti teno evaiṣā na citiḥ / / /
analyzed: lokampṛṇā antāḥ anyāḥ citayaḥ bhavanti na atra lokanpṛṇām upadhāti tena u eva eṣā na citiḥ
translated: Moreover, the other layers end with the Lokampṛṇās, here he does not put down the Lokampṛṇās; thus this is not a layer.

original: tā u vai tisra eva /🔽ayameva lokaḥ prathamā citirdyauruttamātha yā🔽etāstisrastadantarikṣaṃ tadvā idamekamivaivāntarikṣaṃ tā evaṃ tisra evam pañcaivaṃ
analyzed: tāḥ u vai tisraḥ eva  ayam eva lokaḥ prathamā citiḥ dyauḥ uttamā atha yā  etāḥ tisraḥ tat antarikṣam tat vai idam ekam iva eva antarikṣam tāḥ evam tisraḥ evam pañca evam
translated: They are indeed three.

original: ṣaḍevaṃ sapta / / /
analyzed: ṣaṭ evam sapta
translated: The first layer is this (terrestrial) world, the last the sky; then these three (middle layers) are the air. But this air is as it were one only; thus (the altar) is three, thus five, thus seven.

original: nākasada upadadhāti /🔽devā vai nākasado 'traiṣa sarvo 'gniḥ saṃskṛtaḥ sa eṣo 'tra🔽nākaḥ svargo lokastasmindevā asīdaṃstadyadetasminnāke svarge loke devā🔽asīdaṃstasmāddevā nākasadastathaivaitadyajamāno yadetā
analyzed: nākasadaḥ upadadhāti  devāḥ vai nākasadaḥ u tra eṣa sarvaḥ gniḥ saṃskṛtaḥ saḥ eṣa u tra  nākaḥ svargaḥ lokaḥ tasmin devāḥ asīdan tat yat etasmin nāke svarge loke devā  asīdan tasmāt devāḥ nākasadaḥ tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ yat etā
translated: He puts down the Nâkasad (bricks).

original: upadadhātyetasminnevaitannāke svarge loke sīdati / / /
analyzed: upadadhāti etasmin eva etat nāke svarge loke sīdati
translated: The Nâkasads are the gods; the whole Agni has been completed here: that (altar) is the Nâka, the heavenly world; on that the gods sat down. In that the gods sat down on that Nâka, the heavenly world, therefore the Nâkasads are the gods. And in like manner does the Sacrificer now, in that he puts down these (bricks), sit down on that Nâka, the heavenly world.

original: yadveva nākasada upadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva nākasadaḥ upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he puts down the Nâkasads.

original: etadvai devā etaṃ nākaṃ svargaṃ lokamapaśyannetā
analyzed: etat vai devāḥ etam nākam svargam lokam apaśyan etā
translated: The gods saw that Nâka, the heavenly world, by means of these (bricks), the Nâkasads; and in like manner does the Sacrificer now see that Nâka, the heavenly world, by means of these (bricks), the Nâkasads.

original: stomabhāgāste 'bruvannupa tajjānīta yathāsminnāke svarge loke sīdāmeti te🔽'bruvaṃścetayadhvamiti citimicateti vāva tadabruvaṃstadicata yathāsminnāke svarge
analyzed: stomabhāgāḥ te bruvan upa tat jānīta yathā asmin nāke svarge loke sīdāma iti te  bruvan cetayadhvam iti citim icata iti vāva tat abruvan tat icata yathā asmin nāke svarge
translated: The Stomas said, 'Consider ye this, how we may sit in that world of heaven.'

original: loke sīdāmeti / / /
analyzed: loke sīdāma iti
translated: They said, 'Meditate ye!' whereby doubtless they meant to say, 'Seek ye a layer!' 'Seek ye that, how we may sit in that world of heaven.'

original: te cetayamānāḥ /
analyzed: te cetayamānāḥ
translated: Meditating,

original: etā iṣṭakā apaśyannākasadastā upādadhata tābhiretasminnāke svarge🔽loke 'sīdaṃstadyadetābhiretasminnāke svarge loke 'sīdaṃstasmādetā
analyzed: etāḥ iṣṭakāḥ apaśyan nākasadaḥ tāḥ upādadhata tābhiḥ etasmin nāke svarge  loke sīdan tat yat etābhiḥ etasmin nāke svarge loke sīdan tasmāt etā
translated: they saw these bricks, the 'sitters on the Âkâ (sky),' they laid them down, and by them they sat in that world of heaven. In that by them they sat in that world of heaven,🔽these (bricks) are therefore the 'sitters on the Âkâ (sky).' And in like manner does the Sacrificer, when he lays down these (bricks), sit in that world of heaven.🔽He lays them down in the quarters; for that world of heaven is the quarters: in the world of heaven he thus settles them.🔽In the place of the seasonal (bricks) (he lays them down); for the seasonal (bricks) are the year, and the world of heaven is the year: in the world of heaven he thus settles them.

original: nākasadastathaivaikadyajamāno yadetā upadadhātyetasminnevaitannāke svarge loke
analyzed: nākasadaḥ tathā eva ekat yajamānaḥ yat etāḥ upadadhāti etasmin eva etat nāke svarge loke
translated: In the middle of the Stomas (he lays them down); for that is the world of heaven: in that world of heaven he thus establishes them.

original: sīdati / / /🔽dikṣūpadadhāti /
analyzed: sīdati  dikṣu upadadhāti
translated: He lays them down in the quarters;

original: diśo vai sa nākaḥ svargo lokaḥ svarga evainā etalloke
analyzed: diśaḥ vai sa nākaḥ svargaḥ lokaḥ svarge eva enāḥ etat loke
translated: for that world of heaven is the quarters: in the world of heaven he thus settles them.

original: sādayatyṛtavyānāṃ velayā saṃvatsaro vā ṛtavyāḥ saṃvatsaraḥ svargo lokaḥ svarga evainā
analyzed: sādayati ṛtavyānām velayā saṃvatsaraḥ vai ṛtavyāḥ saṃvatsaraḥ svargaḥ lokaḥ svarge eva enā
translated: In the place of the seasonal (bricks) (he lays them down); for the seasonal (bricks) are the year, and the world of heaven is the year: in the world of heaven he thus settles them.

original: etalloke sādayatyantastomabhāgameṣa vai sa nākaḥ svargo lokastasminnevainā
analyzed: etat loke sādayati anta stomabhāgam eṣa vai sa nākaḥ svargaḥ lokaḥ tasmin eva enā
translated: In the middle of the Stomas (he lays them down); for that is the world of heaven: in that world of heaven he thus establishes them.

original: etatpratiṣṭhāpayati / / /🔽sa purastādupadadhāti /
analyzed: etat pratiṣṭhāpayati 🔽sa purastāt upadadhāti
translated: He lays them down in front;

original: rājñyati prācī digiti rājñī ha nāmaiṣā prācī digvasavaste
analyzed: rājñī ati prācī diś iti rājñī ha nāma eṣā prācī diś vasavaḥ te
translated: The eastern quarter is the Queen, the Vasus are thy people, O Jâtavedas;🔽

original: devā adhipataya iti vasavo haitasya diśo devā adhipatayo 'gnirhetīnām🔽pratidhartetyagnirhaivātra haitīnām pratidhartā trivṛttvā stomaḥ pṛthivyāṃ śrayatviti🔽trivṛtā haiṣā stomena pṛthivyāṃ śritājyamukthamavyathāyai stabhnātvityājyena
analyzed: devāḥ adhipatayaḥ iti vasavaḥ ha etasya diśaḥ devāḥ adhipatayaḥ gniḥ hetīnām  pratidhartā iti agniḥ ha eva atra ha etīnām pratidhartā trivṛt tvā stomaḥ pṛthivyām śrayatu iti  trivṛtā ha eṣā stomena pṛthivyām śritā ājyam uktham a vyathāyai stabhnātu iti ājyena
translated: 'The eastern region is the queen',--the eastern region, doubtless, is called the queen;--'the Vasus are thy deities',--the Vasus, doubtless, are the deities of that region;--'Agni is the repeller of shafts',--Agni, doubtless, is here the repeller of shafts;--'may the threefold hymn rest on the earth!'

original: haiṣokthenāvyathāyai pṛthivyāṃ stabdhā rathantaraṃ sāma pratiṣṭhityā antarikṣa iti
analyzed: ha eṣā ukthena a vyathāyai pṛthivyām stabdhā rathantaram sāma pratiṣṭhityai antarikṣe iti
translated: For by the threefold hymn this (region) is indeed rested upon the earth;--'may the hymn in ghee be firmly established for support!'--For by the hymn in ghee this (region) is indeed firmly established on the earth for support;--'may the Rathantara-sâman be established for support in the air!'

original: rathantareṇa haiṣā sāmnā pratiṣṭhitāntarikṣa ṛṣayastvā prathamajā deveṣviti prāṇā
analyzed: rathantareṇa ha eṣā sāmnā pratiṣṭhitā antarikṣe ṛṣayaḥ tvā prathama jāḥ deveṣu iti prāṇā
translated: For by the Rathantara-sâman this (region) is indeed established in the air;--'the Rishis, the first-born, have placed thee among the gods,'--the Rishis, the first-born, doubtless, are the vital airs;

original: vā ṛṣayaḥ prathamajāstaddhi brahma prathamajaṃ divo mātrayā varimṇā prathantviti
analyzed: vai ṛṣayaḥ prathama jāḥ tat hi brahma prathama jam divaḥ mātrayā varimṇā prathantu iti
translated: for that is the Brahman, the first-born;--'extend thou with the measure, the breadth, of the sky!'

original: yāvatī dyaustāvatīṃ varimṇā prathantvityetadvidhartā cāyamadhipatiśceti vākca tau
analyzed: yāvatī dyauḥ tāvatīm varimṇā prathantu iti etat vidhartā ca ayam adhipatiḥ ca iti vāc ca tau
translated: 'As great as the sky is, so great a breadth extend ye!' this is what he thereby says;--'and this Vidhat and this Adhipati,'--Vidhat and Adhipati, doubtless, are speech and mind;

original: manaśca tau hīdaṃ sarvaṃ vidhārayataste tvā sarve saṃvidānā nākasya pṛṣṭhe svarge
analyzed: manaḥ ca tau hi idam sarvam vidhārayataḥ te tvā sarve saṃvidānāḥ nākasya pṛṣṭhe svarge
translated: And the mind, for it holds all this together. All of them, agreeing, on the back of the vault, in heaven,

original: loke yajamānaṃ ca sādayantviti yathaiva yajustathā bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: loke yajamānam ca sādayantu iti yathā eva yajuḥ tathā bandhuḥ
translated: And mind, for they both support all this. May they all, agreeing together, settle the sacrificer in the world of heaven, in the vault of the sky,'--as the text, so the meaning.

original: atha dakṣiṇataḥ /🔽virāḍasi dakṣiṇā digiti virāḍḍha nāmaiṣā dakṣiṇā digrudrāste🔽devā adhipataya iti rudrā haitasya diśo devā adhipataya indro hetīnām🔽pratidhartetīndro haivātra hetīnām pratidhartā pañcadaśastvā stomaḥ pṛthivyāṃ
analyzed: atha dakṣiṇatas  virāj asi dakṣiṇā diś iti virāj ha nāma eṣā dakṣiṇā diś rudrāḥ te  devāḥ adhipatayaḥ iti rudrāḥ ha etasya diśaḥ devāḥ adhipatayaḥ indraḥ hetīnām  pratidhartā iti indraḥ ha eva atra hetīnām pratidhartā pañcadaśaḥ tvā stomaḥ pṛthivyām
translated: 'Then on the right (south) side,--

original: śrayatviti pañcadaśena haiṣā stomena pṛthivyāṃ śritā praugamukthamavyathāyai🔽stabhnātviti praugeṇa haiṣokthenāvyathāyai pṛthivyāṃ stabdhā bṛhatsāma🔽pratiṣṭhityā antarikṣa iti bṛhatā haiṣā sāmnā pratiṣṭhitāntarikṣa ṛṣayastvā🔽prathamajā deveṣviti tasyokto bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: śrayatu iti pañcadaśena ha eṣā stomena pṛthivyām śritā praugam uktham a vyathāyai  stabhnātu iti praugeṇa ha eṣā ukthena a vyathāyai pṛthivyām stabdhā bṛhatsāma  pratiṣṭhityai antarikṣe iti bṛhatā ha eṣā sāmnā pratiṣṭhitā antarikṣe ṛṣayaḥ tvā  prathama jāḥ deveṣu iti tasya uktaḥ bandhuḥ
translated: 'Thou art the all-supporting, the southern region,'--the all-supporting, doubtless, is the name of this southern region;--'the Rudras are thy lords,'--the Rudras, doubtless, are the lords of this region;--'Indra is the repeller of shafts,'--Indra, doubtless, is here the repeller of shafts;--'the fifteenfold hymn may settle thee on the earth!'--by the fifteenfold hymn this (region) is indeed settled on the earth;--'the Prauga hymn for the sake of firmness,'--by the Prauga hymn this (region) is indeed firmly settled on the earth;--'the Brihat-sâman for support in the air,'--by the Brihat-sâman this (region) is indeed supported in the air;--'the Rishis, thy first-born, among the gods,'--the meaning of this has been told.

original: atha paścāt /
analyzed: atha paścāt
translated: 'Then on the left (west) side,--🔽'Thou art the all-embracing, the western region,'--the all-embracing, doubtless, is the name of this western region;--'the Vasus are thy lords,'--the Vasus, doubtless, are the lords of this region;--'Varuṇa is the repeller of shafts,'--Varuṇa, doubtless, is here the repeller of shafts;--'the seventeenfold hymn may settle thee on the air,'--by the seventeenfold hymn this (region) is indeed settled on the air;--'the Vairûpa-sâman for support in the sky,'--by the Vairûpa-sâman this (region) is indeed supported in the sky;--'the Pitrs, thy first-born, among the gods,'--the meaning of this has been told.

original: samrāḍasi pratīcī digiti samrāḍḍha nāmaiṣā pratīci digādityāste devā🔽adhipataya ityādityā haitasyai diśo devā adhipatayo varuṇo hetīnām pratidharteti
analyzed: samrāj asi pratīcī diś iti samrāj ha nāma eṣā pratīci diś ādityāḥ te devā  adhipataye iti ādityāḥ ha etasyai diśaḥ devāḥ adhipatayaḥ varuṇaḥ hetīnām pratidhartā iti
translated: Thou art the emperor, the western region,'--the western region, doubtless, is called the emperor, and the Âdityas are the gods of that region;

original: varuṇo haivātra hetīnām pratidhartā saptadaśastvā stomaḥ pṛthivyāṃ śrayatviti🔽saptadaśena haiṣā stomena pṛthivyāṃ śritā marutvatīyamukthamavyathāyai
analyzed: varuṇaḥ ha eva atra hetīnām pratidhartā saptadaśaḥ tvā stomaḥ pṛthivyām śrayatu iti  saptadaśena ha eṣā stomena pṛthivyām śritā marutvatīyam uktham a vyathāyai
translated: 'they are the overlords,'--the Âdityas, doubtless, are the overlords of that region;--'Varuṇa is the repeller of missiles,'--Varuṇa, doubtless, is here the repeller of missiles;--'may the Saptadasa-stoma settle thee on earth!'

original: stabhnātviti marutvatīyena haiṣokthenāvyathāyai pṛthivyāṃ stabdhā vairūpaṃ sāma🔽pratiṣṭhityā antarikṣa iti vairūpeṇa haiṣā sāmnā pratiṣṭhitāntarikṣa ṛṣayastvā
analyzed: stabhnātu iti marutvatīyena ha eṣā ukthena a vyathāyai pṛthivyām stabdhā vairūpam sāma  pratiṣṭhityai antarikṣe iti vairūpeṇa ha eṣā sāmnā pratiṣṭhitā antarikṣe ṛṣayaḥ tvā
translated: for by the Saptadasa-stoma this (earth) is indeed settled on earth;--'the Marutvatîya hymn for support,'--by the Marutvatîya hymn this (earth) is indeed supported for support;--'the Vairûpa-sâman,'

original: prathamajā deveṣviti tasyokto bandhuḥ / / /🔽athottarataḥ svarāḍasyudīcī digiti svarāḍḍha nāmaiṣodīcī diṅmarutaste devā
analyzed: prathama jāḥ deveṣu iti tasya uktaḥ bandhuḥ  atha uttaratas svarāj asi udīcī diś iti svarāj ha nāma eṣā udīcī diś marutaḥ te devā
translated: 'for stability in the air,'--by the Vairûpa-sâman this (earth) is indeed established in the air;--'the Rishis, thy first-born, among the gods,'--the meaning of this has been explained .🔽Then on the north side (he lays down one) with , 'Thou art the self-ruling, the northern region,'--the northern region, doubtless, is called the self-ruling, and the Maruts are the gods of that region;

original: adhipataya iti maruto haitasyai diśo devā adhipatayaḥ somo hetīnām pratidharteti
analyzed: adhipatayaḥ iti marutaḥ ha etasyai diśaḥ devāḥ adhipatayaḥ somaḥ hetīnām pratidhartā iti
translated: 'they are the overlords,'--the Maruts, doubtless, are the overlords of that region;--'Soma is the repeller of missiles,'--

original: somo haivātra hetīnām pratidhartaikaviṃśastvā stomaḥ pṛthivyāṃ🔽śrayatvityekaviṃśena haiṣā stomena pṛthivyāṃ śritā niṣkevalyamukthamavyathāyai
analyzed: somaḥ ha eva atra hetīnām pratidhartā ekaviṃśaḥ tvā stomaḥ pṛthivyām  śrayatu iti ekaviṃśena ha eṣā stomena pṛthivyām śritā niṣkevalyam uktham a vyathāyai
translated: Soma indeed is the supporter of weapons here. The Ekavimsa Stoma, may it rest on the earth. By the Ekavimsa Stoma he is indeed supported on the earth. The Niskakuliya Uktha for the sake of freedom from pain.

original: stabhnātviti niṣkevalyena haiṣokthenāvyathāyai pṛthivyāṃ stabdhā vai rājaṃ sāma🔽pratiṣṭhityā antarikṣa iti vairājena haiṣā sāmnā pratiṣṭhitāntarikṣa ṛṣayastvā
analyzed: stabhnātu iti niṣkevalyena ha eṣā ukthena a vyathāyai pṛthivyām stabdhāḥ vai rājam sāma  pratiṣṭhityai antarikṣe iti vairājena ha eṣā sāmnā pratiṣṭhitā antarikṣe ṛṣayaḥ tvā
translated: Soma indeed is the supporter of weapons here. The Ekavimsa Stoma, let it rest on the earth. By the Ekavimsa Stoma, indeed, it rests on the earth. The Niskevalya Uktha, let it be firmly established for non-decay. By the Niskevalya Uktha, indeed, it is firmly established on the earth for non-decay. The Vairaja Saman, O King,

original: prathamajā deveṣviti tasyokto bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: prathama jāḥ deveṣu iti tasya uktaḥ bandhuḥ
translated: is firmly established for support in the atmosphere. By the Vairaja Saman, indeed, it is firmly established in the atmosphere for support. The Rishis, your firstborn among the gods. The connection of that has been explained.

original: atha madhye /🔽adhipatnyasi bṛhatī digityadhipatnī ha nāmaiṣā bṛhatī digviśve te🔽devā adhipataya iti viśve haitasyai diśo devā adhipatayo bṛhaspatirhetīnā
analyzed: atha madhye  adhipatnī asi bṛhatī diś iti adhipatnī ha nāma eṣā bṛhatī diś viśve te  devāḥ adhipatayaḥ iti viśve ha etasyai diśaḥ devāḥ adhipatayaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ hetīnā
translated: Now in the middle.🔽You are the overlord, the great direction. The great direction is indeed named the overlord. All the gods

original: pratidharteti bṛhaspatirhaivātra hetīnām pratidhartā triṇavatrayastriṃśau tvā stomau
analyzed: pratidhartā iti bṛhaspatiḥ ha eva atra hetīnām pratidhartā triṇava trayastriṃśau tvā stomau
translated: are your overlords. All the gods indeed are the overlords of this direction. Brihaspati is the supporter of weapons. Brihaspati indeed is the supporter of weapons here. The Trinava and Trayastrimsa Stomas,

original: pṛthivyāṃ śrayatāmiti triṇavatrayastriṃśābhyāṃ haiṣā stomābhyām pṛthivyāṃ śritā
analyzed: pṛthivyām śrayatām iti triṇava trayastriṃśābhyām ha eṣā stomābhyām pṛthivyām śritā
translated: let them rest on the earth. By the Trinava and Trayastrimsa Stomas, indeed, it rests on the earth.

original: vaiśvadevāgnimārute ukthe avyathāyai stabhnītāmiti vaiśvadevāgnimārutābhyāṃ🔽haiṣokthābhyāmavyathāyai pṛthivyāṃ stabdhā śākvararaivate sāmanī pratiṣṭhityā🔽antarikṣa iti śākvararaivatābhyāṃ haiṣā sāmabhyām pratiṣṭhitāntarikṣa ṛṣayastvā
analyzed: vaiśvadeva āgnimārute ukthe a vyathāyai stabhnītām iti vaiśvadeva āgnimārutābhyām  ha eṣā ukthābhyām a vyathāyai pṛthivyām stabdhā śākvara raivate sāmanī pratiṣṭhityā  antarikṣe iti śākvara raivatābhyām ha eṣā sāmabhyām pratiṣṭhitā antarikṣe ṛṣayaḥ tvā
translated: The two verses addressed to the Visve devâh and to the Maruts, In the Uktha, for unshaken stability, are for the stability of the earth by the two Ukthas addressed to the Visve devâh and to the Maruts.🔽 The two Sâmans, the Sâkvara and the Raivata, are for the support of the earth, on the earth.🔽 The two Sâmans, the Sâkvara and the Raivata, are for the support of the air, in the air. The Rishis have established thee,🔽

original: prathamajā deveṣviti tasyokto bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: prathama jāḥ deveṣu iti tasya uktaḥ bandhuḥ
translated: The Vaisvadeva and the Marutvatîya (bricks) with the two Ukthas, 'For unshaken stability,'--the Vaisvadeva and the Marutvatîya (bricks) are the two Ukthas, and on these two Ukthas this (earth) is firmly fixed for unshaken stability. The Sâkvara and Raivata (chants) with the two Sâmans, 'For unshaken stability in the air,'--the Sâkvara and Raivata (chants) are the two Sâmans, and on these two Sâmans this (earth) is firmly fixed in the air. The Rishis, your first-born, among the gods,'--the meaning of this has been explained .

original: etāvānvai sarvo yajñaḥ /🔽yajña u devānāmātmā yajñameva taddevā ātmānaṃ🔽kṛtvaitasminnāke svarge loke 'sīdaṃstathaivaitadyajamāno yajñamevātmānaṃ
analyzed: etāvān vai sarvaḥ yajñaḥ  yajñaḥ u devānām ātmā yajñam eva tat devāḥ ātmānam  kṛtvā etasmin nāke svarge loke sīdan tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ yajñam eva ātmānam
translated: So much, indeed, is the whole sacrifice.

original: kṛtvaitasminnāke svarge loke sīdati / / /
analyzed: kṛtvā etasmin nāke svarge loke sīdati
translated: The sacrifice is the body of the gods: having made the sacrifice their body, the gods then sat down on that world of heaven; and in like manner does the Sacrificer, having made the sacrifice his body, now sit down on that world of heaven.

original: atha pañcacūḍā upadadhāti /🔽yajño vai nākasado yajña u eva pañcacūḍāstadya ime🔽catvāra ṛtvijo gṛhapatipañcamāste nākasado hotrāḥ pañcacūḍā atiriktaṃ vai
analyzed: atha pañcacūḍāḥ upadadhāti  yajñaḥ vai nākasadaḥ yajñe u eva pañcacūḍāḥ tat ye ime  catvāraḥ ṛtvijaḥ gṛhapati pañcamāḥ te nākasadaḥ hotrāḥ pañcacūḍāḥ atiriktam vai
translated: He then lays down the Pañkakûdâs (five-hipped bricks).

original: tadyaddhotrā yadu vā atiriktaṃ cūḍaḥ sa tadyatpañcātiriktā tasmātpañcacūḍāḥ / / /
analyzed: tat yat hotrā yat u vai atiriktam cūḍaḥ sa tat yat pañca atiriktā tasmāt pañcacūḍāḥ
translated: The world of heaven, doubtless, is the sacrifice, and the Pañkakûdâs are the sacrifice itself. Now, those four sacrificial priests, with the householder as the fifth, are the world of heaven; and the four Hotras are the Pañkakûdâs. But what is redundant is a crest-jewel: hence, inasmuch as they are five, and are redundant, they are the Pañkakûdâs.

original: yadveva nākasatpañcacūḍā upadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva nākasad pañcacūḍāḥ upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Nâkasad and Pañkakûdâs.

original: ātmā vai nākasado mithunam pañcacūḍā
analyzed: ātmā vai nākasadaḥ mithunam pañcacūḍā
translated: The Nâkasads are the self, and the Pañkakûdâs are the pair.

original: ardhamu haitadātmano yanmithunaṃ yadā vai saha mithunenātha sarvo 'tha kṛtsnaḥ
analyzed: ardham u ha etat ātmanaḥ yat mithunam yadā vai saha mithunena atha sarvaḥ kṛtsnaḥ
translated: For the pair is half of the self; and when one is with a pair, then he is whole, then he is complete.

original: kṛtsnatāyai / / /
analyzed: kṛtsna tāyai
translated: (He lays them down) for the completeness (of the altar).

original: yadveva nākasatpañcacūḍā upadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva nākasad pañcacūḍāḥ upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Nâkasad and Pañkakûdâs.

original: ātmā vai nākasadaḥ prajā pañcacūḍā atiriktaṃ
analyzed: ātmā vai nākasadaḥ prajā pañcacūḍāḥ atiriktam
translated: The Nâkasads are the self, and the Pañkakûdâs are the offspring.

original: vai tadātmano yatprajā yadu vā atiriktaṃ cūḍaḥ sa
analyzed: vai tat ātmanaḥ yat prajāḥ yat u vai atiriktam cūḍaḥ sa
translated: For the offspring is an addition to the self; and what is an addition is a crest.

original: tadyatpañcātiriktāstasmātpañcacūḍāḥ / / /
analyzed: tat yat pañca atiriktāḥ tasmāt pañcacūḍāḥ
translated: And inasmuch as they are five in number, and an addition, they are the Pañkakûdâs.

original: yadveva nākasatpañcacūḍā upadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva nākasad pañcacūḍāḥ upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Nâkasad and Pañkakûdâs.

original: diśo vai nākasado diśa u eva
analyzed: diśaḥ vai nākasadaḥ diśaḥ u eva
translated: The Nâkasads are the regions, and the Pañkakûdâs are the regions.

original: pañcacūḍāstadyā amuṣmādādityādarvācyaḥ pañca diśastā nākasado yāḥ parācyastāḥ🔽pañcacūḍā atiriktā vai tā diśo yā amuṣmādādityātparācyo yadu vā atiriktaṃ cūḍaḥ sa
analyzed: pañcacūḍāḥ tat yāḥ amuṣmāt ādityāt arvācyaḥ pañca diśaḥ tāḥ nākasadaḥ yāḥ parācyaḥ tāḥ  pañcacūḍāḥ atiriktāḥ vai tāḥ diśaḥ yāḥ amuṣmāt ādityāt parācyaḥ yat u vai atiriktam cūḍaḥ sa
translated: Now those five regions which are on this side of yonder sun are the Nâkasads, and those which are on the other side are the Pañkakûdâs.🔽For those regions which are on the other side of yonder sun are an addition, and what is an addition is a crest.

original: tadyatpañcātiriktāstasmātpañcacūḍāḥ / / /
analyzed: tat yat pañca atiriktāḥ tasmāt pañcacūḍāḥ
translated: And inasmuch as they are five in number, and an addition, they are the Pañkakûdâs.

original: yadveva pañcacūḍā upadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva pañcacūḍāḥ upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Pañkakûdâs.

original: etadvai devā abibhayuryadvai na
analyzed: etat vai devāḥ abibhayuḥ yat vai na
translated: For the gods were afraid lest the Rakshas, the evil spirits, should destroy that (Agni, the altar), when built up in this way. They said,

original: imāṃlokānupariṣṭādrakṣāṃsi nāṣṭrā na hanyuriti ta etāneṣāṃ🔽lokānāmupariṣṭādgoptṝ/🔽nakurvata ya ete hetayaśca prahetayaśca🔽tathaivaitadyajamāna etāneṣāṃ lokānāmupariṣṭādgoptṝ/🔽nkurute ya ete hetayaśca
analyzed: imān lokān upariṣṭāt rakṣāṃsi nāṣṭrāḥ na hanyuḥ iti te etān eṣām  lokānām upariṣṭāt goptṝ  nakurvata ye ete hetayaḥ ca prahetayaḥ ca  tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ etān eṣām lokānām upariṣṭāt goptṝ  n kurute ye ete hetayaḥ ca
translated: lest the Rakshas, the fiends, should smite these worlds from above. They made these (verses) the guardians above these worlds, these which begin with 'The swift one' and end with 'The swifter one.'🔽In like manner does the Sacrificer now make these (verses) the guardians above these worlds, these which begin with 'The swift one' and end with 'The swifter one.'

original: prahetayaśca / / /
analyzed: prahetayaḥ ca

analyzed: ātmā triṣṭubhaḥ nūkam jagatyaḥ pakṣau paṅktayaḥ tha etāsām
translated: the Trishtubhs its body, the Gagatîs its back, the Paṅktis its wings. Now as to these (verses).

original: kakubhāṃ catvāri catvāryakṣarāṇyādāyāticandasyupadadhāti sā sāticandā eva bhavati
analyzed: kakubhām catvāri catvāri akṣarāṇi ādāya aticandasī upadadhāti sā sā aticandā eva bhavati
translated: Having taken four syllables from each of the quarters, he puts down the Atichandas; that is indeed the Atichandas.

original: gāyatrya itarāḥ sampadyante saiva gāyatryaśītiryā bṛhatyaḥ sā bārhatī yā uṣṇihaḥ
analyzed: gāyatryaḥ itarāḥ sampadyante sā eva gāyatrī aśītiḥ yāḥ bṛhatyaḥ sā bārhatī yāḥ uṣṇihaḥ
translated: The others are composed of Gayatri verses; that is the Gayatri of eighty; the Brihatis are the Brihatîs; the Ushnihs are the Ushnih.

original: sauṣṇihyatha yadvaśo yadardharcau yadaindrāgnaṃ yadāvapanaṃ tadaticandā atha
analyzed: sā auṣṇihī atha yat vaśaḥ yat ardharcau yat aindrāgnam yat āvapanam tat aticandāḥ atha
translated: And what is Vasha, what is Ardharcha, what is Aindragna, what is Avapana, that is Atichandas.

original: yannado yatsūdadohā yatpadanuṣaṅgā yatkiṃcātrānuṣṭupkarmīṇaṃ tadanuṣṭubhaḥ / / /
analyzed: yat nadaḥ yat sūdadohāḥ yat pad anuṣaṅgā yat kiṃca atra anuṣṭubh karmīṇam tat anuṣṭubhaḥ
translated: And what is Nada, what is Sudadoha, what are Padanushankas, and whatever else is composed of Anushtubh verses, that is Anushtubhs.

original: pratiṣṭhā dvipadāḥ /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhā dvipadāḥ
translated: The Dvipadâs are the foundation.

original: etāvadvai mahaduktham mahadukthaṃ śrīḥ sarvāmevāsmā etāṃ
analyzed: etāvat vai mahat uktham mahat uktham śrīḥ sarvām eva asmai etām
translated: So much is the great hymn; the great hymn is prosperity; all that prosperity

original: devāḥ prāyacaṃstathaivāsmā ayametāṃ sarvāṃ śriyam prayacati / / /
analyzed: devāḥ prāyacan tathā eva asmai ayam etām sarvām śriyam prayacati
translated: the gods bestowed on him; in the same way does this one bestow on him all that prosperity.

original: yadveva candasyā upadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva candasyāḥ upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he puts down the metres.

original: etadvai devā etaṃ nākaṃ svargaṃ lokamapaśyannetā🔽stomabhāgāstasminnaviśaṃsteṣāṃ viśatām prajāpatiruttamo 'viśatsa yaḥ sa
analyzed: etat vai devāḥ etam nākam svargam lokam apaśyan etā  stomabhāgāḥ tasmin aviśan teṣām viśatām prajāpatiḥ uttamaḥ viśat sa yaḥ sa
translated: The gods saw that world of heaven, that world of heaven which is yonder sun;

original: prajāpatiretāstāścandasyāḥ / / /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ etāḥ tāḥ candasyāḥ
translated: they entered it by these Stomas and Sâmans. Of them as they entered Prajapati entered last. He who is that Prajapati,🔽he is these metres.

original: tasya śiro gāyatryaḥ /
analyzed: tasya śiraḥ gāyatryaḥ
translated: His head are the Gâyatrîs;

original: tā yadgāyatryo bhavanti gāyatraṃ hiśirastisro bhavanti trivṛddhi
analyzed: tāḥ yat gāyatryaḥ bhavanti gāyatram hiśiraḥ tisraḥ bhavanti trivṛt hi
translated: In that they are Gâyatrîs, for the head is Gâyatra. There are three (verses), for the head is three-fold.

original: śiraḥ pūrvārdha upadadhāti purastāddhīdaṃ śiraḥ / / /
analyzed: śiraḥ pūrva ardhe upadadhāti purastāt hi idam śiraḥ
translated: He places them in the front part (of the altar), for the head is here in front.

original: urastriṣṭubhaḥ /🔽tā retaḥsicorvelayopadadhāti pṛṣṭayo vai retaḥsicā uro vai prati
analyzed: uraḥ triṣṭubhaḥ  tāḥ retaḥsicoḥ velayā upadadhāti pṛṣṭayaḥ vai retaḥsicau uraḥ vai prati
translated: The chest is Trishtubhs.

original: pṛṣṭayaḥ / / /
analyzed: pṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: He places them on the range of the Retahsik (bricks), for the Retahsik are the ribs, and the chest is in front of the ribs.🔽(He places them) on the range of the Retahsik, for the ribs are the chest.

original: śroṇī jagatyaḥ /🔽sa yāvati purastātsvayamātṛṇāyai triṣṭubha upadadhāti tāvati🔽paścājjagatīryo vā ayam madhye prāṇastadeṣā svayamātṛṇā yāvatyu vā
analyzed: śroṇī jagatyaḥ  sa yāvati purastāt svayamātṛṇāyai triṣṭubhe upadadhāti tāvati  paścāt jagatīḥ yaḥ vai ayam madhye prāṇaḥ tat eṣā svayamātṛṇā vā
translated: The hips are Gagatîs.

original: etasmātprāṇātpurastādurastāvati paścācroṇī / / /
analyzed: etasmāt prāṇāt purastāt urastāvati paścācroṇī
translated: As many Trishtubhs as he places in front of the naturally-perforated (brick), so many Gagatîs he places behind it. Now that naturally-perforated (brick) is this breath in the middle (of the body); and as great as this breath is in front, so great are the hips behind it.

original: sakthyāvanuṣṭubhaḥ /🔽tā anantarhitā jagatībhya upadadhātyanantarhite tacroṇibhyaṃ
analyzed: sakthyau anuṣṭubhaḥ  tāḥ an antarhitāḥ jagatībhyaḥ upadadhāti an antarhite tat roṇibhyaḥ
translated: The thighs are Anushtubhs.

original: sakthyo dadhāti / / /
analyzed: sakthyaḥ dadhāti
translated: He places them so as not to be separated from the Gagatîs, and thus he places the thighs not separated from the hips.

original: parśavo bṛhatyaḥ /🔽kīkasāḥ kakubhaḥ so 'ntareṇa triṣṭubhaśca kakubhaśca
analyzed: parśavaḥ bṛhatyaḥ  kīkasāḥ kakubhaḥ saḥ u ntareṇa triṣṭubhaḥ ca kakubhaḥ ca
translated: The ribs are Brihatîs.

original: bṛhatīrupadadhāti tasmādimā ubhayatra parśavo baddhāḥ kīkasāsu ca jatruṣu ca / / /
analyzed: bṛhatīḥ upadadhāti tasmāt imāḥ ubhayatra parśavaḥ baddhāḥ kīkasāsu ca jatruṣu ca
translated: The false ribs are Kakubhs. He places the Brihatîs between the Trishtubhs and the Kakubhs: hence the ribs are fastened on both sides, to the false ribs and to the breast-bone.

original: grīvā uṣṇihaḥ /
analyzed: grīvāḥ uṣṇihaḥ
translated: The neck is Ushnih.

original: tā anantarhitā gāyatrībhya upadadhātyanantarhitāstacīrṣṇo grīvā
analyzed: tāḥ an antarhitāḥ gāyatrībhyaḥ upadadhāti an antarhitā asta cīrṣṇaḥ grīvā
translated: He lays them down not separated from the Gâyatrîs; for the neck is not separated from the head.

original: dadhāti / / /
analyzed: dadhāti
translated: He places them so as not to be separated from the Gâyatrîs; he thus places the neck of the head so as not to be separated from the shoulders.

original: pakṣau paṅktayaḥ /🔽tā yatpaṅktayo bhavanti pāṅktau hi pakṣau pārśvata upadadhāti🔽pārśvato hīmau pakṣau yadvarṣīyaścandastaddakṣiṇata upadadhāti dakṣiṇaṃ
analyzed: pakṣau paṅktayaḥ  tāḥ yat paṅktayaḥ bhavanti pāṅktau hi pakṣau pārśvatas upadadhāti  pārśvatas hi imau pakṣau yat varṣīyaḥ candaḥ tat dakṣiṇatas upadadhāti dakṣiṇam
translated: The Pânktis are the wings.

original: tadardham paśorvīryavattaraṃ karoti tasmāddakṣiṇo 'rdhaḥ paśovīryavattaraḥ / / /
analyzed: tad ardham paśoḥ vīryavattaram karoti tasmāt dakṣiṇaḥ ṛdhaḥ paśoḥ vīryavattaraḥ
translated: And as to why they are Pânktis,--the wings are made up of five parts, and he places them on the sides, for these wings are on the sides. And because the Pânkti is the most extended metre, he places it on the right (south) side; for that is the right side of the animal: he thus makes that side the more vigorous, and hence that side of the animal is the more vigorous.

original: udaramaticandāḥ /🔽paśavo vai candāṃsyannam paśava udaraṃ vā annamattyudaraṃ hi🔽vā annamatti tasmādyadodaramannam prāpnotyatha tajjagdhaṃ yātayāmarūpam🔽bhavati tadyadeṣā paśūṃścandāṃsyatti tasmādatticandā atticandā ha vai tāmaticandā
analyzed: udaram aticandāḥ  paśavaḥ vai candāṃsi annam paśavaḥ udaram vai annam atti udaram hi  vai annam atti tasmāt yadā udaram annam prāpnoti atha tat jagdham yātayāma rūpam  bhavati tat yat eṣā paśūn candāṃsi atti tasmāt atticandā atticandā ha vai tām aticandā
translated: The Atichandas is the belly.

original: ityācakṣate paro 'kṣam paro 'kṣakāmā hi devāḥ / / /
analyzed: iti ācakṣate parokṣam parokṣa kāmāḥ hi devāḥ
translated: The metres are cattle, and cattle are food; and the belly is food, for the belly eats food. And hence, when the belly gets food, then that which has been eaten becomes worn out and disfigured. And inasmuch as it eats (â-dyati) cattle, the metres, it is therefore (âti-) chandas (metre). And the Atichandas, indeed, they call that (belly) by a mystic name, for the gods love the mystic name.

original: yoniḥ purīṣavatī /
analyzed: yoniḥ purīṣavatī
translated: The womb is the earth-fillings.

original: te saṃsoṛṣṭe upadadhāti saṃspṛṣṭe hyudaraṃ ca yoniśca
analyzed: te saṃsoṛṣṭe upadadhāti saṃspṛṣṭe hi udaram ca yoniḥ ca
translated: He places them so as to touch, for the belly and the womb touch each other.

original: purīśasaṃhite bhavato māṃsaṃ vai purīṣam māṃsena vā udaraṃ ca yoniśca saṃhite
analyzed: purīśa saṃhite bhavataḥ māṃsam vai purīṣam māṃsena vai udaram ca yoniḥ ca saṃhite
translated: The two (bricks) are the belly and the womb, for the belly and the womb are joined together.

original: pūrvāticandā bhavatyaparā purīṣavatyuttaraṃ hyudaramadharā yoniḥ / / /
analyzed: pūrvā aticandā bhavati aparā purīṣavatī uttaram hi udaram adharā yoniḥ
translated: The first is over-filled, the second is full of excrement, for the belly is above, the womb is below.

original: te prācyā upadadhāti /
analyzed: te prācyau upadadhāti
translated: He puts them down on the east side,

original: prāṅ hyeṣo 'gniścīyate 'tho prāgvai prāca udaram prācī
analyzed: prāṅ hi eṣaḥ agniḥ cīyate prāk vai prācaḥ udaram prācī
translated: for this Agni is built from the east, and moreover the belly is in front, the womb is in front.

original: yonirbahistomabhāgaṃ hṛdayaṃ vai stomabhāgā hṛdayamu vā uttamathodaramatha
analyzed: yoniḥ bahis tomabhāgam hṛdayam vai stomabhāgāḥ hṛdayam u vai uttam atha udaram atha
translated: The Stomabhâgâs are the heart, and the Stomabhâgâs are the highest, then the belly, then

original: yoniḥ / / /
analyzed: yoniḥ
translated: the womb.

original: te dakṣiṇataḥ svayamātṛṇāyā upadadhāti /
analyzed: te dakṣiṇatas svayamātṛṇāyāḥ upadadhāti
translated: He puts them down on the south side of the naturally-perforated (brick),

original: atha prathamāyāṃ citā uttararaḥ🔽svayamātṛṇāyā udaraṃ ca yoniṃ copadadhāti yo vā ayam madhye prāṇastadeṣā
analyzed: atha prathamāyām citau uttararaḥ  svayamātṛṇāyāḥ udaram ca yonim ca upadadhāti yaḥ vai ayam madhye prāṇaḥ tat eṣā
translated: then on the first layer, on the south side of the naturally-perforated (brick),

original: svayamātṛṇaitasya tatprāṇasyobhayata udaraṃ ca yoniṃ ca dadhāti tasmādetasya
analyzed: svayamātṛṇā etasya tat prāṇasya ubhayatas udaram ca yonim ca dadhāti tasmāt etasya
translated: he puts down the belly and the womb; that which is this breath in the middle, that is this naturally-perforated (brick); on both sides of that breath he thus places the belly and the womb; therefore on both sides of this breath

original: prāṇasyobhayata udaraṃ ca yoniśca / / /🔽pratiṣṭhā dvipadāḥ /
analyzed: prāṇasya ubhayatas udaram ca yoniḥ ca  pratiṣṭhā dvipadāḥ
translated: there is the belly and the womb.🔽The two-footed (bricks) are the support.

original: tā yaddvipadā bhavanti dvandvaṃ hi pratiṣṭhā tisro bhavanti
analyzed: tāḥ yat dvi padāḥ bhavanti dvandvam hi pratiṣṭhā tisraḥ bhavanti
translated: The reason why they are two-footed is that the support is in pairs; they are three in number,

original: trivṛddhi pratiṣṭhā paścādupadadhāti paścādhīyam pratiṣṭhā / / /
analyzed: trivṛt hi pratiṣṭhā paścāt upadadhāti paścā adhi iyam pratiṣṭhā
translated: He lays down the Trivrit on the back part; the back part is the support of this (universe);

original: so 'syaiṣa sukṛta ātmā /🔽tadyasya haitamevaṃ sukṛtamātmānaṃ kurvantyetaṃ ha sa🔽sukṛtamātmānamabhisambhavatyatha yasya haitamato 'nyathā kurvanti duṣkṛtaṃ ha
analyzed: saḥ sya eṣa su kṛtaḥ ātmā  tat yasya ha etam evam su kṛtam ātmānam kurvanti etam ha sa  sukṛtam ātmānam abhisambhavati atha yasya ha etam atas nyathā kurvanti duṣkṛtam ha
translated: this is his well-made self.🔽He who makes for him this well-made self, he attains🔽this well-made self. But he who makes for him this in a different way, he makes for him a badly-made self;

original: tasyātmānaṃ kurvanti sa ha sa duṣkṛtamevātmānamabhisambhavati / / /
analyzed: tasya ātmānam kurvanti sa ha sa duṣkṛtam eva ātmānam abhisambhavati
translated: he attains this badly-made self.

original: tadete sāmanidhane abhyukte /🔽arko devānām parame vyomannarkasya devāḥ parame🔽vyomannityetadvai devānāṃ viśatām prajāpatiruttamo 'viśattasmādāhārko devānām🔽parame vyomannityatha yadāhārkasya devāḥ parame vyomannityayaṃ vā
analyzed: tat ete sāma nidhane abhyukte  arkaḥ devānām parame vyoman arkasya devāḥ parame  vyoman iti etat vai devānām viśatām prajāpatiḥ uttamaḥ viśat tasmāt āha arkaḥ devānām  parame vyoman iti atha yat āha arkasya devāḥ parame vyoman iti ayam vā
translated: These two Sâman-chants are recited over it:

original: agnirarkastasyaitaduttamāyāṃ citau sarve devā viṣṭāstasmādāhārkasya devāḥ parame🔽vyomanniti / / /
analyzed: agniḥ arkaḥ tasya etat uttamāyām citau sarve devāḥ viṣṭāḥ tasmāt āha arkasya devāḥ parame  vyoman iti
translated: 'The Arka (flame) of the gods in the highest heaven; the gods of the Arka in the highest heaven' (Taitt. Samh., loc. cit.); for Prajâpati entered last of the gods who entered (the sacrifice); therefore he says, 'The Arka of the gods in the highest heaven.' And as to his saying, 'The gods of the Arka in the highest heaven,'--the Arka is this Agni (the fire-altar); all the gods are seated on his highest layer: therefore he says, 'The gods of the Arka in the highest heaven.'

original: gārhapatyamupadadhāti /
analyzed: gārhapatyam upadadhāti
translated: He lays down the Gârhapatya (hearth).

original: etadvai devāḥ prāpya rāddhvevāmanyanta te
analyzed: etat vai devāḥ prāpya rāddhvā iva amanyanta te
translated: The gods, having reached this (earth), thought themselves successful;

original: 'bruvankenedamarātsmeti gārhapatyenaivetyavruvangārhapatyaṃ vai citvā samāruhya
analyzed: bruvan kena idam arātsma iti gārhapatyena eva iti avruvan gārhapatyam vai citvā samāruhya
translated: 'Who, speaking thus, will build this (fire-altar) for us?' 'The Gârhapatya (hearth) itself,' they said. 'Having built the Gârhapatya and ascended it,

original: prathamāṃ citimapaśyāma prathamāyai dvitīyāṃ dvitīyāyai tṛtīyāṃ tṛtīyāyai caturthīṃ
analyzed: prathamām citim apaśyāma prathamāyai dvitīyām dvitīyāyai tṛtīyām tṛtīyāyai caturthīm
translated: we saw the first layer; for the first (layer) the second, for the second the third, for the third the fourth,

original: caturthyai pañcamīm pañcamyā idamiti / / /🔽ta 'bruvan / upa tajjānīta yatheyamasmāsveva rāddhirasaditi te
analyzed: caturthyai pañcamīm pañcamyai idam iti  te bruvan upa tat jānīta yathā iyam asmāsu eva rāddhiḥ asat iti te
translated: for the fourth the fifth, and for the fifth this (earth).'

original: 'bruvaṃścetayadhvamiti citimicateti vāva tadabruvaṃstadicata yatheyamasmāsveva🔽rāddhirasaditi / / /🔽te cetayamānāḥ /
analyzed: bruvan cetayadhvam iti citim icata iti vāva tat abruvan tat icata yathā iyam asmāsu eva  rāddhiḥ asat iti  te cetayamānāḥ
translated: They said, 'Think ye upon this, how this prosperity may come to us!' They said, 'Meditate (kit) ye!'--meditate (kîd) doubtless means the same as build (kîd). 'Meditate ye how this prosperity may come to us!'

original: etadapaśyannihemamāhṛtyopadadhāmahā iti tamihāhṛtyopādadhata
analyzed: etat apaśyan iha imam āhṛtya upadadhāmahai iti tam iha āhṛtya upādadhata
translated: Meditating, they saw this, 'Let us bring hither that (earth) and lay it down here.' They brought it hither and laid it down here.

original: tasminvyavadanta vasavaḥ purastādrudrā dakṣiṇata ādityāḥ paścānmaruta uttarato
analyzed: tasmin vyavadanta vasavaḥ purastāt rudrāḥ dakṣiṇatas ādityāḥ paścāt marutaḥ uttaratas
translated: On it they disputed, the Vasus on the east side, the Rudras on the south side, the Âdityas on the west side, the Maruts on the north side,

original: viśve devā upariṣṭādihopadadhāmehopadadhāmeti / / /
analyzed: viśve devāḥ upariṣṭāt iha upadadhāma iha upadadhāma iti
translated: the Visve Devâh above. 'Let us lay it down here, let us lay it down here!'

original: te 'bruvan / madhya evopadadhāmahai sa no madhya upahitaḥ sarveṣām
analyzed: te bruvan madhye eva upadadhāmahai sa naḥ madhye upahitaḥ sarveṣām
translated: They said, 'Let us lay it down in the middle: being laid down in the middle of us all,

original: bhaviṣyatīti taṃ madhya upādadhata tadetāṃ rāddhimātmannadadhata madhyato
analyzed: bhaviṣyati iti tam madhye upādadhata tat etām rāddhim ātman adadhata madhyatas
translated: 'It will be,'--in the middle they then laid it down: they thus bestowed that prosperity on themselves in the middle;

original: madhyata evaitadetāṃ rāddhimātmannadadhata tathaivaitadyajamāno
analyzed: madhyataḥ eva etat etām rāddhim ātman adadhata tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ
translated: and in the middle they thus bestowed that prosperity on themselves. And in like manner does the Sacrificer,

original: yadgārhapatyamupadadhātyetāmevaitadrāddhimātmandhatte madhyato madhyata
analyzed: yat gārhapatyam upadadhāti etām eva etat rāddhim ātman dhatte madhyatas madhyatas
translated: when he lays down the Gârhapatya, bestow that prosperity on himself; in the middle (he lays it down),

original: evaitadetāṃ rāddhimātmandhatte / / /🔽yadveva gārhapatyamupadadhāti /
analyzed: eva etat etām rāddhim ātman dhatte  yat u eva gārhapatyam upadadhāti
translated: and in the middle he thus bestows that prosperity on himself.

original: annaṃ vai gārhapatyo 'ttāyamagniścito 'ttra
analyzed: annam vai gārhapatyaḥ u tta ayam agniḥ citaḥ u ttra
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Gârhapatya. The Gârhapatya is food, and this built Agni is a consumer:

original: evaitadannamapidadhāti madhyato madhyata evāsminnetadannaṃ dadhāti / / /
analyzed: eva etat annam apidadhāti madhyatas madhyatas eva asmin etat annam dadhāti
translated: he thus puts food into the consumer; in the middle (he lays it down), and in the middle he thus puts food into him.

original: yadveva gārhapatyamupadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva gārhapatyam upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Gârhapatya.

original: vedirvai devaloko 'tha vā eṣa bahirvedi cito
analyzed: vediḥ vai deva lokaḥ vai eṣa bahirvedi citaḥ
translated: The world of the gods is the Vedi (altar-ground), and this (Agni) is built outside the Vedi;

original: bhavati taṃ yadihāhṛtyopadadhāti tadenaṃ vedau devaloke pratiṣṭhāpayati / / /
analyzed: bhavati tam yat iha āhṛtya upadadhāti tat enam vedau deva loke pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: he now brings him hither and lays him down: he thus establishes him on the Vedi, in the world of the gods.

original: yadveva gārhapatyamupadadhāti /🔽yonirvai puṣkaraparṇamatha vā eṣa bahiryoni cito
analyzed: yat u eva gārhapatyam upadadhāti  yoniḥ vai puṣkaraparṇam atha vai eṣa bahis yoni
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Gârhapatya.🔽The lotus-leaf is the womb, and this (Agni) is built outside the womb;

original: bhavati bahirdho vā etadyoneragnikarma yatpurā puṣkaraparṇāttaṃ
analyzed: bhavati bahirdhas vai etat yoneḥ agnikarma yat purā puṣkaraparṇāt tam
translated: and outside the womb, as it were, is the performance of the sacred rite which is performed before the lotus-leaf;

original: yadihāhṛtyopadadhāti tadenaṃ yonau puṣkaraparṇe pratiṣṭhāpayati tatho haiṣo🔽'bahirdhā bhavatyaṣṭāviṣṭakā upadadhāti tasyokto bandhustaṃ vā etaireva
analyzed: yat iha āhṛtya upadadhāti tat enam yonau puṣkaraparṇe pratiṣṭhāpayati tathā u ha eṣaḥ  bahirdhā bhavati aṣṭau iṣṭakāḥ upadadhāti tasya uktaḥ bandhuḥ tam vai etaiḥ eva
translated: in that he puts it down having brought it here, he thereby establishes it in the womb, on the lotus leaf; and so indeed it is not outside. He puts down eight bricks; the significance of that has been explained. By these (bricks) he establishes it in the world of heaven.

original: yajurbhiretayāvṛtā cinoti yo hyevāsau sa evāyaṃ tamevaitadāhṛtyehopadadhāti / / /
analyzed: yajurbhiḥ etayā āvṛtā cinoti yaḥ hi eva asau saḥ eva ayam tam eva etat āhṛtya iha upadadhāti
translated: in that he puts it down here after bringing it, he thereby establishes it in the womb, on the lotus leaf; and so it is not outside. He puts down eight bricks; the significance of that has been explained. He puts it together with those very formulas, with that very performance; for he who is yonder is this (earth); having brought him, he puts him down here.

original: atha punaścitimupadadhāti /🔽etadvai devā gārhapatyaṃ citvā tasminrāddhiṃ🔽nāpaśyanyonirvai gārhapatyā citireṣo vai yone rāddhiryadretaḥ prajātistasyāmetasyāṃ
analyzed: atha punaścitim upadadhāti  etat vai devāḥ gārhapatyam citvā tasmin rāddhim  na apaśyan yoniḥ vai gārhapatyā citiḥ eṣaḥ vai yoneḥ rāddhiḥ yat retaḥ prajātiḥ tasyām etasyām
translated: He then puts down the Punaskiti.

original: yonau retaḥ prajātiṃ nāpaśyan / / /🔽te 'bruvan / upa tajjānīta yathāsyāṃ yonau retaḥ prajātiṃ dadhāmeti te🔽'bruvaṃścetayadhvamiti citimicateti vāva tadabruvaṃstadicata yathāsyāṃ yonau retaḥ
analyzed: yonau retaḥ prajātim na apaśyan  te bruvan upa tat jānīta yathā asyām yonau retaḥ prajātim dadhāma iti te  bruvan cetayadhvam iti citim icata iti vāva tat abruvan tat icata yathā asyām yonau retaḥ
translated: For the gods, having built the Garhapatya, saw no prosperity in it. The Garhapatya altar is indeed a womb; and that is the womb in which they saw no seed, no procreation.🔽They said, 'Meditate ye (ketay)!'--'Meditate ye!' they said;--'how we may put seed, procreation, into this womb!'🔽They meditated; and saw this Punaskiti, and put it down: in this womb they saw seed, procreation.

original: prajātiṃ dadhāmeti / / /
analyzed: prajātim dadhāma iti
translated: They said, 'Meditate ye!'--'Meditate ye!' they said;--'how we may put seed, procreation, into this womb!'

original: te cetayamānāḥ /
analyzed: te cetayamānāḥ
translated: Meditating,

original: etām punaścitimapaśyaṃstāmupādadhata tadetasyāṃ yonau retaḥ
analyzed: etām punaścitim apaśyan tām upādadhata tat etasyām yonau retaḥ
translated: they saw this Punaskiti, and put it down: in this womb they saw seed, procreation.

original: prajātimadadhurmadhyato madhyata evaitadetasyāṃ yonau retaḥ🔽prajātimadadhustathaivaitadyajamāno yatpunaścitimupadadhātyetasyāmevaitadyonau🔽retaḥ prajātiṃ dadhāti madhyato madhyata evaitadetasyāṃ yonau retaḥ prajātiṃ
analyzed: prajātim adadhuḥ madhyatas madhyatas eva etat etasyām yonau retaḥ  prajātim adadhuḥ tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ yat punar citim upadadhāti etasyām eva etat yonau  retaḥ prajātim dadhāti madhyatas madhyatas eva etat etasyām yonau retaḥ prajātim
translated: in the middle; verily in this womb they have placed seed and propagation. In the same way the sacrificer when he puts on the Punaściti places seed and propagation in this womb.

original: dadhāti / / /
analyzed: dadhāti
translated: In the middle; verily in this womb he places seed and propagation.

original: tāṃ haike jaghanārdha upadadhati /🔽jaghanārdhādvai retaḥ sicyate pucasaṃdhau
analyzed: tām ha eke jaghana ardhe upadadhati  jaghana ardhāt vai retaḥ sicyate puca saṃdhau
translated: Some put it on the hind part,🔽saying, 'From the hind part seed is shed, in the tail-joint;

original: pucādvai retaḥ sicyata iti na tathā kuryādbahirdhā ha te yone retaḥ prajātiṃ dadhati
analyzed: pucāt vai retaḥ sicyate iti na tathā kuryāt bahirdhā ha te yone retaḥ prajātim dadhati
translated: from the tail seed is shed.' Let him not do so; they place seed and propagation outside the womb,

original: ye tathā kurvanti madhya evopadadhyāttatsamprati yonau retaḥ prajātiṃ dadhāti / / /
analyzed: ye tathā kurvanti madhye eva upadadhyāt tat samprati yonau retaḥ prajātim dadhāti
translated: who do so. He should put it on in the middle; then indeed he places seed and propagation in the womb.

original: aṣṭāviṣṭakā upadadhāti /🔽aṣṭākṣarā gāyatrī gāyatro 'gniryāvānagniryāvatyasya
analyzed: aṣṭau iṣṭakāḥ upadadhāti  aṣṭa akṣarā gāyatrī gāyatraḥ gniḥ yāvān agniḥ yāvatī asya
translated: He puts on eight bricks;

original: mātrā tāvataivainametadreto bhūtaṃ siñcati pañca kṛtvaḥ sādayati pañcacitiko 'gniḥ
analyzed: mātrā tāvatā eva enam etat retaḥ bhūtam siñcati pañca kṛtvas sādayati pañca citikaḥ gniḥ
translated: the Gayatri has eight syllables, Agni is connected with the Gayatri; as great as Agni is, as great as is his measure, with so much he thus pours him as seed. Five times he settles it; the fire-altar has five layers,

original: pañca 'rtavaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ saṃvatsaro 'gniryāvānagniryāvatyasya mātrā
analyzed: pañca rtavaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ saṃvatsaraḥ gniḥ yāvān agniḥ yāvatī asya mātrā
translated: the year has five seasons, Agni is the year; as great as Agni is, as great as is his measure,

original: tāvataivainametadreto bhūtaṃ siñcatyaṣṭāviṣṭakāḥ pañca kṛtvaḥ sādayati tattrayodaśa🔽trayodaśa māsāḥ saṃvatsarastrayodaśāgneścitipurīṣāṇi yāvānagniryāvatyasya mātrā
analyzed: tāvatā eva enam etat retaḥ bhūtam siñcati aṣṭāu iṣṭakāḥ pañca kṛtvas sādayati tat trayodaśa  trayodaśa māsāḥ saṃvatsaraḥ trayodaśa agneḥ citi purīṣāṇi yāvān agniḥ yāvatī asya mātrā
translated: By that much he thus pours him (Agni) as seed. Eight bricks he lays down five times, that makes thirteen.

original: tāvattadbhavati / / /
analyzed: tāvat tat bhavati
translated: Thirteen months make a year, and thirteen are the layers of the fire-altar: as great as Agni is, as great as is his measure, so great does this become.

original: yadveva punaścitimupadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva punaścitim upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Punaskiti.

original: etadvā etadayathāyathaṃ karoti
analyzed: etat vai etat ayathāyatham karoti
translated: For he now does what is not proper,

original: yadāhavanīyādgārhapatyamuttaraṃ cinoti tadyatpunaścitimupadadhāti ya🔽evāyamagniścitastamevaitadāhṛtyāsyopariṣṭātpunaścinoti tadyaccitaṃ santam
analyzed: yat āhavanīyāt gārhapatyam uttaram cinoti tat yat punaścitim upadadhāti yaḥ  eva ayam agniḥ citaḥ tam eva etat āhṛtya asya upariṣṭāt punar cinoti tat yat citam santam
translated: in that he builds the Gârhapatya north of the Âhavanîya. Now when he lays down the Punaskiti,🔽he takes that very fire which is built up, and builds it up again on its top. And because he builds up again what is already built,

original: punaścinoti tasmātpunaścitiḥ / / /🔽taddhaike / jaghanārdhe gārhapatyamupadadhati pūrvārdhe punaścitimāhavanīyaśca🔽vā etau gārhapatyaścaivaṃ vā etāvagnī iti na tathā kuryādayaṃ vai loko gārhapatyo
analyzed: punar cinoti tasmāt punaścitiḥ  tat ha eke jaghana ardhe gārhapatyam upadadhati pūrva ardhe punaścitim āhavanīyaḥ ca  vai etau gārhapatyaḥ ca evam vai etau agnī iti na tathā kuryāt ayam vai lokaḥ gārhapatyaḥ
translated: therefore it is the Punaskiti.

original: dyaurāhavanīya uttaro vā asāvasyai tasmādenāmuttarāmevopadadhyāt / / /
analyzed: dyauḥ āhavanīyaḥ uttaraḥ vai asau asyai tasmāt enām uttarām eva upadadhyāt
translated: Now some lay down the Gârhapatya on the hip (of the altar), and the Punaskiti and Âhavanîya on the fore-part, saying, 'These two (fires), to wit, the Gârhapatya and Âhavanîya, are these two (fires).' Let him not do so; for the Gârhapatya is this (terrestrial) world, and the Âhavanîya yonder (sky); and that (sky) is above this (earth): let him therefore place it (the Punaskiti) above this (Gârhapatya).

original: yadveva gārhapatyaṃ ca punaścitiṃ copadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva gārhapatyam ca punaścitim ca upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Gârhapatya and the Punaskiti.

original: vediśca haite agneruttaravediścātha
analyzed: vediḥ ca ha ete agneḥ uttaravediḥ ca atha
translated: The Vedi and the Uttaravedi are indeed the two sacrificial grounds of Agni.

original: ye amū pūrve nivapatyadhvarasya te atha haite agnestadyadete upadhāyāgniṃ
analyzed: ye amū pūrve nivapati adhvarasya te atha ha ete agneḥ tat yat ete upadhāya agnim
translated: Then those which he pours out first are of the sacrifice, and these are of Agni. When he places Agni on these two (grounds),

original: nidadhāti vedau caivainametaduttaravedau ca pratiṣṭhāpayati / / /
analyzed: nidadhāti vedau ca eva enam etat uttaravedau ca pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: he establishes him on the Vedi and the Uttaravedi.

original: yadveva punaścitimupadadhāti /🔽punaryajño haiṣa uttarā haiṣā devayajyā🔽punaryajñamevaitadupadhatta uttarāmeva devayajyāmupa hainam punaryajño
analyzed: yat u eva punaścitim upadadhāti  punar yajñaḥ ha eṣaḥ uttarā ha eṣā deva yajyā  punar yajñam eva etat upadhatte uttarām eva deva yajyām upa ha enam punar yajñaḥ
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Punaskiti.🔽This is the renewed sacrifice, this is the renewed divine worship.

original: namati / / /
analyzed: namati
translated: He places the renewed sacrifice on it, the renewed divine worship. The renewed sacrifice reverences him.

original: yadveva punaścitimupadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva punaścitim upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Punaskiti.

original: yaṃ vai tam prāṇā ṛṣayo 'gre 'gniṃ samaskurvantsa
analyzed: yam vai tam prāṇāḥ ṛṣayaḥ gre gnim samaskurvan sa
translated: The Rishis, the vital airs, in the beginning put together that Agni whom they put together;

original: eṣa tamevaitatpunaścinoti tadyaccitaṃ santam punaścinoti tasmādveva punaścitiḥ / / /
analyzed: eṣa tam eva etat punar cinoti tat yat citam santam punar cinoti tasmāt u eva punaścitiḥ
translated: he is that very one whom he now puts together again. And because he puts together him who is put together, therefore (it is called) Punaskiti.

original: yena ṛṣayastapasā sattramāyanniti /🔽amūnetadṛṣīnāhendhānā agniṃ svarābharanta
analyzed: yena ṛṣayaḥ tapasā sattram āyan iti  amūn etat ṛṣīn āha indhānāḥ agnim svar ābharanta
translated: 'By which the Rishis through penance came to the sacrificial session',

original: itīndhānā agniṃ svargaṃ lokamāharanta ityetattasminnahaṃ nidadhe nāke agnimiti
analyzed: iti indhānāḥ agnim svargam lokam āharantaḥ iti etat tasmin aham nidadhe nāke agnim iti
translated: he says; 'the kindlers brought Agni to the light', he says; 'the kindlers brought Agni to the heavenly world', he says; 'in that heaven I have placed Agni', he says;

original: svargo vai loko nāko yamāhurmanava stīrṇabarhiṣamiti ye vidvāṃsaste manava
analyzed: svargaḥ vai lokaḥ nākaḥ yam āhuḥ manavaḥ stīrṇa barhiṣam iti ye vidvāṃsaḥ te manavaḥ
translated: The world of heaven is the vault which the wise call the strew-covered (world).

original: stīrṇabarhiṣamiti sarvadā haiva sa stīrṇabarhiḥ / / /
analyzed: stīrṇa barhiṣam iti sarvadā ha eva sa stīrṇa barhiḥ
translated: The wise are the men; 'the strew-covered (world)' means that it is always strewed with sacrificial grass.

original: tam patnībhiranugacema devāḥ /🔽putrairbhrātṛbhiruta vā hiraṇyairityetenainaṃ
analyzed: tam patnībhiḥ anugacema devāḥ  putraiḥ bhrātṛbhiḥ uta vā hiraṇyaiḥ iti etena enam
translated: 'May we go to it with our wives, O gods,

original: sarveṇānugacemetyetannākaṃ gṛbhṇānāḥ sukṛtasya loka iti svargo vai loko nākaḥ
analyzed: sarveṇa anugacema iti etat nākam gṛbhṇānāḥ sukṛtasya loke iti svargaḥ vai lokaḥ nākaḥ
translated: with our sons, our brothers, or with gold.' With all this he says, 'May we go to it.' 'Seizing the vault, the world of good deeds,' the vault is the world of heaven;

original: svargaṃ lokaṃ gṛhṇānāḥ sukṛtasya loka ityetattṛtīye pṛṣṭhe adhi rocane diva
analyzed: svargam lokam gṛhṇānāḥ sukṛtasya loke iti etat tṛtīye pṛṣṭhe adhi rocane divaḥ
translated: 'seizing the world of heaven, the world of good deeds,' he says. 'On the third luminous back of the sky,'

original: ityetaddha tṛtīyam pṛṣṭhaṃ rocanaṃ divo yatraiṣa etattapati / / /
analyzed: iti etat ha tṛtīyam pṛṣṭham rocanam divaḥ yatra eṣaḥ etat tapati
translated: that is the third luminous back of the sky, where he shines there.

original: ā vāco madhyamaruhadbhuraṇyuriti /
analyzed: ā vācaḥ madhyam aruhat bhuraṇyuḥ iti
translated: 'The swift one has risen in the middle of speech.'

original: etaddha vāco madhyaṃ yatraiṣa etaccīyate
analyzed: etat ha vācaḥ madhyam yatra eṣaḥ etat cīyate
translated: That is the middle of speech, where he is built up.

original: bhuraṇyuriti bhartaityetadayamagniḥ satpatiścekitāna ityayamagniḥ satām
analyzed: bhuraṇyuḥ iti bhartā eti etat ayam agniḥ sat patiḥ cekitānaḥ iti ayam agniḥ satām
translated: 'The swift one,' that is 'the bearer'; 'this Agni, the lord of the true, the watchful,' this Agni is the lord of the true,

original: pratiścetayamāna ityetatpṛṣṭhe pṛthivyā nihito davidyutaditi pṛṣṭhe pṛthivyā nihito
analyzed: pratiścetayamānaḥ iti etat pṛṣṭhe pṛthivyāḥ nihitaḥ davidyutat iti pṛṣṭhe pṛthivyāḥ nihitaḥ
translated: 'the watchful,' that is, the one who watches over. 'On the back of the earth he is placed, shining,' on the back of the earth he is placed,🔽shining.

original: dīpyamāna ityetadadhaspadaṃ kṛṇutāṃ ye pṛtanyava ityadhaspadaṃ kurutāṃ
analyzed: dīpyamānaḥ iti etat adhaspadam kṛṇutām ye pṛtanyavaḥ iti adhaspadam kurutām
translated: 'Shining', this is the lowest place; 'make them', make the enemies the lowest place;

original: sarvānpāpmana ityetat / / /
analyzed: sarvān pāpmanaḥ iti etat
translated: 'from all evil', this is the lowest place.

original: ayamagnirvīratamo vayodhā iti /
analyzed: ayam agniḥ vīratamaḥ vayaḥ dhāḥ iti
translated: 'This Agni, most manly, the life-bestower',

original: ayamagnirvīryavattamo vayodhā ityetatsahasriyo🔽dyotatāmaprayucanniti sahasriyo dīpyatāmapramatta ityetadvibhrājamānaḥ sarirasya🔽madhya itīme vai lokāḥ sariraṃ dīpyamāna eṣu lokeṣvityetadupa pratyāhi divyāni
analyzed: ayam agniḥ vīryavattamaḥ vayaḥ dhāḥ iti etat sahasriyaḥ  dyotatām a prayucan iti sahasriyaḥ dīpyatām apramattaḥ iti etat vibhrājamānaḥ sarirasya  madhye iti ime vai lokāḥ sariram dīpyamānaḥ eṣu lokeṣu iti etat upa pratyāhi divyāni
translated: 'this Agni, most vigorous, the life-bestower', this is the meaning. 'A thousandfold',🔽'may he shine, not heedless', this is the meaning. 'Shining', 'in the middle of the house', these worlds are the house; 'shining in these worlds', this is the meaning. 'Go forward',

original: dhāmetyupa prayāhi svargaṃ lokamityetat / / /
analyzed: dhāma iti upa prayāhi svargam lokam iti etat
translated: 'to the heavenly abodes', this is the meaning. 'Go forward', 'to the heavenly world', this is the meaning.

original: sampracyavadhvamupa samprayāteti /🔽amūnetadṛṣīnāha samenam🔽pracyavadhvamupa cainaṃ samprayātetyagne patho devayānānkṛṇudhvamiti yathaiva
analyzed: sampracyavadhvam upa samprayāta iti  amūn etat ṛṣīn āha sam enam  pracyavadhvam upa ca enam samprayāta iti agne pathaḥ deva yānān kṛṇudhvam iti yathā eva
translated: 'Assemble, come together',

original: yajustathā bandhuḥ punaḥ kṛṇvānā pitarā yuvāneti vākca vai manaśca pitarā yuvānā🔽vākca manaścaitāvagnī anvātāṃsīttvayi tantumetamiti yo
analyzed: yajuḥ tathā bandhuḥ punar kṛṇvānā pitarā yuvānā iti vāc ca vai manaḥ ca pitarā yuvānā  vāc ca manaḥ ca etau agnī an vātāṃsi id tvayi tantum etam iti
translated: this he says to those Rishis, 'assemble, come together to him'. 'O Agni, make the paths', 'make the paths leading to the gods', as in the Yajus, so the connection. 'The parents, renewing, young', the parents are speech and mind, young;🔽speech and mind are these two fires. 'In you, this thread', this is the thread which the Rishis spun; from that he says this.

original: 'sāvṛṣibhistantustatastametadāha / / /
analyzed: saḥ a vṛṣibhiḥ tantuḥ tatas tam etat āha
translated: 'That thread is woven by the sages, therefore he says this...🔽🔽

original: udbudhyasvāgne pratijāgṛhi tvamiti /🔽imametadagnimāhoccainam budhyasva prati
analyzed: udbudhyasva agne pratijāgṛhi tvam iti  imam etat agnim āha ucca enam budhyasva prati
translated: 'Awake, O Agni, and be watchful!'

original: cainaṃ jāgṛhītīṣṭāpūrte saṃsṛjethāmayaṃ ceti yathaiva yajustathā
analyzed: ca enam jāgṛhi iti iṣṭāpūrte saṃsṛjethām ayam ca iti yathā eva yajuḥ tathā
translated: 'This Agni here, do thou awake and watch over him, and unite him with the sacrifice and the sacrificial food,'--as the text, so the meaning;--

original: bandhurasmintsadhasthe adhyuttarasminniti dyaurvā uttaraṃ sadhasthaṃ viśve devā
analyzed: bandhuḥ asmin sadhasthe adhi uttarasmin iti dyauḥ vai uttaram sadhastham viśve devā
translated: 'the bond in this, the highest seat,'--the highest seat, doubtless, is yonder (heavenly) world;--

original: yajamānaśca sīdateti tadviśvairdevaiḥ saha yajamānaṃ sādayati / / /
analyzed: yajamānaḥ ca sīdata iti tat viśvaiḥ devaiḥ saha yajamānam sādayati
translated: 'sit ye down, ye All-gods, and the Sacrificer!'--he thus seats the Sacrificer together with the All-gods.

original: yena vahasi sahasram /
analyzed: yena vahasi sahasram
translated: 'With that, O Agni, with which thou carriest a thousand,

original: yenāgne sarvavedasamityetaddhāsya pratijñātatamaṃ dhāma🔽yena sahasraṃ vahati yena sarvavedasaṃ tenemaṃ yajñaṃ no naya svardeveṣu gantava
analyzed: yena agne sarvavedasam iti etat ha asya pratijñātatamam dhāma  yena sahasram vahati yena sarvavedasam tena imam yajñam naḥ naya svar deveṣu gantava
translated: with which all wealth,'--that is the most binding of his (Agni's) forms;--

original: iti tena na imaṃ yajñaṃ naya svargaṃ lokaṃ deveṣu gantava ityetadayaṃ te
analyzed: iti tena naḥ imam yajñam naya svargam lokam deveṣu gantave iti etat ayam te
translated: 'with which thou carriest a thousand, with which all wealth, with that lead thou this our sacrifice to the heavenly world of the gods!'--that is, 'with that lead thou this our sacrifice to the heavenly world, to the gods!'--

original: yonirṛtviya iti tasyokto bandhuraṣṭāviṣṭakā upadadhāti tasyo evoktaḥ / / /
analyzed: yoniḥ ṛtviyaḥ iti tasya uktaḥ bandhuḥ aṣṭāu iṣṭakāḥ upadadhāti tasya u eva uktaḥ
translated: 'this is thy natural womb,'--the meaning of this has been explained;--eight bricks he lays down: the significance of this has been explained .

original: ṛtavyā upadadhāti /
analyzed: ṛtavyāḥ upadadhāti
translated: He lays down the seasonal (bricks).

original: ṛtava ete yadṛtavyā ṛtūnevaitadupadadhāti tadetatsarvaṃ
analyzed: ṛtavaḥ ete yat ṛtavyāḥ ṛtūn eva etat upadadhāti tat etat sarvam
translated: The seasonal ones are the seasons: it is the seasons he thus lays down. This (altar) is everything, and the seasons are everything: by everything he thus lays down everything.

original: yadṛtavyāḥ saṃvatsaro vā ṛtavyāḥ saṃvatsara idaṃ
analyzed: yat ṛtavyāḥ saṃvatsaraḥ vai ṛtavyāḥ saṃvatsaraḥ idam
translated: The Rituyas are either the seasons or the Rituyas are the year. This is🔽

original: sarvamidamevaitatsarvamupadadhātyatho prajananametatsaṃvatsaro vā ṛtavyāḥ
analyzed: sarvam idam eva etat sarvam upadadhāti atha u prajananam etat saṃvatsaraḥ vai ṛtavyāḥ
translated: in that the seasonal ones (are bricks), or the seasonal ones are the year, this (earth) is all this, he puts down all this (in the altar). Then this is procreation, the seasonal ones are the year,

original: saṃvatsaraḥ prajananam prajananamevaitadupadadhāti / / /🔽yadveva 'rtavyā upadadhāti /
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ prajananam prajananam eva etat upadadhāti  yat u eva ṛtavyāḥ upadadhāti
translated: the year is procreation, he puts down procreation.

original: kṣatra vā ṛtavyā viśa imā itarā iṣṭakāḥ kṣatraṃ🔽tadviśyattāraṃ dadhāti tāḥ sarvāsu citiṣūpadadhāti sarvasyāṃ tadviśi kṣatramattāraṃ
analyzed: kṣatra vai ṛtavyāḥ viśaḥ imāḥ itarāḥ iṣṭakāḥ kṣatram  tat viśyat tāram dadhāti tāḥ sarvāsu citiṣu upadadhāti sarvasyām tat viśi kṣatramat tāram
translated: And, again, as to why he puts down the seasonal (bricks). The seasonal (bricks) are the nobility, the other bricks are the people;

original: dadhāti / / /
analyzed: dadhāti
translated: he thus places the nobility as the eater among the people. He puts them down in all the layers; everywhere he thus places the nobility as the eater among the people.

original: yadveva 'rtavyā upadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva ṛtavyāḥ upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he puts down the seasonal (bricks).

original: saṃvatsara eṣo 'gniḥ sa ṛtavyābhiḥ saṃhitaḥ
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ eṣaḥ gniḥ saḥ ṛtavyābhiḥ saṃhitaḥ
translated: This Agni is the year; he is held together by the seasonal (bricks);

original: saṃvatsaramevaitadṛtubhiḥ saṃtanoti saṃdadhāti tā vai nānāprabhṛtayaḥ samānodarkā
analyzed: saṃvatsaram eva etat ṛtubhiḥ saṃtanoti saṃdadhāti tāḥ vai nānā prabhṛtayaḥ samāna udarkā
translated: he thus connects the year with the seasons, he joins it. They (the seasonal bricks) have different beginnings, the same end;

original: ṛtavo vā asṛjyanta te sṛṣṭā nānaivāsan / / /
analyzed: ṛtavaḥ vai asṛjyanta te sṛṣṭāḥ nānā eva āsan
translated: the seasons were created; being created, they were each separate.

original: te 'bruvan / na vā itthaṃ santaḥ śakṣyāmaḥ prajanayituṃ rūpaiḥ samāyāmeti ta
analyzed: te bruvan na vai ittham santaḥ śakṣyāmaḥ prajanayitum rūpaiḥ samāyāma iti te
translated: They said, 'Verily, being thus, we shall not be able to procreate; let us agree together in forms.'

original: ekaikamṛtuṃ rūpaiḥ samāyaṃstasmādekaikasminnṛtau sarveṣāmṛtūnāṃ rūpaṃ tā
analyzed: ekaikam ṛtum rūpaiḥ samāyan tasmāt ekaikasmin ṛtau sarveṣām ṛtūnām rūpam
translated: They agreed together in one form each season; therefore in each season the form of all the seasons is seen.

original: yannānāprabhṛtayo nānā hyasṛjyantātha yatsamānodarkā rūpairhi samāyan / / /
analyzed: yat nānā prabhṛtayaḥ nānā hi asṛjyanta atha yat samāna udarkāḥ rūpaiḥ hi samāyan
translated: In that the various ones were created separately, and in that the similar ones were created with similar forms.

original: sa upadadhāti /
analyzed: saḥ upadadhāti
translated: He lays down (them).

original: tapaśca tapasyaśca śaiśirāvṛtū iti nāmanī enayorete nāmabhyāmevaine🔽etadupadadhātyasau vā ādityastapastasmādetāvṛtū anantarhitau tadyadetasmādetāvṛtū
analyzed: tapaḥ ca tapasyaḥ ca śaiśirau ṛtū iti nāmanī enayoḥ ete nāmabhyām eva ene  etat upadadhāti asau vai ādityaḥ tapaḥ tasmāt etau ṛtū an antarhitau tat yat etasmāt etau ṛtū
translated: 'Tapas and Tapasya are the two winter months,' these are the names of these two; with their names he thus lays down these two.

original: anantarhitau tasmādetau tapaśca tapasyaśca / / /
analyzed: an antarhitau tasmāt etau tapaḥ ca tapasyaḥ ca
translated: This (brick) is yonder sun, the hot season; therefore these two months are not separated from him. In that these two months are not separated from him, therefore these two are Tapas and Tapasya.

original: agnerantaḥśleṣo 'sīti /
analyzed: agneḥ antaḥśleṣaḥ si iti
translated: 'Thou art the inner connection of Agni,' (with these words he lays down) the two spring months.

original: saṃvatsara eṣo 'gniḥ sa ṛtavyābhiḥ saṃhitaḥ🔽saṃvatsaramevaitadṛtubhiḥ saṃtanoti saṃdadhāti kalpetāṃ dyāvāpṛthivī kalpantāmāpa
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ eṣaḥ gniḥ saḥ ṛtavyābhiḥ saṃhitaḥ  saṃvatsaram eva etat ṛtubhiḥ saṃtanoti saṃdadhāti kalpetām dyāvāpṛthivī kalpantām āpa
translated: This Agni is the year; he is connected with the seasonal (bricks).🔽He thus connects the year with the seasons, he joins it. 'May heaven and earth agree, may the waters agree,

original: oṣadhaya itīdamevaitatsarvamṛtubhiḥ kalpayati kalpantāmagnayaḥ pṛthaṅnama🔽jyaiṣṭhyāya savratā ityagnayo haite pṛthagyadetā iṣṭakāste
analyzed: oṣadhayaḥ iti idam eva etat sarvam ṛtubhiḥ kalpayati kalpantām agnayaḥ pṛthak nama  jyaiṣṭhyāya savratāḥ iti agnayaḥ ha ete pṛthak yat etāḥ iṣṭakāḥ te
translated: may the plants agree,' thus he makes all this agree with the seasons. 'May the separate Agnis agree,

original: yathānayorṛtvorjyaiṣṭhyāya kalperannevametadāha ye agnayaḥ samanaso 'ntarā
