analyzed: yathā anayoḥ ṛtvoḥ jyaiṣṭhyāya kalperan evam etat āha ye agnayaḥ samanasaḥ ntarā
translated: for the supremacy of the one-minded,' the separate Agnis are these (bricks), for these are the separate Agnis.🔽They agree for the supremacy of these two seasons, he thereby says.

original: dyāvāpṛthivī ime iti yathaiva yajustathā bandhuḥ śaiśirāvṛtū abhikalpamānā
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī ime iti yathā eva yajuḥ tathā bandhuḥ śaiśirau ṛtū abhikalpamānā
translated: Heaven and Earth: as the text, so the meaning. The two winter seasons, approaching,

original: indramiva devā abhisaṃviśantviti yathendraṃ devā abhisaṃviṣṭā evamimāvṛtū
analyzed: indram iva devāḥ abhisaṃviśantu iti yathā indram devāḥ abhisaṃviṣṭāḥ evam imau ṛtū
translated: 'Let them enter into Indra as the gods into Indra,'--as the gods entered into Indra, so do these two seasons enter into him;

original: jyaiṣṭhyāyābhisaṃviśantvityetaddve iṣṭake bhavato dvau hi māsāvṛtuḥ
analyzed: jyaiṣṭhyāya abhisaṃviśantu iti etat dve iṣṭake bhavataḥ dvau hi māsau ṛtuḥ
translated: 'for supremacy,'--that is, 'for the sake of supremacy.' There are two bricks: a season consists of two months.

original: sakṛtsādayatyekaṃ tadṛtuṃ karoti / / /🔽tadyadete atropadadhāti /🔽saṃvatsara eṣo 'gnirima u lokāḥ saṃvatsarastasya dyaureva
analyzed: sakṛt sādayati ekam tat ṛtum karoti  tat yat ete atra upadadhāti  saṃvatsaraḥ eṣaḥ gniḥ ime u lokāḥ saṃvatsaraḥ tasya dyauḥ eva
translated: He lays them down together: he thus makes the two a season.

original: pañcamī citirdyaurasya śiśira ṛtustadyadete atropadadhāti yadevāsyaite🔽ātmanastadasminnetatpratidadhāti tasmādete atropadadhāti / / /
analyzed: pañcamī citiḥ dyauḥ asya śiśiraḥ ṛtuḥ tat yat ete atra upadadhāti yat eva asya ete  ātmanaḥ tat asmin etat pratidadhāti tasmāt ete atra upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he puts them down here. This Agni is the year, and these worlds are the year: its fifth layer is yonder sky,

original: yadvevaite atropadadhāti /🔽prajāpatireṣo 'gniḥ saṃvatsara u prajāpatistasya śira eva
analyzed: yat u eva ete atra upadadhāti  prajāpatiḥ eṣaḥ gniḥ saṃvatsaraḥ u prajāpatiḥ tasya śiraḥ eva
translated: and its winter season is yonder sky. When he puts them down here, he thereby restores to him (Agni-Pragâpati) what these two are to him, his body; and therefore he puts them down here.

original: pañcamī citiḥ śiro 'sya śiśira ṛtustadyadete atropadadhāti yadevāsyaite
analyzed: pañcamī citiḥ śiraḥ sya śiśiraḥ ṛtuḥ tat yat ete atra upadadhāti yat eva asya ete
translated: And, again, as to why he puts them down here. This Agni is Pragâpati, and Pragâpati is the year: its fifth layer is the head,

original: ātmanastadasminnetatpratidadhāti tasmādete atropadadhāti / / /
analyzed: ātmanaḥ tat asmin etat pratidadhāti tasmāt ete atra upadadhāti
translated: and its winter season is the head. When he puts them down here, he thereby restores to him what these two are to him, his body; and therefore he puts them down here.

original: sa purastātsvayamātṛṇāyai ca viśvajyotiṣaśca 'rtavye upadadhāti /
analyzed: sa purastāt svayamātṛṇāyai ca viśvajyotiṣaḥ ca ṛtavye upadadhāti
translated: He places the Ṛtu-bricks to the east of the naturally-perforated one and the Visvagyotis.

original: dyaurvā uttamā
analyzed: dyauḥ vai uttamā
translated: The highest (brick) is the sky,

original: svayamātṛṇāditya uttamā viśvajyotirarvācīnaṃ taddivaścādityācca 'rtūndadhāti🔽tasmādarvācīnamevāta ṛtavo 'tho prajananametadarvācīnaṃ taddivaścādityāśca🔽prajananaṃ dadhāti tasmādarvācīnamevātaḥ prajāyate sthitaṃ haivātaḥ
analyzed: svayamātṛṇā ādityaḥ uttamā viśvajyotiḥ arvācīnam tat divaḥ ca ādityāt ca ṛtūn dadhāti  tasmāt arvācīnam eva atas ṛtavaḥ prajananam etat arvācīnam tat divaḥ ca ādityāḥ ca  prajananam dadhāti tasmāt arvācīnam eva atas prajāyate sthitam ha eva atas
translated: the highest naturally-perforated one is the sun. He places the Ṛtus between the sky and the sun;🔽therefore the Ṛtus are here below. Moreover, this is the propagation (of the altar); he places the propagation here below the sky and the sun;

original: parākprajananaṃ yāvanto hyeva sanāgre devāstāvanto devāḥ / / /
analyzed: parāk prajananam yāvantaḥ hi eva sanā agre devāḥ tāvantaḥ devāḥ
translated: therefore propagation takes place here below. The propagation is indeed established here above; for as many gods as there were in the beginning, so many gods are (now).

original: atha prathamāyai svayamātṛṇāyai prathamāyai ca viśvajyotiṣa upariṣṭādṛtavye🔽upadadhāti /
analyzed: atha prathamāyai svayamātṛṇāyai prathamāyai ca viśvajyotiṣe upariṣṭāt ṛtavye  upadadhāti
translated: Then he places the Ṛtu-bricks above the first naturally-perforated one and the first Visvagyotis.

original: iyaṃ vai prathamā svayamātṛṇāgniḥ prathamā🔽viśvajyotistadūrdhvānṛtūndadhāti tasmādita ūrdhvā ṛtavo 'tho
analyzed: iyam vai prathamā svayamātṛṇā agniḥ prathamā  viśvajyotiḥ tat ūrdhvān ṛtūn dadhāti tasmāt itas ūrdhvāḥ ṛtavaḥ
translated: The first naturally-perforated one is this (earth), the first Visvagyotis is Agni;🔽he places the Ṛtus above that; therefore the Ṛtus are above this (earth). Moreover, this is the propagation (of the altar);

original: prajananametaditastadūrdhvam prajananaṃ dadhāti tasmādita ūrdhvameva prajāyate / / /
analyzed: prajananam etat itas tat ūrdhvam prajananam dadhāti tasmāt itas ūrdhvam eva prajāyate
translated: he places the propagation above this (earth); therefore propagation takes place above this (earth).

original: tā na vyūhet /
analyzed: tāḥ na vyūhet
translated: He should not separate them.

original: nedṛtūnvyūhānīti yo vai mriyata ṛtavo ha tasmai vyuhyante
analyzed: na id ṛtūn vyūhāni iti yaḥ vai mriyate ṛtavaḥ ha tasmai vyuhyante
translated: 'Lest he should arrange the seasons,'--for to him who dies the seasons are indeed arranged;

original: tasmādyatraiva prathame upadadhāti tatsarvā upadadhyāt / / /
analyzed: tasmāt yatra eva prathame upadadhāti tat sarvāḥ upadadhyāt
translated: therefore let him put down all (the bricks) where he puts down the first.

original: atho ime vai lokā ṛtavyāḥ /🔽imāṃstallokānūrdhvāṃścitibhiścinotyatho kṣatraṃ vā
analyzed: atha u ime vai lokāḥ ṛtavyāḥ  imān tat lokān ūrdhvān citibhiḥ cinoti atha u kṣatram vā
translated: Moreover, the seasonal (bricks) are these worlds;🔽he thus builds up these worlds upwards by the layers; moreover, the seasonal (bricks) are the ruling power;

original: ṛtavyāḥ kṣatraṃ tadūrdhvaṃ citibhiścinotyatho saṃvatsaro vā ṛtavyāḥ saṃvatsaraṃ🔽tadūrdhvaṃ citibhiścinoti tā nānyayā
analyzed: ṛtavyāḥ kṣatram tat ūrdhvam citibhiḥ cinoti atha u saṃvatsaraḥ vai ṛtavyāḥ saṃvatsaram  tat ūrdhvam citibhiḥ cinoti tāḥ na anyayā
translated: he thus builds up the ruling power upwards by the layers; moreover, the seasonal (bricks) are the year;

original: yajuṣmatyeṣṭakayopariṣṭādabhyupadadhyānnetkṣatraṃ viśābhyupadadhānīti / / /
analyzed: yajuṣmatyā iṣṭakayā upariṣṭāt abhyupadadhyāt na id kṣatram viśā abhyupadadhāni iti
translated: he thus builds up the year upwards by the layers; he should not put down any other brick above the seasonal and Yajuṣ bricks; lest he should put the ruling power above the people.

original: tā haitā eva saṃyānyaḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ ha etāḥ eva saṃyānyaḥ
translated: Now these are the same as the Samyāni (bricks).

original: etadvai devā🔽ṛtavyābhirevemāṃlokāntsamayuritaścordhvānamutaścārvācastathaivaitadyajamāna
analyzed: etat vai devā  ṛtavyābhiḥ eva imān lokān samayuḥ itas ca ūrdhvānam utas ca arvācaḥ tathā eva etat yajamāna
translated: For the gods,🔽by means of the seasonal (bricks), then went to these worlds from hence upwards and from yonder downwards; and in like manner does the Sacrificer,

original: ṛtavyābhirevemāṃlokāntsaṃyātītaścordhvānamutaścārvācaḥ / / /
analyzed: ṛtavyābhiḥ eva imān lokān saṃyāti itas ca ūrdhvān amutas ca arvācaḥ
translated: by means of the seasonal (bricks), now go to these worlds from hence upwards and from yonder downwards.

original: tadu ha carakādhvaryavaḥ /🔽anyā eva saṃyānīrityupadadhati na tathā kuryādatyahaiva
analyzed: tat u ha carakādhvaryavaḥ  anyāḥ eva saṃyānīḥ iti upadadhati na tathā kuryāt atyaha eva
translated: Now, the Charaka-Adhvaryus

original: recayantyetā u eva saṃyānyaḥ / / /
analyzed: recayanti etāḥ u eva saṃyānyaḥ
translated: put down other Samyāni (bricks), saying, 'So must it not be done; for they (the gods) went by these (seasonal bricks) alone.'

original: atha viśvajyotiṣamupadadhāti /
analyzed: atha viśvajyotiṣam upadadhāti
translated: He then lays down the Visvagyotis (all-light brick).

original: ādityo vā uttamā viśvajyotirādityo hyevāmuṣmiṃloke
analyzed: ādityaḥ vai uttamā viśva jyotiḥ ādityaḥ hi eva amuṣmin loke
translated: The highest light is the sun, for the sun is the highest light in yonder world.🔽He thereby lays the sun into it.

original: viśvajyotirādityamevaitadupadadhāti / / /🔽yadveva viśvajyotiṣamupadadhāti /
analyzed: viśvajyotiḥ ādityam eva etat upadadhāti  yat u eva viśvajyotiṣam upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Visvagyotis.

original: prajā vai viśvajyotiḥ prajā hyeva viśvaṃ jyotiḥ
analyzed: prajā vai viśvajyotiḥ prajā hi eva viśvam jyotiḥ
translated: The Visvagyotis is offspring, for offspring are the all-light;

original: prajananamevaitadupadadhāti / / /
analyzed: prajananam eva etat upadadhāti
translated: he thus lays generative power into it.

original: sa purastātsvayamātṛṇāyai viśvajyotiṣamupadadhāti /
analyzed: sa purastāt svayamātṛṇāyai viśvajyotiṣam upadadhāti
translated: He lays down the Visvagyotis in front of the naturally-perforated one;

original: dyaurvā uttamā🔽svayamātṛṇāditya uttamā viśvajyotirarvācīnaṃ taddiva ādityaṃ dadhāti tasmādeṣo
analyzed: dyauḥ vai uttamā  svayamātṛṇā ādityaḥ uttamā viśvajyotiḥ arvācīnam tat divaḥ ādityam dadhāti tasmāt eṣaḥ
translated: the highest naturally-perforated one is the sky,🔽and the highest Visvagyotis is the sun: he thus places the sun on this side of the sky; whence he shines on this side of it.

original: 'rvācīnamevātastapa tyatho prajananametadarvācīnaṃ taddivaḥ prajananaṃ dadhāti
analyzed: rvācīnam eva atas tapa ti atha u prajananam etat arvācīnam tat divaḥ prajananam dadhāti
translated: And, moreover, this is generative power: he thus places generative power on this side of the sky;

original: tasmādarvācīnamevātaḥ prajāyate / / /🔽atha prathamāyai svayamātṛṇāyai /
analyzed: tasmāt arvācīnam eva atas prajāyate  atha prathamāyai svayamātṛṇāyai
translated: whence generation takes place on this side of it.🔽He then lays down the Visvagyotis above the first naturally-perforated one;

original: upariṣṭādviśvajyotiṣamupadadhātīyaṃ vai🔽prathamā svayamātṛṇāgniḥ prathamā viśvajyotiritastadūrdhvamagniṃ dadhāti
analyzed: upariṣṭāt viśvajyotiṣam upadadhāti iyam vai  prathamā svayamātṛṇā agniḥ prathamā viśvajyotiḥ itas tat ūrdhvam agnim dadhāti
translated: the first naturally-perforated one is this (earth),🔽and the first Visvagyotis is the fire: he thus places the fire above this (earth);

original: tasmādita ūrdhvo 'gnirdīpyate 'tho prajananametaditastadūrdhvam prajananaṃ
analyzed: tasmāt itas ūrdhvaḥ gniḥ dīpyate prajananam etat itas tat ūrdhvam prajananam
translated: whence the fire burns above this (earth). And, moreover, this is generative power: he thus places generative power above this (earth);🔽whence generation takes place above this (earth).

original: dadhāti tasmādita ūrdhvameva prajāyate / / /
analyzed: dadhāti tasmāt itas ūrdhvam eva prajāyate
translated: therefore it is born upwards from here.

original: atha madhyamāyai svayamātṛṇāyai /🔽upariṣṭādviśvajyotiṣamupadadhātyantarikṣaṃ
analyzed: atha madhyamāyai svayamātṛṇāyai  upariṣṭāt viśvajyotiṣam upadadhāti antarikṣam
translated: Now for the middle naturally-perforated one.🔽He puts down the All-light above, the middle naturally-perforated one is the atmosphere,

original: vai madhyamā svayamātṛṇā vāyurmadhyamā viśvajyotirantarikṣe tadvāyuṃ dadhāti
analyzed: vai madhyamā svayamātṛṇā vāyuḥ madhyamā viśvajyotiḥ antarikṣe tat vāyum dadhāti
translated: the middle All-light is Vayu; in the atmosphere he places Vayu;

original: tasmādayamantarikṣe vāyuḥ / / /🔽tānyetāni jyotīṃṣi /
analyzed: tasmāt ayam antarikṣe vāyuḥ  tāni etāni jyotīṃṣi
translated: therefore Vayu is in the atmosphere here.🔽These are those lights.

original: tadyadetā evamupadadhātyetānyevaitajjyotīṃṣi samyañci dadhāti
analyzed: tat yat etāḥ evam upadadhāti etāni eva etat jyotīṃṣi dadhāti
translated: In that he puts them down in this way, he places those lights in union;

original: tasmādita ūrdhvo 'gnirdīpyate 'rvāṅsāvādityastapatyantarikṣe 'yaṃ tiryaṅ vāyuḥ pavate / / /
analyzed: tasmāt itas ūrdhvaḥ gniḥ dīpyate rvāṅ sau ādityaḥ tapati antarikṣe yam tiryaṅ vāyuḥ pavate
translated: therefore the fire burns upwards from here, the sun shines downwards from here, and this Vayu blows transversely in the atmosphere here.

original: parameṣṭhī tvā sādayatviti /
analyzed: parameṣṭhī tvā sādayatu iti
translated: May Prajapati settle thee,

original: parameṣṭhī hyetām pañcamīṃ
analyzed: parameṣṭhī hi etām pañcamīm
translated: for Prajapati saw this fifth layer.

original: citimapaśyaddivaspṛṣṭhe jyotiṣmatīmiti divo hyasau pṛṣṭhe jyotiṣmānādityaḥ / / /
analyzed: citim apaśyat divaḥ pṛṣṭhe jyotiṣmatīm iti divaḥ hi asau pṛṣṭhe jyotiṣmān ādityaḥ
translated: On the back of the sky, full of light, for yonder sun is full of light on the back of the sky.

original: viśvasmai prāṇāyāpānāya /🔽vyānāyeti prāṇo vai viśvajyotiḥ sarvasmā u vā etasmai
analyzed: viśvasmai prāṇāya apānāya  vyānāya iti prāṇaḥ vai viśvajyotiḥ sarvasmai u vai etasmai
translated: For all expiration, inspiration,

original: prāṇo
analyzed: prāṇo
translated: and cross-breathing, for the All-light is expiration, and for all this (universe) expiration is placed;🔽therefore it is placed in the middle.

original: viśvaṃ jyotiryaceti sarvaṃ jyotiryacetyetatsūryaste 'dhipatiriti sūryamevāsyā adhipatiṃ
analyzed: viśvam jyotiḥ yacā iti sarvam jyotiḥ yacā iti etat sūryaḥ te dhipatiḥ iti sūryam eva asyāḥ adhipatim
translated: 'He who has spread out the all-light', that is, 'he who has spread out all the light'; 'Sûrya is thy overlord', Sûrya he makes to be its overlord.

original: karoti sādayitvā sūdadohasādhivadati tasyokto bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: karoti sādayitvā sūdadohasā adhivadati tasya uktaḥ bandhuḥ
translated: 'The all-light', he says; that is, 'the all-light I spread;' 'the sun is thy overlord', he says; he makes the sun his overlord. Having settled it, he recites the Sûdadohas verse on it; the significance of this has been explained.

original: tā haitā eva saṃyānyaḥ /🔽etadvai devā🔽viśvajyotirbhirevemāṃlokāntsamayuritaścordhvānamutaścārvācastathaivaitadyajamāno
analyzed: tāḥ ha etāḥ eva saṃyānyaḥ  etat vai devā  viśvajyotirbhiḥ eva imān lokān samayuḥ itas ca ūrdhvānam utas ca arvācaḥ tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ
translated: Now these (formulas) are the same as the Samyani (formulas).

original: viśvajyotirbhirevemāṃlokāntsaṃyātītaścordhvānamutuścārvācaḥ / / /🔽tadu ha carakādhvaryavo /🔽'nyā eva saṃyānīrityupadadhati na tathā kuryādatyahaiva
analyzed: viśvajyotirbhiḥ eva imān lokān saṃyāti itas ca ūrdhvān amutur ca arvācaḥ  tat u ha caraka adhvaryavaḥ  nyāḥ eva saṃyānīḥ iti upadadhati na tathā kuryāt atyaha eva
translated: For by the all-lights the gods then went to these worlds, both upwards and downwards; and in like manner does the Sacrificer now, by the all-lights, go to these worlds, both upwards and downwards.

original: recayantyetā u eva saṃyānyaḥ / / /🔽atha lokampṛṇāmupadadhāti /🔽asau vā ādityo lokampṛṇaiṣa🔽hīmāṃlokānpūrayatyamumevaitadādityamupadadhāti tāṃ sarvāsu citiṣūpadadhātīme🔽vai lokā etāścitayo 'muṃ tadādityameṣu lokeṣu dadhāti tasmādeṣa sarvebhya
analyzed: recayanti etāḥ u eva saṃyānyaḥ  atha lokampṛṇām upadadhāti  asau vai ādityaḥ lokampṛṇā eṣa  hi imān lokān pūrayati amum eva etat ādityam upadadhāti tām sarvāsu citiṣu upadadhāti ime  vai lokāḥ etāḥ citayaḥ mum tat ādityam eṣu lokeṣu dadhāti tasmāt eṣa sarvebhyaḥ
translated: Now, the Charaka-Adhvaryus lay down other Samyani (formulas); but let him not do so, for they would be throwing away the sacrifice. These (formulas) are the Samyani.

original: evaibhyo lokebhyastapati / / /
analyzed: eva ebhyaḥ lokebhyaḥ tapati
translated: He then lays down the Lokamprinâ (earth-filling brick). The Lokamprinâ, doubtless, is yonder sun; for he fills these worlds; it is yonder sun he thus lays down. He lays it down in all the layers; for these layers are these worlds: he thus places yonder sun in these worlds, whence he shines for all these worlds.🔽He lays it down on every side: he thus places yonder sun in all these worlds, whence he shines for all these worlds.

original: yadveva lokampṛṇāmupadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva lokampṛṇām upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Lokamprinâ (earth-filling brick).

original: kṣatraṃ vai lokampṛṇā viśa imā itarā iṣṭakāḥ🔽kṣatraṃ tadviśyattāraṃ dadhāti tāṃ sarvāsu citiṣūpadadhāti sarvasyāṃ tadviśi
analyzed: kṣatram vai lokampṛṇāḥ viśaḥ imāḥ itarāḥ iṣṭakāḥ  kṣatram tat viśyat tāram dadhāti tām sarvāsu citiṣu upadadhāti sarvasyām tat viśi
translated: The Lokamprinâ is the Kshatra (nobility), and these other bricks are the Vis (people);

original: kṣatramattāraṃ dadhāti / / /
analyzed: kṣatra mattāram dadhāti
translated: he thus places the Kshatra, the ruler, in the midst of the Vis (people);--he lays it down in all the layers: he thus places the Kshatra, the ruler, in the midst of the whole people.

original: saiṣaikaiva bhavati /
analyzed: sā eṣā ekā eva bhavati
translated: It is one only:

original: ekasthaṃ tatkṣatramekasthāṃ śriyaṃ karotyatha yā dvitīyā
analyzed: ekastham tat kṣatram ekasthām śriyam karoti atha yā dvitīyā
translated: he thus makes the Kshatra one-standing, and prosperity one-standing. Then as to the second (layer).

original: mithunaṃ tadardhamu haitadātmano yanmithunaṃ yadā vai saha mithunenātha sarvo🔽'tha kṛtsnaḥ kṛtsnatāyā ekena yajuṣā bahvīriṣṭakā upadadhāti kṣatraṃ🔽tadvīryeṇātyādadhāti kṣatraṃ viśo vīryavattaraṃ karotyathetarāḥ pṛthaṅnānā
analyzed: mithunam tad ardham u ha etat ātmanaḥ yat mithunam yadā vai saha mithunena atha  kṛtsnaḥ kṛtsna tāyai ekena yajuṣā bahvīḥ iṣṭakāḥ upadadhāti kṣatram  tat vīryeṇa atyādadhāti kṣatram viśaḥ vīryavattaram karoti atha itarāḥ pṛthak nānā
translated: That is a pair: the pair, doubtless, is the half of the self; for when one is with a mate, then he is whole and complete.

original: yajurbhirupadadhāti viśaṃ tatkṣatrādavīryatarāṃ karoti pṛthagvādinīṃ nānācetasam / / /🔽sa vā asyāṃ sraktyām prathame upadadhāti /
analyzed: yajurbhiḥ upadadhāti viśam tat kṣatrāt avīryatarām karoti pṛthak vādinīm nānācetasam  sa vai asyām sraktyām prathame upadadhāti
translated: By one formula he lays down many bricks: he thus endows the Kshatra with strength, and makes the Kshatra stronger than the Vis (people). The others (he lays down) separately, with different formulas: he thus makes the Vis weaker than the Kshatra, and causes it to be of different speech and of different mind.🔽He lays it down on the first (layer):

original: amuṃ tadādityametasyāṃ diśi
analyzed: amum tat ādityam etasyām diśi
translated: he thereby places yonder sun in this region.

original: padhātyathetastasmādato 'nuparyaityathetastasmādato 'nuparyaityathetastasmādato
analyzed: padhāti atha itas tasmāt atas nu paryaiti atha itas tasmāt atas
translated: from this side he goes around; therefore he goes around from this side. From this side he goes around; therefore he goes around from this side. From this side he goes around; therefore he goes around from this side.

original: 'nuparyaityathātastasmādato 'nuparyaiti / / /
analyzed: nuparyaiti atha atas tasmāt atas nuparyaiti
translated: He places it here from there; therefore it goes round from here. He places it here from there; therefore it goes round from here. He places it here from there; therefore it goes round from here. He places it here from there; therefore it goes round from here.

original: sa yadyatraiva prathame upadadhāti /🔽taduttame anūpadadhyātsakṛddhaivāsāvāditya🔽imāṃlokānparyetya nātipracyavetātihṛtya pūrve uttame anūpadadhātyamuṃ
analyzed: sa yat yatra eva prathame upadadhāti  tat uttame anūpadadhyāt sakṛt ha eva asau āditya  imān lokān paryetya na atipracyaveta atihṛtya pūrve uttame anūpadadhāti amum
translated: If he were to place the last one in the same place as the first one,🔽then this sun, having gone round these worlds, would not pass beyond (them). Having passed over the first, he places the last one;

original: tadādityamimāṃlokānatipracyāvayati tasmādasāvāditya imāṃlokānasaṃsthito
analyzed: tat ādityam imān lokān atipracyāvayati tasmāt asau ādityaḥ imān lokān a saṃsthitaḥ
translated: he thus makes this sun pass beyond these worlds; therefore this sun, not remaining (fixed),

original: dakṣiṇāvṛtpunaḥ punaranuparyaiti / / /
analyzed: dakṣiṇa āvṛt punar punar anuparyaiti
translated: goes round these worlds again and again, turning to the right.

original: lokam pṛṇa cidram pṛṇeti /🔽lokaṃ ca pūraya cidraṃ ca pūrayetyetadatho sīda dhruvā
analyzed: lokam pṛṇa cidram pṛṇa iti  lokam ca pūraya cit ram ca pūraya iti etat atha u sīda dhruvā
translated: 'Fill the world, fill the desire,' he says;

original: tvamityatho sīda sthirā tvam pratiṣṭhitetyetadindrāgnī tvā🔽bṛhaspatirasminyonāvasīṣadannitīndrāgnī ca tvā bṛhaspatiścāsminyonau
analyzed: tvam iti atha u sīda sthirā tvam pratiṣṭhitā iti etat indra agnī tvā  bṛhaspatiḥ asmin yonau asīṣadan iti indra agnī ca tvā bṛhaspatiḥ ca asmin yonau
translated: 'fill the world and fill the desire,' he says; 'and sit firm here,' he says; 'and sit firm, well-established,' he says. 'May Indra and Agni,

original: pratyatiṣṭhipannityetadanuṣṭubhā vāgvā anuṣṭubvāgindra indro lokampṛṇā na
analyzed: pratyatiṣṭhipan iti etat anuṣṭubhā vāc vai anuṣṭubh vāc indraḥ indraḥ lokampṛṇā na
translated: may Brihaspati settle thee in this womb,' he says; 'may Indra and Agni, and Brihaspati settle thee in this womb,' he says. 'With the Anustubh metre,' (with these words) he touches it; the Anustubh is speech, Indra is speech; the Lokampṛṇā bricks are all the bricks;

original: sādayatyasanno hyeṣa sūdadohasā vadati prāṇo vai sūdadohāḥ
analyzed: sādayati a sannaḥ hi eṣa sūdadohasā vadati prāṇaḥ vai sūdadohāḥ
translated: he places it; for this (cup) is not pressed; with the Sûdadohas he recites; for the Sûdadohas are the breath.

original: prāṇenaivainametatsaṃtanoti saṃdadhāti / / /🔽tadāhuḥ / kathameṣā lokampṛṇāyātayāmnī bhavatītyasau vā ādityo
analyzed: prāṇena eva enam etat saṃtanoti saṃdadhāti  tat āhuḥ katham eṣā lokampṛṇā ayātayāmnī bhavati iti asau vai ādityaḥ
translated: He places it (the Lokampṛṇā brick) with the Sûdadohas (verses); for the Sûdadohas are the breath, and by the breath he thus joins and puts together (the Lokampṛṇā bricks).

original: lokampṛṇāyātayāmā vā eṣo 'tho vāgvai lokampṛṇāyātayāmnyu vai vāk / / /
analyzed: lokampṛṇā ayātayāmā vai eṣā u tha u vāc vai lokampṛṇā ayātayāmnī u vai vāc
translated: As to this they say, 'How does that Lokamprinâ become inexhaustible?'--Well, that Lokamprinâ is yonder sun, and he is inexhaustible; and speech also is the Lokamprinâ, for speech is inexhaustible.

original: sa vai yajuṣmatīrupadhāya /🔽lokampṛṇayā pracādayatyannaṃ vai yajuṣmatya iṣṭakā🔽ātmā lokampṛṇānnaṃ tadātmanā paridadhāti tasmādannamātmanā parihitamātmaiva🔽bhavati / / /
analyzed: sa vai yajuṣmatīḥ upadhāya  lokampṛṇayā pracādayati annam vai yajuṣmatyaḥ iṣṭakā  ātmā lokampṛṇā annam tat ātmanā paridadhāti tasmāt annam ātmanā parihitam ātmā eva  bhavati
translated: Having laid down the Yagus-containing (bricks),

original: sa vā ātmanneva /
analyzed: sa vai ātman eva
translated: he covers them with the Lokamprinâ; for the Yagus-containing bricks are food, and the Lokamprinâ is the body: he thus encloses the food on both sides by the body, and hence food, when enclosed on both sides by the body, becomes the body itself.

original: yajuṣmatīrupadadhāti na pakṣapuceṣvātmaṃstadannaṃ dadhāti🔽yadu vā ātmannannaṃ dhīyate tadātmānamavati tatpakṣapucānyatha
analyzed: yajuṣmatīḥ upadadhāti na pakṣa puceṣu ātman tat annam dadhāti  yat u vai ātman annam dhīyate tat ātmānam avati tat pakṣa pucāni atha
translated: He lays down the Yagus-containing (bricks) on the body (of the altar), not on the wings and tail; he thus puts food into the body.🔽And whatever food is put into the body that supports the body and the wings and tail;

original: yatpakṣapuceṣu naiva tadātmānamavati na pakṣapucāni / / /
analyzed: yat pakṣa puceṣu na eva tat ātmānam avati na pakṣa pucāni
translated: but what (food) is put into the wings and tail does not support either the body or the wings and tail.

original: ubhayīryajuṣmatīśca lokampṛṇāścātmannupadadhāti /
analyzed: ubhayīḥ yajuṣmatīḥ ca lokampṛṇāḥ ca ātman upadadhāti
translated: He lays down both the Yagus-containing (bricks) and the Lokamprinâs on the body (of the altar);

original: tasmādayamātmā dviguṇo
analyzed: tasmāt ayam ātmā dviguṇaḥ
translated: hence this body is double.

original: bahulatara iva lokampṛṇā eva pakṣapuceṣu tasmātpakṣapucāni tanīyāṃsīvānūcīśca
analyzed: bahulataraḥ iva lokampṛṇāḥ eva pakṣa puceṣu tasmāt pakṣa pucāni tanīyāṃsi iva anūcīḥ ca
translated: The Lokampṛṇā bricks are more numerous in the wings and tail; therefore the wings and tail are smaller and more numerous.

original: tiraścītmannupadadhātyasthīni vā iṣṭakāstasmādimānyanvañci ca tiryañci
analyzed: tiraści itman upadadhāti asthīni vai iṣṭakāḥ tasmāt imāni anvañci ca tiryañci
translated: He lays them down in the body, sloping towards the tail; for the bricks are bones; therefore these (bones) are in the body, both lengthwise and crosswise.

original: cātmannasthīni parācīreva pakṣapuceṣu na hi kiṃ cana pakṣapuceṣu
analyzed: ca ātman asthīni parācīḥ eva pakṣa puceṣu na hi kim cana pakṣa puceṣu
translated: He lays them down in the body, sloping towards the tail; for the wings and tail are crosswise; for there is no bone in the wings and tail

original: tiryagasthyasti taddhaitadeva citasya cācitasya ca vijñānamevameva cita itarathācitaḥ / / /
analyzed: tiryak asthi asti tat ha etat eva citasya ca a citasya ca vijñānam evam eva citaḥ itarathā a citaḥ
translated: that is crosswise. This, then, is the difference between the built and the unbuilt (altar): in this way it is built, in the other way it is unbuilt.

original: sa vai svayamātṛṇāṃ lokampṛṇayā pracādayati /
analyzed: sa vai svayamātṛṇām lokampṛṇayā pracādayati
translated: He covers the naturally-perforated one with the Lokampṛṇā (bricks).

original: prāṇo vai svayamātṛṇādityo lokampṛṇā🔽prāṇaṃ tadādityena saminddhe tasmādayamuṣṇaḥ prāṇastayā sarvamātmānam🔽pracādayati sarvaṃ tadātmānamādityena saminddhe tasmādayaṃ sarva
analyzed: prāṇaḥ vai svayamātṛṇā ādityaḥ lokampṛṇā  prāṇam tat ādityena saminddhe tasmāt ayam uṣṇaḥ prāṇaḥ tayā sarvam ātmānam  pracādayati sarvam tat ātmānam ādityena saminddhe tasmāt ayam sarva
translated: The naturally-perforated one is the breath, and the Lokampṛṇā is the sun;🔽he thus kindles the breath by the sun. For this reason this breath is warm. He covers the whole body with it;

original: evātmoṣṇastaddhaitadeva jīviṣyataśca mariṣyataśca vijñānamuṣṇa eva jīviṣyañcīto🔽mariṣyan / / /
analyzed: eva ātmā uṣṇaḥ tat ha etat eva jīviṣyataḥ ca mariṣyataḥ ca vijñānam uṣṇaḥ eva  mariṣyan
translated: he thus kindles the whole body by the sun. For this reason this whole body is warm. This, then, is the difference between one who will live and one who will not live: he who is warm will live, he who is cold will not live.

original: sa yasyāṃ sraktyām prathame upadadhāti /
analyzed: sa yasyām sraktyām prathame upadadhāti
translated: In whatever layer he lays down the first (bricks),

original: tato daśabhirdaśabhiḥ saṃcādayannetyā
analyzed: tatas daśabhiḥ daśabhiḥ saṃcādayan etyā
translated: he should cover (the altar) by going round it in sets of ten.

original: svayamātṛṇāyai sa tenaiva dakṣiṇāvṛjjaghanena svayamātṛṇāṃ saṃcādayannetyānūkyāyā
analyzed: svayamātṛṇāyai sa tena eva dakṣiṇāvṛt jaghanena svayamātṛṇām saṃcādayan etya anūkyāyā
translated: He covers the naturally-perforated one with that (brick) turning his right side towards it, and then the anus.

original: atha punaretya tamavadhiṃ saṃcādayati / / /
analyzed: atha punar etya tam avadhim saṃcādayati
translated: Then, having returned, he covers that boundary (of the altar).

original: ātmānamagre saṃcādayati /🔽ātmā hyevāgre sambhavataḥ sambhavatyatha dakṣiṇam
analyzed: ātmānam agre saṃcādayati  ātmā hi eva agre sambhavataḥ sambhavati atha dakṣiṇam
translated: He covers the self first;

original: pakṣamatha pucamathottaraṃ taddakṣiṇāvṛttaddhi devatrātho evaṃ vā asāvāditya
analyzed: pakṣam atha pucam atha uttaram tat dakṣiṇa āvṛt tat hi devatrā atha u evam vai asau āditya
translated: for of those who are born the self is born first, then the right wing, then the tail, then the left; for that (is the way) in a rightward direction with the gods. Moreover, in this way, indeed, yonder sun

original: imāṃlokāndakṣiṇāvṛdanuparyaiti / / /
analyzed: imān lokān dakṣiṇa āvṛt anuparyaiti
translated: goes round these worlds in a rightward direction.

original: sa eṣa prāṇa eva yallokampṛṇā /
analyzed: saḥ eṣa prāṇaḥ eva yat lokampṛṇā
translated: Now this Lokampṛṇā (brick) is the breath itself;

original: tayā sarvamātmānam pracādayati
analyzed: tayā sarvam ātmānam pracādayati
translated: with it he covers the whole body;

original: sarvasmistadātmanprāṇaṃ dadhāti tadyaddhāsyaiṣāṅgaṃ nābhiprāpnuyātprāṇo hāsya
analyzed: sarvasmin tat ātman prāṇam dadhāti tat yat ha asya eṣā aṅgam na abhiprāpnuyāt prāṇaḥ ha asya
translated: he thus puts breath into the whole body. But if he were not to reach any limb of it,

original: tadaṅgaṃ nābhiprāpnuyādyadu vai prāṇo 'ṅgaṃ nābhiprāpnoti śuṣyati vā vai
analyzed: tat aṅgam na abhiprāpnuyāt yat u vai prāṇaḥ ṅgam na abhiprāpnoti śuṣyati vā vai
translated: breath would not reach that limb of his. And if breath does not reach a limb,

original: tanmlāyati vā tasmādenaṃ sarvamevaitayā pracādayet / / /🔽sa vā ātmana evādhi pakṣapucāni cinoti /
analyzed: tat mlāyati vā tasmāt enam sarvam eva etayā pracādayet  sa vai ātmanaḥ eva adhi pakṣa pucāni cinoti
translated: it either dries up or decays. For this reason he should cover the whole of it with it.🔽He piles the wings and tail on the body itself;

original: ātmano hyevādhyaṅgāni prarohantyatha
analyzed: ātmanaḥ hi eva adhi aṅgāni prarohanti atha
translated: for the limbs grow from the body.

original: yatpurastādarvācīrupadadhyādyathānyata āhṛtyāṅgam pratidadhyāttādṛktat / / /
analyzed: yat purastāt arvācīḥ upadadhyāt yathā anyatas āhṛtya aṅgam pratidadhyāt tādṛś tat
translated: If he were to put down (the bricks) in front (of the fire) towards the back, it would be as if one were to take a limb and put it down in front of the body.

original: na bhinnāṃ na kṛṣṇāmupadadhyāt /
analyzed: na bhinnām na kṛṣṇām upadadhyāt
translated: He should not put down a broken or black one.

original: ārcati vā eṣā yā bhidyata ārtamvetadrūpaṃ🔽yatkṛṣṇaṃ nedārtamātmānamabhisaṃskaravā iti nābhinnām
analyzed: ārcati vai eṣā yā bhidyate ārtam vā etat rūpam  yat kṛṣṇam na id ārtam ātmānam abhisaṃskaravai iti na abhinnām
translated: For that (brick) is burnt which is broken, and that is a form of distress;🔽and black is a form of distress. 'I will not make myself distressed,' (thinking thus) he should not put down a broken one.🔽'I will not make distress outside myself,' (thinking thus) he should not put down a black one.🔽Having counted the Dhishnya hearths, he should put down the one which is left over last.

original: parāsyennedanārtamātmano bahirdhā karavāṇīti dhiṣṇyebhyaḥ pratisaṃkhyāya yā
analyzed: parāsyet na id an ārtam ātmanaḥ bahirdhā karavāṇi iti dhiṣṇyebhyaḥ pratisaṃkhyāya yā
translated: If the Virâg (metre) should be left over, it should be put down last.

original: virājamatiricyerannottarāmudbhaveyustadvai khalu tā ārcanti tā bhittvotkara
analyzed: virājam atiricyeran na uttarām udbhaveyuḥ tat vai khalu tāḥ ārcanti tāḥ bhittvā utkara
translated: They indeed burn that (brick). Having broken it,

original: utkiredutkaro vā atiriktasya pratiṣṭhā tadyatrātiriktasya pratiṣṭhā tadevainā
analyzed: utkiret utkaraḥ vai atiriktasya pratiṣṭhā tat yatra atiriktasya pratiṣṭhā tat eva enā
translated: he should throw it on the rubbish-heap. The rubbish-heap is the foundation of what is left over. There where the foundation of what is left over is,

original: etatpratiṣṭhāpayati / / /
analyzed: etat pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: there he establishes it.

original: athāta iṣṭakāmātrāṇāmeva /🔽pādamātrīḥ prathamāyāṃ cottamāyāṃ ca
analyzed: atha atas iṣṭakā mātrāṇām eva  pāda mātrīḥ prathamāyām ca uttamāyām ca
translated: Now then of the measures of the bricks.

original: cityorupadadhyātpratiṣṭhā vai pādo yo vai pādaḥ sa hasta ūrvasthamātryo varṣiṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: cityoḥ upadadhyāt pratiṣṭhā vai pādaḥ yaḥ vai pādaḥ sa hastaḥ ūrva stha mātryaḥ varṣiṣṭhāḥ
translated: He should put down (bricks) one foot long in the first and last layers of the altar. The foot is a foundation. What is a foot is a hand. The longest (bricks) should be the length of the thigh.

original: syurna hyūrvasthātkiṃ cana varṣīyo 'sthyasti tryālikhitavatyastisraścitayaḥ syustrivṛto
analyzed: syuḥ na hi ūrva sthāt kim cana varṣīyaḥ sthi asti tri ālikhitavatyaḥ tisraḥ citayaḥ syuḥ trivṛtaḥ
translated: For there is no bone longer than the thigh. The three layers should have three lines. The three layers are threefold.

original: hīme lokā aparimitālikhite dve raso haite citī aparimita u vai rasaḥ sarvāstveva
analyzed: hi ime lokāḥ aparimita alikhite dve rasaḥ ha ete citī aparimitaḥ u vai rasaḥ sarvā astu eva
translated: These worlds are limited; these two layers are the essence; the essence is unlimited;

original: tryālikhitavatyaḥ syuḥ sarve hyeveme lokāstrivṛtaḥ / / /
analyzed: tri ālikhitavatyaḥ syuḥ sarve hi eva ime lokāḥ trivṛtaḥ
translated: all (the layers) should have three lines, for all these worlds are threefold.

original: athāta iṣṭakānāmevāvapanasya /
analyzed: atha atas iṣṭakānām eva āvapanasya
translated: Now, then, of the laying of the bricks.

original: yāṃ kāṃ ca yajuṣmatīmiṣṭakāṃ vidyāttām
analyzed: yām kām ca yajuṣmatīm iṣṭakām vidyāt tām
translated: Whatever brick one knows to be possessed of a Yagus-formula,

original: madhyamāyāṃ citā upadadhyādantarikṣaṃ vai madhyamā citirantarikṣamu vai
analyzed: madhyamāyām citau upadadhyāt antarikṣam vai madhyamā citiḥ antarikṣam u vai
translated: that one should put down in the middle layer; the middle layer is the atmosphere; the atmosphere is

original: sarveṣām bhūtānāmāvapanamatho annaṃ vai yajuṣmatya iṣṭakā udaram madhyamā
analyzed: sarveṣām bhūtānām āvapanam atha u annam vai yajuṣmatyaḥ iṣṭakāḥ udaram madhyamā
translated: the receptacle of all beings; moreover, the bricks possessed of Yagus-formulas are food, and the middle layer is the belly;

original: citirudare tadannaṃ dadhāti / / /🔽tadāhuḥ / nopadadhyānnedatirecayānīti sa vā upaiva dadhyātkāmebhyo vā etā iṣṭakā🔽upadhīyante na vai kāmānāmatiriktamasti sa vai naivopadadhyādetāvadvā etaddevā
analyzed: citiḥ udare tat annam dadhāti  tat āhuḥ na upadadhyāt na id atirecayāni iti sa vai upa eva dadhyāt kāmebhyaḥ vai etāḥ iṣṭakāḥ  upadhīyante na vai kāmānām atiriktam asti sa vai na eva upadadhyāt etāvat vai etat devāḥ
translated: in the belly he puts the food.

original: akurvan / / /
analyzed: akurvan
translated: As to that they say, 'Let him not put (the bricks) down, lest he should overstep (the proper time).' Let him, nevertheless, put them down; for these bricks are put down for the sake of (special) wishes; and there is nothing excessive in wishes. Let him, nevertheless, not put them down; for so much did the gods do.

original: atha purīṣaṃ nivapati /🔽māṃsaṃ vai purīṣam māṃsenaivainametatpracādayatīṣṭakā
analyzed: atha purīṣam nivapati  māṃsam vai purīṣam māṃsena eva enam etat pracādayati iṣṭakā
translated: Then he pours down the earth.🔽The earth is the flesh; with flesh he covers it. He puts down the brick;

original: upadhāyāsyīṣṭakā asthi tanmāṃsaiḥ saṃcādayati / / /
analyzed: upadhāya asyi iṣṭakāḥ asthi tat māṃsaiḥ saṃcādayati
translated: the brick is the bone; he covers the bone with flesh.

original: sa vai svayamātṛṇāyāmāvapati /🔽prāṇo vai svayamātṛṇānnam purīṣam prāṇe tadannaṃ
analyzed: sa vai svayamātṛṇāyām āvapati  prāṇaḥ vai svayamātṛṇā annam purīṣam prāṇe tat annam
translated: He scatters it on the naturally-perforated (brick).🔽The naturally-perforated one is the breath, and the chips are food: he thus puts food into the breath.

original: dadhāti tena sarvamātmānam pracādayati tammādyatprāṇe 'nnaṃ dhīyate
analyzed: dadhāti tena sarvam ātmānam pracādayati tammāt yat prāṇe nnam dhīyate
translated: He covers the whole body with it: hence whatever food is put into the breath

original: sarvamātmānamavati sarvamātmānamanuvyeti / / /
analyzed: sarvam ātmānam avati sarvam ātmānam anuvyeti
translated: supports the whole body, and pervades the whole body.

original: na svayamātṛṇāyāmāvapedityu haika āhuḥ /🔽prāṇaḥ svayamātṛṇā
analyzed: na svayam ātṛṇāyām āvapet iti u ha eke āhuḥ  prāṇaḥ svayamātṛṇā
translated: 'Let him not scatter (the chips) on the naturally-perforated (brick),' say some,

original: netprāṇānapidadhānīti🔽sa vā aiva vapedannena vai prāṇā viṣṭabdhā yo vā annaṃ nātti saṃ vai tasya prāṇā🔽rohanti tadyasya ha tathā kurvanti yathā śuṣkā sūrmī suṣiraivaṃ ha so
analyzed: na id prāṇān apidadhāni iti  sa vai ā eva vapet annena vai prāṇāḥ viṣṭabdhāḥ yaḥ vai annam na atti sam vai tasya prāṇāḥ  rohanti tat yasya ha tathā kurvanti yathā śuṣkā sūrmī suṣirā evam ha sā
translated: 'lest he should shut up the breath.'🔽But let him scatter (the chips) thereon; for the vital airs are supported by food: the vital airs of him, indeed, who does not eat, rise up; and, verily, he who does so (as directed) is born in yonder world like a dry, hollow reed.

original: 'muṣmiṃloke sambhavati tasmātsvayamātṛṇāyāmaiva vapet / / /🔽svayamātṛṇāyāmopya /🔽anūkyayā saṃcādayannetyā pariśridbhyaḥ sa tenaiva
analyzed: muṣmin loke sambhavati tasmāt svayam ātṛṇāyām ā eva vapet  svayamātṛṇāyām opya  anūkyayā saṃcādayan etyā pariśridbhyaḥ sa tena eva
translated: Therefore let him scatter (the chips) on the naturally-perforated (brick).🔽Having scattered (the chips) on the naturally-perforated (brick),

original: dakṣiṇāvṛjjaghanena svayamātṛṇāṃ saṃcādayannaityā punaranūkyāyai / / /
analyzed: dakṣiṇāvṛt jaghanena svayamātṛṇām saṃcādayan aiti ā punaranūkyāyai
translated: he covers them with the enclosing-stones, turning his right side towards them. He then covers the naturally-perforated (brick) on the right side, turning his right side towards it, and then the enclosing-stones on the left side, turning his left side towards them.

original: ātmānamagre saṃcādayati /
analyzed: ātmānam agre saṃcādayati
translated: He first covers the body (of the altar),

original: ātmā hyevāgre sambhavataḥ sambhavatyatha dakṣiṇam
analyzed: ātmā hi eva agre sambhavataḥ sambhavati atha dakṣiṇam
translated: for the body is the first to be produced of what is produced; then the right side,

original: pakṣamatha pucamathottaraṃ taddakṣiṇāvṛttaddhi devatrā / / /
analyzed: pakṣam atha pucam atha uttaram tat dakṣiṇa āvṛt tat hi devatrā
translated: The left side is the tail, the right side is the northern direction, for the gods move from right to left.

original: sa eṣa prāṇa eva yatpurīṣam /
analyzed: saḥ eṣa prāṇaḥ eva yat purīṣam
translated: This very dust is the breath.

original: tena sarvamātmānam pracādayati🔽sarvasmiṃstadātmanprāṇaṃ dadhāti tadyaddhāsyaitadaṅgaṃ nābhiprāpnuyātprāṇo
analyzed: tena sarvam ātmānam pracādayati  sarvasmin tat ātman prāṇam dadhāti tat yat ha asya etat aṅgam na abhiprāpnuyāt prāṇaḥ
translated: With it he covers his whole self.🔽In his whole self he places the breath. Now if he were to leave any part of him unsprinkled,

original: hāsya tadaṅgaṃ nābhiprāpnuyādyadu vai prāṇo 'ṅgaṃ nābhiprāpnoti śuṣyati vā vai
analyzed: ha asya tat aṅgam na abhiprāpnuyāt yat u vai prāṇaḥ ṅgam na abhiprāpnoti śuṣyati vā vai
translated: the breath would not reach that part of him. And if the breath does not reach a part of him,

original: tanmlāyati vā tasmādenaṃ sarvamevaitena pracādayet / / /🔽indraṃ viśvā avīvṛdhanniti /
analyzed: tat mlāyati vā tasmāt enam sarvam eva etena pracādayet  indram viśvāḥ avīvṛdhan iti
translated: it either dries up or withers. Therefore he should cover everything with it.

original: indraṃ hi sarvāṇi bhūtāni vardhayanti samudravyacasaṃ
analyzed: indram hi sarvāṇi bhūtāni vardhayanti samudra vyacasam
translated: All beings have strengthened Indra.

original: gira iti mahimānamasyaitadāha rathītamaṃ rathīnāmiti rathitamo hyeṣa rathināṃ
analyzed: giraḥ iti mahimānam asya etat āha rathītamam rathīnām iti rathitamaḥ hi eṣa rathinām
translated: Sea-vast - he says this to indicate his greatness. Best of charioteers among charioteers - for he is indeed the best of charioteers.

original: vājānāṃ satpatim patimityannaṃ vai vājā annānāṃ satpatim
analyzed: vājānām satpatim patim iti annam vai vājāḥ annānām satpatim
translated: Lord of treasures, lord of food - treasures mean food. He is the lord of food.

original: patimityetadaindryānuṣṭubhā nivapatyaindraṃ hi purīṣaṃ
analyzed: patim iti etat aindryā anuṣṭubhā nivapati aindram hi purīṣam
translated: Lord - he says this. He scatters with a verse addressed to Indra. For the dust belongs to Indra.

original: tadetadardhamagneryatpurīṣamardhamaiṣṭakam / / /
analyzed: tat etat ardham agneḥ yat purīṣam ardham aiṣṭakam
translated: This is half of Agni - the dust, and half of the bricks.

original: tadāhuḥ / yatsarvaiścandobhiḥ sarvābhirdevatābhiriṣṭakā🔽upadadhātyathaitadekayaikadevatyayā nivapati kathametadardhamagneritīndro vai🔽sarvāndevānpratistadyadaindryā nivapati tenaitadardhamagneratha yadanuṣṭubhā
analyzed: tat āhuḥ yat sarvaiḥ candobhiḥ sarvābhiḥ devatābhiḥ iṣṭakā  upadadhāti atha etat ekayā eka devatyayā nivapati katham etat ardham agneḥ iti indraḥ vai  sarvān devān pratistat yat aindryā nivapati tena etat ardham agneḥ atha yat anuṣṭubhā
translated: As to this they say, 'Since he lays down the bricks with all the metres and with all the deities,

original: vāgvā anuṣṭubvāgu sarvāṇi candāṃsi teno evārdham / / /
analyzed: vāc vai anuṣṭubh vāc u sarvāṇi candāṃsi tena u eva ardham
translated: and now pours out this (oblation) with one metre and one deity, how then is this half of Agni?' Indra, doubtless, is all the gods: in that he pours out (the oblation) with one sacred to Indra, thereby this is half of Agni. And the Anushtubh metre, doubtless, is speech, and speech is all the metres: thereby this is the other half of Agni.

original: atha vikarṇīṃ ca svayamātṛṇāṃ copadadhāti /🔽vāyurvai vikarṇī dyauruttamā🔽svayamātṛṇā vāyuṃ ca taddivaṃ copadadhātyuttame upadadhātyuttame hi vāyuśca🔽dyauśca saṃspṛṣṭe saṃspṛṣṭe hi vāyuśca dyauśca pūrvāṃ
analyzed: atha vikarṇīm ca svayamātṛṇām ca upadadhāti  vāyuḥ vai vikarṇī dyauḥ uttamā  svayamātṛṇāḥ vāyum ca tat divam ca upadadhāti uttame upadadhāti uttame hi vāyuḥ ca  dyauḥ ca saṃspṛṣṭe saṃspṛṣṭe hi vāyuḥ ca dyauḥ ca pūrvām
translated: He then lays down the Vikarnî and the Svayamâtrinnâ.🔽The Vikarnî, doubtless, is Vâyu (the wind), and the uppermost Svayamâtrinnâ is the sky: he thus places Vâyu and the sky (in the fire-altar). He places them on the top, for Vâyu and the sky are on the top. They are in contact, for Vâyu and the sky are in contact.

original: vikarṇīmupadadhātyarvācīnaṃ taddivo vāyuṃ dadhāti tasmādeṣo 'rvācīnameva vātaḥ🔽pavate / / /
analyzed: vikarṇīm upadadhāti arvācīnam tat divaḥ vāyum dadhāti tasmāt eṣaḥ u rvācīnam eva vātaḥ  pavate
translated: He places the Vikarnî on the east side, and the Svayamâtrinnâ on the west side: he thus places Vâyu on this side of the sky; whence that wind blows on this side only.

original: yadveva vikarṇīmupadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva vikarṇīm upadadhāti
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Vikarnî.

original: yatra vā ado 'śvaṃ citimavaghrāpayanti tadasāvāditya
analyzed: yatra vai adaḥ śvam citim avaghrāpayanti tat asau āditya
translated: Where they make the horse smell the layer (of the fire-altar), that is the sun, the highest deity; and the Vikarnî is the wind: he thus places the wind in the sun, the highest deity.

original: imāṃlokāntsūtre samāvayate tadyattatsūtraṃ vāyuḥ sa sa yaḥ sa vāyureṣā sā vikarṇī🔽tadyadetāmupadadhātyasāveva tadāditya imāṃlokāntsūtre samāvayate / / /
analyzed: imān lokān sūtre samāvayate tat yat tat sūtram vāyuḥ sa sa yaḥ sa vāyuḥ eṣā sā vikarṇī  tat yat etām upadadhāti asau eva tat ādityaḥ imān lokān sūtre samāvayate
translated: And in that he lays down this (brick), yonder sun weaves these worlds into the thread.

original: yadveva vikarṇīṃ ca svayamātṛṇāṃ copadadhāti /🔽āyurvai vikarṇī prāṇaḥ
analyzed: yat u eva vikarṇīm ca svayamātṛṇām ca upadadhāti  āyuḥ vai vikarṇī prāṇaḥ
translated: And, again, as to why he lays down the Vikarnî and the Svayamâtrinnâ.

original: svayamātṛṇāyuśca tatprāṇaṃ copadadhātyuttame upadadhātyuttame hyāyuśca prāṇaśca
analyzed: svayamātṛṇā āyuḥ ca tat prāṇam ca upadadhāti uttame upadadhāti uttame hi āyuḥ ca prāṇaḥ ca
translated: The Vikarnî is life, and the Svayamâtrinnâ is the vital air; he thus lays life and the vital air together. He lays them down at the top, for life and the vital air are at the top (of the body).🔽He lays the Vikarnî down first, and the Svayamâtrinnâ afterwards, for life is before the vital air.

original: saṃspṛṣṭe saṃspṛṣṭe hyāyuśca prāṇaśca pūrvāmuttarāṃ vikarṇīmupadadhātyāyuṣā
analyzed: saṃspṛṣṭe saṃspṛṣṭe hi āyuḥ ca prāṇaḥ ca pūrvām uttarām vikarṇīm upadadhāti āyuṣā
translated: He lays them down so as to touch, for life and the vital air touch each other. He lays the northern one first, and the southern afterwards, for life is before the vital air.

original: tatprāṇamubhayataḥ parigṛhṇāti / / /
analyzed: tat prāṇam ubhayatas parigṛhṇāti
translated: He thus encloses the vital air on both sides.

original: prothadaśvo na yavase /
analyzed: prothat aśvaḥ na yavase
translated: The horse neighs for the barley,

original: 'viṣyanyadā mahaḥ saṃvaraṇādvyasthāt ādasya vāto anuvāti🔽śociradha sma te vrajanaṃ kṛṣṇamastīti yadā vā etasya vāto 'nuvāti śocirathaitasya
analyzed: viṣyanyadā mahaḥ saṃvaraṇāt vyasthāt ādasya vātaḥ anuvāti  śociḥ adha sma te vrajanam kṛṣṇam asti iti yadā vai etasya vātaḥ nuvāti śociḥ atha etasya
translated: when he hath stepped forth from the great enclosure; the wind blows after him,🔽and then thy path is black, O horse. When the wind blows after him,

original: vrajanaṃ kṛṣṇam bhavati triṣṭubhopadadhāti traiṣṭubho hi vāyurāgneyyāgnikarma
analyzed: vrajanam kṛṣṇam bhavati triṣṭubhā upadadhāti traiṣṭubhaḥ hi vāyuḥ āgneyyā agnikarma
translated: then his path becomes black. With a Trishtubh (verse) he lays it down, for the wind belongs to the Trishtubh; with one addressed to Agni (he lays it down), for it is an act relating to Agni.

original: hyaniruktayānirukto hi vāyuratha yadvāta ityāha vāto hi vāyuḥ / / /
analyzed: hi aniruktayā aniruktaḥ hi vāyuḥ atha yat vātaḥ iti āha vātaḥ hi vāyuḥ
translated: for the wind is indeed undefined, and when he says 'wind', it is because wind is indeed wind.

original: atha svayamātṛṇāmupadadhāti /🔽āyoṣṭvā sadane sādayāmītyeṣa vā🔽āyustasyaitatsadanamavata ityeṣa hīdaṃ sarvamavati cāyāyāmityetasya hīdaṃ sarvaṃ🔽cāyāyāṃ samudrasyahyetaddhṛdayaṃ raśmīvatīm bhāsvatīmiti raśmīvatī hi
analyzed: atha svayamātṛṇām upadadhāti  āyoḥ tvā sadane sādayāmi iti eṣa vā  āyuḥ tasya etat sadanam avataḥ iti eṣa hi idam sarvam avati ca āyāyām iti etasya hi idam sarvam  cāyāyām samudrasya hi etat hṛdayam raśmīvatīm bhāsvatīm iti raśmīvatī hi
translated: Then he lays down the naturally-perforated one.

original: dyaurbhāsvatyā yā dyām bhāsyā pṛthivīmorvantarikṣamityevaṃ hyeṣa
analyzed: dyauḥ bhāsvatyā yā dyām bhāsyā pṛthivīm ā uru antarikṣam iti evam hi eṣa
translated: 'I settle thee in the abode of life', he says; for this (Agni) is life, and this is its abode. 'Of the all-supporting', (he says); for this (Agni) supports all this (universe). 'In the shade', (he says); for all this (universe) is in the shade of this (Agni). 'The radiant, the light-bringing', (he says); for the sky is indeed radiant and light-bringing. 'May it illumine the sky, the earth, and the broad atmosphere', (he says); for thus indeed

original: imāṃlokānābhāti / / /🔽parameṣṭhī tvā sādayatviti /
analyzed: imān lokān ābhāti  parameṣṭhī tvā sādayatu iti
translated: this (Agni) shines on these worlds.🔽'May Parameshthin settle thee', (with these words) he lays down (the naturally-perforated brick);

original: parameṣṭhī hyetām pañcamīṃ citimapaśyan / / /
analyzed: parameṣṭhī hi etām pañcamīm citim apaśyan
translated: for Parameshthin saw this fifth layer.

original: yadveva parameṣṭhinopadadhāti /
analyzed: yat u eva parameṣṭhinā upadadhāti
translated: And again, in that he lays down Parameshthin.

original: prajāpatiṃ visrastaṃ devatā ādāya
analyzed: prajāpatim visrastam devatāḥ ādāya
translated: The gods, having taken away Prajapati when relaxed,

original: vyudakrāmaṃstasya parameṣṭhī śira ādāyotkramyātiṣṭhan / / /
analyzed: vyudakrāman tasya parameṣṭhī śiraḥ ādāya utkramya atiṣṭhan
translated: departed. Parameshthin, having taken his head, departed and stood (by).

original: tamabravīt /🔽upa mehi ma etaddhehi yena me tvamudakramīriti kim me tato
analyzed: tam abravīt  upa me hi me etat hehi yena me tvam udakramīḥ iti kim me
translated: He said to him,

original: bhaviṣyatīti tvaddevatyameva ma etadātmano bhaviṣyatīti tatheti
analyzed: bhaviṣyati iti tvad devatyam eva me etat ātmanaḥ bhaviṣyati iti tathā iti
translated: 'Come to me, give me that by which thou hast departed from me.' 'What will be my reward?' 'This part of my self shall be sacred to thee.' 'So be it.'

original: tadasminnetatparameṣṭhī pratyadadhāt / / /
analyzed: tat asmin etat parameṣṭhī pratyadadhāt
translated: In this (layer) Parameshthin then deposited that (vital air).

original: tadyaiṣottamā svayamātṛṇā /🔽etadasya tadātmanastadyadetāmatropadadhāti
analyzed: tat yā eṣā uttamā svayamātṛṇā  etat asya tat ātmanaḥ tat yat etām atra upadadhāti
translated: That which is this uppermost naturally perforated brick,🔽that is his body. In that he puts it on here,

original: yadevāsyaiṣātmanastadasminnetatpratidadhāti tasmādetāmatropadadhāti / / /
analyzed: yat eva asya eṣā ātmanaḥ tat asmin etat pratidadhāti tasmāt etām atra upadadhāti
translated: in that (part) of his body he thus restores to him what is his. For this reason he puts it on here.

original: divaspṛṣṭhe vyacasvatīm prathasvatīmiti /
analyzed: diva pṛṣṭhe vyacasvatīm prathasvatīm iti
translated: 'On the back of the sky, wide and extended,' (with these words) he puts it on;

original: divo hyetatpṛṣṭhaṃ
analyzed: divaḥ hi etat pṛṣṭham
translated: for this is the back of the sky,

original: vyacasvatprathastaddivaṃ yaca divaṃ dṛṃha divam mā hiṃsīrityātmānaṃ yacātmānaṃ
analyzed: vyacasvat prathaḥ tat divam yaca divam dṛṃha divam mā hiṃsīḥ iti ātmānam yaca ātmānam
translated: wide and extended. 'Support the sky! Make firm the sky! Harm not the sky!'--support thyself!

original: dṛṃhātmānam mā hiṃsīrityetat / / /🔽viśvasmai praṇāyāpānāya /
analyzed: dṛṃha ātmānam mā hiṃsīḥ iti etat  viśvasmai praṇāya apānāya
translated: make thyself firm! harm not thyself!--this is what he says.

original: vyānāyodānāyeti prāṇo vai svayamātṛṇā sarvasmā u vā🔽etasmai prāṇaḥ pratiṣṭhāyai caritrāyetīme vai lokāḥ svayamātṛṇā ima u lokāḥ🔽pratiṣṭhā caritraṃ sūryastvābhipātviti sūryastvābhigopāyatvityetanmahyā svastyeti
analyzed: vyānāya udānāya iti prāṇaḥ vai svayamātṛṇā sarvasmai u vā  etasmai prāṇaḥ pratiṣṭhāyai caritrāya iti ime vai lokāḥ svayamātṛṇāḥ ime u lokāḥ  pratiṣṭhā caritram sūryaḥ tvā abhipātu iti sūryaḥ tvā abhigopāyatu iti etat mahyā svastyā iti
translated: 'For all expiration, cross-breathing, inspiration, up-breathing, through-breathing,'--the naturally perforated brick is the vital air; for him, for all,🔽the vital air (serves) for a foundation, for a resting-place;--'for the resting-place, for the moving about,'--the naturally perforated brick is these worlds; these worlds are the foundation, the resting-place, the moving about;

original: mahatyā svastyetyetaccardiṣā śaṃtameneti yaccardiḥ śaṃtamaṃ tenetyetat / / /
analyzed: mahatyā svastyā iti etat cardiṣā śaṃtamena iti yat cardiḥ śaṃtamam tena iti etat
translated: 'may the sun protect thee!'--that is, 'may the sun guard thee!'--'with great bliss,'--that is, 'with great well-being;'--'with the most propitious favour,'--that is, 'with whatever most propitious favour there is.'

original: nānopadadhāti /
analyzed: nānā upadadhāti
translated: He puts it on in several (layers),

original: nānā hi vāyuśca dyauśca sakṛtsādayati samānaṃ tatkaroti samānaṃ🔽hyāyuśca prāṇaśca te vā ubhe eva śarkare bhavata ubhe svayamātṛṇe samānaṃ
analyzed: nānā hi vāyuḥ ca dyauḥ ca sakṛt sādayati samānam tat karoti samānam  hi āyuḥ ca prāṇaḥ ca te vai ubhe eva śarkare bhavataḥ ubhe svayamātṛṇe samānam
translated: the wind and the sky are different; he places (them) together: he makes them one, for life and breath are one. They are both gravel and both naturally-perforated bricks; they are placed together,

original: hyevāyuśca prāṇaścāthaine sūdadohasādhivadati prāṇo vai sūdadohāḥ prāṇeṇaivaine🔽etatsaṃtanoti saṃdadhāti / / /🔽tā asya sūdadohasa iti /
analyzed: hi eva āyuḥ ca prāṇaḥ ca atha ene sūdadohasā adhivadati prāṇaḥ vai sūdadohāḥ prāṇeṇa eva ene  etat saṃtanoti saṃdadhāti  tau asya sūda dohasaḥ iti
translated: The wind and the sky are different, he places them together, he makes them one, for life and breath are one. They are two gravels, two naturally perforated (bricks), for life and breath are one. Then he recites the Sûdadohas over them. The Sûdadohas is breath; by the breath he connects, he joins them.

original: āpo vai sūdo 'nnaṃ dohaḥ somaṃ śrīṇanti pṛśnaya ityannaṃ vai🔽pṛśni janmandevānāmiti saṃvatsaro vai devānāṃ janma viśa iti yajño vai viśo yajñe hi
analyzed: āpaḥ vai sūdaḥ nnam dohaḥ somam śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ iti annam vai  pṛśni janman devānām iti saṃvatsaraḥ vai devānām janma viśaḥ iti yajñaḥ vai viśaḥ yajñe hi
translated: They are his Sûdadohas. The Sûdadohas is water, the dohas is food. The dappled (cows) mix the Soma, food is dappled.

original: sarvāṇi bhūtāni viṣṭāni triṣvā rocane diva iti savanāni vai trīṇi rocanāni🔽savanānyetadāhānuṣṭubhā vāgvā anuṣṭubvāgu sarve prāṇā vācā caivaine etatprāṇena
analyzed: sarvāṇi bhūtāni viṣṭāni triṣu ā rocane divaḥ iti savanāni vai trīṇi rocanāni  savanāni etat āha anuṣṭubhā vāc vai anuṣṭubh vāc u sarve prāṇāḥ vācā ca eva ene etat prāṇena
translated: The birthplace of the gods, the year is the birthplace of the gods. The people, the people are the sacrifice, for in the sacrifice all beings are settled. In the three shining realms of the sky, the three shining realms are the pressings (of Soma);

original: ca saṃtanoti saṃdadhāti sā vā eṣaikā satī sūdadohāḥ sarvā iṣṭakā anusaṃcarati prāṇo
analyzed: ca saṃtanoti saṃdadhāti sā vai eṣā ekā satī sūdadohāḥ sarvāḥ iṣṭakāḥ anusaṃcarati
translated: he says this about the pressings. With an Anushtubh (verse), the Anushtubh is speech; in speech are all the vital airs; by speech and by the vital airs he connects, he joins them. That one (verse) indeed, though it is one, accompanies all the bricks as the Sûdadohas. The vital airs are the bricks;

original: vai sūdadohāstasmādayameka eva prāṇaḥ santsarvāṇyaṅgāni
analyzed: vai sūdadohāḥ tasmāt ayam ekaḥ eva prāṇaḥ san sarvāṇi aṅgāni
translated: Therefore this one breath, being, pervades all the limbs.

original: sarvamātmānamanusaṃcarati / / /
analyzed: sarvam ātmānam anusaṃcarati
translated: It moves through the whole self.

original: atha svayamātṛṇāsu sāmāni gāyati /
analyzed: atha svayamātṛṇāsu sāmāni gāyati
translated: Then on the naturally-perforated (bricks) he sings the Samans.

original: ime vai lokāḥ svayamātṛṇāstā etāḥ śarkarāstā devā
analyzed: ime vai lokāḥ svayamātṛṇāḥ tāḥ etāḥ śarkarāḥ tāḥ devā
translated: The naturally-perforated (bricks) are these worlds. These are the gravels. The gods,

original: upadhāyaitādṛśīrevāpaśyanyathaitāḥ śuṣkāḥ śarkarāḥ / / /🔽te 'bruvan / upa tajjānīta yathaiṣu lokeṣu ramasupajīvanaṃ dadhāmeti te🔽'bruvaṃścetayadhvamiti citimicateti vāva tadabruvaṃstadicata yathaiṣu lokeṣu
analyzed: upadhāya etādṛśīḥ eva apaśyan yathā etāḥ śuṣkāḥ śarkarāḥ  te bruvan upa tat jānīta yathā eṣu lokeṣu ramas upajīvanam dadhāma iti te  bruvan cetayadhvam iti citim icata iti vāva tat abruvan tat icata yathā eṣu lokeṣu
translated: having laid them down, saw them just as these dry gravels are.

original: rasamupajīvanaṃ dadhāmeti / / /
analyzed: rasam upajīvanam dadhāma iti
translated: They said: 'Consider how we may put sap and sustenance into these worlds.' They said: 'Meditate!' by 'meditate' they meant 'seek a layer'; 'seek how we may put sap and sustenance into these worlds.'

original: te cetayamānāḥ /🔽etāni sāmānyapaśyaṃstānyagāyaṃstaireṣu lokeṣu🔽rasamupajīvanamadadhustathaivaitadyajamāno yadetāni sāmāni
analyzed: te cetayamānāḥ  etāni sāmāni apaśyan tāni agāyan taiḥ eṣu lokeṣu  rasam upajīvanam adadhuḥ tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ yat etāni sāmāni
translated: Meditating,🔽they saw these Samans. They sang them. By them they put sap and sustenance into these worlds. In the same way the sacrificer now, in that he sings these Samans,

original: gāyatyeṣvevaitallokeṣu rasamupajīvanaṃ dadhāti / / /
analyzed: gāyati eṣu eva etat lokeṣu rasam upajīvanam dadhāti
translated: puts sap and sustenance into these worlds.

original: svayamātṛṇāsu gāyati /
analyzed: svayamātṛṇāsu gāyati
translated: He sings on the naturally-perforated (bricks).

original: ime vai lokāḥ svayamātṛṇā eṣvevaitallokeṣu rasamupajīvanaṃ🔽dadhāti / / /
analyzed: ime vai lokāḥ svayamātṛṇāḥ eṣu eva etat lokeṣu rasam upajīvanam  dadhāti
translated: The naturally-perforated (bricks) are these worlds. In these worlds he puts sap and sustenance.

original: sa vai bhūrbhuvaḥ svariti /
analyzed: sa vai bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar iti
translated: He sings 'bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svaḥ'.

original: etāsu vyāhṛtiṣu gāyati bhūriti vā ayaṃ loko bhuva
analyzed: etāsu vyāhṛtiṣu gāyati bhūḥ iti vai ayam lokaḥ bhuva
translated: In these Vyâhritis he sings, 'Bhûr!'--this world, doubtless, is Bhûr;

original: ityantarikṣalokaḥ svarityasau loka eṣvevaitallokeṣu rasamupajīvanaṃ dadhāti / / /
analyzed: iti antarikṣa lokaḥ svar iti asau lokaḥ eṣu eva etat lokeṣu rasam upajīvanam dadhāti
translated: 'Bhuvah!'--the air-world is Bhuvah; 'Svah!'--that world is Svah. In these worlds he places sap, the means of subsistence.

original: tāni vai nānāprastāvāni /🔽samānanidhanāni tāni yannānāprastāvāni nānā🔽hyapaśyannatha yatsamānanidhanānyekā hyeva yajñasya pratiṣṭhaikaṃ nidhanaṃ
analyzed: tāni vai nānā prastāvāni  samāna nidhanāni tāni yat nānā prastāvāni nānā  hi apaśyan atha yat samāna nidhanāni ekā hi eva yajñasya pratiṣṭhā ekam nidhanam
translated: They (the three Vyâhritis) have different beginnings,

original: svarga eva lokastasmātsvarjyotirnidhanāni / / /
analyzed: svargaḥ eva lokaḥ tasmāt svar jyotiḥ nidhanāni
translated: and the same end. As to their having different beginnings, it is because they saw (the three worlds) separately; and as to their having the same end, it is because the one foundation, the one end of the sacrifice, is the heavenly world: hence they have the heavenly world for their end.

original: athainaṃ hiraṇyaśakalaiḥ prokṣati /🔽atraiṣa sarvo 'gniḥ saṃskṛtastasmindevā🔽etadamṛtaṃ rūpamuttamadadhustathaivāsminnayametadamṛtaṃ rūpamuttamaṃ
analyzed: atha enam hiraṇya śakalaiḥ prokṣati  atra eṣa sarvaḥ gniḥ saṃskṛtaḥ tasmin devā  etat amṛtam rūpam uttamadadhuḥ tathā eva asmin ayam etat amṛtam rūpam uttamam
translated: He then sprinkles it with chips of gold.

original: dadhāti / / /
analyzed: dadhāti
translated: This (altar) is the whole Agni (fire-altar) completed; and in him the gods then placed that most excellent immortal form; and in like manner does this (Sacrificer) now place in him that most excellent immortal form.

original: yadvevainaṃ hiraṇyaśakalaiḥ prokṣati /🔽etadvā asminnado 'mūm purastādramyāṃ🔽tanūm madhyato dadhāti rukbhaṃ ca puruṣaṃ
analyzed: yat u eva enam hiraṇya śakalaiḥ prokṣati  etat vai asmin adaḥ mūm purastāt ramyām  tanūm madhyatas dadhāti rukbham ca puruṣam
translated: And, again, as to why he sprinkles it with chips of gold.

original: cāthainametatsarvamevopariṣṭādramyayā tanvā pracādayati / / /
analyzed: ca atha enam etat sarvam eva upariṣṭāt ramyayā tanvā pracādayati
translated: Now, on that former occasion he places in him that most beautiful form in the middle, the gold and the man; and now he covers him entirely with that most beautiful form above.

original: dvābhyāṃdvābhyāṃ śatābhyām /
analyzed: dvābhyām dvābhyām śatābhyām
translated: With two hundred (chips) each time.

original: dvipādyajamāno yajamāno
analyzed: dvipād yajamānaḥ yajamānaḥ
translated: The sacrificer, with two feet, is the sacrificer.

original: 'gniryāvānagniryāvatyasya mātrā tāvataivāsminnetadamṛtaṃ rūpamuttamaṃ dadhāti
analyzed: gniḥ yāvān agniḥ yāvatī asya mātrā tāvatā eva asmin etat amṛtam rūpam uttamam dadhāti
translated: Agni is as great as Agni is in measure; with so much he places in him this highest immortal form.

original: pañca kṛtvaḥ pañcacitiko 'gniḥ pañca 'rtavaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ saṃvatsaro
analyzed: pañca kṛtvas pañca citikaḥ gniḥ pañca ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ saṃvatsaraḥ
translated: Five times (he does so); the fire-altar has five layers, the year has five seasons, the year

original: 'gniryāvānāgnaryāvatyasya mātrā tāvataivāsminnetadamṛtaṃ rūpamuttamaṃ dadhāti
analyzed: gniḥ yāvān āgnar yāvatī asya mātrā tāvatā eva asmin etat amṛtam rūpam uttamam dadhāti
translated: is Agni. As great as Agni is, as great as is his measure, with so much he places in him this highest immortal form.

original: sahasreṇa sarvaṃ vai sahasraṃ sarveṇaivāsminnetadamṛtaṃ rūpamuttamaṃ dadhāti / / /
analyzed: sahasreṇa sarvam vai sahasram sarveṇa eva asmin etat amṛtam rūpam uttamam dadhāti
translated: With a thousand (verses); a thousand means everything: with everything he places in him this highest immortal form.

original: paścādagre prāṅ tiṣṭhan /🔽athottarato dakṣiṇātha purastātpratyaṅṅatha jaghanena
analyzed: paścāt agre prāṅ tiṣṭhan  atha uttaratas dakṣiṇā atha purastāt pratyaṅ atha jaghanena
translated: Standing behind in front (of the fire),🔽then on the north side on the south, then in front facing the west, then having gone round along the back,

original: parītya dakṣiṇata udaṅ tiṣṭhaṃstaddakṣiṇāvṛttaddhi devatrāthānuparītya paścātprāṅ
analyzed: parītya dakṣiṇatas udaṅ tiṣṭhan tat dakṣiṇāvṛt tat hi devatrā atha anuparītya paścāt prāṅ
translated: on the south side on the north. That is sunwise, for that is the gods' direction. Then having gone round along the front,

original: tiṣṭhaṃstatho hāsyaitatprāgeva karma kṛtam bhavati / / /
analyzed: tiṣṭhan tathā u ha asya etat prāk eva karma kṛtam bhavati
translated: he stands behind facing the east. Thus this rite of his is performed in the right direction.

original: sahasrasya pramāsi /
analyzed: sahasrasya pramā asi
translated: Thou art the measure of a thousand,

original: sahasrasya pratimāsi sahasrasyonmāsi sāhasro 'si sahasrāya tveti
analyzed: sahasrasya pratimā asi sahasrasya unmā asi sāhasraḥ si sahasrāya tvā iti
translated: thou art the counterpart of a thousand, thou art the counterpart of a thousand, thou art a thousand, for a thousand thee!

original: sarvaṃ vai sahasraṃ sarvamasi sarvasmai tvetyetat / / /
analyzed: sarvam vai sahasram sarvam asi sarvasmai tvā iti etat
translated: A thousand means everything: for everything (thee), is what he means.

original: athātaścitipurīṣāṇāmeva mīmāṃsā /🔽ayameva lokaḥ prathamā citiḥ paśavaḥ purīṣaṃ
analyzed: atha atas citi purīṣāṇām eva mīmāṃsā  ayam eva lokaḥ prathamā citiḥ paśavaḥ purīṣam
translated: Now, then, the examination of the filling-up of the layers.🔽This very world is the first layer, cattle the filling.

original: yatprathamāṃ citim purīṣeṇa pracādayatīmaṃ tallokam paśubhiḥ pracādayati / / /
analyzed: yat prathamām citim purīṣeṇa pracādayati imam tat lokam paśubhiḥ pracādayati
translated: In that he covers the first layer with filling, thereby he covers this world with cattle.

original: antarikṣameva dvitīyā citiḥ /🔽vayāṃsi purīṣaṃ yaddvitīyāṃ citim purīṣeṇa
analyzed: antarikṣam eva dvitīyā citiḥ  vayāṃsi purīṣam yat dvitīyām citim purīṣeṇa
translated: The second layer is the air.🔽Birds are the filling. In that he covers the second layer with filling,

original: pracādayatyantarikṣaṃ tadvayobhiḥ pracādayati / / /
analyzed: pracādayati antarikṣam tat vayobhiḥ pracādayati
translated: thereby he covers the air with birds.

original: dyaureva tṛtīyā citiḥ /
analyzed: dyauḥ eva tṛtīyā citiḥ
translated: The third layer is the sky.

original: nakṣatrāṇi purīṣaṃ yattṛtīyāṃ citim purīṣeṇa pracādayati
analyzed: nakṣatrāṇi purīṣam yat tṛtīyām citim purīṣeṇa pracādayati
translated: The stars are the filling. In that he covers the third layer with filling,

original: divaṃ tannakṣatraiḥ pracādayati / / /
analyzed: divam tat nakṣatraiḥ pracādayati
translated: thereby he covers the sky with the stars.

original: yajña eva caturthī citiḥ /🔽dakṣiṇāḥ purīṣaṃ yaccaturthī citim purīṣeṇa pracādayati
analyzed: yajñaḥ eva caturthī citiḥ  dakṣiṇāḥ purīṣam yat caturthī citim purīṣeṇa pracādayati
translated: The fourth layer is the sacrifice.🔽The sacrificial fee is the filling. In that he covers the fourth layer with filling,

original: yajñam taddakṣinābhiḥ pracādayati / / /
analyzed: yajñam tad dakṣi nābhiḥ pracādayati
translated: thereby he covers the sacrifice with the sacrificial fee.

original: yajamāna eva pañcamī citiḥ /
analyzed: yajamānaḥ eva pañcamī citiḥ
translated: The sacrificer himself is the fifth layer.

original: prajā purīṣaṃ yatpañcamīṃ citim purīṣeṇa pracādayati
analyzed: prajā purīṣam yat pañcamīm citim purīṣeṇa pracādayati
translated: Offspring is the filling. In that he covers the fifth layer with filling,

original: yajamānaṃ tatprajayā pracādayati / / /🔽svarga eva lokaḥ ṣaṣṭhī citiḥ /
analyzed: yajamānam tat prajayā pracādayati  svargaḥ eva lokaḥ ṣaṣṭhī citiḥ
translated: thereby he covers the sacrificer with offspring.🔽The sixth layer is the heavenly world.

original: devāḥ purīṣaṃ yatṣaṣṭhīm citim purīṣeṇa
analyzed: devāḥ purīṣam yat ṣaṣṭhīm citim purīṣeṇa
translated: The gods are the filling. In that he covers the sixth layer with filling,

original: pracādayati svargaṃ tallokaṃ devaiḥ pracādayati / / /
analyzed: pracādayati svargam tat lokam devaiḥ pracādayati
translated: He covers (it); verily he covers the world of heaven with the gods.

original: amṛtameva saptamī citiḥ tāmuttamāmupadadhātyamṛtaṃ tadasya sarvasyottamaṃ
analyzed: amṛtam eva saptamī citiḥ tām uttamām upadadhāti amṛtam tat asya sarvasya uttamam
translated: The seventh layer is immortality; he puts it on the top; immortality is the top of all this (universe);

original: dadhāti tasmādasya sarvasyāmṛtamuttamaṃ tasmāddevā anantarhitāstasmādu te 'mṛtā
analyzed: dadhāti tasmāt asya sarvasya amṛtam uttamam tasmāt devāḥ an antarhitāḥ tasmāt u te mṛtā
translated: he places it on the top; therefore immortality is the top of all this (universe). Therefore the gods are not shut out; therefore are they immortal.

original: ityadhidevatam / / /
analyzed: iti adhidevatam
translated: Thus as regards the deity.

original: athādhyātmam /
analyzed: atha adhyātmam
translated: Now as regards the body.

original: yaiveyam pratiṣṭhā yaścāyamavāṅ prāṇassatprathamā citirmāṃsam🔽purīṣaṃ yatprathamāṃ citim purīṣeṇa pracādayatyetasya tadātmano māṃsaiḥ
analyzed: yā eva iyam pratiṣṭhā yaḥ ca ayam avāṅ prāṇaḥ sat prathamā citiḥ māṃsam  purīṣam yat prathamām citim purīṣeṇa pracādayati etasya tat ātmanaḥ māṃsaiḥ
translated: That on which he stands, and that downward breath, is the first layer, flesh;🔽the filling is the bones. In that he covers the first layer with filling,

original: saṃcādayatīṣṭakā upadhāyāsthīṣṭakā asthi tanmāṃsaiḥ saṃcādayati
analyzed: saṃcādayati iṣṭakāḥ upadhāya asthi iṣṭakāḥ asthi tat māṃsaiḥ saṃcādayati
translated: he covers this body with flesh. The bricks are put on; the bricks are the bones; he covers the bones with flesh.

original: nādhastātsaṃcādayati tasmādime prāṇā adhastādasaṃcannā upariṣṭāttu🔽pracādayatyetadasya tadātmana upariṣṭānmāṃsaiḥ saṃcādayati tasmādasyaitadātmana
analyzed: na adhastāt saṃcādayati tasmāt ime prāṇāḥ adhastāt a saṃcannāḥ upariṣṭāt tu  pracādayati etat asya tat ātmanaḥ upariṣṭāt māṃsaiḥ saṃcādayati tasmāt asya etat ātmanaḥ
translated: He does not cover below; therefore these breaths are uncovered below. But he covers above;

original: upariṣṭānmāṃsaiḥ saṃcannaṃ nāvakāśate / / /
analyzed: upariṣṭāt māṃsaiḥ saṃcannam na avakāśate
translated: he covers this body above with flesh; therefore this body of his is covered above with flesh. It does not open out.

original: yadūrdhvam pratiṣṭhāyā avācīnam madhyāt /🔽taddvitīyā citirmāṃsam purīṣaṃ
analyzed: yat ūrdhvam pratiṣṭhāyāḥ avācīnam madhyāt 🔽tad dvitīyā citiḥ māṃsam purīṣam
translated: That which is above the base and below the middle,🔽that is the second layer, flesh; the filling is the bones.

original: yaddvitīyāṃ citim purīṣeṇa pracādayatyetadasya tadātmano māṃsaiḥ
analyzed: yat dvitīyām citim purīṣeṇa pracādayati etat asya tat ātmanaḥ māṃsaiḥ
translated: In that he covers the second layer with earth, thereby he covers that (part of his body) with flesh.

original: saṃcādayatīṣṭakā upadhāyāsthīṣṭakā asthi tanmāṃsaiḥ saṃcādayati purīṣa
analyzed: saṃcādayati iṣṭakāḥ upadhāya asthi iṣṭakāḥ asthi tat māṃsaiḥ saṃcādayati purīṣa
translated: He puts down bricks; the bricks are the bones; he covers the bones with flesh. He puts down earth;

original: upadadhāti purīṣeṇa pracādayatyetadasya tadātmana ubhayato māṃsaiḥ saṃcādayati
analyzed: upadadhāti purīṣeṇa pracādayati etat asya tat ātmanaḥ ubhayatas māṃsaiḥ saṃcādayati
translated: he covers (it) with earth; thereby he covers that (part of his body) on both sides with flesh.

original: tasmādasyaitadātmana ubhayato māṃsaiḥ saṃcannaṃ nāvakāśate / / /
analyzed: tasmāt asya etat ātmanaḥ ubhayatas māṃsaiḥ saṃcannam na avakāśate
translated: Therefore that (part of his body) is covered on both sides with flesh and does not become visible.

original: madhyameva tṛtīyā citiḥ /
analyzed: madhyamā iva tṛtīyā citiḥ
translated: The middle is the third layer.

original: yadūrdhvam madhyādavācīnaṃ grīvābhyastaccaturthī
analyzed: yat ūrdhvam madhyāt avācīnam grīvābhyaḥ tat caturthī
translated: What is above the middle and below the neck is the fourth layer.

original: citirgrīvā eva pañcamī citiḥ śira eva ṣaṣṭhī citiḥ prāṇā eva saptamī
analyzed: citiḥ grīvāḥ eva pañcamī citiḥ śiraḥ eva ṣaṣṭhī citiḥ prāṇāḥ eva saptamī
translated: The neck is the fifth layer. The head is the sixth layer. The vital airs are the seventh layer.

original: citistāmuttamāmupadadhāti prāṇāṃstadasya sarvasyottamāndadhāti tasmādasya
analyzed: citiḥ tām uttamām upadadhāti prāṇān tat asya sarvasya uttamān dadhāti tasmāt asya
translated: He puts that (layer) uppermost; he thereby places the vital airs uppermost of all this (universe); therefore

original: sarvasya prāṇā uttamāḥ purīṣa upadadhāti māṃsaṃ vai purīṣam māṃsena
analyzed: sarvasya prāṇāḥ uttamāḥ purīṣe upadadhāti māṃsam vai purīṣam māṃsena
translated: the vital airs are uppermost of all this (universe). He puts down earth; earth means flesh;

original: tatprāṇānpratiṣṭhāpayati nopariṣṭātpracādayati tasmādime prāṇā
analyzed: tat prāṇān pratiṣṭhāpayati na upariṣṭāt pracādayati tasmāt ime prāṇāḥ
translated: with flesh he establishes the vital airs; he does not cover above; therefore these vital airs

original: upariṣṭādasaṃcannāḥ
analyzed: upariṣṭāt a saṃcannāḥ
translated: are not covered above.
